story:
We’ve been in Esports for a long time. From the early days of dial up fun, to Xpeke backdooring his way to victory in League of Legends at IEM Katowice, to today with over 27M people watching our CS:GO boys victory at ESL Cologne. After 11 years of blood, sweat, and broken gear… we know what makes great Esports hardware. No flashy green lights will get you a Pentakill. No fan on a mouse will help you hit a headshot. Esports gear is about simplicity, comfort, and reliability - it’s exactly what you need to perform and nothing else.  


We’ve decided to take a risk. Today we’re launching Fnatic Gear, professional grade equipment designed for Esports.




Together, we want to redefine Esports gear. No marketing BS or fancy useless tech features - Just great products, inspired by our players and our experience as world-class professional gamers.












Our first mouse, the FLICK, is equipped with technology to deliver the precision, accuracy and control needed to perform at the highest levels in Esports. FLICK is pro-player designed, tested, and approved for the highest levels of competitive play.






Our first keyboard, the RUSH, is equipped with Cherry MX switches to provide rapid response, control, and feel required for intense competitive play.



The 2016 Fnatic Edition FOCUS Pad is only available through purchasing the FOCUS Fnatic Edition Pad Perk  and is not available as an option with other FOCUS perks and bundles.

Our special 2016 Fnatic graphic FOCUS cloth mouse pad available in L and XL. Shipping starts in February.







Quality is everything.  We have made the Fnatic Gear products to our quality standards, built so they perform and stand the test of time. If at any point in our manufacturing process of Fnatic Gear we feel the products might not meet our quality standards we will not put it out.  Simple as that.

This is just the beginning. We're in this for the long run. 100% of revenue from all perks purchased on Indiegogo will be dedicated to the development of new amazing gear to share with you and our players in 2016.





We’ve created a whole bunch of ways you can back our campaign, all support is welcomed! Have a look and pick your choice:
















Crowdfunding


What happens to my money in the case that you have not reached your goal by the end of your campaign?

We have already started making these products, so the moment you purchase a perk, you can be certain we will deliver you a product regardless if we reach our goal or not.  We chose "flexibile" funding on Indiegogo which means this is not an "all or nothing" campaign.  

Why are we on a crowdfunding platform?

Some people have been wondering why we chose to Crowdfund our new venture... Firstly, crowdfunding is very powerful because it allows us to have a close, connected relationship with our customers and community. Something that is often hard if you only go the traditional route which is through big distributors/retailers... It also allows us to charge lower prices, if we can establish this relationship direct to our consumers.

Finally, we're a small company... less than 40 staff, crowdfunding is an opportunity to stay nimble and small, and ultimately allow us to listen to what our community wants more... without having to raise big sums of money from VC’s, we can grow organically with our community.


Products

SPECIFICATIONS



How do I choose a specific size mouse pad or keyboard?
We will contact you with a follow-up email at the end of the campaign asking for your preference of product options and then once you choose we will ship it out.  If we do not hear a response, we will reach out again, after two weeks, we will send you our most popular version of that product.


Wait... How did Fnatic learn how to make hardware?

We started by getting our hands on virtually every other brand's product we could.  We particularly loved a lot of things about one company's products. Func Inc was a peripheral manufacture in Sweden.  While we loved the design language and build quality of Func's old products, we didn't feel any of products were quite right for Esports aside from their KB-460 Keyboard.  We were truly impressed with the design and attention to detail we saw from the guys at Func and knew we wanted to work with them.  A few talks, and months later, we officially added Func Inc's team, based out in Sweden, to Fnatic to create Fnatic Gear.  


What did the process of product development look like?

We decided to scrap the rest of Func's product designs and start developing everything else from scratch.

We spent months with our players giving feedback on what they wanted in Esports gear.  It was an long long long long long process.  We spent a ton of time in Asia, evaluating factory partners, working with them to build initial prototypes, testing materials, and countless hours testing and validating our products designs.  

Only now, we truly feel we are ready to bring forth the FLICK, RUSH, FOCUS, and BOOST to the community.

Are the products plug & play? Does the FLICK Optical Mouse or RUSH Mechanical Keyboard come with any software?

Yes. While all of our products are plug and play, they come with basic software to change profile settings, LED colors, and macro settings.

Do the products work on both PC & MAC.

Yes, the products work plug and play with both PC and MAC. However, our current software does not support MAC systems. This means currently, MAC users will have limited capability to change settings on the mouse and keyboard. We will be further developing our software to better support MAC users in the near future.

What languages does the RUSH Keyboard come in?

The Fnatic Gear RUSH keyboard is available in US, UK, NORDIC, GERMAN, and FRENCH layouts.

Will you be making a left handed mouse?

This is our initial line-up of products which we’ve kept small and focused, but our plan is to make many more!  We’re already in R&D with a few more products, but, unfortunately, a left-handed mouse isn’t one them. We’ll be gauging the community interest during the campaign and  after, and look to prioritise new products based off of that.


Shipping

When will my Fnatic Gear products ship?

Fnatic Gear will begin shipping products in December 2015 at the end of our campaign, on a first-ordered, first-received basis. Our team will keep you notified of your Fnatic Gear ship date.

Where does Fnatic Gear ship from?

All products will be shipped from the UK.

Where does Fnatic Gear ship to?

We currently ship to the US, Canada, EU (all 28 countries), Australia, New Zealand, Japan, Singapore, Taiwan, Hong Kong, South Korea, and the rest of the world.


Warranty

What is the warranty?

We provide a 2 year warranty against manufacturer's defects. Free repairs and component replacements will be provided under warranty period for manufacturer's defect. If not in accordance with the instructions of use, human factors, product surface damage, bumps or scratches will not be covered under this warranty.


Contact

If I have questions, how can I reach your team?

Please read through the FAQ first to find your answer. We are receiving a lot of special requests, and are responding as fast as possible!

For questions related to Indiegogo.com and how it works you can contact support@indiegogo.com.

For all other questions regarding Fnatic Gear, including business, press, etc - please contact us at indiegogo@fnatic.com.

I am a distributor or reseller interested in Fnatic Gear, who should I contact?
Please email brian@fnatic.com.

Indiegogo Campaign

I ordered Fnatic Gear, but I didn’t get a confirmation email. How can I check the status?

Please refer to this article on How to Check if Your Contribution is Successful. For questions related to the Indiegogo campaign, you can contact support@indiegogo.com.

For all other questions regarding Fnatic Gear, contact us at indiegogo@fnatic.com.

There was an error with my contribution. What happened?

Please refer to this article on common contribution errors and steps to resolve Common Contribution Errors.

story:
Our Story

Imagine a game with a code gun that shoots Javascript to create anything you can imagine in Unity, the world's greatest game engine. We have created a game that teaches you how to make games so that you can make the games that teach everything else. We believe you have the power to code the change you wish to see in the world by learning how to make games. We believe in a world beyond just making knowledge accessible, a world where all knowledge becomes playable. We believe we've found a way to make code literacy not just possible but fun for all so that this great art form we all enjoy called games becomes a gateway to a world where you don't just play games and consume information, you create games and make the world a stage where we are truly players in it leveling up our skills and achieving our aspirations through games.

We've decided to crowdfund our game with our fans. We get so many emails every day asking about getting early access to Code Hero that we want to give you a chance to not only get early access to the game but also to accelerate and enhance our development at the same time.

Who We Are
We're Primer Labs, a group of indy game developers founded by Alex Peake to make all knowledge playable. I'm Alex and I've spent the last year building Code Hero and bringing it to beta so you could play and learn.

Where We're Based
We're participants in the global hackerspace movement based at Noisebridge Hackerspace, San Francisco and involved in Hack The Future from Hacker Dojo, Mountain View.

The Impact

Code Hero teaches kids and adults alike how to write their first lines of code and make their first video games with Unity 3D.

If we don't get funding, it will take a lot longer to finish Code Hero, a lot of kids aren't going to learn programming and you're not going to get to play the beta versions early.


What We Need & What You Get

We've bootstrapped for our first year of development. Most of the team members have worked for free with their spare time because they believe in this project. And now that we have a beta in the works, we need money to work full time on it and turn it into a finished game. 


You Get The Code Hero Preorder with Early Private Beta Access!

We're going to sell 10,000-100,000 preorders of the game for $10 to raise a hundred thousand to a million dollars in preorders. We have over 9,000 people signed up for the beta on our site already, so the interest level should cover the resources we need to finish the game.

Most of the money a game takes to develop goes to paying brilliant creative people. We have a team of 7 developers and we have a number of super talented folks we'd like to hire who can help us knock features and technology and polish out of the park.

We've bootstrapped and borrowed from friends and family to get this far and raised 15K of seed money from our mentor Greg Miller to develop our beta. We've stretched that thin by relying on the volunteer efforts of most of the team. Now we have a beta to polish and develop into a full game.


Preorder for beta access and name your price for $1 or more to save on the $31.37 full game release! You get early access to the game at your price! You help fund the development of Code Hero Code Hero Private Beta is now available in beta preorder. Buy it now to support our development and you get to download the betas and receive the full game when it ships! Buy your copy of Code Hero and be first to get it! You can now preorder Code Hero to receive the private beta and guarantee first access to new versions till the gold master game ships! What you get with the game: A game that teaches you how to make games An account on the Code Hero online community network to share your achievements and collaborate on projects with others Digital download whenever you need to. All reward levels include the benefits of the previous levels.
story_txt:
Our Story
Imagine a game with a code gun that shoots Javascript to create anything you can imagine in Unity, the world's greatest game engine. We have created a game that teaches you how to make games so that you can make the games that teach everything else. We believe you have the power to code the change you wish to see in the world by learning how to make games. We believe in a world beyond just making knowledge accessible, a world where all knowledge becomes playable. We believe we've found a way to make code literacy not just possible but fun for all so that this great art form we all enjoy called games becomes a gateway to a world where you don't just play games and consume information, you create games and make the world a stage where we are truly players in it leveling up our skills and achieving our aspirations through games.
We've decided to crowdfund our game with our fans. We get so many emails every day asking about getting early access to Code Hero that we want to give you a chance to not only get early access to the game but also to accelerate and enhance our development at the same time.

story:
A Classic Gaming Arcade of Epic Proportions

Build it and they will come. That's what they say. We want to build an arcade in the UK. An Epic Arcade. Like the ones still thriving in Japan to this day. We'll have classic games. New games. Pinball machines. Consoles. Free-play events. Tournaments. Cocktail cabinets. Gaming booths. Streamed gaming marathons. World Record High Score events. Homebrew/indie gaming events. Cabinet building workshops. Cabinet hire. And everything else in-between. Oh, and did we mention that we plan to have over 200 playable machines at any given time, with an additional stock of Jamma boards so we can rotate through our game offerings on a regular basis. Epic.

Why?

We don't just want to setup a videogame arcade. We want to create a legacy. A legacy to everything that was great about arcades back in the 80's and 90's. Growing up in Blackpool (England, UK) I was constantly exposed to the latest and greatest arcade game sensations as soon as they hit the streets. Blackpool was a mecca for gamers - rows of arcades along the seafront offering everything a young gamer could ask for. But it was more than that, more than playing the new games before any else. It was the buzz. The thrill. The excitement of setting a new highscore and proudly putting your initials on top of the leaderboard whilst a group of people stood behind you in silent awe. And that's what we want to recreate. The adrenalin rush. Social interaction. Meeting new friends (real ones, not faceless people you spend hours chatting to online!). The buzz of setting a new record or beating a new-found-friend on your favourite fighting game.

 

Where?

Being based in Scotland there's only one practical place to open this arcade and that is the country's capital, Edinburgh. Why Edinburgh? We want to attract gamers from all around the world, not just people living locally. Edinburgh is a thriving tourist destination and we want to maximise that exposure so that as many people as possible can enjoy what we plan to create.

Funding permitting, we plan to secure a 3-storey building within the bounds of the city centre of Edinburgh. We have huge plans for our vision, and you can follow progress on our project website at www.epicarcadeproject.com where we will keep you updated as things develop, including sourcing machines, architect drawings, artist impressions, and so forth. You can even enter polls to suggest games, and there will be a final, all-important competition to have the honour of naming our arcade from a narrowed-down list of suggestions.

Will the Games Cost Me to Play?

A set fee to get in, then it's all free-play central from there on in. That's 200+ cabinets, pinball galore, loads of consoles and games, and plenty of other goodies to satisfy your gaming needs. Arcade will be open for a minimum of 12 hours every single day. 

 

East Meets West

Whilst there will be a large focus on classic videogames, we also want to recreate the buzz and excitement that is still thriving in the arcades in Japan. Multi-storey arcade-plexes, bursting at the seams with machines and gamers hanging out, socialising, and having fun. So we're going to have a nice mix of some of the newer games on the market, ranging from classic shooters from developer Cave, to some of the more obscure Japanese-only machines out there.

 

Why Should I Get Excited About This Project and Donate to it?

Good question. Here is just a taster of what we'll have available in our arcade:

  • Over 200 playable arcade machines
  • A dozen pinball machines
  • Gaming memoribilia
  • Aracde machines hooked up to giant screens around the arcade
  • Consoles to play in our comfy couch area
  • Booths available for you and your mates to game together on a cocktail cabinet
  • Highscore leaderboards for both the arcade highscores and world record holders
  • Gaming marathon sessions which will be streamed live on the internet
  • World record attempts
  • Competitions
  • Homwbrew/indie gaming events
  • Swap shops
  • Machine hire
  • Room hire for events
  • Talks from game designers and developers, lectures, workshops, gaming documentary viewings, game-influenced DJ sets
  • Late night sessions
  • Merchandise
  • A fully immersive VR machine (Lawnmower man anyone?) - assuming we can track one down which is proving mighty difficult!
  • Influence other gaming projects, such as our ambition to build a 48-player networkable version of the classic game Bomberman, or a 4-player remake of Smash TV - to name but a few
  • Be part of something special, to tell people you helped make this happen, that you were there from the beginning

 

The Impact

To reignite the passion of the arcades of yesteryear. To prove to the world that arcades are the home of videogames, not fruit machines. To be the industry leader in a new wave of videogame arcades across the globe, and encourage similar projects around the world.

How Will My Donation Be Spent?

If we reach our target then we'll be able to do all of the above, and much more. You might not think that it could cost almost $500,000 to setup an arcade, but when you factor in the cost of securing over 200 authentic machines, a dozen pinball machines, architect and legal fees, insurance, rent, rates (electricity costs won't be cheap!), refurbishing a 3-floor building to our specifications, an additional stock of Jamma boards, parts, etc. then the costs soon add up. Not to mention staffing costs! Of course, we want this to be a successful business venture that makes money so that it can continue to operate, however having this funding in place will be paramount in covering costs whilst the arcade is in its infancy. Keeping true to its roots as a videogame arcade is our primary focus, so not having to initially worry about where the next rent payment is coming from will allow us to focus our energy on the important stuff.

However, and there's always a however - should we only reach partial funding then we will scale the project accordingly. Smaller premises, less cabinets, less of the expensive machines. Not ideal, but sill focusing on the main goal. Our website www.epicarcadeproject.com will detail progress and keep all enthusiasts informed of the scheduled opening.

What If You Exceed Your Initial Funding Proposal?

We have thought about this over and over, and we came to the conclusion that this funding campaign will go in one of these two ways - either people just won't get it and we'll raise $1000, or it'll become a huge success and we'll raise close to a million :-)

If we hit a funding target of a million dollars we will be able to have the arcade on free-play for a full year without any entry fees (possibly longer depending on the final total raised), allowing as many people as possible to enjoy the arcade completely free of charge. You will be able to make a small onsite donation if you choose. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Love the idea, want to help out, but not in a position to make a financial donation. No problem. There's a host of ways you can help:

  • Spread the word - tell your friends, family, the world about Epic Arcade Project . Use your facebook account, twitter, blog, whatever you have at your disposal.
  • use the Indiegogo share tools
  • Visit www.epicarcadeproject.com and contribute in the shaping of the arcade via our forum - recommend cabinets, consoles, events, tournaments, even a name!
  • Buy merchandise for christmas presents, birthday presents, or a just-for-the-hell-of-it present

Parting Words ...

If we don't make this happen we feel the videogame arcades will wither away and die. Our children and new-generation gamers won't have been given the opportunity to feel the buzz, the rush, the excitement of a real, physical gamers paradise. Keep our dream alive. For nostalgias sake.

story:
Ye Olde Commons is a site dedicated to supporting the hobbies of larping, battle games, reenactment, interactive theater, and similar recreational activities.  Since our foundation in 2004, we have worked to enhance the facilities to support these hobbies, including changing the appearance to evoke an appropriate setting.

One wish that has been raised by many attendees of games at the site is a fireplace in the tavern.  We would like to make this a reality, which will require some significant construction to replace a large section of wall with a chimney that must reach above the peak of the dining hall to meet building code.

We have performed the initial investigation, discussed the plans with the building inspector, and received several contractor quotes.  This indiegogo project goal is set at 50% of the estimated total cost.  We are excited to move ahead, and will use these project funds to initiate the work this fall.  If we exceed the project goal, we will be able to increase the size of the hearth inside, and use natural stone rather than bricks, which will enhance the appearance greatly.

Note: see Comments tab for FAQ on pledges

story:
About us

Meiko Miniatures is a small company producing high quality miniatures for Fantasy Football. We offer alternative designs to the ones existing and we provide the players with a wide variety of miniatures to help them complete their teams. To achieve this we always work with the most talented sculptors.


You can see our full catalogue and contact us here:

http://www.meikominiatures.com/

 

Why crowdfunding?

Not so long ago, Meiko Miniatures released the Lizardmen Big Guy, the Hemlocked Skink Assassin Star Player nº 1 and the four Lizardmen Girls (2 Cheerleaders and 2 Bloodweiser Girls). All these miniatures were very well received by our customers, so we decided to release a whole Meiko Lizardmen Team: 6 Skinks, 6 Saurus, a new Star Player nº 2 (Saurus Silly Billy) and several more Coaching Staff minis (Coach, Apothecary…). 

The sculpting of most of these miniatures has already been made. But we need your help to speed up the casting process. That way, we will be able to release the Meiko Lizardmen Team much sooner than what was initially planned. Using Indiegogo as a platform to rise funds helps us a lot since we can finance new miniatures, obtain feedback from our customers and it gives us confidence to keep working on. In exchange you will get some cool rewards. All the miniatures that you will receive will be made with metal, including the Lizardmen Turn Counter.

P. Ramos (a.k.a. Poncho) is the skilled sculptor of all the miniatures of the Meiko Lizardmen Team. He will also sculpt the Lizardmen Turn Counter, a great accessory for a great team. P.Ramos is currently considered by many Fantasy Football fans as one of the best Fantasy Football sculptors worldwide. His sculpting style specially fits with the Lizardmen race, since he has a special gift to give shape to the Lizardmen minis that we all have in mind. You don’t believe us? Please take a look at the images, we hope that will change your mind.

 

NEW LEVEL FOR EXTRA SKINKS!!! After reading all your comments we have decided to listen your advices and changing the old Level 5 (which was 6 Saurus) for a new Level 5 (3 Skinks of your choice). We hope that this New Level 5 will help you to complete your teams. 

 

How do these Lizardmen look like?

 

How can you support this team?

 

LEVEL 1 

If you are already a contributor to this campaign, you can claim this perk to get the Hemlocked Skink Assassin Star Player nº 1 for just 7 EUR! It will be shipped together with your other perks of Level 3 or higher.

 

LEVEL 2

If you are already a contributor to this campaign, you can claim this perk to get the new Silly Billy Star Player nº 2 for just 9 EUR! It will be shipped together with your other perks of Level 3 or higher.

 

LEVEL 3

You will receive one Big Guy. In addition you will receive one Lizardmen Turn Counter. Free shipment included.

 

LEVEL 4

You will receive six Skinks, one of each model, all miniatures different. In addition you will receive one Lizardmen Turn Counter. Free shipment included.

 

NEW LEVEL 5

You will receive 3 Skinks of your choice from the six different models. The 3 Skinks can be different each other, but they can also be repeated if you prefer. Please let us know the numbers of the three Skinks that you wish after claiming this perk. Free shipment included.

 

LEVEL 6

You will receive six Skinks and six Saurus, one of each model, all miniatures different. In addition you will receive one Lizardmen Turn Counter. Free shipment included. (only 30 available)

 

LEVEL 7

You will receive six Skinks and six Saurus, one of each model, all miniatures different. In addition you will receive one Lizardmen Turn Counter. Free shipment included.

 

LEVEL 8 

You will receive six Skinks, six Saurus and a Big Guy, one of each model, all miniatures different. In addition you will receive one Lizardmen Turn Counter. Free shipment included. (only 30 available)

 

LEVEL 9

You will receive six Skinks, six Saurus and a Big Guy, one of each model, all miniatures different. In addition you will receive one Lizardmen Turn Counter. Free shipment included.

 

LEVEL 10 

You will receive FIVE COMPLETE teams. Each Team includes six Skinks, six Saurus and a Big Guy, one of each model, all miniatures different. In addition you will receive five Lizardmen Turn Counters. For rewards, this level counts as 5 "Levels 9". Free shipment included. (only 15 available) 

 

LEVEL 11 

You will receive the painted team used for the box art in this project! This team includes six Skinks, six Saurus and a Big Guy, one of each model, all miniatures different. Painted to the highest level by a professional miniature painter. In addition you will receive one Lizardmen Turn Counter. Feldherr figure case and free shipment included. Delivery time depends on painter's schedule. (only 1 available)

  

Reward Goals

If we reach 4.500 EUR All contributors of Level 6 and higher will get a Skink Cheerleader miniature for free.

 

If we reach 6.000 EUR All contributors will get a new Lizardmen Coach for just 7 EUR, adding the Reward Perk for it.

 

If we reach 7.500 EUR All contributors of Level 6 and higher will get a a Skink Bloodweiser Girl for free.

 

If we reach 10.000 EUR All contributors will get a new Lizardmen Apothecary for just 7 EUR, adding the Reward Perk for it.

 

If we reach 12.000 EUR All contributors of Level 6 and higher will get a Meiko Saurus Cheerleader miniature for free.

 

If we reach 14.000 EUR All contributors will get a new Lizardmen Star Player for just 7 EUR, adding the Reward Perk for it.

 

 

EXTRA REWARD PERKs

With the REWARD PERK you can claim any of the Reward Goals available for just 7 EUR!

The Reward Goals currentlly available are:

LIZARDMEN COACH

 

SET OF 2 LIZARDMEN TOKENS (Big Guy Coin + 2nd Turn or RR Marker)

 

SAURUS BLOODWEISER.

 

 

You can claim one of this Reward Goals each time you get one REWARD PERK, the Level located beetween Level 1 and Level 2. Please let us know which Perk you wish after claming the Reward Perk. If you wish two (or three) of these Perks, you will need to claim two times (or three times) the Reward Perk. 

In case you forget to let us know which Perk you wish, once the campaign ends up we'll contact you by e-mail to know which Perk you prefer.

 

These Perks will be shipped together with your other perks of Level 3 or higher.

 

 

Estimated shipment date: Late Spring 2013 (except LEVEL 11 which depends on the painter)

If you are already a contributor to this campaign, you can claim this perk to get the Hemlocked Skink Assassin Star Player nº 1 for just 7 EUR! It will be shipped together with your other perks of Level 3 or higher.

 
LEVEL 2
If you are already a contributor to this campaign, you can claim this perk to get the new Silly Billy Star Player nº 2 for just 9 EUR! It will be shipped together with your other perks of Level 3 or higher.

 
LEVEL 3
You will receive one Big Guy. In addition you will receive one Lizardmen Turn Counter. Free shipment included.

 
LEVEL 4
You will receive six Skinks, one of each model, all miniatures different. In addition you will receive one Lizardmen Turn Counter. Free shipment included.

 
NEW LEVEL 5
You will receive 3 Skinks of your choice from the six different models. The 3 Skinks can be different each other, but they can also be repeated if you prefer. Please let us know the numbers of the three Skinks that you wish after claiming this perk. Free shipment included. 

 
LEVEL 6
You will receive six Skinks and six Saurus, one of each model, all miniatures different. In addition you will receive one Lizardmen Turn Counter. Free shipment included. (only 30 available)

 
LEVEL 7
You will receive six Skinks and six Saurus, one of each model, all miniatures different. In addition you will receive one Lizardmen Turn Counter. Free shipment included.

 
LEVEL 8 
You will receive six Skinks, six Saurus and a Big Guy, one of each model, all miniatures different. In addition you will receive one Lizardmen Turn Counter. Free shipment included. (only 30 available)

 
LEVEL 9
You will receive six Skinks, six Saurus and a Big Guy, one of each model, all miniatures different. In addition you will receive one Lizardmen Turn Counter. Free shipment included.

 
LEVEL 10 
You will receive FIVE COMPLETE teams. Each Team includes six Skinks, six Saurus and a Big Guy, one of each model, all miniatures different. In addition you will receive five Lizardmen Turn Counters. For rewards, this level counts as 5 "Levels 9". Free shipment included. (only 15 available) 

 
LEVEL 11 
You will receive the painted team used for the box art in this project! This team includes six Skinks, six Saurus and a Big Guy, one of each model, all miniatures different. Painted to the highest level by a professional miniature painter. In addition you will receive one Lizardmen Turn Counter. Feldherr figure case and free shipment included. Delivery time depends on painter's schedule. (only 1 available)

  
Reward Goals
If we reach 4.500 EUR All contributors of Level 6 and higher will get a Skink Cheerleader miniature for free.

 
If we reach 6.000 EUR All contributors will get a new Lizardmen Coach for just 7 EUR, adding the Reward Perk for it.

 
If we reach 7.500 EUR All contributors of Level 6 and higher will get a a Skink Bloodweiser Girl for free.

 
If we reach 10.000 EUR All contributors will get a new Lizardmen Apothecary for just 7 EUR, adding the Reward Perk for it.

 
If we reach 12.000 EUR All contributors of Level 6 and higher will get a Meiko Saurus Cheerleader miniature for free.

 
If we reach 14.000 EUR All contributors will get a new Lizardmen Star Player for just 7 EUR, adding the Reward Perk for it.

 
 
EXTRA REWARD PERKs
With the REWARD PERK you can claim any of the Reward Goals available for just 7 EUR!
The Reward Goals currentlly available are:
LIZARDMEN COACH

 
SET OF 2 LIZARDMEN TOKENS (Big Guy Coin + 2nd Turn or RR Marker)

 
SAURUS BLOODWEISER.

 
 
You can claim one of this Reward Goals each time you get one REWARD PERK, the Level located beetween Level 1 and Level 2. Please let us know which Perk you wish after claming the Reward Perk. If you wish two (or three) of these Perks, you will need to claim two times (or three times) the Reward Perk.  
In case you forget to let us know which Perk you wish, once the campaign ends up we'll contact you by e-mail to know which Perk you prefer.
 
These Perks will be shipped together with your other perks of Level 3 or higher.
 
 
Estimated shipment date: Late Spring 2013 (except LEVEL 11 which depends on the painter)

story:
Help us boost our game to the top on iTunes and Google+.

We have designed a brand new color tansformation puzzle Bolla+

With your help, we are going to post Bolla+ on each review site and bring to everyone our cool puzzle.
We need about $1300 to be able to afford the promotion of Bolla+ on major review sites, and boost it to the top on iTunes and Google+.

ITunes:  

Google+: 

We hope you enjoy playing our game and will ask your friends to download it as well.


Game Description

Bolla+ is a brand new color transformation puzzle where you need to clean up the space on board and think strategicly.

When you join color balls, one of them disapear while another is changing color in a rainbow sequence.

Only violet colors disappear when they're joined, and thus you have to create a strategic combination to clean up the space fast.

When you exchange ball positions you'll get a new ball on the board, and when you've made a wrong move you'll get more balls on the board.

story:
Our Story

My name is Dinko Kundalic and I'm a published comic artist and an amateur flash game designer. For the last few months me, my brother Damir Kundalic, and a friend Reagan Mcclellan have been brain storming ways to make a new type of MMO game that will bring new concepts to this game genre. After a lot of scribbling and sketching we finally got it. The game is going to feature a unique command and conquer system where a team can actually win over territories, or lose them if they don't make an effort to defend them. You will start as a simple army recruit in a 20foot/6meter fully customizable Mech unit for 1 of 3 teams of your choice. Each of the 3 teams will have their own territories on the world map, with ranging concentration of forces and defenses. You will be able to choose to defend your own territory, or attack the enemy teams territory depending on your level (obviously a level 1 player isn't going to attack a capital city). The leveling up system is also going to be some what unique. The amount of exp points you gain is going to be based on the type of enemies you fight. Attacking high level enemies gains you a lot of points, while even killing enemies that are too many levels under you will get you none. But even more than that, loosing to players who are a few levels below you will actually subtract exp point you currently have. I think that is enough information about the game for now, we don't want to give away everything at once.

The Impact

Why is this game important to us and to you perhaps. This is going to be a new type of MMO game where you actually accomplish something through killing hundreds of enemies and exploring hundreds of miles. This isn't going to be yet another useless MMORPG game that you can play for hours on end and no one else can even see the difference you made in your virtual world. So what I'm trying to say is that this will be the making of something different that people will refer to in years to come and will probably be playing updated versions of.


What We Need & What You Get

We need a lot of money to make this game happen. I have a full time job and 2 par time ones, so my time for now it limited and the money I earn is not nearly enough to fund a professional game making team to make my dream come true. Luckily I and my brother are artists, and as such are gifted in certain areas that are needed from making graphics for these kind of games. Oh, and my friend I told you about, "Reagan Mcclellan" just happens to be a semi professional game programmer. So all wee need is time to make the game and a couple of bucks to keep the rent of of our back while we do so. We need somewhere around 10 000usd to make this game just how we imagined it, but even 2000usd ensures us a beta version, with less parts and less weapon types and so on. We need to rent out a server, better equipment and to know that we wont go hungry or sleepy from the lack of coffee during the period of making the game. We don't expect you to give us money for nothing, For everyone who backs our project we got something in stored.


Other Ways You Can Help

We need more programmers to help us directly, or just with some advise. Your work will not go unnoticed, you will be given recondition as aprogrammer in the credits.

PS. We might also need artists but I'm confident for now that me and my brother can handle it.

story:
Our Story

cieCap's co-founders, Mark Rutledge and Ben Gurga, have decided to take a huge leap and bootstrap the continued growth and scaling of this new social gaming and gamification venture. We have had a successful pilot launch over the past two months. We have been fortunate to engage with a number of local business owners and local consumers that have supported our vision and shared with us how much they LOVE cieCap!

 

The cieCap Effect

We created cieCap to bring a new, innovative technology to local businesses whose growth will benefit the development of the communities around them. cieCap fills a market need for customers to engage with the businesses closest to them, earn points for rewards and discounts all while having fun! In return, those businesses are able to offer their customers a fun experience and inform them of their products and services, the history of their community and ways their business positively contribute to the community.

 

Why We Need Your Help

We are taking a different course than many tech startups and focusing on building a product and company that builds communities. To do this we are bootstrapping our company, pulling from our own savings, resilience and networks to grow what will be a transformative social gaming and local business marketing tool. Along the way, we plan to rewrite the blueprint on building a successful, profitable tech company for the 21st century. Bootstrapping is not the easiest path to choose, but we believe it will be the most fulfilling and will allow us to focus on what will be best for you, our users, and for businesses using cieCap for marketing. We need your help as a funding partner and an early spokesperson for cieCap so we can continue on this path towards a fun and socially beneficial technology platform.

 

 

What Your Help Will Go Towards

Your funding support will go towards:
  • Providing a month of free cieCap services to 100 local businesses. 30 each in Detroit, MI and New Orleans, LA; 40 in Pittsburgh, PA. These three cities are all experiencing major economic development and have substantial independent business communities -- $10,000 Value
  • Hosting cieCap Launch Labs in the above 3 cities to bring together members of local technology, business and community development ecosystems to design and test new social gamification tools and officially launch cieCap -- $3,500 Value
  • Acquire small office space in Detroit, MI for operations and development for 3 staff persons -- $900 Value
  • Print marketing materials for the 100 businesses we will begin rolling cieCap out through -- $350 Value
  • Begin rolling cieCap out in additional markets: New York, NY; Washington, DC; Chicago, IL; San Francisco, CA; Oakland, CA; Los Angeles, CA; Portland, OR -- $300 Value

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Donate as much as you feel compelled and comfortable with, and please help us spread the word by using the sharing buttons under the video. Share with your friends, family and social networks and please feel free to ask us any questions you have about our campaign and company. Please email Mark at mark.rutledge@ciecap.com with any questions.

story:
DOWNLOAD THE DEMO AND FALL IN LOVE!

You get an unexpected package delivery one day. When you open it, there’s a man inside - but luckily, he comes with instructions! You have your own impressionable boyfriend. It’s your duty to shape him into a proper person… since he’s actually a “doll” with no past exposure to people. 

However, this delivery wasn’t meant for you. Will you fall in love with the person he turns out to be? Will you be able to keep him by your side?

  • Influence Boyfriend by choosing what pastimes and jobs he takes  
  • Raise your affection with Boyfriend during visual novel sections
  • Choose which pronouns he calls you by
  • Watch as his looks change depending on his personality
  • Partial voice acting for each personality
  • An array of random events, allowing for better replayability
  • Two distinct endings per personality  
  • Special, unlockable sexy scenes (R17), unique to each personality
  • Three bonus unlockable scenes

Expansion-pack only.

Expansion-pack only.

All funds raised after IGG & transfer fees will go straight back into development to improve the game with more content, with the bare minimum amount of content having already been funded by Reine Works. In fact, thanks to pre-orders made on itch.io, we managed to hit three stretch goals prior to this campaign's start!

$200 - Extra feature: clicker mini-game + mini-game toggle ~ ACHIEVED 09/02

$300 - 5 new CGs ~ ACHIEVED 09/03

$500 - 1 new sexy (R17) scene per Boyfriend ~ ACHIEVED 09/14

$750 - 5 new CGs ~ ACHIEVED 09/20

$1,000 - New route: Beta Boyfriend ~ ACHIEVED 09/24

$1,250 - 1 new random event, voted on by Backers ~ ACHIEVED 09/27

$1,500 - Epilogues + epilogue CGs

$1,750 - Partial voicing for NPCs

$2,000 - Voiced epilogues

pigionsdeliver [concepts, writing, campaign graphics]

gamerbum [concepts, editing, programming]

Maddie [writing, audio management, video]

Mama J [writing]

Alison H. [graphic design, chibi CG artist]

Jonah Scott [Boyfriend's voice]

MukangASO [sprite artwork]

mootecky [CG artwork]

gin-1994 [background artwork]

Poloski [misc. campaign help]

story:
Crazy Make 'Em Ups™ is one part Kings Cup, one part Battle Wizards, one part Cards Against Humanity®, and one part Mad Libs®. The gameplay is very loose and open to interpretation so you and your friends can decide exactly how much fun you want to have. (Hint: It should be ALL the fun. Unless you are boring. Then you should go back to that Apples to Apples® knock off.)


You sound like a drunk Swede invading Canada

I'm the opposite of the person you say that to.

Oh so you did the Gymnasty

Well the neighbors got a good show

Who's pants are these?

Not the first time I've been kicked out of IHOP.

My boss makes me drink, on purpose.

The world will look up and shout "Save us!"

And I'll look down and whisper "Hodor."

the game made me do it.

I've never seen hodor, hodor so emphatically.

Hello, sunshine! Now go away.

there is a person we don't know in the lost and found.

I'm going to do this, and I'm going to regret it

I'm going to need a liver transplant

i woke up in mostly my own clothes this time. so, that's a win.

i'm married now.


Real Bad Decision plush teddy bears are here! Pledge $300 (or more!) to get one of your very own! Put them on your bed for when you bring home that one night stand. We won't judge.

We might or might not send prints of these guys to you for helping us get the project off the ground.


We're pretty cool people. We like playing games with cool people. Not everyone is as cool as you though. The game is meant to be played for fun, and no one has to perform an action that makes them uncomfortable. We understand (no we don't) that some people don't want to take their clothes off or drink. We made it easy to differentiate the clothing/drinking cards so you can play with your lame ass church group on Sundays and your awesome fucking party crew on the 4th of July.

Conceptually, the game is a bit different from other games you have played, it's left to the players to fill in ways to make the cards more fun. It's more of a loose framework of stuff for you to do rather than cards with strict rules. We leave it open-ended on purpose so y'all* can agree on what you think is the most fun way to play the game.

Players take cards from the deck, fill in any blanks, then place them face down on the table. They then take turns drawing each card and performing the action listed. Some actions are tame - "Hug the person to your left." Others... well... we hope you wore clean underwear (and so does the person to your right).

*Our copy editor really wanted to use the word "y'all". {shudders}


All joking aside, we've been working on various game ideas for several years in our free time outside our day jobs. Todd, our owner, has been coming up with silly games his entire life. This is the first one we feel would be awesome fun for you to play AND is simple enough to be produced by our little team. We don't believe in biting off more than we can chew, but if this game takes off, it could give us the freedom to come up with even more wacky ideas! It would really mean a lot to all of us to be able to see people enjoying a product we created.

Hey, look! It's our team! (Dustin, Todd, Carrie, Brian, and Jessie)



Wow. I honestly can't believe you read this far. I bet you kept turning the pages of The Monster at the End of this Book when you were a kid, didn't you? Don't worry, I did too. You had to really love scrolling or want to know more to get this far... As a reward for your persistence, if you go to our site, you can download the game for free! Just give us a nice review on Amazon or something :-)

http://crazymakeemups.com

Thanks for checking out our project!

Your Friends,

story:
Short Summary

Indiana has set a precedent that we feel is unacceptable. With the recent Religious Freedom Restoration Act, Indiana has introduced a law that allows business owners to legally discriminate impose their religious freedom upon the LGBT community. Naturally, being game designers, we are protesting this in the only way we know how: by making a card game. 

Gameplay

In RFRA:TCG, the object of the game is to spend your money before your friends. Players take turns by deciding whether they want to safely shop online or take their chances by visiting a local Indiana business. Be careful though! Because of the new RFRA, a business has the religious right to kick you out of the store if your character believes in something they don't approve of.
This is a fun, quick game that illustrates the absurdities of the new Indiana law. We guarantee you will have at least 5 minutes of fun and the peace of mind knowing that you donated to a worthy cause.

What We Need & What You Get

We are asking for $100,000, although frankly any dollar amount will suffice. Where will this money go? 100% of it will be donated to GLAAD, a 501(c)(3) non for profit organization which supports the LGBT community. Your contribution is tax deductible. So donate now!

What will you get in return? What, the warm fuzzy feeling of knowing that you have donated to a just progressive cause isn't enough for you? Ok fine, you get to play this admittedly hastily created game that we feel is fun, funny, but most importantly highlights the potential impacts on LGBT people in Indiana.

Upon donating at least $5, at the conclusion of the campaign you will receive a print-and-play document which will allow you to print your own copy of RFRA:TCG (Religious Freedom Restoraction Act: The Card Game). Currently there are no plans to print a physical card game (except for the $1,000 pledge level), but who knows, maybe if enough people hate the idea we will make it into a bonafide game.

Who We Are

We are Hogger Logger LLC, a game development company based in Freehold, New Jersey. We love pizza, bagels, and Chinese food, but we hate bigotry. As yearly attendees of Gen Con in Indianapolis, it is already bad enough that Indiana's coffee is disgusting. This is the tipping point for us.

Risks & Challenges

There are no risks. There are no challenges. The only risk we assume is hopefully we don't get too much hate mail. But even if we do, we'll just post it online for the world to see and laugh at. By the way, if you want to send us hate email, please send it to hoggerloggerllc@gmail.com.

Other Ways You Can Help

Share this campaign on your favorite social media. Feel free to follow us on Facebook and Twitter to receive all our nifty updates. And be sure to tell your friends that yes, this is most certainly an anti-gay bill.

FAQ

Q. Is my contribution tax deductible?
A. Yes. After you donate,  you will receive an email from FirstGiving confirming the tax-deductible status of your contribution.
Q. Is this an April Fools joke?
A. Do we look like people who joke?
Q. Are you profiting off of this?
A. No. 100% of the proceeds are being given to GLAAD.

With the recent Religious Freedom Restoration Act, Indiana has introduced a law that allows business owners to legally discriminate impose their religious freedom upon the LGBT community. Naturally, being game designers, we are protesting this in the only way we know how: by making a card game.

Players take turns by deciding whether they want to safely shop online or take their chances by visiting a local Indiana business. Be careful though! story:
We have been Greenlit on our Kickstarter campaign! Thank you to everyone for their support!

Magic was thought long vanished from the world of Gallantia after a civil war between the ancient wizards and the armies of man. Until now....

We've been featured on:

Outside of Asia, the potential of visual novels, to this day, remains largely untapped. The recent success of the Kickstarter campaign of Afterthought Studios’A More Beautiful World gives me hope as it sees to combine aspects from both sides of the prime meridian. - Haogamers

Afterthought Studios has the beginnings of a great game in their hands and it is exciting to see where they will move Violetta as the game moves forward, especially when it comes to friendship or romance! If you’re into complex stories that focus on individuals but on relationships and worlds as well or if you enjoy magical, traveling story lines like those inSpice and Wolf or Maoyuu Maou Yuusha, please consider checking out the lovely demo! - Hayurika

Our GUI has also been staff picked on Portfolium!


Magic vanished when the ancient wizards who ruled Gallantia were ousted by the armies of man. Knowledge of the arcane and the ones who worked the ancient Blessings were lost - buried in the sands of time.   

Magic has been relegated to the realm of myth, of superstition. Yet, myths often have a basis in truth, and a chance encounter in the Eternal Forest could change the world forever.

Join Violetta, the Witch of Everlasting Journeys, as she travels through an expansive fantasy setting rich in history and lore on an epic quest to discover if mankind has truly made "A More Beautiful World" in the absence of miracles.

What will she find at the end of her adventure? Hope for a brighter tomorrow, or despair in the nature of man? That's the question YOU will have to help answer.

Inspired by novels such as 'Spice and Wolf' and 'Maoyuu Maou Yuusha', A More Beautiful World follows their tradition of placing emphasis on relationships, money and politics. 

As you join Violetta, expect to see many familiar elements in her journey; history buffs will also pick out real world events reflected in the story from China, Europe and the Americas.That's the question that remains to be answered.

Fans of classical literature can expect to find allusions to their favourite works in the visual novel too! Will you join Violetta on her journey?


Curious for a taste of the visual novel? 

Please follow this link to download our demo! It spans about 60% of the length of Act I, an estimated 60-80 minutes in playtime. There are four Acts in total, with Act II being similar to Act I in length while Act III and IV combined are three times longer than Acts I and II.

Do note that our revamped demo is coming to the Steam Store soon.

The demo is also hosted on Mediafire and IndieDB.

Do note that this demo is merely a sample of the narrative experience that A More Beautiful World seeks to offer!

In Act I, Violetta meets the Merchant; in the later acts, she will meet many other characters while bidding farewell to her previous companions.

Afterthought Studios' aim is to create stories that resound with our readers and inspire them to apply lessons to their daily lives. We are experienced creators and visual novel enthusiasts from around the world who came together to create a story worth being retold for the ages.

Our author, Darren Kwok, is based in Singapore. He has assisted in the marketing and greenlighting for several visual novels and games.

On our music team, we have Steven Melin, a video game, film, & television music composer based in Atlanta, GA. He has previously assisted industry veterans Garry Schyman (Shadow of Mordor, Bioshock series) and Penka Kouneva (Gears of War 3, Prince of Persia: The Forgotten Sands). Melin is also a writer for Vision1 Music and AudioJungle music libraries.


‘harmonicblend’ is a music circle founded by Trass. They have worked on several indie games and other projects, including some personal projects. They are currently most known for their works featured in the indie horror game Dreaming Mary soundtrack, as well as Sol=Akata, the album which they prepared for Comiket and was sold out in just two hours - More recently, COSMOCRYSTAL, another one of their productions sold out at M3-Fall in Japan. Check out the the song you heard from our trailer right here!


As for our art, we are working with the talented Yuuki, who will be responsible for all the sprites and CGs in A More Beautiful World. Sillyselly will be creating our background art. ameliori and artsvan, from Fervent are the folks behind the successful visual novels Who Is Mike and CUPID are also assisting in the artistic process. With the funds from the Kickstarter, we would also undergo an art revamp and upgrade.

Our programmer, MysteryCorgi, has several visual novels under her belt, including Culina: The Spirit of Cooking and Hands in the Kitchen. She also did work for That Cheap and Sacred Thing as well as logos and GUIs for various indie projects. Special thanks is also accorded to Krystian Alabrudzinski, our partner. 

The logo for A More Beautiful World was made by Luna Li and the GUI designed by Camille Arana, and part of the main menu was designed from the resource created by TsukinoHikari20.

We will also be working with Aria for our art revamp.



As A More Beautiful World will be fully voiced in English, we are working with other professionals in the voice acting field.

Sound Cadence Studios is a freelance indie Casting & Production Studio, founded by Amber Lee Connors, professional voice actress, director and writer and it is also partnered with Team Four Star, who supplies some of the in-house talent. 

They have an extensive portfolio which includes Dead Island: Epidemic as well as Dread Out.


We require the extra funding to bring our game to its maximum potential and to complete the remainder of the game. Some changes include an art upgrade.

We've absorbed most of the costs by ourselves to minimize the amount of funds raised, in order to reduce the risk for our backers.


Our physical reward for A More Beautiful World comes in a 2 Disc swing tray, which will contain a beautiful 8 page booklet, the game and our OST!

The cover art of the DVD cases is being illustrated by Aria -

All digital rewards will be distributed via mediums such as Steam; we will send out keys to all of you amazing backers the moment they become available! Once again, everyone in Afterthought Studios thanks you for taking a look at our project.

Full Visual Novel Conversion ($10,000)

Any funds raised on IndieGoGo's InDemand program will contribute directly to our production of our visual novel.

story:
For 24 years Galcom has manufactured solar powered radios for distribution by missionaries and pastors around the world. Last year we added an audio Bible function to our radios and the demand has blown us away.

To keep up, we need to purchase a new, larger SD card duplicator to put the audio Bibles and other sermons and teachings that we've received from our partners around the world onto the 'ImpaX' players.

Missionaries and Pastors in remote areas often get to a village only once every couple months. Being able to hand out a solar audio Bible or fix-tuned radio allows them to talk to people about Jesus every day. Also, 70% of the world doesn't read so leaving them a Bible or other written material has little impact.

When people donate to Galcom to send a radio or audio Bible around the world 100% of their gift goes to that radio. That doesn't leave us with anything to purchase necessary equipment upgrades. We think that a 31 slot SD duplicator will allow us to keep up with demand sending out 3,000+ radios and audio Bibles each month.

For any gift of $50 or more we will send you our solar powered 'Storyteller' audio Bible that includes the "Jesus Story" which is a dramatized Gospel of Luke, great for sharing with friends who may never have heard of Jesus before.

story:
Our Story

Grant Duffrin and Wingel Buendia are student filmmakers, currently in preproduction of parts II & III of the â€œLink to the Futureâ€ series. Our goal is to explain the official timeline recently released by Nintendo, clearing up how the convoluted order of events came into being in two separate films.

Check out the first film here.

The films will continue in the style set by the first film, which is a parody of the â€œLegend of Zeldaâ€ and â€œBack to the Futureâ€ franchises. They will both be around 6 minutes long, like the first film, and center on the ever-expanding and confusing universe of the Zelda video games.

Our hopes are to raise 1,500 dollars. This is the estimated amount we need to allow for quality costumes, props, and other production costs. These funds will also cover equipment costs and feeding cast and crew. With your help, we can make these two films amazing!

 

The Impact

The first film grew very popular on the Internet, getting a lot of attention from Zelda and Back to the Future fans alike. There is still more of the story to tell, however. If the 1,500 dollars isnâ€™t met, weâ€™ll still make the films on what we have. The more money we collect though will mean higher production value.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Most of the money will be used for props and costumes, as there are plenty of new characters and settings being introduced. Catering, on-set essentials, and permits also need to be taken into account. As this is our only funding source outside of our own pockets, we are hoping to make as much on here.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Anything you can donate will greatly be appreciated, and donâ€™t forget to share this page with other! Use the share tool and help spread the word!

Thank you so much for your time and consideration. We greatly appreciate your collaboration with us to make this project something special.

story:
Hello, my name is Jeff Gunzenhauser.

I am writing you because I am a gamer that plays with 1 arm and I have adapted to teach myself to play video games such as Call of duty Black ops 2

I am trying to get to Columbus to compete in the MLG event going on Nov 22. Competing there will help me to network and gain the fan base i will need to take my goal further and that is to help kids with disabilities enjoy the something that brings joy.  

My gamer tag is 1ARM ASSASSIN and my Twitch Channel ishttp://www.twitch.tv/1arm_assassin. Anything would help. 

Thank you for your time. If you have any questions, my contact info appears below. Email: gunzie57@yahoo.com Twitter: twitter.com/1ARM_ASSASSIN

story:
Kenney Land will be located in the Netherlands (Limburg, Kerkrade), a place where game developers are free to learn, work, teach, create and play.

Over the last couple of months we've provided the community with over 6,500 assets (Download) which are completely free and ready to use in all kinds of projects.

Now, we'd like to open a game development community in our hometown, Kerkrade. This place will be a location where (aspiring) game developers can learn, teach, create and play. A massive amount of events will be like there, like Game Jams, workshops, trainings, meetings, livestreams and more!

You can get involved right away by joining the community, signing-up is free and there's no need to pledge:

Kenney Land Community

Feel free to invite other game developers, artists, writers and musicians to the community.

We will teach the following disciplines:
Construct 2, Unity, Unreal Engine, Adobe AIR/Flash and Game Maker Studio along these programming languages: JavaScript, ActionScript, C#, Python, C / C++, Game Maker Lanugage (GML) and more, based on demand!

    And the following events will be organized:

    • Bi-weekly developer meetings
    • Game jams (Ludum Dare)
    • Workshops (beginner, advanced, expert)
    • Trainings (beginner, advanced, expert)
    • Livestreams
    • Game nights

    To start this community a venue is needed, which we already rented (see pictures). The space needs to be remodeled though to provide the full potential and give beginner game developers a chance to get started in their career.

    (Click for larger images)


    Here's where you can help! Any donation, even small ones, help us get to that goal and get the venue up and running.

    So, what exactly will be organised at Kenney Land?

    First of all, game developers can visit to work, learn teach, create and play. Our goal is to provide a place for programmers, designers, sound artists and writers where they can develop their skills. There aren't any game development studies nearby, the only way people who'd like to pursue a career in game development can make it happen is by self study.

    To give beginners a helping hand or to teach advanced developers new disciplines all kinds of workshops and training sessions will be held. There will also be guest presentations by established names in the game development industry.

    Regularly there will be (open) meetings in which companies, freelancers and amateurs come together to chat about the game industry, socialize and give presentations.

    In addition to the above events we also provide resources for game developers. OUYA, Oculus Rift and more development kits will be ready for use. There will be a large number of books on game development available (all programming languages) and a wide range of graphics and sound assets (12,000+) that may be freely used by developers.

    What if I'm not located in the Kenney Land area, why would I fund?

    We understand that most of the funders will not be close (enough) to Kenney Land to attend regulary, or even attend at all. That's why we've chosen to give away a pack with over 4,000 NEW assets, watch the video above for a complete overview of what's included!

    Crowdfunding Pack

    (pledge $20 or more to receive)

    If you decide to pledge $20 you'll receive the crowdfunding pack (within 24-hours after pledge). It'll be licensed to you, and you're the only one that may use it! 3 months after the crowdfunding campaign (if it succeeds) the assets will be re-licensed and released in the public domain (CC0). Here's what's included:

    ART

    • Alien Spaceships Pack (45 assets)
    • Explosion Pack (60 assets)
    • Isometric Buildings Pack (650 assets)
    • Platformer Pack Redux (360 assets)
    • Roguelike Pack (2125 assets)
    • UI Pack Pixel Edition (750 assets)
    • Brobots (35 assets)
    • Brick pack (40 assets)
    AUDIO
    • Foley sounds (85 sounds)
    • Music loops (30 files)
    • Retro sounds (35 sounds)
    OTHER
    • Sources (3 files)

    Also, we're planning to do weekly Kenney LIVE events where everyone around the world can tune in and request assets and other game art to be made. Next to that we will also livestream our workshops and give special workshops for those not able to attend.

    Perks

    We've got various different perks to thank you for your pledge;

    What happens when the funding goal is met?

    Three (3) months after the campaign has ended all the assets in the crowdfunding pack will have their licenses changed to CC0 (Public domain) and will be free for everyone.

    We will be able to access the venue starting October 1st, after that we will start remodeling the place into Kenney Land and we hope to welcome our first developers around December to January (2015).

    Risks & challenges

    When the funding goal is not met we'll be looking at other funding options, like an investment or loan. In the worst case the venue will still be realized but on a smaller scale or with less equipment available.

    All the perks are done and ready to be distributed, there's no risk in not receiving the perks when the project is not funded well enough.

    I don't have money but like to help, tell me how!

    Hey no worries! You can help out by telling others about this campaign by sharing on Twitter, Facebook and other social media. It would also be great if you could send a message about this campaign to the press.

    Thanks for reading and possibly your pledge!

A massive amount of events will be like there, like Game Jams, workshops, trainings, meetings, livestreams and more!You can get involved right away by joining the community, signing-up is free and there's no need to pledge:Kenney Land CommunityFeel free to invite other game developers, artists, writers and musicians to the community.We will teach the following disciplines:Construct 2, Unity, Unreal Engine, Adobe AIR/Flash and Game Maker Studio along these programming languages: JavaScript, ActionScript, C#, Python, C / C++, Game Maker Lanugage (GML) and more, based on demand!And the following events will be organized:

Bi-weekly developer meetings


Game jams (Ludum Dare)


Workshops (beginner, advanced, expert)


Trainings (beginner, advanced, expert)


Livestreams


Game nights

To start this community a venue is needed, which we already rented (see pictures). The space needs to be remodeled though to provide the full potential and give beginner game developers a chance to get started in their career.
(Click for larger images)
Here's where you can help! Any donation, even small ones, help us get to that goal and get the venue up and running.So, what exactly will be organised at Kenney Land?First of all, game developers can visit to work, learn teach, create and play. Our goal is to provide a place for programmers, designers, sound artists and writers where they can develop their skills. There aren't any game development studies nearby, the only way people who'd like to pursue a career in game development can make it happen is by self study.To give beginners a helping hand or to teach advanced developers new disciplines all kinds of workshops and training sessions will be held. There will also be guest presentations by established names in the game development industry.Regularly there will be (open) meetings in which companies, freelancers and amateurs come together to chat about the game industry, socialize and give presentations.In addition to the above events we also provide resources for game developers. OUYA, Oculus Rift and more development kits will be ready for use. There will be a large number of books on game development available (all programming languages) and a wide range of graphics and sound assets (12,000+) that may be freely used by developers.What if I'm not located in the Kenney Land area, why would I fund?We understand that most of the funders will not be close (enough) to Kenney Land to attend regulary, or even attend at all. That's why we've chosen to give away a pack with over 4,000 NEW assets, watch the video above for a complete overview of what's included!Crowdfunding Pack
(pledge $20 or more to receive)
If you decide to pledge $20 you'll receive the crowdfunding pack (within 24-hours after pledge). It'll be licensed to you, and you're the only one that may use it! 3 months after the crowdfunding campaign (if it succeeds) the assets will be re-licensed and released in the public domain (CC0). Here's what's included:ART

Alien Spaceships Pack (45 assets)


Explosion Pack (60 assets)


Isometric Buildings Pack (650 assets)


Platformer Pack Redux (360 assets)


Roguelike Pack (2125 assets)

UI Pack Pixel Edition (750 assets)
Brobots (35 assets)
Brick pack (40 assets)
AUDIO

Foley sounds (85 sounds)


Music loops (30 files)


Retro sounds (35 sounds)

OTHER

Sources (3 files)


Also, we're planning to do weekly Kenney LIVE events where everyone around the world can tune in and request assets and other game art to be made. Next to that we will also livestream our workshops and give special workshops for those not able to attend.
Perks
We've got various different perks to thank you for your pledge;






What happens when the funding goal is met?
Three (3) months after the campaign has ended all the assets in the crowdfunding pack will have their licenses changed to CC0 (Public domain) and will be free for everyone.We will be able to access the venue starting October 1st, after that we will start remodeling the place into Kenney Land and we hope to welcome our first developers around December to January (2015).Risks & challengesWhen the funding goal is not met we'll be looking at other funding options, like an investment or loan. In the worst case the venue will still be realized but on a smaller scale or with less equipment available.All the perks are done and ready to be distributed, there's no risk in not receiving the perks when the project is not funded well enough.I don't have money but like to help, tell me how!Hey no worries! You can help out by telling others about this campaign by sharing on Twitter, Facebook and other social media. It would also be great if you could send a message about this campaign to the press.Thanks for reading and possibly your pledge!

story:
1/6 ¿Qué es Battlefields Operation II? / ¿What is Battlefields Operation II?
2/6 ¿Por qué ofrecerlo desde una campaña? / Why from a campaign?
3/6 ¿Qué escenografía encontrarás? / What scenery you will find?
4/6 METAS / GOALS
5/6/ESP ¿Cómo hacer un pedido? / 5/6/ENG How to order?
6/6 Información adicional sobre nuestros productos /Additional infomration about our products

1/6 ¿Qué es Battlefields Operation II?
¿What is Battlefields Operation II?

Es la campaña de la marca española EnCobertura destinada a la fabricaión de la línea de escenografía de terrenos para wargames. En esta campaña se ofrecen todos los artículos para un completo campo de batalla para wargames de todo tipo y escala: desde el terreno principal, hasta elementos naturales como bosques, colinas, formaciones rocosas y ríos entre otros. Además, ofrecerá escenografía temática para escenarios concretos como Villers-Bocage, ideal para juegos de segunda guerra mundial como Flames of War, entre otros.

Puedes encontrar más información en nuestra web www.encobertura.com, así como el catálogo completo.

Is the campaign of the spanish brand EnCobertura destined to manufacture of the scenery terrain line for wargames. This line includes all the items for a complete wargame gameboard of any scale or any theme: from main terrain or gameboard, to elements as forest, hills, rocks formations and rivers inter alia.

You can find more information on our www.encobertura.com, as well as the complete catalogue.

 

 

2/6 ¿Por qué ofrecerlo desde una campaña?
Why from a campaign?

El motivo de crear esta campaña es para ofrecer este material a precio de fábrica, el mismo del que disfrutaría un comprador mayorista.

Esta línea de productos fue diseñada y puesta a la venta hace ya algún tiempo, siendo por tanto un producto testeado que ofrece todas las garantías. Podéis ver una gran cantidad de fotos.

Debido a los procesos de fabricación, y a la mano de obra que requieren estos productos, podemos ofrecer mejores precios y condiciones a nuestros clientes, si fabricamos una gran cantidad de piezas, en lugar de hacerlo en pequeñas demandas. Ese es el motivo por el que hacemos la campaña. ¡¡Nuestro beneficio será el de nuestros clientes!!

¿Cuándo entregamos vuestra escenografía? Toda la escenografía se entregará entre la segunda quincena de Marzo y Junio de 2014, haciendo un esfuerzo para evitar retrasarnos todo lo que podamos.

The reason of this campaign is offer this material at factory price, the same for a wholesale buyer.

This product line was designed and saled a time ago, and is then a tested stuff that offer all warranties.

Due to manufacturing processes and manpower needed on this stuff, we can offer better prices and conditions if manufacture a great deal of pieces, instead of in small claims. It is the reason of the campaign. Our profit will be to our customers!!

When your scenery will be delivered? All scenery will be delivered between the last 15 days of March and June of 2014, trying to prevent any delay.

3/6 ¿Qué escenografiá encontrarás?
What scenery you will find?

A continuación, las categorías de nuestros productos para terrenos de wargame.
PINCHA EN LAS IMÁGENESpara acceder a los productos en nuestra web.

The following are our products cateogories for wargames terrain.
CLICK THE IMAGES to access at our web products.



4/6 METAS /GOALS

Según evolucione la campaña, conseguiréis recompensas por las contribuciones realizadas y las categorías de las cuales adquirísteis artículos, siendo acumulativas por metas. Revisa actualizaciones. Más info en nuestra web www.encobertura.com.


As the campaign evolves, you will get rewards for your contribution and by each categoy of the items that you choose belong, being cumulative. See updates to see actual goals. More info at our web www.encobertura.com.

5/6/ESP ¿Cómo hacer un pedido?


1º Entra en www.encobertura.com/productos.php, elige el artículo del que estés interesado, y pulsa el botón


2º Completa los datos solicitados en la sección de Indiegogo a la que serás llevada para realizar la aportación correctamente. Repite los pasos 1º y 2º con todos los artículos que desees.

3º Envíanos un mail a info@encobertura.com copiando y completando la siguiente ficha:

Nombre: ____________
Apellidos: ___________
E-mail: ______________
Aportación 1: ___€ para el artículo ___.
Aportación 2: ___€ para el artículo ___.
Aportación 3: ___€ para el artículo ___.
...
(Para bonos de pintado)
Aportación 7: ___€ para pintar el/los artículos de las aportaciones ___, ___, en la textura _____.

Ejemplo:

Nombre: Chuck
Apellidos: Norris
E-mail: gmail@chucknorris.com
Aportación 1: 10€ para el artículo Palmeras 15mm.
Aportación 2: 70€ para el artículo Formaciones Rocosas.
Aportación 3: 100€ para el artículo Superficie Enrollable.
Aportación 4: 50€ para pintar los artículos de las aportaciones 2 y 3, en la textura Terreno Devastado.

5/6/ENG How to order?


1º Enter at www.encobertura.com/productos.php, choose your item and click


2º Fill in the form at Indiegogo page that will appear to make your contribution. Repeat 1ª y 2" steps with all items that you want.

3º Send us an e-mail to info@encobertura.com indicating copying and filling this form:

Name: ____________
Surnames: ___________
E-mail: ______________
Contribution 1: ___€ for article ___.
Contribution 2: ___€ for article ___.
Contribution 3: ___€ for article ___.
...
(For painting bonus)
Contribution 7: ___€ to paint items of contributions ___, ___, at texture _____.

Example:

Name: Chuck
Surnames: Norris
E-mail: gmail@chucknorris.com
Contribution 1: 10€ for article 15mm Palmtree.
Contribution 2: 70€ for article Rock Formations.
Contribution 3: 100€ for article Roll-up Surface.
Contribution 4: 50€ to paint items of contributions 2 and 3, at texture Wasteland.

6/6 Información adicional sobre nuestros productos
Additional infomration about our products

- Gastos de Envío / Shipping Cost

- Terrenos Modulares / Modular Gameboards

- Superficies Enrollables / Roll-up Surfaces

- Escenografía Flexible / Flexible Scenery

¡¡GRACIAS POR COLABORAR CON NOSOTROS!!
THANK YOU FOR COOPERATING WITH US!!
