story:
Fundraiser Update

If you have reached this fundraiser page after the end of the fundraiser, please visit our website, WhukGames.com, for more details on the progress of Cassiopeia Drift, and additional details on how you can help!

Cassiopeia Drift

Whuk Games is proud to announce the up-and-coming Space Action title, Cassiopeia Drift. This multiplayer game will be released in Q1 2014, and focuses on a post-apocalyptic human society, decimated and driven from their home under mysterious circumstances. Players will fly through space, harvesting resources to build ships, command space stations, manage shops, and more! Donate now to help it become shiny!

Gameplay

In this game, you play a citizen of humanity, exiled from our galaxy. Choose to ally with any of a number of factions or remain independent. Fly solo or team up to explore this strange new galaxy. Rebuild your forces and prepare to exact revenge! Experience the free flight style of Freelancer, the fleet management style of Homeworld, the space station management style of Far Gate, and if we reach those stretch goals, look forward to the space station interior style of Battlefront 2 and the level editing style of Evil Genius.

F.A.Q.
How are you different from Eve Online?
Besides being Free to Play? Our game will allow you to actually pilot and customize your own ship. Switch colors, add decals, adjust weapon mount points. Our missions will have better, more interesting rewards, and you can solo them. You don't have to join a faction. Our game will have an ongoing inspirational storyline. We will allow you to fly from planet to planet, from star to star without 'warping to a grid'. Mining will be automated, and you can even leave the asteroid or planet and get notifications from homing beacons to come back when your mining drones are full. You will be able to interact with asteroids and planets; exploit the resources, make stations on the surface, and employ the services of the native populations!

What if you don't make your goal?
We are releasing Cassiopeia Drift in Q1 2014, but we would like to make it the best game it can be. For that, we need your help!

Why do you need all this money? Where will it go?
We are putting the money toward the cost of software licenses, hiring extra talent, acquiring software to get a better quality of work done, and feeding our faces to keep the development going.

How much will the game cost?
The game will be free-to-play, so you can still play the game with your friends. The DVD will be available in the Whuk Games store for the cost of $24.99 before shipping. The DVD with Soundtrack will be available for $39.99. The game also can be purchased digitally for $10, which allows you to pilot Carrier motherships and operate Slipstream engines! The signed Collectors Editions are only available through this campaign!

What can I do in this game? What's your vision?
Fly and interact with a variety of space vessels of varying sizes from tiny Scout ships to huge Carriers and the Ark Ship. Take on missions and hire red-shirts to expedite your progress, as well as to repair your ship, manufacture new items, research new technologies. Capitalize on the curious effects of spatial anomalies and ancient alien artifacts. You can even start your own space station to control systems, currencies, and governments!

Design a portion of the game? What's that mean?
At the Admiral contributor level, you get to design or redesign a major portion of the game, for a limited time! We will make you an honorary member of Whuk Games. You will have creative control over a portion of game lore, the history and appearance of a default faction, the default designs for a class of starships, the ultimate fate of one of the five arks, or a minigame of your own design. The choice is completely up to you.

Fundraiser-Exclusive Features

Escape Pod: Most players who play the game will be subject to penalties if their ship is destroyed. With a "Hidesaver" escape pod on your side, however, you have no need to worry. All crew and cargo will be buffered in the escape pod's teleporter array, while the Superstring Conduit engines minimize travel time.

Whuk: While exploring the stars of the Milky Way galaxy, Humankind stumbled upon these small cute creatures. Like a dog or a pig without a snout or a tail, cooing Whuks are said to have a calming and cathartic effect upon the weary starship captain. Jr. Lt. Donors start the game with a Whuk!

Alien Race: Andromeda's satellite galaxy 'Cassiopeia' is host to a variety of alien life forms. With your donation, you will work with our game artist to design your own awesome space-faring alien creature, and see it come to life within the game!

Ark Captain: Five arks left Sol to escape the impending doom offered by the threat. Each of the arks was captained by an elite naval fleet officer of the old Order of Humankind. With your donation, you will become that fleet officer! Your image will be immortalized in the historical records!

System Requirements

A Unity3d Compatible OS; Windows XP or later; and a 3d card.

 

 Click the image to watch it on Youtube!

Alpha Stage: Functionality Video

Each tier includes the rewards from the tiers above it.

Old Sea Dog - 1$
Free Beer [in-game item]
Name in the Credits!
Exclusive Dev Forums!


Cadet - 10$
FTL Pilot's License.
"HideSaver" escape pod for life!
Preregister in April!


Jr. Lieutenant - 25$
Fully equipped Transport or Fighter.
Two in-game defense ships.
Free in-game pet Whuk!


Chief Petty Officer - 33$
Design your character's own outfit and appearance.
Work with Whuk Games designers.
Start the game with it!
Lieutenant - 50$
Fully equipped Frigate/Heavy Fighter.
DVD/box art PDFs/ISO!
Space Outpost kit!


Lt. Commander - 100$
Cassiopeia Drift T-Shirt.
Fully equipped Frigate or battleship.
Space Station kit! One(1) BETA Key.


 Captain - 250$
Signed Game Disc in a DVD case!
Art Book PDF!
Starbase kit! Three(3) total BETA Keys.


Commodore - 500$
Design your own alien race!
Soundtrack CD! Unlimited BETA Keys.
Carrier ship and a Plush Whuk!


 Admiral of the Fleet - 5000$
Your likeness as an Ark Captain!
Join the Whuk Games team and help design the game!
Dine with Whuk Games and get a Huge Plush Whuk!

 

Rocky Asteroid - $10,000

When this goal is reached, all pledge levels will receive one (1) FREE BETA KEY (in addition to however many beta keys you already have), and the 'Minesprayer' weapons pack. Since this will let us release this multiplayer game without the need for huge patches, we'll include physical Cloth patches of the Game Logo to every supporter who gives us their mailing address. The game will also be supported on Mac OS X 10.5+ and Ubuntu 10.10+ in addition to Windows.

Iron Comet - $30,000

At this level, Whuk Games will be able to hire more talent in order to finish the game's basics sooner, and start working on more advanced modules. This means we'll be able to put space station interiors and hand-to-claw combat into the game and every pledge gets a fundraiser-exclusive ray-gun. The game will also be released for Ouya.

$100k, $300k, $1m

More ships, aliens, missions, and minigames! Posters for everyone? IOS or Android? Space station level editors? Contribute and vote today!

Whuk Games

Whuk Games is:
Steve Mattison, former Activision Game Tester for the Call of Duty series, creator of the acclaimed "Aperture Science" FuturePinball Table, programmer of many clones (Urban Dead was an awesome challenge to recreate) and winner of many "Game-in-a-Day" contests. (Lavana Online was fun while it lasted!)

Meidel Hirabayashi, legendary artist extraordinaire.

Kris Wood, texture artist for Fable 2, 3d modeller of badassery for Empire Earth 3 and Silent Hill 5...

...and more!

???Special Guest Artists???

The game will also highlight a special guest appearance by one or more digital or musical artists. Wait and find out! (Are you excited yet? I know I am!)

Each of the arks was captained by an elite naval fleet officer of the old Order of Humankind. With your donation, you will become that fleet officer! Your image will be immortalized in the historical records!
System Requirements
A Unity3d Compatible OS; Windows XP or later; and a 3d card.
 

 Click the image to watch it on Youtube!
Alpha Stage: Functionality Video

Each tier includes the rewards from the tiers above it.

Old Sea Dog - 1$Free Beer [in-game item]Name in the Credits!Exclusive Dev Forums!Cadet - 10$FTL Pilot's License."HideSaver" escape pod for life!Preregister in April!Jr. Lieutenant - 25$Fully equipped Transport or Fighter.Two in-game defense ships.Free in-game pet Whuk!



Chief Petty Officer - 33$Design your character's own outfit and appearance.Work with Whuk Games designers.Start the game with it! Lieutenant - 50$Fully equipped Frigate/Heavy Fighter.DVD/box art PDFs/ISO!Space Outpost kit!Lt. Commander - 100$Cassiopeia Drift T-Shirt.Fully equipped Frigate or battleship.Space Station kit! One(1) BETA Key. Captain - 250$Signed Game Disc in a DVD case!Art Book PDF!Starbase kit! Three(3) total BETA Keys.Commodore - 500$Design your own alien race!Soundtrack CD! Unlimited BETA Keys.Carrier ship and a Plush Whuk! Admiral of the Fleet - 5000$Your likeness as an Ark Captain!Join the Whuk Games team and help design the game!Dine with Whuk Games and get a Huge Plush Whuk!

 

Rocky Asteroid - $10,000

When this goal is reached, all pledge levels will receive one (1) FREE BETA KEY (in addition to however many beta keys you already have), and the 'Minesprayer' weapons pack. Since this will let us release this multiplayer game without the need for huge patches, we'll include physical Cloth patches of the Game Logo to every supporter who gives us their mailing address. The game will also be supported on Mac OS X 10.5+ and Ubuntu 10.10+ in addition to Windows.
Iron Comet - $30,000

At this level, Whuk Games will be able to hire more talent in order to finish the game's basics sooner, and start working on more advanced modules. This means we'll be able to put space station interiors and hand-to-claw combat into the game and every pledge gets a fundraiser-exclusive ray-gun. The game will also be released for Ouya.
$100k, $300k, $1m
More ships, aliens, missions, and minigames! Posters for everyone? IOS or Android? Space station level editors? Contribute and vote today!

Whuk Games

Whuk Games is:Steve Mattison, former Activision Game Tester for the Call of Duty series, creator of the acclaimed "Aperture Science" FuturePinball Table, programmer of many clones (Urban Dead was an awesome challenge to recreate) and winner of many "Game-in-a-Day" contests. (Lavana Online was fun while it lasted!)Meidel Hirabayashi, legendary artist extraordinaire.Kris Wood, texture artist for Fable 2, 3d modeller of badassery for Empire Earth 3 and Silent Hill 5...
...and more!

???Special Guest Artists???
The game will also highlight a special guest appearance by one or more digital or musical artists. Wait and find out! (Are you excited yet? I know I am!)

story:
What is EVOLUTION GAMES?

An Indie launch pad for Indie Games that will include free games and scholarship opportunities for players, and (free!) useful player feedback and seed money for Indie Game Developers.

$20,000 in seed money for Indie Game Developers!

$8,000 in scholarships for game players!

Free-to-Play Games!

Useful player feedback to help make your games better!

For more details, click here.

Beginning in December, Indie Game Developers will be able to upload their games on GotChosen’s Evolution Games webpage.  The top ten each month will be chosen (by our legions of registered users!) to compete in one of our (five) monthly contests.  The top two games (each month) will split a $1000 seed capital prize, and advance to our $15,000 Championship round! The top player each month wins a $1,000 scholarship - $3,000 in the Championship! ALL players are encouraged (via points) to provide useful feedback to the game devs.

To wrap up what we're offering...

• A launch pad for indie game devs to launch their games & RAISE MONEY!

• A portal for game devs to get FREE world-wide EXPOSURE for their games!

• An opportunity for game devs to get FREE & USEFUL player testing feedback!

• A portal for players to play games for FREE – and win SCHOLARSHIP MONEY!

So, you have a soft spot for indie games & gamers?   Donate to a good indie game cause, today!

FAQ:

What is Evolution Games?

Evolution Games is GotChosen's fourth scholarship program and first seed money opportunity for Indie Game Developers.

Who is GotChosen?

GotChosen is an innovative startup in multimedia technology, advertising, and business development headquartered in Orlando, Florida. We are developing our proprietary technologies based on choice and privacy. 

Launched in May 2012, we have already awarded $134,000 in scholarships, from three current scholarship programs:

  • GotScholarship $40,000 Scholarship Give Away - The largest single private scholarship initiative with no educational institution affiliation (currently in its fourth round)
  • GotChosen $1000 Every Month Scholarship - Entrants compete each month for a single $1000 scholarship
  • Lights Camera Action Video Scholarship - Students submit videos for a chance to win $250 - $3000 in scholarship grants. Season 3 will start December 2013.

For additional information about our scholarship programs, click here!

How will GotChosen use funds from this campaign ?

The Evolution Games project has a $50,000 budget, which includes $28,000 of prize money:

                    

So, what happens if we raise more than our goal?  More prize money will be awarded!

Please join us in supporting the Indie Game Developers of the world by contributing to Evolution Games! 

Our Perks

Supporters of indie game developers deserve a special place in our "Indie Game Developer Wall of Fame" (pix of all perks coming soon!). 

Besides well-deserved recognition, other perks are:

• A really cool Evolution Games pen or t-shirt

• Your picture (or avatar) appearing in the crowd at our "Evolution Games Arena"

• How 'bout we name a monthly winner trophy after YOU?

(There will three trophies given per month: the most popular uploaded game - in the pre-contest qualifier, the most played contest game, and the top game player of the month.)

The best movies win Oscars.  The best TV Shows win Emmys.  The best Evolution Game developers or players could win the [insert your name here] trophy!

Are there Sponsorship opportunities?

If your target market likes to play games (uh, which one doesn't?), why not sponsor an individual game, a monthly contest, or our championship round?  Check out the sponsor perks!

Thank You!  Thank You!  Thank You!

Thank you for your support of Indie Game Developers and players!  With your help, we can create the launch pad of choice for Indie Game Developers world-wide!

If you can’t help us financially, please help us by spreading the word and sharing the igg.me/at/evolution-games link for Evolution Games.

We look forward to playing the Evolution Games with you at https://www.gotchosen.com/en/evolution-games.

story:
Short Summary

Anyone who has ever tried to produce an independent film knows the trials and tribulations of reaching a broad audience.  Today, the savy indie producer has to think beyond the big screen.  That's the reason I've created the WANT A RIDE? mobile game, to entertain while briging attention to my upcoming feature film MARTY AND VAHE TAKE A RIDE.

The money raised via this campaign will go directly to the design, and creation of WANT A RIDE mobile game.  With your help we will create a fun, enteraining game, that stands on its own with addictive play while promoting the feature film MARTY AND VAHE TAKE A RIDE.

Each level of the game consists of a maze in the style of various cities around the U.S..The player navigates from the maze entrance to the destination (designated by a  labeled garage), with the primary goal of making it there before the other player. While en route, the maze will suddenly rotate, causing disorientation and change in direction that the player must deal with in order to complete his goal.  Along the way the player will have the option of completing additional objectives and collecting items but must remember to make it through the maze before time runs out! A fun and challenging experience for everyone!

What We Need & What You Get

The funds raised here go to pay the designers, artists, game creators AND the costs of licensing different platforms - ANDROID, APPLE, PC etc...

  • When you donate $10 you recieve a link to a pre-release copy of the full game. For a donation of $25 or more you'll recieve a copy of a beautiful, full color screenshot from the game designers.   If you spring for the full monty of $50 or more you'll get an autographed photograph signed by SEINFELD superstar Jason Alexander.  Have a message to share?  For $250 you get a billboard IN THE GAME for the first year of production. Drop $500 or more and get your screenplay analyzed by writer/producer Brian Herskowitz (a $750 value). 
  • If we don't meet our goal, we'll take what money is raised to help support the team of artists creating this fun and addictive game.

Other Ways You Can Help

Just becasue you don't have money doesn't mean you can't help!

  • Help us spread the word.  Ask all your rich and smart friends to contribute!.
  • Use the share tools on Indiegogo - twitter, Facebook, and shout it from the mountain tops.

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
Short Summary

Hello, my name is George Pilpilidis. I study computer engineering in Volos at the University of Thessaly. I happen to live with a roommate, John "The Cook" Nebegleras, who happens to be a gamer, and a really good one. I know a good gamer when I see one, because I am a gamer myself, and I'm into game development. Because of my work, my desktop, though not a gaming one, is far better than his, so I sometimes let him try new games on it. He has his birthday next month, January the 21st, and I wanted to make him a present that unfortunately I can't afford!

What I Need?

What I want is to build him a gaming desktop, so he can play and stream next generation gaming content. He always talks about wanting to start a Twitch stream, but I can clearly see that his desktop is not enough to support such an action.

We are both working, but the money we are making are exactly what we need to make a living, so buying a high-end gaming desktop, even by combining our wallets, is far beyond our imagination.

The Surprise!

Though we have talked about it a lot and I know that it's his dream, he has no idea that I started this crowdfunding campaign, so my goal is to make as much money as I can till his birthday to buy him a gaming desktop PC!

Why you?!

The only answer I can give you to this question is "because me!". I am a gamer and I understand the needs of a gamer. If you have ever felt the need to buy a new release and didn't have the money, if you have ever lived a computer crash, blue screens of death, lags, low frame rates, uninstalling new games because your machine can't afford it, you will understand what I want to offer to him.

If you are like me and John and can't offer big amounts of money...

Share it! Like it! Talk about it! Spread the word! The days are not that many and it's only one month till his birthday! Let us all be the Santa Claus for John Nebeglera's Christmas!

Also feel free to suggest good gaming desktop parts that we can buy!

story:
Hey there, my name is Paul Bragiel and I'm raising funds to develop a video game that will benefit athletes pursuing their dream of being in the Olympics!  Why am I doing this?  Because I am training for the 2014 Winter Olympics myself and have seen first hand how hard it is.  :)  My event is cross-country skiing.  I'm certainly a long shot as I just began training last year and am 36 years old with no experience in this sport. With all that said, I have done a few things to increase my chances: I quit my day job to focus solely on skiing this past year, I have a coach who's worked with past Olympians, and I even changed my citizenship.  Turns out Colombia doesn't have a strong winter sports tradition, so by being a citizen of Colombia, I have significantly less competition on the national level (read: none) :)  This is still going to be a difficult challenge as I need to qualify under a certain time set by the Olympic Committee.

Over this past year, I've encountered many Olympic hopefuls who are giving everything they've got to be at the opening ceremonies this upcoming February.  The costs to these individuals are extraordinary; from putting education and family plans on hold to driving themselves deep into debt all to be a part of the greatest celebration in the world.  With this campaign, I'd like to donate proceeds from my video game to other Olympic hopefuls to follow their dreams.  I'll be focusing on foundations in Finland and Colombia as these two countries have been very accommodating during my journey to qualify for the Olympics.  With your contribution, we can help Olympic hopefuls reach their dream of participating in the games. 


The game cleverly titled Team Paul Skiing will be a fun side-scroller tapping game for iOS devices.  The genre of this game is known as an endless runner.  With the tap of your fingers you determine the speed of which Paul skis move and when there are obstacles in his way, with the swipe of your finger you destroy the obstacles. There will be 3 levels set in the following locations: Finland, where I started my training; Colombia, where I'll be on roller skis; and the final level will be in Russia at the Olympics facing my competition and most likely finishing last place :P 

We have some fun prizes, so I hope you will contribute to this campaign! The game is slated for mid-December completion.  




By reaching the 10k goal we're still operating at a major loss but we really want the money raised to go to olympics hopefuls.  The breakdown of the funds will be that 50% of the proceeds go to youth sports foundations.  The remaining 50% will go towards development, perks, shipping etc.




On5: The Game is led by Egor and his development team On5.  They have developed numerous games for iOS and Android devices and have worked with large publishers such as Electronic Arts, Atari, DeNA/ngmoco, Samsung.  Over 10 million people have enjoyed playing their games. 

Paul Bragiel: Before I quit my day job and focused on training for the Olympics, I developed video games for mobile devices like the game boy and mobile phones.  In the past my game production company, Paragon 5, developed games like Micro Machines, Karnajj, Worms (mobile) and Super Monkey Ball (mobile).  I will be working closely with my friend Egor and his company.  



The idea of making this game has never been for profit.

I want to help other athletes reach their dream of making it to the Olympics.  There are other crowdsourcing sites we could have gone with, but they don't allow proceeds to go to a foundation, luckily Indiegogo does :)




Below is my youtube channel where you can watch my progress towards the Olympics as well as links to media publications writing about my journey:



http://www.arcticstartup.com/2013/10/16/io-ventures-paul-bragiel-to-train-for-the-olympics-in-lapland

http://motherboard.vice.com/blog/a-silicon-valley-vc-is-trying-to-hack-his-way-into-the-olympics

http://techcrunch.com/2013/06/20/bragiel-sochi-olympics/

story:
How the idea was born ?

The JinxOnU idea was born out of a question i asked my self : Who am i ? One of the answers i gave myself was that i like to laugh at myself and others. In a good and friendly way. As i gave it more thought it turned out that it's not easy to prank your friends effectively and with little effort. Is there an app that will allow me to do it easily ? As i browsed the different app markets, all i could find are story tellers jokes of all kinds, and some that perform some things to your own device. But what about pulling a practical joke on my friends ? for this question there was no answer.

Project Status

The current status of the project is that the game is actually finished, fully functional, tested extensively and about to be beta launched these days.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Actually its quite simple - we need your support to further invest in marketing so we can distribute the game to a much larger audience.

In return to your support you'll get personal gradidutes with the game logo, even get to pick a future Jinx to be implemented into the game.

 

The Impact

The mobile app market is truely flooded with apps of all shapes, kind and form. The marketing efforts take a lot of time, effort and financial backbone to pull it off successfully. We won't be able to do it without your contributions and support. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

In addition to supporting our marketing efforts by contributing to this project, you can also help by posting about the game on facebook. Word of mouth is one of the most effective ways in the social media era and every one count.
story_txt:
How the idea was born ?
The JinxOnU idea was born out of a question i asked my self : Who am i ? One of the answers i gave myself was that i like to laugh at myself and others. In a good and friendly way. As i gave it more thought it turned out that it's not easy to prank your friends effectively and with little effort. Is there an app that will allow me to do it easily ? As i browsed the different app markets, all i could find are story tellers jokes of all kinds, and some that perform some things to your own device. But what about pulling a practical joke on my friends ? for this question there was no answer.
Project Status
The current status of the project is that the game is actually finished, fully functional, tested extensively and about to be beta launched these days.
 


What We Need & What You Get
Actually its quite simple - we need your support to further invest in marketing so we can distribute the game to a much larger audience.
In return to your support you'll get personal gradidutes with the game logo, even get to pick a future Jinx to be implemented into the game.
 


The Impact
The mobile app market is truely flooded with apps of all shapes, kind and form. The marketing efforts take a lot of time, effort and financial backbone to pull it off successfully. We won't be able to do it without your contributions and support. 
 


Other Ways You Can Help
In addition to supporting our marketing efforts by contributing to this project, you can also help by posting about the game on facebook. Word of mouth is one of the most effective ways in the social media era and every one count.

story:
What is Gun Simulator?

A first person, free to play, extremely gory multiplayer game. With Aim to push PC graphics as high and photo-realistic as possible! 

Yes our team is small, but we're hardcore gamers too. We want to build a game we can be proud of, and unlike a lot of companies on here that have the money to advertise and pay to show off some of the game, our goals are genuine and we don't plan to be like the companies in the media. 


We plan on supporting and updating the game not only in code, but graphically as well.

Email us with any questions at; skyfoxgames@yahoo.com

(Why a yahoo? Because we were a mobile developer, we did not need a website. Priority number one is the alpha itself.)


Video Coming Soon!

Gun Simulator is being developed by SKYFOX STUDIOS. We plan to build a game that can span 10 years, with constant updates, and a library of over 1,000 guns!


Our talent mostly has experience in mobile games. We will be using Unreal Engine 4 and be pushing PC limits. This will be a system melter at the highest graphic settings.

Things you'll be able to adjust.
-Up to 32X AA.
-Resolutions of up to 8k!
-30, 60, 120, and Unlimited FPS options! With Multiplayer having options to set you up with players only playing at your frame rate.
-DX 11.1 Support, with future DX 12 support.
-Tessellation, and more!

PLAY FOR $

The shooter will give pc gamers what they love most! Options! 2v2, 4v4, 8v8, 30v30 and an option to practice against bots offline.

MODES: There are two type of matches, FOR FUN, and FOR $


In for $, players bet any amount of in game cash they want depending on the three kinds of FOR $ modes they choose.

Win rate is the average of the entire team. 30vs30 is not in this mode either.

EXAMPLE:

(Lowest tier has a max betting limit of 1,000C and a minimum of 100C.

Middle tier has max betting limit of 10,000C and a minimum of 2,000C

KOR Tier is exclusive to Knights of the Round members with no betting limit)

  • First person, and 3rd person in future.
  • Simulation Detail. What does this mean? Everything from gravity of the bullet, to how the type of bullet effects the body, speed of bullets, etc..
  • You'll even have an option to clean your gun! It's not for nothing. Depending on the environment and weapon, your gun can jam under certain conditions.

What about users that don't spend any money?

There will be a free gun in each category available for the week. You can't level it up unless you buy it with credits.

Pricing model once the final game releases:

Real Life $1=5,000C     $5=55,000C     $10=155,000C     $15=350,000C

$22=550,000C and a lifetime membership to Knights of the Round*

           

*Free weapons and items exclusive to the Knights released monthly, an exclusive mode, and a No Limit mode in FOR $.


There will be a percentage of money given to the developer every purchase, the details are still in work.


Customization/Spend in game $ these ways

  • New guns available every 2-4 weeks. Depending on the gun, price will be 50,000C-200,000C
  • Character customization items will be released every 2-4 weeks. Anything from your shades to your boots, with some affecting character in game traits. Character items will go from 1,000C-1,000,000,000C.
  • Weapon Customization will be greater than any game in existence. You will be able to break apart every weapon and see exactly how it works, if you so choose. And a lot of parts, can be replaced or added on.



FUNDING AND DEVELOPMENT


$15,000 is our starting goal to get the Alpha running. The total cost of the game will be $75,000 for the first version to go public, but with $15,000 we can get something that will get people more than excited for the final version. 


Where is this money going and how will it be used?

GUN SIMULATOR will support 8k Resolutions, so we will be renting a 8k Camera to take over 1,000 8k photos of every gun, gun part, etc..

We will be using the highest FPS camera we can afford (1,000-1,000,000) and firing the guns under different kinds of conditions.

Audio will be taken not only by the gun, but hundreds of locations up to 1 mile away to get the most realistic audio of the gun no matter how far away you are from it in the game.

Gun bullets, including different round types, will be fired into the gel like dummies (similar to the ones used in "Deadliest Warrior") to get the most accurate in game simulation damage.


Future Goals;

Oculus Support

Playstation 4 Support

Upload your face and in game characters lip syncing to your talking.

Different ways to hold your gun.


    INVESTORS

    We want to give back to the people that help us, investing in SkyFox Games will set you up with 2 checks a year of your percentage profits. Starting March 2016, the second month being September.

    You will also get a full cost breakdown and exclusive access to our developing website to see receipts of every penny spent from the campaign.
    (Don't like the terms? Email us! We're willing to work with Investors of all types.)

    1KoB9z21Rt9rxBUMykfZhn9G7hLoa4cs6e  Bitcoin Users can donate to this address.
    Contact skyfoxgames@yahoo.com for more information.

story:
Look at all of those backer tiers! Don't you like backer tiers? Pay my rent!

Anyway, this is Invasion of the Inter-Dimensional – 25th Anniversary Edition EX (A college project). A 2D/3D world-based platformer in the vein of things like Chameleon Twist, Mario 64 and Kirby 64. It's being developed in the Unity 3D Engine, and will (maybe) feature controller support. Maybe.

Note: All backers will receive a copy of the game, whether they like it or not. No matter how much they pledged. Even if it's only a dollar, you get the game. You don't have to play it, but you're getting it.

You play as a character who was sleeping at the time of an alien invasion on his alternate-dimensional home planet, which annihilated society and assimilated his planet-mates into those aliens. They are primitively-shaped, and as you were sleeping, you weren't fully infected (don't question it). You now possess the power to morph into all three of the types of primitive shapes of the alien species; Cube, Sphere, and Cylinder.

The game features a rock-paper-scissors style effectiveness triangle (kind of like the weapon effectiveness from Fire Emblem).

It's a platformer. You move around the world and collect things and get to the end goal. Eliminate the threat and save your planet.


UPDATE #1: Production Has Begun!

The Profile/Menu system has been created and implemented, and the actual game has begun production. Expect regular updates from here on in.

You can follow updates on my website; http://dkgamingblog.wordpress.com/

You now possess the power to morph into all three of the types of primitive shapes of the alien species; Cube, Sphere, and Cylinder.The game features a rock-paper-scissors style effectiveness triangle (kind of like the weapon effectiveness from Fire Emblem). Kill Triangle. I made it in Paint!o 
Cube: Rolls slowly (like a die), largest form, can
squish enemies/activate switches.
o 
Sphere: Rolls quickly (like the Morph Ball from
Metroid), smallest form, can roll down slopes and avoid enemies.
o 
Cylinder: Can jump (extends like a pogo stick),
middle-sized form, can kill enemies by landing on them.
It's a platformer. You move around the world and collect things and get to the end goal. Eliminate the threat and save your planet.UPDATE #1: Production Has Begun!The Profile/Menu system has been created and implemented, and the actual game has begun production. Expect regular updates from here on in.You can follow updates on my website; http://dkgamingblog.wordpress.com/

story:
Me, My Campaign and You

Hey, You :) Welcome to my campaigns page! I really appreciate your presence here. My name is Kaspar-Hardi and I am the head behind The Silent Sky, the animator and the writer, the developer and the producer, the author as they would say. This started out as my personal project where I invested my free time for the last 7 years, which led to a small team of three. It's been a slow process and I always wanted to speed it up.

I have been fascinated by animations from the ground up, always captivated by the unlimited ways how animation can deliver the story, the vision of someones imagination and The Silent Sky is no exception.

If everything is possible in ones imagination, then everything is possible in animation.

 

 

As the adventurous heart who once dreamed to tell stories, I can now finally put them on the table and make it real. With the help of You of course.

When I went traveling I experienced something that expanded my imagination. That was a recognition from my childhood that reminded me how crucial the adventures are for us to sprout and mature, to seek journeys life offers in order to grow.

That's when I also started to do my first sketches and write the first ideas about the story. I hate to say, it's been almost a decade now. The money had to come from somewhere, right. But I have never let that adventurous heart to die and this establishes a strong commitment for me to do what I love, this project, and if I can share it with the world...

Whats better than that, right!?

 

 

We will make it happen one way or another, I'm pretty good at washing dishes now, so slowly and slowly, one day we would have the game completed ;) but I would prefer to skip the dishes part and keep my heart and strong faith for this project, and with Your help this could happen so much faster and probably so much better.

 

 

But because we do this on our free time and none of us doesn’t have it as much as we would like, we don't really get to choose the release date.

We all want to fully commit and with helping us you don’t just help with this project, you also might help to start a little studio, where more games like this could be crafted.

 

 

 

Is set in 2005 in a small town of Estonia, Eastern Europe, a place nobody really knows about, where hardly anything happens and where everybody knows everybody. It's about a boy, Siim, who's 10 years old, eager for an adventures and who encounters a mysterious event just right on his backyard of the house. He can't resist on going to explore what it is and finds something he is not supposed to find. The discovery drags him into a world of secrets and conspiracies taking him to the end of the world, space and the stars. When struggling with many things that comes with the unknown, also the seriousness of the world orchestrated by an adult mind, he needs to keep his candid spirit up and find his way back home.

You as Siim are sent to many different places of the earth and off the earth, where you encounter many different unique characters who help and assist in different ways or stop you as you become a potential threat.

The story narration runs in a linear fashion but offers many different dialog choices that brings up more reactions in dialogues and are a nice touch of bringing up the characteristics to make the game much more colorful and enjoyable to play. After all it's a story to tell.

 

 

Risks and challenges

For this campaign I chose flexible funding. It has its drawbacks but at least it gives us some sort of boost to bring this game closer to the release date with some, if not all, of the goals we've set.

I know, the assurance is never there and it takes time to build up the trust but nothing is easy even for the developers. The campaign brings up a new responsibility and I don't want to promise too much big things, though I would like to, big dreamer as I am :) but my goal is to get this project done as successfully as possible.

 

 

And this is where You can help us! :) With the help of You we can achieve something great or magnificent. You choose :)

It could be text based, it could be with audio dialogs. Both have their advantages. Text is easier, can be quickly achieved and leaves more room for imagination. Audio dialogs would bring up the uniqueness of characters. It is totally achievable but it takes just more time and resources. There is a middle ground where I could do both, text and a little bit of audio to support.

It could be simple, or more compelling. I would like to add more cinematic clips, custom animations, smooth the transitions with extra frames were possible and add more interactive content to make the delivering of the story more beautiful and captivating. Also would like to keep the game flow longer with more scenes, characters and adding more sections to the story.

It could be an ambience based or more melodic. Music has a very important role. This is also quite a responsible work and I am not satisfied if it doesn't deliver the spirit of the game. Though it's gonna be a lot of ambience based to keep you in the story, music still has its place. We already have some nice tracks, but still need to work on it and that's a job for another artist who knows its work. Original composition would be the way to go, but still a lot can be achieved by a royalty free music from many talented artists if we don’t reach the desired goal.

(I am happy to announce that we stumbled upon a great artist Peter Nanasi, who already has created a wonderful piece of audio track that brings The Silent Sky alive. And would be cool if he could make us more of those :) Check out his Soundcloud https://soundcloud.com/nanasipeter page and have a little taste of his talent)

Game could have one language or translated into many. Well, to be honest, its already prepared for English and Estonian. But to make it available for more wider audience we would like to add couple more options like French, Spanish and perhaps German.

 

 

Major part of our time, also the funding, would go for animations and programming. It is simply a process that just takes time and we don't like to settle with simple and quick results. Though most of complicated animations are done, they still need to be updated, improved or retouched. We are still in a early stage and a lot of art work, puzzles and recordings need to be made and implemented. On top of that a lot of experimenting and testing.

All of the images and animation you see here are still under development and subject to change, therefore most likely will be different in the final product.

Just saying!

 

 

The size of Your generosity in whatever form or way can make a big difference in ones life and its really hard to match and reply to that. We are not a big company and can't promise you lots of goodies. Therefore we put all our effort and energy into the game and offer what we can actually deliver. Most of the content is digital, simple to process and also little less environment polluting :)

Besides my everlasting sincere gratitude which has 100% lifetime warranty that comes with every perk you choose I offer many other cool bonuses. Every one of them honor you in different ways and give you the opportunity to join the adventure.

 

5$ The Wanderer Perk adds Your name in the end credits of a game as Indiegogo supporter.

10$ The Seeker Perk gives You a free digital copy of a game on the platform of Your choice.

15$ The Traveler Perk gives You the download of games soundtrack.

20$ The Adventurer Perk will give You early access to the game and downloadable content, like wallpapers, posters, artwork etc.

40$ The Explorer Perk gives You a digital copy of the game for each system we produce.

70$ A Star Perk places Your name randomly in a game.

100$ A Stubborn Heart Perk adds exclusive backer T-shirt in Your T-shirt collection.

200$ The Player Perk adds a drawn picture of You into the game that can be commented on.

500$ A Game Changer Perk adds You as a character that can be interfered with.

1000$ The Creator Perk adds Your uniqueness/likeness to Your character and its participation in a games story, also You as an executive producer of the game.

 

 

 

I am working together on this with someone who has a creative mind, Erkki Sepp. He is talented and very committed programmer. With his help, we've done so much. We have a working alpha demo with partly functional menu, which is a lot. The core structure is there, but making everything working perfectly takes time.

And Taavi Veermets, the animated soul, is doing everything to polish it up. Very talented artist and visionary. He helps to develop the game and is kind of a blood flowing between the heart and mind, connecting and putting it all together. He's main responsibilities are the interface and audio editing.

 

 

There are a lot of beautiful and brilliant ideas out there to back, but we know that there are also a lot of people out there who're still in love with classical point-and-click adventure games and people who would like to give us a hand in any way they can.

A HUGE THANK YOU to all of you who can spread the word about our campaign around the globe and web!

Feel free to use the Indiegogo share tools and make some noise!

Or just meditate, I'm sure that helps too ;)

And if you have any questions about the project or campaign, check the FAQ section and don't hesitate to contact us!

1000$ The Creator Perk adds Your uniqueness/likeness to Your character and its participation in a games story, also You as an executive producer of the game.
 
 

 
I am working together on this with someone who has a creative mind, Erkki Sepp. He is talented and very committed programmer. With his help, we've done so much. We have a working alpha demo with partly functional menu, which is a lot. The core structure is there, but making everything working perfectly takes time.
And Taavi Veermets, the animated soul, is doing everything to polish it up. Very talented artist and visionary. He helps to develop the game and is kind of a blood flowing between the heart and mind, connecting and putting it all together. He's main responsibilities are the interface and audio editing.
 
 


There are a lot of beautiful and brilliant ideas out there to back, but we know that there are also a lot of people out there who're still in love with classical point-and-click adventure games and people who would like to give us a hand in any way they can.
A HUGE THANK YOU to all of you who can spread the word about our campaign around the globe and web!
Feel free to use the Indiegogo share tools and make some noise!
Or just meditate, I'm sure that helps too ;)
And if you have any questions about the project or campaign, check the FAQ section and don't hesitate to contact us!

story:
Kromaia is a six degrees of freedom adventure shooter which takes action, speed, agility and immersion to a new level. Insane enemy patterns, impressive swarms, giant god-like guardians, ancient temples, contraptions, treasures, visual ecstasy... All in a vast and unexplored universe only ruled by physic laws.

- #14 FINAL HOURS!! -

Just a few hours left... We want to remind all of you, hesitant watchers: Kromaia will be completed regardless of the funds raised, so join us while you're in time!! :D

A BIG THANK YOU to all our backers. Your support will help us boost the development and marketing for Kromaia as much as possible, trust our hard work! Stay tuned for upcoming news about version updates, your perks and content addition!

The Kraken Empire salutes you!

- #11 PUBLIC DEMO!! -

Download it here while our crowdfunding campaign lasts!

- #8 THE SCORE ATTACK TAKES OFF!! -

From now on, every new $10+ pledger will gain access to the score attack minigame preview in less than 24 hours!

- #7 PERK UPGRADE NOW SUPPORTED! -

We have received several questions asking about the possibility of increasing the pledge amount to receive a higher perk, as Indiegogo doesn't offer the option to increase your initial pledge.

All our perks include the previous ones, so we can sum up all the pledges from the same user and give him the higher perk that would be reached with his combined pledge.

This way, from now on, you can start pledging to try our demo and pledge again later to increase your total pledge amount in order to receive the perk you really want to get!



  • Unique and immersive journey, mixing technology and myth, in an innovative gameplay experience
  • Get your hands one of the fastest and most agile gameplays to date
  • Interact with hundreds of physical objects, like asteroids, structures and devices, and fight dozens of enemies at once
  • Believable and destructible world with its own rules and physic laws
  • Breaking visual atmosphere which combines ancient architecture, mechanical artefacts and weird creatures
  • Artificial intelligence based on independent simple brains that cooperate creating emergent behaviours
  • Different selectable ships with unique weapons and capabilities
  • Moddable content using plain text (XML) including levels, objects, weapons, player and AI units...
  • Several playing modes for every kind of player: Story Mode (adventure), Score Attack (arcade), Timed Circuit (racing)...



Kromaia takes place in a multiverse and tells the story of a stranded soul who awakens in a weird shrine, finding itself sealed inside a mechanical unit. Having no memories at all, it must make its way in search for answers, in a world of forgotten devices and hostile creatures, while a somehow familiar voice within claims to know its mind better than itself.

According to the mechanical armor system log, the shrine and the infinite void surrounding it, Kyllene, is actually an artificial anomaly. It serves as an access port to several parallel realities, recorded copies of the original Universe, presumably collapsed. Kyllene's very existence seems related to this copies and its machinery appears not to be 100% functional.




Is it still possible to make something different set in outer space? We do think so. For that reason, you will not find in Kromaia slow movement, ships maneuvering like planes or boats, nor endless steering pursuits in circles, but a completely different approach. Our navigation system is entirely driven by physical forces, a different set of thrusters is arranged for each ship in order to maximize maneuverability: Fluid displacement for novices and, for experts, impossible turns and extreme dodging, combined with a powerful multidirectional boost system that allows moving over the real speed of sound in any way you can imagine.

Forget all the vehicles you have already controlled like aircrafts, rockets, choppers or traditional spaceships, think of all of their capabilities available at the same time at the tip of your fingers. Besides, Kromaia features a special kind of emergent gameplay: Here we will use the word "procedural" for something different than just randomly generated worlds. The advanced A.I. system in Kromaia uses physical parameters and a sophisticated prediction model to adapt units speed, attacks, flocking and smart group formations to the actions you take during your quest. The results: the game experience is different every time depending on the way you play.




One of our main motivations was that we think of space as a great game environment, but we wanted to try something different from the standards prevailing in most of games. For that reason, what you will find in Kromaia is a different approach.

- ZERO G MEETS ÜBER AGILITY -

Our navigation system is entirely driven by physical forces and consists of a set of thrusters arranged in order to maximize maneuverability: Fluid displacement for novices and, for experts, impossible turns and extreme dodging, combined with boost, while moving over the real speed of sound ( 340m/s!! ). The power curve of the thrusters is directly controlled by the inputs specified on XML files which defines them, in addition to other structural and modular features.

As we said before, not like  aircrafts or traditional spaceships, but all of them at the same time: you can even edit the unit file to change the position/orientation used by thrusters, add or remove them and modify their power capabilities; assign thrusters groups for certain inputs, as well as tuning or disabling the artificial friction system, which eases navigation in a vacuum environment like outer space.

- EMERGENT GAMEPLAY: PROCEDURALITY AT ITS BEST -

Here we will use the word “procedural” for something different than just randomly generated worlds. The advanced A.I. system in Kromaia uses physical parameters and a sophisticated prediction model to adapt units speed, attacks, flocking and smart group formations to the actions you take during your quest. The results: the game experience is different depending on the way you play. Maybe you ace at dodging at full speed or you prefer shooting and killing everything that moves around.

Maybe you prefer shooting while stopped or at a low speed, you can even move backwards while shooting. Our AI will adapt to your gameplay style and your experience will be unique, just as your game style is.

- YOU MAKE THE WHOLE THING BE GREAT -

The strategy chosen by the player will lead an enemy swarm to adopt an aggressive behaviour to defend an item that you are supposed to pick, or gather in number to pursuit you when you decide to be more conservative. A straight line is not necessarily the fastest/smartest to reach your goal: use asteroids to cover yourself from enemy attacks or break them to generate shockwaves; if a giant creature looks at you ready to fire a fatal beam, throw a gravity bomb to attract and turn his head. Physics + A.I. + Your Brain in all their glory!

- WEAPONS -

The way you play is also the way you attack and defend. Through your adventure you will be able to use a wide range of technologies, including
  • High speed impact projectiles
  • Precission laser beams
  • Smart bullets and homing missiles
  • Special items as gravity bombs
  • An energy blades melee system!

- MOVE THE STORY FORWARD -

We strongly believe that truly immersive experiences start with an underlying big, deeply complex system able to make the player feel like a drop in the ocean. And giving the game a story is giving the game a soul. To create this universe, we have taken inspiration from ancient mythological poems. It involves a solid cosmology, hidden legendary treasures and a “hero” gifted with great abilities, confronting by himself a whole world commanded by machine-like gods. And, like in many mythological stories, there is no good, evil or time limits. You are just given the option to trigger events and advance to see what’s next, using your power.

- EXTREME ENGINEERING -

Piloting at ultra-high speeds; moving and colliding hundreds of physical objects simultaneously; soft bodies like physical hair; multi-hull breakable entities... Is this possible avoiding at the same time those typical vibrations and precision glitches affecting ships, projectiles and cameras movement? And still have a good and fluid performance? Yes. We decided to create our own engine to break these barriers and it’s being tough, but we are passionate and mad enough to bear with that. No fairy tales here: We’ve spent more than two years since the first prototype, refining and optimizing our engine before reaching what we talk about today.

The game we want to create demanded from us to forget about some indie-related assumptions regarding “fast development”. Keeping that in mind, and after being told several times we were nuts, we decided to combine our passion and experience in the games industry with the most technical aspects regarding our professional and academic background. As a result, we built what we call an "extreme software engineering project" to achieve a powerful, highly flexible environment or universe in which no object could move by means of nothing but physical forces.



A huge and modular system allowing customisation for a lot of physical parameters and behaviours is great to experiment with, but complicates a bit the creation of The Editor. Anyway, We don’t want Kromaia to be a “closed” creation. We’re assembling a version that we think you will like, but this does not mean you can’t make another one by yourself! We are considering making a modding manual, so don’t be afraid of XML files, they are not only technical, but also fun!

Some Examples:

  • Modify the scale, mass, local position and orientation for each hull of every structure unit, enemy or boss.
  • Redesign your propulsion system. Add or remove thrusters, modify their power and arrangement. Set movement inputs for groups of thrusters.
  • Modify your weaponry module. Do you want to fire at a higher rate? Do you want to use another type of projectile or a beam weapon? Do you want more cannons? Do you want to fire backwards? Do you want to throw enemy units??!! Up to you...
  • Modify projectiles features. Right, they have their own files, so you can edit their linear and angular velocity or set them to scale themselves with time.
  • Tune your units and your enemies, even bosses. Add extra and removable hulls which will come off when they are severely damaged. Attach them with fixed joints, or use physical ropes. Add layers of weak points and set physical hairs to achieve an organic appearance.
  • Create and add new units. You will decide whether to include many hulls, modules for weaponry or A.I., a powerful propulsion system...

  • Copy modules from one unit to another. If you think that a certain enemy is too friendly, give him a pair of laser cannons and regret later.
  • A.I. tuning for every enemy unit. Experiment with different values for angular and linear velocities, accelerations, movement type... Besides, select the behaviours to be used by A.I. groups, group movement and formations, as well as how close do you want the enemies to be before they start firing.
  • Create new planets and black holes with custom physical parameters, which determine the range for their gravity field.
  • Edit the colour layers for areas/levels and their units and structures.

To sum things up: You can edit almost every aspect in the game using XML





$10

SCORE ATTACK MINI-GAME: EARLY ACCESS

Chain Drive is an action mini-game which condenses all the piloting and fighting gameplay from Kromaia in a vintage arcade style experience. Now the only goal is to survive in order to face a bigger swarm, achieve a longer combo, fight a harder boss and get to the Olympus of High Scores. You gain access to our current  version of this mini-game and the final DRM-Free digital version on release.

+ [Current version: PC-Windows. Take a look at our Stretch Goals for Linux and Mac support]

+ [Includes all future platforms we reach (Linux, Mac, Steam…) as long as they don’t imply a cost for us]


$15

THE GAME

A DRM-Free digital copy of Kromaia awaits you! The original adventure featuring the multiverse and the journey in search for the final answer. Kyllene system activates your armor and awakes you after your soul calibrates the unit. The year is NaN.

Along with the story mode, some secrets and trophies remain hidden, waiting for the most tenacious players to unveil them.

+ [All the previous rewards are included]

+ [Current version: PC-Windows. Take a look at our Stretch Goals for Linux and Mac support]

+ [Includes all future platforms we reach (Linux, Mac, Steam…) as long as they don’t imply a cost for us]


$20

EVERY ALPHA/BETA FROM NOW ON

You will gain access to the monthly preliminary versions we will deliver. Follow the development process from the inside!

+ [All the previous rewards are included]

+ [Current version: PC-Windows. Take a look at our Stretch Goals for Linux and Mac support]

+ [Includes all future platforms we reach (Linux, Mac, Steam…) as long as they don’t imply a cost for us]


$25

MULTIMEDIA EDITION

Digital pack containing the original soundtrack, HD version of the promotional art we release (currently 1 cover) and the Comic*.

[*] Only if the comic stretch goal is reached

+ [All the previous rewards are included]


$35

ALL DLC DERIVED FROM KROMAIA

All future DLCs and mini-games derived from Kromaia (New ships, Asteroids, Out Run-Like...).

+ [All the previous rewards are included]

+ [Current version: PC-Windows. Take a look at our Stretch Goals for Linux and Mac support]

+ [Includes all future platforms we reach (Linux, Mac, Steam…) as long as they don’t imply a cost for us]


$45

EXCLUSIVE UNIT

An exclusive unit with unique weapons/abilities. Only for Indiegogo backers!

+ [All the previous rewards are included]


$60

ALL THE PREVIOUS PROTOTYPES / EXPERIMENTS

You will receive all the prototype versions in the road to the final build of Kromaia. The evolution of the project in your hands!

+ [Old prototypes are PC-Windows only]

+ [All the previous rewards are included]


$80

YOUR NAME IN THE BACKER CREDITS

Your name will be linked for life to the name of Kromaia. As a main backer, you will appear in a special section of the credits sequence/screen dedicated to all of you in this tier: Our eternal gratitude!

+ [All the previous rewards are included]


$100

KRAKEN EMPIRE SUPPORTER

A digital copy of every future game released by Kraken Empire! We want Kromaia to be just the beginning of this journey. Come with us!

+ [All the previous rewards are included]


$150

EXCLUSIVE COMPANION DRONES

Two autonomous A.I. drones which will fight by your side during your adventure, enhancing your combat abilities and introducing a new form of gameplay! Indiegogo Exclusive!

+ [All the previous rewards are included]


$200

PHYSICAL EDITION

Kromaia physical Edition including: Physical copies of the game and the original soundtrack, postcard, t-shirt and comic*.

[*] Only if the comic stretch goal is reached

+ [All the previous rewards are included]


$300

CONTROL SCHEME DESIGNED BY YOU

The thruster arrangement you design, including inputs and active thrusters for each movement, to be able to pilot in any way you can think of!

+ [All the previous rewards are included]


$500

THE ENEMY GRUNT YOU DESIGN

Help us designing an enemy grunt! It may have various hulls, weak points, a basic A.I. behaviour...

+ [All the previous rewards are included]


$1,000

ENGINEER

With your help we will create a new unit following the hull, propulsion, weapon modifications and control scheme you design!

+ [All the previous rewards are included]


$5,000

LEVEL DESIGNER

This reward will give you the chance to help us to design an extra level including the path, targets and enemy waves!

+ [All the previous rewards are included]


$10,000

RELEASE THE KRAKEN!

The ultimate perk! Along with us, you will create an extra boss featuring layered weak points, weaponry variations and the behaviour you design!

+ [All the previous rewards are included]







Probably you are wondering how we will use the funds raised and why we chose the "flexible funding" model. To answer those questions we should refer to the very nature of this campaign, which differs from most of the crowdfunding projects out there.

As you may have noticed, we've already put a lot of effort and time in Kromaia, and that's why we are determined to complete the project: The main purpose of the campaign is not launching the project or deciding whether the game will be developed or not, but achieving the quality level we want for our game in this crucial stage.

This means that your perks are safe, even if our main goal is not reached. :)

With the funds achieved we will build entirely the worlds we originally designed; your help will contribute to finance the music, sound effects and the sound library licensing, as well as the extra development costs to to push our engine to the max, in addition to the company costs required to make that additional effort. Besides, these funds will allow us to afford the campaign and promotion costs, which eventually will give Kromaia the chance to create a strong community and the visibility it needs to move towards digital distribution in this huge ocean, the indie community is. Let's go!




As we said, the way to reach this point has not been easy at all. In addtition to the years of self-funding, we have had to push our engine to the limit to overcome some limitations and being able to achieve the features and performance we wanted. Now we can say we are convinced that Kromaia will be a truly unique experience and determined to give our best to complete a great game.

With all that work and time spent in a project, having your game more exposed to the public before it's finished is not a decision to be taken lightly, even more considering Kromaia is far from being a casual game. At its current status, the project needs to gather the support to start the race to the final release more safely, with a strong community, and then evolve according to this support to reach  the quality levels which allow the game to make its way.

Your help will mean a boost for our team to keep moving forward to materialize such a final effort, deal with licensing, having by our side great professionals and all the costs this final stage implies for our little company. All this will make possible to provide Kromaia with the production values in terms of engineering, art, and music to make a difference.

Rest assured that we will work harder than ever, and with your support Kromaia will be much more than what we dreamed of.



Hey, Daniel here!

Hi there! I'm Antonio!

Our team consist of just two developers, Daniel Blasco and Antonio Iglesias. All the design, engineering and art you can see in the game are the work of two guys doing their best in all the fields they know about. Music is the only thing we have outsourced.

We met at university while studying "Informatics Engineering" in our hometown, Zaragoza (Aragon, Spain), where we began to develop small games and have endless discussions on design and gameplay. Later on, we met again and worked together in a studio called "Enigma Software Productions" where we developed "War Leaders: Clash of Nations" (PC), "History: Legends of War" (PC, PSP, PS Vita, PS3, Xbox360) and "Music School" (Nintendo DS). During that time, and using the little spare time left between crunches, we started putting together a set of ideas we had been discussing for years in a new project, trying to create a different space game experience: the goal was a complex, highly immersive system or universe able to support a high amount of compound physical entities, in which no object could move by means of nothing but physical forces, while keeping a good performance.

The project kept growing and at some point we realized that the engine had the potential to become something great and worthy to share. That's how we decided to start our own studio to develop Kromaia, and that's what we have been doing for three years with no external funding at all, work, work, more work and good advices from great people in the indie community, as well as volunteers who selflessly helped us out to polish the gameplay. Additionally, the talented composer Josh Whelchel is creating an awesome soundtrack for us in order to complete this experience that we feel is so unique.




This campaign would be impossible without some great people helping us set everything up for the Indiegogo launch, and, in some cases, since the very beginning of the project, so let us introduce them!

  • Kevin Greenlee, AKA LoudCore is a critically acclaimed US Video Game Composer and Music Producer. Since his start in 2006, he has been able to compose music for a wide variety of games and other media outlets. He is best known for working with StarForge.

  • David Daza is (an experienced comic-book artist. He has worked for several publishers in USA and Spain – Dark Horse (STAR WARS), IDW Publishing (TRANSFORMERS), Moonstone Books and Planeta-DeAgostini among others.

  • Josh Whelchel is a video game music composer and enthusiast, also scoring for Castle Story and Mojang's Scrolls. He brings years of experience to the Kromaia soundscape, including a love for spacy geometry inspired landscapes. You can follow his updates on twitter @soundofjw and listen to his current drafts on Soundcloud. Follow him on Loudr.



OGRE (Object-Oriented Graphics Rendering Engine) is a scene-oriented, flexible 3D engine written in C++ designed to make it easier and more intuitive for developers to produce applications utilising hardware-accelerated 3D graphics. The class library abstracts all the details of using the underlying system libraries like Direct3D and OpenGL and provides an interface based on world objects and other intuitive classes.

Bullet Physics is a professional open source collision detection, rigid body and soft body dynamics library.

IrrKlang is a high level 2D and 3D cross platform (Windows, Mac OS X, Linux) sound engine and audio library.

Boost provides free peer-reviewed portable C++ source libraries.
