Now the only goal is to survive in order to face a bigger swarm, achieve a longer combo, fight a harder boss and get to the Olympus of High Scores. You gain access to our current  version of this mini-game and the final DRM-Free digital version on release.
+ [Current version: PC-Windows. Take a look at our Stretch Goals for Linux and Mac support]
+ [Includes all future platforms we reach (Linux, Mac, Steam…) as long as they don’t imply a cost for us]







$15
THE GAME



A DRM-Free digital copy of Kromaia awaits you! The original adventure featuring the multiverse and the journey in search for the final answer. Kyllene system activates your armor and awakes you after your soul calibrates the unit. The year is NaN. 
Along with the story mode, some secrets and trophies remain hidden, waiting for the most tenacious players to unveil them.
+ [All the previous rewards are included]
+ [Current version: PC-Windows. Take a look at our Stretch Goals for Linux and Mac support]
+ [Includes all future platforms we reach (Linux, Mac, Steam…) as long as they don’t imply a cost for us]







$20
EVERY ALPHA/BETA FROM NOW ON




You will gain access to the monthly preliminary versions we will deliver. Follow the development process from the inside!
+ [All the previous rewards are included]
+ [Current version: PC-Windows. Take a look at our Stretch Goals for Linux and Mac support]
+ [Includes all future platforms we reach (Linux, Mac, Steam…) as long as they don’t imply a cost for us]







$25
MULTIMEDIA EDITION




Digital pack containing the original soundtrack, HD version of the promotional art we release (currently 1 cover) and the Comic*.
[*] Only if the comic stretch goal is reached
+ [All the previous rewards are included]







$35
ALL DLC DERIVED FROM KROMAIA




All future DLCs and mini-games derived from Kromaia (New ships, Asteroids, Out Run-Like...).
+ [All the previous rewards are included]
+ [Current version: PC-Windows. Take a look at our Stretch Goals for Linux and Mac support]
+ [Includes all future platforms we reach (Linux, Mac, Steam…) as long as they don’t imply a cost for us]







$45
EXCLUSIVE UNIT




An exclusive unit with unique weapons/abilities. Only for Indiegogo backers!
+ [All the previous rewards are included]







$60
ALL THE PREVIOUS PROTOTYPES / EXPERIMENTS




You will receive all the prototype versions in the road to the final build of Kromaia. The evolution of the project in your hands!
+ [Old prototypes are PC-Windows only]
+ [All the previous rewards are included]







$80
YOUR NAME IN THE BACKER CREDITS




Your name will be linked for life to the name of Kromaia. As a main backer, you will appear in a special section of the credits sequence/screen dedicated to all of you in this tier: Our eternal gratitude!
+ [All the previous rewards are included]







$100
KRAKEN EMPIRE SUPPORTER




A digital copy of every future game released by Kraken Empire! We want Kromaia to be just the beginning of this journey. Come with us!
+ [All the previous rewards are included]







$150
EXCLUSIVE COMPANION DRONES




Two autonomous A.I. drones which will fight by your side during your adventure, enhancing your combat abilities and introducing a new form of gameplay! Indiegogo Exclusive!
+ [All the previous rewards are included]







$200
PHYSICAL EDITION




Kromaia physical Edition including: Physical copies of the game and the original soundtrack, postcard, t-shirt and comic*.
[*] Only if the comic stretch goal is reached
+ [All the previous rewards are included]







$300
CONTROL SCHEME DESIGNED BY YOU




The thruster arrangement you design, including inputs and active thrusters for each movement, to be able to pilot in any way you can think of!
+ [All the previous rewards are included]







$500
THE ENEMY GRUNT YOU DESIGN




Help us designing an enemy grunt! It may have various hulls, weak points, a basic A.I. behaviour...
+ [All the previous rewards are included]







$1,000
ENGINEER




With your help we will create a new unit following the hull, propulsion, weapon modifications and control scheme you design!
+ [All the previous rewards are included]







$5,000
LEVEL DESIGNER




This reward will give you the chance to help us to design an extra level including the path, targets and enemy waves!
+ [All the previous rewards are included]







$10,000
RELEASE THE KRAKEN!




The ultimate perk! Along with us, you will create an extra boss featuring layered weak points, weaponry variations and the behaviour you design!
+ [All the previous rewards are included]




Probably you are wondering how we will use the funds raised and why we chose the "flexible funding" model. To answer those questions we should refer to the very nature of this campaign, which differs from most of the crowdfunding projects out there.As you may have noticed, we've already put a lot of effort and time in Kromaia, and that's why we are determined to complete the project: The main purpose of the campaign is not launching the project or deciding whether the game will be developed or not, but achieving the quality level we want for our game in this crucial stage.This means that your perks are safe, even if our main goal is not reached. :)With the funds achieved we will build entirely the worlds we originally designed; your help will contribute to finance the music, sound effects and the sound library licensing, as well as the extra development costs to to push our engine to the max, in addition to the company costs required to make that additional effort. Besides, these funds will allow us to afford the campaign and promotion costs, which eventually will give Kromaia the chance to create a strong community and the visibility it needs to move towards digital distribution in this huge ocean, the indie community is. Let's go!

As we said, the way to reach this point has not been easy at all. In addtition to the years of self-funding, we have had to push our engine to the limit to overcome some limitations and being able to achieve the features and performance we wanted. Now we can say we are convinced that Kromaia will be a truly unique experience and determined to give our best to complete a great game.With all that work and time spent in a project, having your game more exposed to the public before it's finished is not a decision to be taken lightly, even more considering Kromaia is far from being a casual game. At its current status, the project needs to gather the support to start the race to the final release more safely, with a strong community, and then evolve according to this support to reach  the quality levels which allow the game to make its way.Your help will mean a boost for our team to keep moving forward to materialize such a final effort, deal with licensing, having by our side great professionals and all the costs this final stage implies for our little company. All this will make possible to provide Kromaia with the production values in terms of engineering, art, and music to make a difference.Rest assured that we will work harder than ever, and with your support Kromaia will be much more than what we dreamed of.












Hey, Daniel here!
Hi there! I'm Antonio!


Our team consist of just two developers, Daniel Blasco and Antonio Iglesias. All the design, engineering and art you can see in the game are the work of two guys doing their best in all the fields they know about. Music is the only thing we have outsourced.
We met at university while studying "Informatics Engineering" in our hometown, Zaragoza (Aragon, Spain), where we began to develop small games and have endless discussions on design and gameplay. Later on, we met again and worked together in a studio called "Enigma Software Productions" where we developed "War Leaders: Clash of Nations" (PC), "History: Legends of War" (PC, PSP, PS Vita, PS3, Xbox360) and "Music School" (Nintendo DS). During that time, and using the little spare time left between crunches, we started putting together a set of ideas we had been discussing for years in a new project, trying to create a different space game experience: the goal was a complex, highly immersive system or universe able to support a high amount of compound physical entities, in which no object could move by means of nothing but physical forces, while keeping a good performance.

The project kept growing and at some point we realized that the engine had the potential to become something great and worthy to share. That's how we decided to start our own studio to develop Kromaia, and that's what we have been doing for three years with no external funding at all, work, work, more work and good advices from great people in the indie community, as well as volunteers who selflessly helped us out to polish the gameplay. Additionally, the talented composer Josh Whelchel is creating an awesome soundtrack for us in order to complete this experience that we feel is so unique.


This campaign would be impossible without some great people helping us set everything up for the Indiegogo launch, and, in some cases, since the very beginning of the project, so let us introduce them!


Kevin Greenlee, AKA LoudCore is a critically acclaimed US Video Game Composer and Music Producer. Since his start in 2006, he has been able to compose music for a wide variety of games and other media outlets. He is best known for working with StarForge.


David Daza is (an experienced comic-book artist. He has worked for several publishers in USA and Spain – Dark Horse (STAR WARS), IDW Publishing (TRANSFORMERS), Moonstone Books and Planeta-DeAgostini among others.


Josh Whelchel is a video game music composer and enthusiast, also scoring for Castle Story and Mojang's Scrolls.  He brings years of experience to the Kromaia soundscape, including a love for spacy geometry inspired landscapes.  You can follow his updates on twitter @soundofjw and listen to his current drafts on Soundcloud. Follow him on Loudr.




OGRE (Object-Oriented Graphics Rendering Engine) is a scene-oriented, flexible 3D engine written in C++ designed to make it easier and more intuitive for developers to produce applications utilising hardware-accelerated 3D graphics. The class library abstracts all the details of using the underlying system libraries like Direct3D and OpenGL and provides an interface based on world objects and other intuitive classes.
Bullet Physics is a professional open source collision detection, rigid body and soft body dynamics library.
IrrKlang is a high level 2D and 3D cross platform (Windows, Mac OS X, Linux) sound engine and audio library.
Boost provides free peer-reviewed portable C++ source libraries.

story:
Who We Are

Stone Soup Entertainments, LLC was created in 2013 after 3 years of tabletop gaming. Every Saturday, we would go to our friend’s house and spend hours creating characters and campaigns that pushed the limits of the rules. After customizing every game we came across, we decided that instead of altering existing rules we should create our own from scratch. While creating the rules, we realized that much of the fun we were accustomed to was from creating the many customized characters and situations that worked within the existing rules. Given this realization, we decided on a game which required the most minimum of rules and was compatible with every literary genre.

The name Stone Soup Entertainments, LLC represents the fundamental goal of the company and its projects. The name is based around an old folktale where hungry travelers come to a village, carrying nothing more than an empty cooking pot. Upon their arrival, the villagers are unwilling to share any of their food stores with the hungry travelers. Then the travelers go to a stream and fill the pot with water, drop a large stone in it, and place it over a fire. The villagers, curious to the soup they are making, hand them a little bit of seasoning to help them out. More and more villagers walk by, each adding another ingredient. Finally, a delicious and nourishing pot of soup is enjoyed by all.

The moral of the story, and by extension the Light-On-Rules-Engine, is that the more you put into the “soup”, the more you gain. The Light-On-Rules-Engine is designed to give players the room necessary to add in game play elements to enhance their personal level of play; this allows for an unlimited amount of play options for you and your gaming group to enjoy.

Sean Williams first became a part of Stone Soup Entertainments, LLC after playing various types of role-playing games. Driven with the desire to create something that millions would enjoy, Sean was eager to begin working on something he felt would be able to combine elements that everyone could enjoy. Combining his knowledge of science with his passion for writing, Sean compiled every idea and concept and helped establish a company with a solid product that will continue to pave the way for creativity and critical thinking in gaming across a wide audience.

What the Game Means to Us

The Light-On-Rules-Engine is a quick and simple tabletop gaming experience designed to allow for limitless customization and endless hours of unique game play. For the last year, we at Stone Soup Entertainments, LLC have been creating the bare minimum of rules needed so that the game can be picked up and played by both veteran and first time role players. The final result has been a game system that can be molded to any type of game world or quickly adapted to a game world that you have already established. This last year has seen the company Stone Soup Entertainments, LLC become a hard earned reality so that we would be able to construct a viable "launch pad for dreams." Overcoming what obstacles we have come across, we have been able to construct our first product that we wish to launch into the gaming community. We are actually 90% of the way to completing our launch, but this last stretch is so important that we are going to need the help of the community now more than ever.

The contents of the book has been fully written and we are currently editing the final layout of the art on the cover and within its pages. Once done, we will be ready to take orders via our website and begin bulk printing. This will allow us the necessary time to work on the future products that we have lined up to be used in conjunction with the Light-On-Rules-Engine rule book. This means that we will be periodically releasing new content that will both enhance your game play as well as introduce settings that you can play in; the new content will give you a starting point to create a campaign or give you ideas to create your own. The Light-On-Rules-Engine is specifically made to give future campaign designers the freedom to create any world imaginable. Our goal is to encourage gamers to use their imagination more freely in an environment that adapts to their play style.

The Light-On-Rules-Engine is just the first step on our journey. The rulebook is there to show what the base mechanics of the game are to quickly get future players acclimated to the system. The majority of the funds raised via Indiegogo will go towards completing the scenario books entitled War Powers and Looking Glass.

War Powers is a pseudo-futuristic setting where people with super powers dominate everyday life and where military actions are governed by a board of directors rather than a central government. The first module centers around a group of soldiers working for America’s Rapid Response Operational Warfare Service (A.R.R.O.W.S.) as they try to find the people responsible for a brutal killing.

Looking Glass is a high fantasy setting that takes place during World War I. The German army has pushed their way into the realm of Wonderland and try to manipulate the barriers between worlds in an effort to tip the outcome of the war in their favor. As the barrier weakens, random people are constantly being drawn in to this surreal landscape and find themselves in the middle of a war on two fronts. It’s up to them to decide how they wish to get home.


Our Impact on the Community

After years of being a part of the gaming community as a whole, we believe that it is our time to give something back and we feel that everyone should be a vital part of the process. We want to share our thoughts with everyone in the community and allow them the ability to share their own thoughts. We can accomplish this by creating a forum for the free flow of ideas and creative thinking. By allowing players in the community to express themselves, we will be able to create more enriched content in the future and strengthen the community by accepting their input. A big part of the Light-On-Rules-Engine is to listen to and adapt to the input of the community so that it will change shape to better suit the community's needs.

Using our website as a portal for the community's ideas, we will create special community areas so that players and campaign designers can share their created content. This will allow the players to communicate with each other and find like-minded individuals that they can be connected to. We hope that this will change the way our players think of community gaming and inspire a new generation of player/creator interaction. We would be happy to share our favorite player-created campaigns periodically as well as continuously release new campaigns that we have created.

Other Ways You Can Help

With every way that we are promoting our campaign, you can help promote it via any social media or publishing venue that you know. If you have a group of friends that you regularly game with, you can mention this project to them and help spread the word. Share and Like our Facebook page or follow us on Twitter.

Funding Our Campaign

The bulk of the funding is going towards hiring a full time team of writers and artists to continue to provide quality products that fit with the Light-On-Rules-Engine. Working on a commission basis, we have only been able to get so far and with your support we'll be able to include even more art than we have now.


Cover by Ken Bastard



The Shootout by Ken Bastard


The GI's by Ken Bastard

The Tavern by Aga Marlon


Repairs by Sheree Hill.



Game Play Examples


These are the examples we've made during our live stream on Twitch.tv. Be sure to be on the lookout for more as we are doing live streams every weekend in June!

story:
Welcome to our Indiegogo campaign! We're launching this campaign to help turn Caribbean Island: A Pirate Adventure into an awesome game that will be bigger and more ambitious than anything we've ever made to date!

 



Caribbean Island: A Pirate Adventure is a point-and-click adventure game in the old-school style titles. We’re creating an epic, fun and challenging new adventure.

The game focuses on the story of Oliver.
Oliver is an eccentric pirate seeking treasures.
And survives mostly by using wit and negotiation rather than weapons or force.
Our hero will arrive to an island and the only way to start the adventure is with your help.

The initial plan is to have 4 chapters on the game. If we reach extra goals we can add a 5th and 6th chapter.
We hope to have the game done in around mid 2014.

With your help, Caribbean Island will become a reality—forged by Voon in 2D graphics in 1536p resolution!!, and it will be available for PC, Mac, Linux, iOS and Android. Hopefully if we reach an extra goal it will be on GameStick and OUYA too.

 

 Please, vote for us on Steam Greenlight!

 

Update 1: We are also going to bring a pixelated version so you can choose to play on full HD graphics or old-style pixel art (you can change it at anytime of the game). 

 

We Need Your Help!

Every penny donated (after covering the awesome donation perks, indiegogo fees, etc) will go toward the production of this game. We are already working on the game but we need funds to continue and hire more people to work on it.

Every pledge will help make this vision become a reality.
Contribute today and receive the exclusive rewards available only to those pledging through this IndieGogo campaign.

 

 

REWARDS:

$10 - Wallpapers
Get an exclusive wallpaper pack.

 

 

$20 - THE GAME
Download Caribbean Island: A Pirate Adventure for PC, Mac and Linux, DRM-free.
You will be listed in the "Donors" section of the Caribbean Island credits in the game and on the official website!

 

 

$30 - GAME + SOUNDTRACK
Digital download of the game's soundtrack + EVERYTHING in the previous rewards!

 

 

$40 - MANUAL
Digital download of the game's manual + EVERYTHING in the previous rewards!

 

$50 - BETA
Beta access! + EVERYTHING in the previous rewards!

 

$80 - PHYSICAL COPY
Physical Copy of the game in an Old School BOXED DVD + EVERYTHING in the previous rewards!

 


 

 

 

FAQ

Q: What if you don't reach the goal amount?

A: The game will be developed, but we will be forced to downsize the project. You still will get the game.

Q: Will the game be free or paid?

A: There will be 2 versions of the game. One will be lite/free and there will be a second premium/full version that will be paid. Exact price of the premium/full game has not yet been determined but it will be in line with other games of similar awesomeness.

Q. When do we get the perks?

A: That depends on the perk AND where in the world you are. For items that require physical shipment please give us 6 - 10 weeks beyond the end of the campaign. Please note that your perks could also come a lot sooner than that.

Q. How do I tell you my t-shirt size?

A: We are reading every single comment so please leave your t-shirt size or any other additional information you think we should know to make sure we get you your perks :)

Q. What if I left out the shipping costs by mistake?

A. You can make an additional donation in the amount required for your perk and just notify us through the comments. We will be reading them all.

Q. Why don't I see my comment anymore?

All comments that require a response will be recorded, responded to, and hopefully resolved :) We delete them because it makes it easier to track progress.

Q. Can I upgrade my donation to get a higher tier?

A. Yes. You can donate the additional amount to bring you up to the tier level you want. Then, you will receive everything in that tier as well as all of the tier prizes below. Leave information in the comments so we can notate it and confirm that the donation information is correct.

Q. What is a physical copy?

A physical copy is a box with its own unique box art and a DVD copy of the game.

A physical copy is a box with its own unique box art and a DVD copy of the game.

story:
Gam3rCon, The World Resources SimCenter and LanDiego and have joined together to produce an exciting new eSports series in San Diego, The Gam3rCon Championship Series (GCS), a PC and Console video gaming league that takes place every weekend leading up to the Gam3rcon Convention July 18-24, 2013! 

This will be the most prominent gaming competition in the area and will establish a new standard for eSports in Southern California. Gamers of all backgrounds and ages are welcome to attend the GCS and participate to reap wonderful rewards. Each GCS event features games to play just for fun, food & beverages, and prizes for participation.

                                                                      Exclusive Tee-shirt for all backers at $25 or more

HOW IT WORKS:

The GCS competitions span multiple gaming genres and platforms. Players can play one or up to all five of the GCS games in an attempt to reach that game’s championship tournament. Each time a player competes they have the opportunity to earn points by defeating rival competitors. 

At the end of the series, the players with the most points in each game category will qualify for the FINAL championships July 18-24, 2013 at Gam3rCon in downtown San Diego.

The GCS involves two PC games and three console games:

  • Starcraft 2
  • League of Legends
  • Call of Duty: Black ops 2
  • Super Street Fighter 4
  • Ultimate Marvel vs. Capcom 3

    RAZA Gaming Jersey for all backers at $75

Each game will have its own competitive season. The competitions will take place every Saturday and Sunday starting April 13th at the World Resources SimCenter. PC Games will be played on Saturdays with console games being played on Sundays.

THE VENUES:

WORLD RESOURCES SIMCENTER

The primary GCS competitions will be held at the World Resources SimCenter in Downtown San Diego. This innovative training and workshop venue is an ideal location for gaming events. It boasts twelve 7ft. x 7ft. projector screens, enough space for competitors and spectators to enjoy every event comfortably, and is located in the heart of downtown San Diego where both Gam3rCon and the ever-popular Comic-Con take place. Our hosts at the SimCenter have graciously allowed us to transform their venue into a gamer’s paradise every weekend.

GAM3RCON @ THE 10TH AVENUE THEATRE

After the regular GCS season has ended (approximately one week before the Gam3rCon convention) the championship tournaments for each game will be held at both the World Resources SimCenter and Gam3rCon in the 10th Avenue Theatre in downtown San Diego.

THE PAYOFF:

We have started this campaign in order to raise the funds necessary to rent the space required to host all of the GCS events, provide food and beverages for attendees at every event and pay the SimCenter staff members who are on hand to host the GCS. We will also be producing some fantastic rewards for those who back us, including a rooftop party at Gam3rCon for all backers. We are attempting to provide an exciting weekly event for gaming enthusiasts to enjoy and have the ability to compete for amazing prizes.

PARTNERS:

story:
Hey there dice rollers!

After a regroup and a bunch of improvements we are back in business with our portable 6x4 handy dandy play surface.

"you mean a folding table right?"

Well yes and no.  It is a quad folding table built rugged and big enough for you not to have to bring any additional tables or surface doodads to play a game.  It's 30lbs, folds into its own carry box, and takes less than 2 minutes to set--up or take down.  There are many 6 foot tables out there, believe us we have probably looked at most of them, but none have the specs we are offering with the ALPHA.

"so... I already have a table..."

Hey good for you Champ, we do too.  What about the folks that don’t?  But what happens if you need an additional table space because the friends and beers have multiplied in numbers at the gathering?  Maybe you're tired of hosting at your place because you're the only one in the group that has a table?  Perhaps rolling dice in 3 layers of clothing isn't as much fun anymore because the only place your spouse will let you have a giant 24 square foot table is the basement, garage, or attic?  Or perhaps you've always been curious how it feels to roll dice with one hand while flipping burgers with the other (we mean outside).  Then the ALPHA may be for you!

So that's what the ALPHA Game Table brings to you.  A play surface when you need it, and a convenient storage or stowage case when you don't.  Slip it under your bed, in the car, or hide it behind a cat... no wait, a couch.  We designed the ALPHA so we could enjoy our hobby ANYWHERE.  And now you can too...

 

Firmer Terra LLC

We are businessmen who enjoy miniatures war games.  We started Firmer Terra LLC to help bring some much needed solutions to problems that we face with this hobby.  Finding a play space for various miniatures games has always been an issue.  Most of these games require 24 or 16 square feet of flat real estate.  Most tables do not have the proper width so we have to improvise by cutting the play space short or building some bulky surface that ends up in the basement or garage.

We researched various table manufacturers and selected the best fit for a relationship based on quality, price, and experience.  After introducing our table requirement we spent months engineering, and re-engineering, the various changes necessary to have a unit of this size.  This included structural modifications, color schemes, dimensional adjustments, frame changes, and stress tolerances.  In the end we had a prototype of a surface unit that was unique to our company.

We hope to deliver a product based on three core concepts:

  • PORTABLE- the table has to be lightweight (about 30lbs), it has to be able to fold and store in a convenient manner either in a car trunk or under a bed.  Average set-up or take-down takes less than 2 minutes.
  • VERSATILE- the table has to be able to accommodate most miniatures tabletop games and accessories.  That means the surface area has to be a minimum of 4 feet by 6 feet.
  • VALUE DRIVEN- the price point has to be reasonable.  Our standard was that the table would cost less than the average army of miniatures or the terrain.  As part of this campaign we are offering the ALPHA at $130.00 plus shipping. 

In the end we had the ALPHA Game Table.  A surface that you can feel free to set-up in any room, and when you're done playing just fold up and stow away. 

All of the photos you see are with full permission from our manufacturer.  The ALPHA in the set-up video is our only prototype and is unique to our design.  We need your support to make this happen.

What We Need & What You Get

So we have completed the design phase of the process.  We have a smaller sample unit that we put through rugged abuse testing.  What we need from the Indiegogo community is an initial understanding of the market along with the capital required for the first MOQ (minimum order quantity).  We have paid for the retooling and production set-up.  This was one of the greatest obstacles since creating a table of this dimension is not common for most manufacturing molds and special tooling was required.

Our campaign will run in two phases.  We have limited initial production line slated for delivery in December of 2016; and hopefully in time to get to your doorstep by the 20th of December.  Our overrun and additional manufacturing is scheduled to arrive in the first part of 2017.  We will avoid shipping (that is cargo ship) these units during December since freighters charge more for peak season, but more importantly since cargo has a higher chance of being damaged during these months in ports.

The Impact

We started this project with one goal in mind, to have these tables and use them.  We can't order just a few units since factories produce in bulk.  So we decided to crowdfund our concept and let fellow gamers in on the idea.  Your support will help us make this a reality.  If everything goes according to plan backers will be waging war on these tables in time for the December holidays.

Intended Purpose and Instructions

READ FIRST

With proper care this unit is designed to give you a comfortable game play surface for many years.  Please be sure to check out any further updates at firmerterra.com.  If you should require technical support please email info@firmerterra.com

PLEASE INSPECT YOUR TABLE WHEN REMOVING PACKAGING MATERIALS.  AVOID USING KNIVES OR CUTTERS AROUND THE UNIT AS YOU CAN DAMAGE THE SURFACE.

SURFACE WEIGHT: The ALPHA Game Table was designed to support 45 Kilo, or 100 lbs, of surface weight dispersed throughout its area, and any 2 x 2 inch area to support at least 2 lbs.  We recommend testing the stability of the unit if you plan on adding more weight (we do not recommend exceeding weight specs).

The table is intended for its original use as a play surface for tabletop games.  Do not sit or stand on the unit.  Always supervise children, pets, when engaging with the unit as excess weight concentrations may cause the unit to become unstable.  When not in use fold the table to storage mode.

STABILITY: The ALPHA Game Table is a lightweight play surface.  Test the stability of the table prior to leaning or jarring the unit.  Always make sure that the locking latches are engaged when the unit is being used as a surface or while in storage mode.  The unit performs best on flat solid ground (hard floors), always test the stability before playing.

SET-UP: Follow the set-up video on firmerterra.com for any instruction.  The table is designed to set-up and take down in less than 2 minutes.  When flipping the unit to change modes be sure to hold securely at each shorter end with a partner.  Attempting to flip this large surface space by yourself may result in damage to the hinges or structure.  Make sure to be clear of all hinges when changing modes.

SURFACE: The surface of the table is designed of water resistant MDF and aluminum.  If the table becomes wet use a cloth to absorb moisture.  The table is rated for outdoor use, but prolonged exposure to sunlight or moisture may damage the unit.  The surface may become scratched if not properly handled.  Most scratches will not impact the functionality of the unit.  For more information go to firmerterra.com.  Avoid exposing the surface to hot containers.  Avoid exposing the surface to high energy impact.

Discard all packaging material properly and keep away from children.

Avoid dragging the table when in play mode.  Ask someone to help you lift the unit and move it.

When in storage mode, be mindful of the table edges and surface.  Make certain that the table has been properly converted in each mode and that the joints and surface edges line up properly.  Avoid forcing the table during mode changes.  All joints should move freely and allow for easily mode change.

Avoid blaming poor dice rolls on the table as subsurface emotional damage may result.

Be mindful where you play.  Avoid high traffic paths as you are going to block 24 square feet of space. 

The user(s) assume all liability when using this unit.  Exercise common sense at all times.  Be mindful of the fact that this is a lightweight structure.  Avoid dangerous environments when playing a game.

In other words

We do not recommend, advise, or ever encourage sitting, bracing, or (for the love of...) laying on top of this gaming surface.  The ALPHA is intended as a gaming surface strictly.  Please never stand on it, or use it as a recliner, a pool diving board, a bridge, or hoist it above your head in a fit of victory.  Always exercise caution and respect for what this game surface is and its original intent; to enjoy miniatures games and similar hobbies.

Risks & Challenges

Any product that is manufactured abroad has inherent risk of failure. This is why we have created a relationship with a proven manufacturer and a domestic customs receiver.
Price of raw materials can fluctuate, although we do not predict any dramatic impacts on the types of materials we are using.  Upon receiving these units we will evaluate random packages for shipping damage, coherency to specs, and overall play-ability.
Table wobble is inherent with any lightweight piece of furniture. You can't stand on this table or smash it in a fit of dice roll rage. A redesign of the original prototype proved that independently braced legs help absorb wobble. Our test group had no issues with this. Besides, most gamers stand around their tables rather than sit by them.  We have played dozens of games on the prototype and found no issue with this.
We have over 30 years of business building experience (over half of that in foreign work). We have been building businesses out of ideas for over 2 decades. Although the video may not be uber professional we wanted to pass along the savings to our backers.
The ALPHA Game table has been evaluated, test run, and is now in the initial phase of manufacture.  We are offering these units in limited production run as a test of the market and a step in beginning full manufacture.  A secondary production run will commence as soon as the initial units arrive.  If everything goes according to schedule these finished units should be entering the US by December of 2016.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you like the idea, but can't contribute, then we would appreciate it if you spread the word.  Tell your gaming friends.  You may know a miniatures enthusiast who is going off to college and would appreciate a surface that can easily stow under a seat.  Or perhaps you're already in a house and people just can't appreciate a, permanent, giant table in the middle of a room.  Fold away when you're done.  The entire process takes less than 2 minutes.

If you're into miniatures games and are tired of going to other people's homes to play then this is worth your attention.

If you're into miniatures and are tired of always hosting the game because you're the only one with a surface then this is worth your attention.

If you enjoy owning large portable surfaces, and you've never played miniatures war games, then this is worth your attention.

You get the idea....

story:
Welcome to Rave Game Networks!

I have always thought about the idea of a central hub for Brony gaming. There are many media networks, (Ponyville Live, Everfree, etc.) why not gaming? From that point on, Project Harmony was born. I am here to present the idea of a central Brony PC gaming network that anyone can join. A network driven by the Bronies, for the Bronies. For example, you can join the network with your own server, or even a Brony gaming YouTube channel. Absolutely no fees, just certain criteria to meet. You can become part of the family, gain players, and a good community.

What this is:

  • A community-driven PC gaming network for game servers and YouTube channels.
  • A group of Bronies that want to make the PC gaming experience better for everyone. (That includes you)
  • A place to make friends, talk to other Bronies, and have fun.
  • A place to express yourself and learn something.

What this isn’t:

  • A confined group for a select few
  • A group for console gaming (Although we will accept gaming YouTube channels if you have console-related videos.)
  • A place that you have to pay membership fees to add your server or channel
  • A “Brony server list” website

What we have right now:

  • 4 Minecraft servers connected with Bungeecord (300 slots)
  • A large community/forum with over 400 members
  • Affiliation with Sonic Radioboom (A Brony radio station run by Lauren King)
  • A bi-weekly podcast on iTunes

What we need the money for:

  • To pay for the Minecraft server
  • To add a Team Fortress 2 payload server
  • To add a Team Fortress 2 attack+defend/2fort server
  • To add a Garry’s Mod pony DarkRP server
  • To add a 300 slot Teamspeak server (To strengthen the community!)
  • To give money back to charity.

Charity:

Yes, we’re giving $760 of our goal amount to Child’s Play. Child’s Play is a charity that gives video games and toys to kids in hospitals. Also, 80% of any extra money we get past out goal will also be given to Child’s Play. Child’s play is one of the primary charities of the Humble Indie Bundle, and Mojang themselves.

What’s in it for me:

Ah, the perks! We wouldn't forget that. We have various perks to the right, such as Lifetime VIP Membership on our Minecraft servers, and VIP on all new servers. Plus, being the first to have your server added, and even executive packages, so check it out!

Budget:

Minecraft 2 years = $550 x 2 = $1100

Teamspeak 2 years = $410

Team Fortress 2 (2 servers on 1 box) 2 years = $770

Garry's Mod 2 years = $520

DDoS Protection 2 years (for all servers) = $2020

Charity = $760

Indiegogo/other fees = $420

goal = $6000

The mod itself is a mod based of the popular tv series Stargate. Adding characters,vehiles,maps and weapons to the game of Arma making it able to play with  your friends on our server.

Well in 2013 the boom of the mod was amazing with to date 13.000 downloads, the mod has toped charts in Arma. The server that has been up as you know or played on has been always full with the 100 people that the server holds. The server is now down and we have began the stage of finalizing the mod. We have now set our eyes on the future and need you the people to voice your opinion for our next step. 

We have came to the following conclusion ether set a massive update to Arma 2 mod or set to the skys with Arma 3 and begin development. Ether way the projects funding has been a issue the amount of Devs needed you can imagine is a issue.

story:
Preliminary Medal Concept Rendering

/ The Story

We are big Olympic fans who work at a Toronto design agency called Jacknife.  When we saw Gilmore Junio give up his spot to allow Denny Morrison to race instead (and bring home a silver medal), we were inspired to do something special for Gilmore to recognize his incredible personal sacrifice.

It's easy to celebrate the winners - they get medals! But we think Gil Junio is the biggest winner of all.  He proved it with the dedication he showed to both his team and his country. No one deserves to be rewarded more than Gilmore and we want to give him a gold medal of his own.  We believe the rest of Canada does too. 

Will you help us thank Gilmore with his own gold medal?

Preliminary Medal Concept Rendering

/ What We Need & What You Get

Our team is made up of experienced designers who have volunteered their time and expertise to design this medal for Gil.

What we are asking for is your help to fund the materials and manufacturing costs, and more importantly, to let Gilmore know how many Canadians were touched by his selfless act.

Any funds that don't go towards making and delivering Gilmore his medal will go to Speed Skating Canada or to a charity of Gil Junio's choice.

We are actively seeking ways to make this medal as efficiently as possible including contacting suppliers and manufacturers to see if they want to contribute, but we can't count on that. 

Preliminary Medal Concept Rendering

/ Funds Raised

If for any reason we can't realize our medal design we will donate all funds to Speed Skating Canada or the charity of Gil's choice.

/ Budget Breakdown

Materials: $1,250
Manufacturing: $2,500
Travel to bring Gil to Toronto to receive his medal: $2500
Perks Fulfillment (Buttons, Postage) & Fees: up to $750
TOTAL: $7,000

/ The Impact

We think that this is an amazing opportunity to celebrate and recognize a Canadian hero for his personal sacrifice. Junio's actions really embody what it means to be Canadian and while he probably doesn't expect any kind of reward for what he did, we definitely think he deserves one!

/ Other Ways You Can Help

Want to say thank you to Gilmore Junio in other ways? Help us spread the word - share this campaign on Facebook, Twitter or just straight up tell your friends!  You can use the indiegogo share tools to do this or link to our website: thanksgilmore.com

#ThanksGilmore

/ Our Team

The design team at Jacknife has extensive experience producing beautiful and meaningful award designs. Recently our work has included a trophy design for Red Bull's THRE3STYLE International DJ Competition and a DesignThinkers Award for the Association of Registered Graphic Designers of Ontario. In addition to this we have a well-regarded client list who consistently rely on us for amazing product and graphic design projects. Our work speaks for itself at jacknifedesign.com.

We reserve the right to review names prior to placing on our website and/or ribbon to prevent advertisers from abusing this perk.

story:
VicoVR is the world's first Full Body Controller (Gaming System) for Mobile Virtual Reality.

VicoVR is a Bluetooth accessory that provides Wireless Full Motion and Positional tracking to Android and iOS VR headsets. Currently only very expensive, enterprise - level systems, such as VRcade, can offer truly Wireless Full Motion experience. Consumer VR Systems, offering Full Motion, such as HTC Vive, Oculus are all wired solutions.

VicoVR brings Full Motion capability to Mobile VR gaming! Without a PC, wires, or wearable sensors! VicoVR is compatible with Samsung Gear VR, Google Daydream and any other Android or iOS headset. The VicoVR gaming system truly allows you to move freely within mobile gaming worlds!

VicoVR comes complete as a stand-alone 3D Gaming System or as an add-on Bluetooth Accessory for your existing VR Headset or Gaming Platform (Android, iOS).

Enable Positional & Full Body Tracking with Wireless 3D Motion Sensing!


Precise 3D Coordinates of 19 Body Joints.

Internal processor of VicoVR processes depth data of the scene and outputs Full Body Tracking data wirelessly, with minimal latency, to any Android or iOS Head Mounted Display!
This does not consume the processing power of your Mobile Head Mounted Display, all processing is done inside VicoVR!




A Complete Gaming System or an Upgrade to Existing.
VicoVR is Versatile as a Stand-Alone Gaming System or it can Easily be Added-On to Existing iOS or Android 3D VR Displays and/or Platforms.

Check Out Some Games Showcasing VicoVR Technology!

VicoVR already has some exciting Android VR applications developed by 3DiVi and third party developers with more than ten finished Android applications. Over the coming months, our stand-alone gaming library will expand, all free to our backers as the library grows. In the meantime, there are a ton of games already available on many existing gaming platforms.




Pairs With Existing Gaming Platforms
VicoVR syncs with Android TV, Apple TV, Android Game Consoles and other gaming platforms and can also be paired with Samsung Gear VR, Goolge Daydream, or Google Cardboard adding an extra dimension of gaming.

For pairing, simply download the VicoVR app, it also serves as a catalog of games!


VicoVR processes depth input inside the sensor and recognizes 19 body joints of two people in  real time.


VicoVR works both for standing and sitting (half body) poses!


Proprietary 3D vision based processing unit detects precise 3D coordinates of 19 body joints for each user presented in Field-of-View of the sensor. 

This data is then sent wirelessly - with minimal latency - to any Android or iOS HMD. Best of all: these features do not consume processing power of your Mobile HMD - all processing is done inside VicoVR!  



VicoVR solves one of the key problems of Mobile VR - the lack of HMD Positional Tracking.

Mobile Head Mounted Displays becoming increasingly popular and more powerful with better displays and better internal sensors for gaze tracking. 

However, they lack the ability to locate themselves in 3D spaces- this is what's known as Positional Tracking. Without Positional Tracking users are limited in the types of VR applications, meaning they lack the ability to move freely in VR worlds. 
Only pricey, wired, and PC based systems like HTC Vive and Oculus offer this more advanced feature. VicoVR enables Positional Tracking for Mobile VR headsets - without a PC, wires, or any additional wearable sensors!

To avoid collision with objects & people, VicoVR may warn users when they’re exiting a safe zone. 

It's a great feature that keeps gaming uninterrupted and all players safe!



The key ingredient of VicoVR is the industry leading Full Body Tracking software developed by 3DiVi!



We are constantly working to improve quality of our body tracking software.

Our wireless hand controller is perfect for performing simple UI control and navigation tasks (e.g. "confirm" command). 



While VicoVR is perfect for immersive full body and headset positional tracking, our Wireless Hand Controller comes in handy when fighting zombies or playing ping pong! 

Supports Android and iOS smartphones 4 to 6 inches, features high quality lenses, reliable locking & adjusts to different eye features.


If you already have your own headset- that’s great! You can use any Android or iOS headset with VicoVR. 



VicoVR is designed to be easily upgradable with over-the-air software upgrades, using Android (or, later, iOS) application.



VicoVR works beyond VR! As a Bluetooth accessory it can be paired simultaneously with other Smart devices - such as Apple TV, Android TV and the like. With VicoVR it's possible to play in VR against your friends playing on TV! 



The depth sensing module of VicoVR is capable of capturing the accurate measurements of objects.


This feature may be used for 3D scanning allowing users to take measurements (scans) of their bodies and try clothes on in virtual fitting rooms. This feature may be implemented by developers using VicoVR SDK. 


VicoVR is capable of capturing point clouds representing people in real time and wirelessly sending this data to any Android/iOS device. 






We provide plugins for Unity3D and UE4, as well as samples and documentation for developers. Developers can now easily create Android and iOS applications with full body interactivity for Google Cardboard, Samsung Gear VR, iPhone VR.



Embedded software found in VicoVR is highly optimized and requires moderate ARM chipset for processing. This means that VicoVR is less expensive and consumes 10 times less energy than solutions based on Kinect+Windows PC.












3DiVi Inc. was started five years ago with the idea to bring 3D gesture recognition technology to emerging computer platforms. By assembling the brilliant team of computer vision engineers, we created a state of the art 3D body tracking software. Our developments happened just in time for the emergence of the Mobile VR market.

Our team found 3D Full Body Tracking was capable of solving key problems in Mobile VR.  We identified the lack of positional tracking of Mobile headset and the lack of body interactivity to be two of the biggest issues. Our team believed the sensor should work wirelessly- without a PC- meaning the sensor should have its own embedded processing capability. This belief is how VicoVR was born.

During the last year we’ve evolved from a duct-tape prototype to a validated prototype that’s ready for mass production. The VicoVR prototype has already been assembled in small quantities and shipped to Android VR developers. More than ten Android VR apps are ready for VicoVR and we've had successful demos at VRLA2016, CES2016, and MWC2015. VicoVR is literally a game changing peripheral device with a total addressable market (TAM) of over two billion Android and iOS devices! 

Our team deeply believes this is the beginning of a great chapter in full body presence within the Mobile VR world. To grow in sync with the Mobile VR industry, we look forward to working endlessly to evolve the capabilities of VicoVR via software updates. 

VicoVR’s breakthrough in accuracy, stability, and latency of body tracking has resulted in a virtual reality gaming system unlike any other. With VicoVR, virtual truly becomes reality. We cannot wait to share this gaming reality with our backers. 

3DiVi Inc. is headquatered in San Francisco and has a R&D office in Russia.



Q: What is VicoVR?

A: VicoVR sensor is a Bluetooth peripheral that brings wireless Kinect-like motion tracking capability to Android and iOS ecosystems - without a PC, wires, or wearable sensors! When wirelessly paired with Mobile VR headsets such as Samsung GearVR or Google Cardboard, VicoVR enables HMD-positional-tracking and full-body-tracking capabilities. When wirelessly paired with the new generation of gaming platforms such as AndroidTV, AppleTV, or an Android game console, VicoVR enhances mobile gaming with familiar Kinect-like body tracking.



Q: Is VicoVR Sensor similar to Microsoft Kinect?   

A: Yes and no. VicoVR sensor is similar to Kinect as it uses similar bundle of depth sensing technology and the body tracking SDK (middleware). The key difference is VicoVR Sensor’s embedded processing capability. Unlike Kinect SDK, which requires xBox or Windows PC for middleware processing, our proprietary middleware is executed inside sensor on embedded processing unit. Processing results such as real time user skeletal tracking data and gestures are sent then by Bluetooth to any compatible host device.


By offloading heavy image processing tasks from the host CPU, VicoVR Sensor makes full featured 3D motion control available on any Bluetooth enabled device. You can think of VicoVR Sensor as a new type of Bluetooth peripheral, which is especially perfect for emerging Mobile VR applications requiring full body tracking and gesture control.


Q: Is VicoVR compatible with Google's Daydream platform?
A: Yes! VicoVR is the perfect accessory for Daydream  - it provides Full Body and Positional Tracking capability (both for Headset and for Daydream Controller). 


Q: What's the difference between VicoVR and Google Daydream?

A: Daydream lacks Body tracking and Positional Tracking. Google Daydream desperately needs solution to this issue and that's where VicoVR comes into play!



Q: Is VicoVR compatible with any headset other than "Google Cardboard, Samsung Gear VR and other Android HMDs"?

A: VicoVR is Bluetooth peripheral compatible with any Android and iOS device. It means any Cardboard-type of headset can be used with VicoVR such as Homido, Liquid VR, View Master and others.


Q: Does VicoVR enable Positional Tracking of Mobile VR headset (Android, iOS)?
A: Yes! VicoVR wirelessly communicates Location Tracking data to Mobile VR headset, solving one of the key problems of Mobile VR. This feature works without any markers and not consuming any processing resource of Mobile headset.


Q: How many skeletal joints are detected for person? Can VicoVR track more than one person?
A: Yes, VicoVR can track upto two people simultaneously, detecting up to 19 body joints for each person.


Q: Will it work for sitting poses?
A: Yes, VicoVR skeletal tracking can work reliably for the standing case (full body) and for the sitting case (upper half body).


Q: What if there are two players overlay each other, will VicoVR recognize it?
A: Yes, VicoVR skeletal tracking can effectively separate users in case of overlay, but we recommend to avoid such cases in designing usage scenario for VicoVR.


Q: What is the latency of tracking?
A: Latency of skeletal tracking is 15 ms, latency of wireless transfer is 6.5 ms.

Q: I'm an Android VR Developer, can I get the VicoVR Devkit now?
A: Yes! We have a Developer Program where qualified developers can get immediate access to VicoVR devkit prototypes and SDK. To request devkit prototype please fill form at www.vicovr.com/developers. 


Q: Can VicoVR be used with Oculus or HTC Vive?
A: VicoVR was designed with primary focus on Mobile VR headsets (Android, iOS) and in its current version cannot connect to Windows PC. But this feature may be added later by means of firmware updates, without the need to replace sensor hardware. 


Q: What's the range of the Tracking area?
A: Tracking range is between 0.5 - 4.5 meters and is limited by the Field of View of Sensor which is 60 degrees (horiz.).


Q: Is any option to try VicoVR before purchase?
A: 

Yes! We are based in San Francisco and demo at all major VR events and meetups in the area and across US. Please follow us on social networks to learn our event schedule! If you are in the Bay Area, feel free to reach to info@vicovr.com to schedule an appointment.





Q: Who develops application for VicoVR Sensor?
A: Despite VicoVR is the new platform, we already having several Android developers creating applications and demos for VicoVR. When VicoVR is available later in 2016, apps for VicoVR Sensor will be available on Google Play, AppStore, or on Oculus Gear VR Store.


Q: I am an Android VR Developer, can I get VicoVR Devkit now?
A: Yes! We have Developer Program where qualified developers can get immediate access to VicoVR devkit and SDK. To join VicoVR Developer Program please visit our website. Currently over twenty Android developers already joined our developer program. VicoVR is attractive to Mobile game developers because our Unity3D/UE4 plugins allow them opportunity to quickly add full body control to their existing Android or iOS apps.


Q: Do you provide SDK?
A: Yes, we provide plugins for Unity3D, UE4 and C++ API.


Q: Is PC required?
A: No PC is required. You need VicoVR Sensor and any Bluetooth enabled host device such as Android HMD, AppleTV, Android TV, or Android game console.


Q: Can it be paired with iOS devices?
A: Yes, consumer version of VicoVR can be paired with iOS devices. 


Q: Can VicoVR be used in non- VR applications?
A: Yes, VicoVR as a Bluetooth peripheral can be paired with any Bluetooth compatible devices such as AppleTV, AndroidTV, or Android PC. Kinect-like body tracking capability of VicoVR Sensor can be used in new generation of Mobile OS - based applications beyond VR, such as TV gaming, medical, security, or smart home applications.

Q: Does Vico VR detect the physics (i.e. mass, gravity, and speed) of the gesture? For example, when playing Moon Bird, if I wave my hands faster & harder, will the bird fly higher? 
A: Sure, VicoVR enables to take physics of body gesture (mass, gravity, and speed) into account, but it is defined on application level, not in VicoVR itself. VicoVR communicates in real time (currently at 30 fps) 3D positional data of 19 body joints of human body. And then Android app developer, using VicoVR plugin with his favorite game engine (unity3D, UE4), sets the physics rules inside his app

Q: I want to scan my room, can VicoVR do 3D scanning?
A: This is perfect application for VicoVR but this feature will not be supported in the current version of VicoVR (we also not provide access to raw depth map to third party developers). But we are working on adding new features and capabilities including 3D scan capability. Adding new features to VicoVR in the future can be done easily by means of software upgrades.

Q: If you turn off the lights, can VicoVR still sense you?
A: Yes, it can.


Q: How does VicoVR use the RGB camera?
A: VicoVR has RGB camera as part of its depth sensing module, but it is not used in the current version. We reserve it for future applications of VicoVR, such as 3D scanning, live 3D holograms and the like. These features can be enabled in the future with VicoVR firmware updates using existing VicoVR hardware. 

Q: If my game/app is higher than 30 FPS will it delay, operate too quickly, and/or cause motion sickness?
A: For good user experience in VR, the game should operate at least at 60 fps. VicoVR refresh rate is currently 30 fps, resulting in some latency on the part of body tracking and HMD positional tracking. As for latency of HMD orientation tracking, which we believe is the major source of motion sickness, it is defined not by VicoVR but by quality of IMU sensors of HMD. 

Q: Can I play popular VR games currently on the market using my VicoVR gaming system? 

A: Firstly, we work with Mobile HMDs only. Secondly, developers need to use our free SDK to add body control and to make the game VicoVR-compatible. Games can be:

1. New and developed only for VicoVR 

OR

2. Already existing Android games 


Q: What controllers are compatible with VicoVR?

A: Developers are free to use any extra controller of their choice with VicoVR SDK.


Q: Does Vico VR detect finger movement?

A: We do not track individual fingers. 


Q: Does Vico VR support Voice Recognition? 

A: No, this feature is not supported and we have no plans for enabling it in the future. We think that your Mobile HMD is better suited to handle any voice recognition tasks.

Q: Does VicoVR have physics implementation for hands and feet?

A: While we have samples of body models as part of SDK, all Android VR developers are free to use any other models they like.


Q: Does VicoVR track both position and orientation of HMD?

A: No, VicoVR just tracks position of Mobile HMD by approximating body tracking data. Orientation of HMD is tracked by Mobile HMD itself with no influence from VicoVR. 


Q: Does VicoVR work well with bracelets, watches, sleeves, etc?

A: VicoVR uses high quality IR based depth sensing module for tracking body. But, as usual in computer vision, we cannot guarantee fault free performance under any circumstances, especially with materials non reflecting IR (such as some types of fabric, watches, bracelets, etc). 

Q: Does VicoVR work outdoors?
A: Current version of VicoVR uses IR based depth sensing module and it means VicoVR cannot work outdoor or indoor with a direct sunlight.


Q: What data is sent from VicoVR to the Mobile Headset?
A: VicoVR processes depth input and wirellessly outputs to Android or iOS headset:

  • User pixel masks, unlimited @ 30 fps
  • 3D coordinates of upto 19 skeletal joints for user, two users max @ 30 fps
  • 3D Point Cloud @ 30 fps, upto 160*120
  • Hand pointers (3D), Gestures (fist open/closed, swipes).

All processing is done inside sensor, completely off-loading CPU of Android/iOS Headset!


Q: I know that depth map based tracking cannot provide submillimeter accuracy of tracking - how accurate is your HMD's positional tracking?
A: Yes, 3D position tracking of HMD is based on just one head joint and cannot provide a comfortable experience because of some jitter. However, by having data of all other body joints apart from head, and taking into consideration body kinematics, there is an opportunity to significantly reduce jitter in headset location. We're constantly working to improve perceived accuracy of headset tracking, and those improvements will be available via firmware updates, without the need to replace sensor hardware. 


Q: What is the Warranty? 

A: We provide a one (1) year limited warranty. We guarantee you receive your VicoVR Sensor free of manufacturing defects.


Q: Can I change or cancel my perk?

A: Indiegogo has now made it easier than ever to upgrade your perks. You can now do so on the contributions tab of your Indiegogo profile. See more information on how to do this for Indiegogo here: https://support.indiegogo.com/hc/en-us/articles/526756-How-to-Upgrade-Your-Perk

Regarding cancellations, Indiegogo policies dictate that campaign owners have no ability to adjust perk selections. Backers can upgrade, change, or cancel their perks/rewards at anytime on their contributor's profile until the campaign has closed. After the campaign has ended and funds have been disbursed, the campaigners will evaluate such requests will be handled on a case-by-case basis. 


Q: How much is shipping and handling? 

A: Shipping and handling, which includes shipping the items to our offices, packing and fulfilling orders will cost:

  • FREE in the Domestic United States (including Hawaii, Puerto Rico, Alaska)
  • $10 to Canada, 
  • $15 to UK, EU, Australia, and Japan
  •  $30 Rest-of-World
