More than ten Android VR apps are ready for VicoVR and we've had successful demos at VRLA2016, CES2016, and MWC2015. VicoVR is literally a game changing peripheral device with a total addressable market (TAM) of over two billion Android and iOS devices! 
Our team deeply believes this is the beginning of a great chapter in full body presence within the Mobile VR world. To grow in sync with the Mobile VR industry, we look forward to working endlessly to evolve the capabilities of VicoVR via software updates. 
VicoVR’s breakthrough in accuracy, stability, and latency of body tracking has resulted in a virtual reality gaming system unlike any other. With VicoVR, virtual truly becomes reality. We cannot wait to share this gaming reality with our backers. 

3DiVi Inc. is headquatered in San Francisco and has a R&D office in Russia.









Q: What is VicoVR?
A: VicoVR sensor is a Bluetooth peripheral that brings wireless Kinect-like motion tracking capability to Android and iOS ecosystems - without a PC, wires, or wearable sensors! When wirelessly paired with Mobile VR headsets such as Samsung GearVR or Google Cardboard, VicoVR enables HMD-positional-tracking and full-body-tracking capabilities. When wirelessly paired with the new generation of gaming platforms such as AndroidTV, AppleTV, or an Android game console, VicoVR enhances mobile gaming with familiar Kinect-like body tracking.
Q: Is VicoVR Sensor similar to Microsoft Kinect?   
A: Yes and no. VicoVR sensor is similar to Kinect as it uses similar bundle of depth sensing technology and the body tracking SDK (middleware). The key difference is VicoVR Sensor’s embedded processing capability. Unlike Kinect SDK, which requires xBox or Windows PC for middleware processing, our proprietary middleware is executed inside sensor on embedded processing unit. Processing results such as real time user skeletal tracking data and gestures are sent then by Bluetooth to any compatible host device.
By offloading heavy image processing tasks from the host CPU, VicoVR Sensor makes full featured 3D motion control available on any Bluetooth enabled device. You can think of VicoVR Sensor as a new type of Bluetooth peripheral, which is especially perfect for emerging Mobile VR applications requiring full body tracking and gesture control.

Q: Is VicoVR compatible with Google's Daydream platform?A: Yes! VicoVR is the perfect accessory for Daydream  - it provides Full Body and Positional Tracking capability (both for Headset and for Daydream Controller). 

Q: What's the difference between VicoVR and Google Daydream?
A: Daydream lacks Body tracking and Positional Tracking. Google Daydream desperately needs solution to this issue and that's where VicoVR comes into play!
Q: Is VicoVR compatible with any headset other than "Google Cardboard, Samsung Gear VR and other Android HMDs"?

A: VicoVR is Bluetooth peripheral compatible with any Android and iOS device. It means any Cardboard-type of headset can be used with VicoVR such as Homido, Liquid VR, View Master and others.Q: Does VicoVR enable Positional Tracking of Mobile VR headset (Android, iOS)?


A: Yes! VicoVR wirelessly communicates Location Tracking data to Mobile VR headset, solving one of the key problems of Mobile VR. This feature works without any markers and not consuming any processing resource of Mobile headset.Q: How many skeletal joints are detected for person? Can VicoVR track more than one person?


A: Yes, VicoVR can track upto two people simultaneously, detecting up to 19 body joints for each person.Q: Will it work for sitting poses?


A: Yes, VicoVR skeletal tracking can work reliably for the standing case (full body) and for the sitting case (upper half body).Q: What if there are two players overlay each other, will VicoVR recognize it?


A: Yes, VicoVR skeletal tracking can effectively separate users in case of overlay, but we recommend to avoid such cases in designing usage scenario for VicoVR.Q: What is the latency of tracking?


A: Latency of skeletal tracking is 15 ms, latency of wireless transfer is 6.5 ms.



Q: I'm an Android VR Developer, can I get the VicoVR Devkit now?A: Yes! We have a Developer Program where qualified developers can get immediate access to VicoVR devkit prototypes and SDK. To request devkit prototype please fill form at www.vicovr.com/developers. Q: Can VicoVR be used with Oculus or HTC Vive?


A: VicoVR was designed with primary focus on Mobile VR headsets (Android, iOS) and in its current version cannot connect to Windows PC. But this feature may be added later by means of firmware updates, without the need to replace sensor hardware. Q: What's the range of the Tracking area?


A: Tracking range is between 0.5 - 4.5 meters and is limited by the Field of View of Sensor which is 60 degrees (horiz.).Q: Is any option to try VicoVR before purchase?


A: Yes! We are based in San Francisco and demo at all major VR events and meetups in the area and across US. Please follow us on social networks to learn our event schedule! If you are in the Bay Area, feel free to reach to info@vicovr.com to schedule an appointment.Q: Who develops application for VicoVR Sensor?


A: Despite VicoVR is the new platform, we already having several Android developers creating applications and demos for VicoVR. When VicoVR is available later in 2016, apps for VicoVR Sensor will be available on Google Play, AppStore, or on Oculus Gear VR Store.Q: I am an Android VR Developer, can I get VicoVR Devkit now?


A: Yes! We have Developer Program where qualified developers can get immediate access to VicoVR devkit and SDK. To join VicoVR Developer Program please visit our website. Currently over twenty Android developers already joined our developer program. VicoVR is attractive to Mobile game developers because our Unity3D/UE4 plugins allow them opportunity to quickly add full body control to their existing Android or iOS apps.Q: Do you provide SDK?


A: Yes, we provide plugins for Unity3D, UE4 and C++ API.Q: Is PC required?


A: No PC is required. You need VicoVR Sensor and any Bluetooth enabled host device such as Android HMD, AppleTV, Android TV, or Android game console.Q: Can it be paired with iOS devices?


A: Yes, consumer version of VicoVR can be paired with iOS devices. Q: Can VicoVR be used in non- VR applications?


A: Yes, VicoVR as a Bluetooth peripheral can be paired with any Bluetooth compatible devices such as AppleTV, AndroidTV, or Android PC. Kinect-like body tracking capability of VicoVR Sensor can be used in new generation of Mobile OS - based applications beyond VR, such as TV gaming, medical, security, or smart home applications.

Q: Does Vico VR detect the physics (i.e. mass, gravity, and speed) of the gesture? For example, when playing Moon Bird, if I wave my hands faster & harder, will the bird fly higher? 


A: Sure, VicoVR enables to take physics of body gesture (mass, gravity, and speed) into account, but it is defined on application level, not in VicoVR itself. VicoVR communicates in real time (currently at 30 fps) 3D positional data of 19 body joints of human body. And then Android app developer, using VicoVR plugin with his favorite game engine (unity3D, UE4), sets the physics rules inside his app

Q: I want to scan my room, can VicoVR do 3D scanning?


A: This is perfect application for VicoVR but this feature will not be supported in the current version of VicoVR (we also not provide access to raw depth map to third party developers). But we are working on adding new features and capabilities including 3D scan capability. Adding new features to VicoVR in the future can be done easily by means of software upgrades.


Q: If you turn off the lights, can VicoVR still sense you?


A: Yes, it can.Q: How does VicoVR use the RGB camera?


A: VicoVR has RGB camera as part of its depth sensing module, but it is not used in the current version. We reserve it for future applications of VicoVR, such as 3D scanning, live 3D holograms and the like. These features can be enabled in the future with VicoVR firmware updates using existing VicoVR hardware. Q: If my game/app is higher than 30 FPS will it delay, operate too quickly, and/or cause motion sickness?


A: For good user experience in VR, the game should operate at least at 60 fps. VicoVR refresh rate is currently 30 fps, resulting in some latency on the part of body tracking and HMD positional tracking. As for latency of HMD orientation tracking, which we believe is the major source of motion sickness, it is defined not by VicoVR but by quality of IMU sensors of HMD. 

Q: Can I play popular VR games currently on the market using my VicoVR gaming system? 
A: Firstly, we work with Mobile HMDs only. Secondly, developers need to use our free SDK to add body control and to make the game VicoVR-compatible. Games can be:
1. New and developed only for VicoVR 
OR
2. Already existing Android games 

Q: What controllers are compatible with VicoVR?
A: Developers are free to use any extra controller of their choice with VicoVR SDK.

Q: Does Vico VR detect finger movement?
A: We do not track individual fingers. 

Q: Does Vico VR support Voice Recognition? 
A: No, this feature is not supported and we have no plans for enabling it in the future. We think that your Mobile HMD is better suited to handle any voice recognition tasks.
Q: Does VicoVR have physics implementation for hands and feet?
A: While we have samples of body models as part of SDK, all Android VR developers are free to use any other models they like.

Q: Does VicoVR track both position and orientation of HMD?
A: No, VicoVR just tracks position of Mobile HMD by approximating body tracking data. Orientation of HMD is tracked by Mobile HMD itself with no influence from VicoVR. 

Q: Does VicoVR work well with bracelets, watches, sleeves, etc?
A: VicoVR uses high quality IR based depth sensing module for tracking body. But, as usual in computer vision, we cannot guarantee fault free performance under any circumstances, especially with materials non reflecting IR (such as some types of fabric, watches, bracelets, etc). 
Q: Does VicoVR work outdoors?A: Current version of VicoVR uses IR based depth sensing module and it means VicoVR cannot work outdoor or indoor with a direct sunlight.

Q: What data is sent from VicoVR to the Mobile Headset?A: VicoVR processes depth input and wirellessly outputs to Android or iOS headset:


User pixel masks, unlimited @ 30 fps
3D coordinates of upto 19 skeletal joints for user, two users max @ 30 fps
3D Point Cloud @ 30 fps, upto 160*120
Hand pointers (3D), Gestures (fist open/closed, swipes).

All processing is done inside sensor, completely off-loading CPU of Android/iOS Headset!

Q: I know that depth map based tracking cannot provide submillimeter accuracy of tracking - how accurate is your HMD's positional tracking?A: Yes, 3D position tracking of HMD is based on just one head joint and cannot provide a comfortable experience because of some jitter. However, by having data of all other body joints apart from head, and taking into consideration body kinematics, there is an opportunity to significantly reduce jitter in headset location. We're constantly working to improve perceived accuracy of headset tracking, and those improvements will be available via firmware updates, without the need to replace sensor hardware. 
Q: What is the Warranty? 
A: We provide a one (1) year limited warranty. We guarantee you receive your VicoVR Sensor free of manufacturing defects.Q: Can I change or cancel my perk?
A: Indiegogo has now made it easier than ever to upgrade your perks. You can now do so on the contributions tab of your Indiegogo profile. See more information on how to do this for Indiegogo here: https://support.indiegogo.com/hc/en-us/articles/526756-How-to-Upgrade-Your-PerkRegarding cancellations, Indiegogo policies dictate that campaign owners have no ability to adjust perk selections. Backers can upgrade, change, or cancel their perks/rewards at anytime on their contributor's profile until the campaign has closed. After the campaign has ended and funds have been disbursed, the campaigners will evaluate such requests will be handled on a case-by-case basis. Q: How much is shipping and handling? 
A: Shipping and handling, which includes shipping the items to our offices, packing and fulfilling orders will cost:


FREE in the Domestic United States (including Hawaii, Puerto Rico, Alaska)
$10 to Canada, 
$15 to UK, EU, Australia, and Japan

 $30 Rest-of-World

story:
All of you are invited to interactively explore my electronic retro-pictorial MAZEum of collections.

 

  • Would you like to venture into the atmosphere of 1970s/80s/90s?
  • Remind what was the envy of every preschooler/schoolboy/schoolgirl?
  • Once again feel the delicious taste of turbo gum, ulker final or cin cin football?

The doors are open to everyone with a hint of nostalgia in his heart and desire to rack one`s brain.

  • You do not only crawl through rooms and exhibits just like that. No, it would be boring.
  • Do you want to hear the stories of bubble gum pictures? comic books? electronic games?
  • Do you want to strain your mind to the limits at the same time?

Our curator - Muko - the hamster - will guide you willingly, but he will not lead you by hand. He will tell some stories about one exhibit or another and ... ups, he disappeared again in the maze.

You are all alone now and you have to earn the next story.

  • What is this game about?
  • Contents
  • Genesis of the project
  • To the point
  • What makes this game unique?
  • What is done?
  • Screens
  • TODO and why crowdfunding?
  • Perks
    • for Friends of the museum
    • for Tenacious collectors
    • for Ultimate gamers
  • Fundings
  • Staff
  • Contact
  • FAQ


 

I am a collector - I am collecting stuff for ages - I have no clue whether it`s already a disease or still the hobby - but somehow I manage for now.

Years passing away quicker and quicker so I decided to fulfill my dreams that remind me of my childhood.



The first dream was to release a new book from a forgotten collection "Album for collectors" - SUCCEEDED

 


(btw. I got so engaged that the next one will be prepared at the end of 2016)



The next dream was to set a new Guinness World Record - my category - largest collection of chewing gum packets (pictures/stickers/tattoos) - SUCCEEDED.




Current dream on the list is to make computer game with my children. I wouldn`t be myself if I did not push here something connected to my hobby - collecting



There is also one final dream on the list - currently postponed for the future - I would like to open a real museum of collections where you could go back in time to XX century, play some old arcades, flipper games take a look into chewing gum pictures, comic books or collections of stamps.

I hope I will succeed some day.

 

 

  • Would you like to catch a glimpse of collectibles from 70s/80s/90s?
  • Would you like to go back to years when pictures from TURBO gum were official currency replacement in school, stickers from KOUKOU ROUKOU wafers were present on every pupils` notebook and hand held consoles meant NU PAGADI?
  • Would you like to rack your brain a bit in extremely difficult 2, 3 and 4 dimensional mazes?
  • Would you like to have your own contribution to the final look of the game? graphics? maybe an ending?
  • Maybe thanks to this game you will eventually start collecting something on your own :)
  • And maybe thanks to you I will manage to open sometime in the future first in the world museum of bubble gum packets? (in the real world - not the virtual one)? You can enjoy the foretaste of the museum now in Poland - mini-collection of TURBO gum pictures in a cafe in Warsaw.


 

 

  • Maze for everyone - from 4 to 99+
  • First (I hope) in the world playable museum sightseeing
  • Extremely difficult game with 2, 3 and 4 dimensional mazes
  • Great graphics :) prepared with help of 6, 3 and 0-year old directors (and maybe you!!)
  • Tons of knowledge about collections from 70s/80s/90s
  • No micropayments


 

 

  • Most part of the engine
  • Part of graphics
  • Intro
  • Team - three graphics/sfx directors and me (developer)
  • PrePre-alpha - version of game
  • Screens of this masterpiece below

 


 

 




 

 




 

 




 

 

Whatever happens I will finish this game. With your help the game can be much better. I know that apart from that I am outstanding ;) game developer, graphic designer and animation and music creator, I accept with humility that there are better pros. Thanks to your help I could pay professionals that could help make this game much better. In the first place it would be worth:

 

  • Improve the Intro and game graphics
  • Refine sound and music
  • Make ports to android, ios, ...
  • Finish levels
  • Finish and optimize the engine
  • Buy needed licenses
  • Improve whatever I do not see but you and "band of scoffers" will notice


 

Choose perk for yourself and support this project!
I have prepared 3 groups of perks - so that everyone can find something for themselves.

 

  • PERKS for Friends of the museum
  • PERKS for Tenacious collectors
  • PERKS for Ultimate gamers


 

 

  • Thanks on facebook and museum of collections www site


  • Excellent postcard with thanks especially for you

  • Sensational limited postage stamp

  • Unprecedented letter with thanks especially for you

  • Unique bubble gum insert with superb vehicle

  • Fearless hand drawn Muko - main hero in the game (A5 format)

  • Evil hand drawn Kuko - main villain in the game (A6 format)

  • Spectacular T-shirt with game character

  • Unconventional cup with game character

  • Or maybe you want to rent an unprecedented gum inserts exhibition for your caffe/pub?


 

 

  • "Eggs" type - retro electronic game packed in specially designed box

    optional: nu pagadi, mickey mouse, Tom the fisher cat, autoslalom, circus, frog

  • Brilliant complete serie of 60 BOMBIBOM inserts (from bubble gums)

  • Fantastic complete serie of 70 TURBO inserts (from first bubblle gum pictures serie in Poland with numbers 51-120)

  • Amazing complete serie of 70 TURBO inserts (continuation of bubble gum pictures with numbers 121-190)

  • Electrifying complete serie of 88 TURBO stickers (collected from bubble gums)

  • Breathtaking complete serie of 36 LOTUS stickers (collected from bubble gums)

  • Astounding complete serie of 55 Football BubbleGum cards (collected from bubble gums)

  • Outstanding complete serie of 300 stickers with fantastic EKSTRAKLASA football players

  • Thrilling album and 104 phenomenal cards / stickers from 13 different series - a compendium of knowledge about the different collections in a single album

  • Enchanting 18 different originally sealed boosters of collectible cards

 

 

  • Member of the jury - access to alpha version. Comments and constructive criticism welcomed. Influence on the final version of the game.

  • Thanks in game on special board for supporters

  • Thanks after level ending - with selected locomotive picture.

  • Thanks after collecting side prize - for chosen collection.

  • Access to beta version of the game before premiere


  • Early access to main prizes board (eg. for the first one who finishes the game)

  • Place for your sign/token/symbol around the maze in selected level

  • Design your own wall graphics(in line with game style)

  • Design your own side prize graphics(in line with game style)

  • Lets prepare ending of the game together

  • Design your own picture for game ending

 

 

  • Finish the game in unity3D webGL engine, 2D mazes

10 USD

  • Implement 3D mazes

100 USD

  • Implement 4D mazes

200 USD

  • Hire graphics designer to consult/improve graphics

1000 USD

  • Hire sound designer to consult/improve sound

1500 USD

  • Implementation of the game difficulty - adaptive algorithm

1600 USD
 

  • Above???
    There are a lot of other topics to think about

  • Licenses

???? USD

  • Modify game for tablets/smartphones android

???? USD

  • Modify game for tablets/smartphones apple

???? USD

  • 5D level for real hard-cores

???? USD

  • Any other ideas from you and members of the jury

???? USD

 


 

 

 

Johny - 6+ years, main director of graphics and sound fx
Hannah - 3+ years, second director of graphics and sound fx
Adam - 0+ years old, eats all our pictures
Agnes - mum, main malcontent, blocks any progress
Gregory - father, developer


 

 

  • www: Museum of Collections
  • mailto: kontakt@muzeumkolekcji.pl
  • facebook: Museum of Collections
  • twitter: Museum of Collections
  • exchange: My items for exchange


 

 

  • Who is MUKO?

 Hamster - custodian of the museum.
In the game Muko waits for a package with albums and locomotive stickers (real album prepared by museum in 2015)

  • Who is KUKO?

 Bad villain.
Kuko`s main target is to make Muko`s life more difficult (Kuko destroyed albums and stickers that came to Muko).

story:
UNLOCKED! NEW 110k GOAL -CHROMA BIKE TRAILS (counting Paypal, this goal is UNLOCKED)

We are at 106k now with 7 hours to go. We create TRON-like Bike trails for the Thunder Bumping Bikes that all backers receive at game launch. Change the colors or cycle them like LED gaming gear. (delivered with bikes at game launch. Can be turned on and off independent of CHROMA bike skin)

KAIJU SLAYER & MAX KAHUNAS

You can down custom design a calldown sound for your THMPR calldowns and also design a horn effect for your bike. (within guidelines and at game launch). Furthermore CHROMA effect on 60k holo wings is available only to Kaiju Slayers and Max Kahunas.

UNLOCKED! 100k goal THMPR mini-pet!

The community demanded a 100k goal and asked for at mini-THMPR pet that can run around and emote mining. This pet will come in standard THMPR skin as well as CHROMA variant. Congrats community!!! YOU DID IT! (to be provide at launch of game)

 

 

UNLOCKED! CHROMA bike skin!

Our passionate community has gotten us incredibly far! We are at 90k including Paypal direct donations. TODAY IS THE LAST DAY TO BACK. After this these stretch rewards will NEVER BE AVAILABLE AGAIN. No bikes will ever be in the game again. the chroma skins, the 60k wings, the NPC greetings, the emotes...all exclusive. THIS IS THE LAST CHANCE TO UNLOCK THESE AWARDS. Even $1 Unlocks a huge swath of rewards! See the full $1 list here: https://forums.em8er.com/threads/just-1-to-get-plenty-of-em-8er-m3-milestone-exclusive-rewards.903/

95k End of Day Goal: CHROMA Bikes

If we reach 95k by the end of day, everyone will unlock the CHROMA bike skin for the Thunder Bumpin Bike, the ONLY bike that will EVER be in the game, exclusive to ALL backers this fundraiser. This bike skin has GLOW strips where you can control and blend colors, or cycle them, just like popular LED gaming peripherals. Help us reach this goal and finish our 400%+ funding with a flourish! (bikes provided at launch of game)

 

$85,000 UNLOCKED!

Combat Music by Michael Bross!

We've blasted past our 75k stretch goal, so now it's time to announce our 85k goal! Michael Bross, Audio Director and Lead Composer for Firefall, will compose the combat music for the game and the playable mockup!

All backers will also receive (at final game), the Tiki Torch group emote. Throw down a sci-fi Tiki torch and all nearby Omniframes will dance, along with player characters. The Tiki torch will play a popular Em-8ER in-joke (as an option): a classic sea shanty modernized and sung by Grummz himself. For more in-jokes and fun, don't forget to join  us on our Discord server: https://discord.gg/A8jsTfU

Laura Post (voice of Aero) CONFIRMED

Laura Post (voice actress for Aero in Firefall) is CONFIRMED as coming to Em-8ER. For backers this round, they will get the OP-AI Omniframe voice pack featuring Laura. There will also be an NPC in the game that she will voice!

75k REACHED BIKE UNLOCKED! INVASION MOCKUP UNLOCKED!

You did it! We've reached 75k with Paypal counted. You've unlocked the one and only bike that will ever be made for Em-8ER and ONLY available to backers of this round. If you want this bike, this will be the ONLY time to get it EVER in the game. Just back for $1 (current backers already receive this unlock) and have this epic bike that will be able to hold 2 character player riders (concept still being refined so additional seat will be added).

You've also funded the invasion mockup: a non playable Unreal exe that shows what an invasion looks like. This will be used to add to our THMPR playable mockup and filmed together for our Kickstarter video.

Congratulations backers! New backers, pledge now to receive ALL the stretch goals noted here (Max and Kaiju Slayers have some exclusive stretches not available to everyone)

 

LAST WEEKEND of Funding to Go!

$50,000 Unlocked, 600 Backers unlocked!

Sunday is the last day of funding! With your help we’ve already raised enough to allow us to create:

Human Male & Female characters
Geesuit Pilot Suits
An Omniframe Gun and modular art pipeline
Tsi-Hu Shapeshifters in humanoid & beast form
Basic shooting & combat
Motion capture animations
Base concepts
Concept and Model a Kaiju giant monster

NEW THMPR vs Kaiju combat unlocked!

UNLOCKED!!!, 60k-WINGS unlocked on $60,000 stretch goal!


The wings are shown here in two sizes. We will be experimenting to see if the wings can be scaled up in flight, and scaled down for walking/running. At the very least they will be the same size as the standard omniframe wings.

How to up your pledge: If you want to upgrade your pledge, simply use the "Back This" button and pay the difference between the perks ( DO NOT CLICK ON THE NEW PERK ITSELF, that will just pay the full price. Use the "Back This" button at the top). Then e-mail grummz@crixa.io from the same e-mail address you used to back and inform us of the change. If you do not wish an additional perk, you can increase your pledge by any amount large or small via the "Back This" button.

Note that these stretch goal rewards are nearly for ALL BACKERS, even $1 unlocks all these EXCLUSIVE rewards:

  • Pin-Up "nose art" decal and "Tiki God Mask" decal.
  • CHROMA jetpack jets.
  • Get the mini-Tshi-Hu beast pet.
  • Receive the THMPR Chroma skin.
  • Founder Emote base set for their characters and Omniframes.
  • Receive the CHROMA Omniframe skin.
  • 3D files of the Kaiju that you can print.
  • 60k Holo-Wings!
  • Op-AI voice pack for Omniframes!
  • Exclusive, never seen again Motocycle mount!

UNLOCKED! $25,000 - Tsi-Hu Beasts. UNLOCKED!

Model the Tsi-Hu  in Beast Form, without animations and import it into Unreal. Reward: All backers get two decals to place on their Omniframe (at final game launch): Pin-Up "nose art" decal and "Tiki God Mask" decal.

UNLOCKED! 300 Backers - CHROMA Jets

Help spread the word and get this backed. Post screenshots, art, and videos of Em-8ER and link to our fundraiser. Reward: All backers get CHROMA jetpack jets. Control the color and other options of your Omniframe's jumpjets (final game launch).

UNLOCKED! $30,000 - ANIMATE & FIGHT THE BEAST. UNLOCKED!

Full animation and scripting of the Tsi-Hu Beast to attack in Melee mode and fight the player characters in their MEKs. Reward:  PETS! All backers get the mini-Tshi-Hu beast pet (at game launch).

UNLOCKED! 500 Backers - THMPR CHROMA skin

All backers will receive the THMPR Chroma skin. This unique skin features glow stripes on the THMPR whose color, intensity and cycling can be controlled by the backer (final game).

UNLOCKED! $35,000 - NPCS & Base Concepts

We purchase a motion capture system to be able to make more animations for things like NPCs at bases and emotes for players. We also create the first base concept art for player built bases in the game. Reward: All backers will receive Founder Emote base set for their characters and Omniframes. TBD with community input. 6 (3 human, 3 omniframe) different animations unique and exclusive to backers.

UNLOCKED! 750 Backers - Omniframe Unique AI Voicepack

Spread the word and post our art and videos and demo screenshots everywhere to get us to 750 Backers! Reward: All backers will receive a custom VOICE PACK for their Omniframe Pilot Assistant Intelligence or OP-AI. We will do our best to book Laura Post, the voice of Aero in Firefall for this pack if she is available, or another equally unique voice just for backers.

UNLOCKED! $40,000 - Model the Tsi-Hu and Fight Them

We model the humanoid Tsi-Hu and use our motion capture system to save time animating them and go straight to fighting them in-game. We will also concept and model their gun so they can pew-pew at players. Rewards:  All backers will receive the CHROMA Omniframe skin. This unique, exclusive skin has glow stripes where the players can control the intensity, color and cycling. For light/med/heavy frames.

UNLOCKED! 1000 Backers - Deepstrike Omniframe Skin

All backers will receive the Deepstrike Omniframe skin (black with red accents), which allows you to visually (cosmetic only) "teleport in" with your frame instead of having it dropped by drop-ship. (light/med/heavy frames included).

UNLOCKED! $45,000 - Model a Giant Kaiju!

Kaiju is a major theme of the game. We will concept and model a non-animated Kaiju intended to go head to head with the THMPR and similar in size. Reward: 3D files of the Kaiju so you can print and assemble one yourself for your desk!

UNLOCKED!!! 1250 Backers - Founder Flags

All backers will receive a "founder flag" that signifies you are one of the very first to back Em-8ER. These flags are attached and worn on the back of your Omniframe like a warbanner.

UNLOCKED! $50,000 - Animate & Fight a Giant Kaiju!

We take the Kaiju from the last stretch goal, animate it and script it to the fight the THMPR and players in the playable mockup!. Reward: Mini Kaiju pet in final game!

UNLOCKED!!! 1500 Backers OR $75,000 - Thunder Bumping Bikes

If you get us to 1500 backers, we will provide all backers with a unique sci-fi motorcycle for player characters (not your Omniframe) at (final game) launch. Note that this is mainly cosmetic. Most players will travel using skim mode on their Omniframe. Using a bike you will still have to incur the wait-time of calling down your MEK once you reach your destination.

UNLOCKED!!!! $60,000 - Full Playable Mockup

This is it, we fund fully and don't have to do any more milestones. We create the playable mockup THMPR encounter. Call down a THMPR mining mech and defend it from waves of attacking Tsi-Hu shapeshifting between humanoid and beast modes. Fight a giant Kaiju as it grapples with your THMPR and defeat it as the climax of the encounter. This will be our demo for our future "fund the full-time game team" fundraiser to make the final game. Reward: The goal is the reward. Play it and enjoy.

NEW - $85,000 STRETCH GOAL - COMBAT MUSIC

We will include combat music in the game AND the PLAYABLE MOCKUP composed and performed by Michael Bross, Firefall's Audio Director and Composer.

 

Here it is, our 3rd successful milestone goal on Indiegogo!

Em-8ER is a game with a fanbase!

Games take a lot of funding to create. Instead of one large goal, we divided ours into cheaper, smaller steps and deliver the latest version of our game to you along the way. Each smaller funding step entitles you to new collectable skins and perks and lets you build confidence in the progress of our unique massive planetary wargame!

Your incredible support has driven our last 2  successfully delivered IndieGoGo campaigns to well over 469-600% of our goals. We're confident you can make this one a huge success too! With our community at over 10,000 fans, we're bigger than ever and growing! 8300 on our mailing list, 4900 on our forums, 2300 in our discord chat server, and another 4700 on our change.org petition. You fans have been amazing in your support!

Don't forget to visit our website for much more detail about the game and progress so far!

Mine with MEK/A not pickaxes! Mine resources with your calldown pet mech and craft everything in the world from weapons to abilities to bases to help fight the massive war against Kaiju invaders. Mining is combat oriented, fight against waves of enemies. The longer you last, the more precious the ore!

Em-8ER - A Massive Battle Fought Online

Em-8ER is played online, in a persistent open world where players must conquer and terraform new territory and wage a huge war against an aggressive shape-shifting group of aliens and monstrous creatures. While there is nothing quite like Em-8ER, we've been influenced by games/films/anime such as:

  • Planetside 2 - Massive open world wars, but ours are PvE.
  • Firefall - Jetpacks, gliding and thumping. Fast movement.
  • Starcraft - RTS base building (We worked on this game too)
  • Pacific Rim - Kaiju! Giant monster battles!
  • Attack on Titan - Fast, agile humans with vertical combat vs giants.
  • Xenoblade Chronicles - Mecha! But ours are smaller, more like exosuits.

Em-8ER offers a a blend taken from a little bit of each of these inspirations, and more. Our experience with delivering large scale worlds like World of Warcraft and Firefall mean we are in a unique position to deliver on this vision.

Furious Mech vs Monster Combat

Pilot MEK suits called "omniframes" in fast paced gunplay and brutal melee combat. Grapple with the Tsi-Hu in their dangerous, bladed beast forms and use finisher moves to eliminate your enemies. Craft and collect multiple omniframes, load them out with your own weapons and abilities, and make your combat style truly unique. Jet up, skim the terrain, and glide over landscapes in nimble combat maneuvers.

Craft Everything, Build Bases

Mine precious resources with giant autonomous drill-mechs known as MEK/A. Use those resources to craft everything in the game from weapons and abilities, to establishing and upgrading huge military bases. Research tech trees to unlock higher tiers of crafting and join with other players to pool resources to build bigger and better fortifications and upgrades for bases

Terraform the World

Conquer new zones and terraform them by establishing bases and deploying giant atmospheric machines that churn the atmosphere and gradually alter the landscape into lush biomes. The more you terraform the world, the more unique resources and crafting tiers are unlocked. Players must all work together in a huge group effort to advance the state of the world and defend it from destructive invasion by the Tsi-Hu and their giant monsters.

Giant Kaiju Monster Battles

The Tsi-Hu enslave and use giant, tech-augmented monsters called kaiju as their siege weapons. The Tsi-Hu have blended their technology with the beasts, augmenting them to control them and equip them with advanced weapons and shield generators. These giant beasts rip through bases and can lay waste to entire zones. Players must band together to bring them down.

Immediate Rewards for New Backers!

In addition to this fundraiser's new goals of characters, weapons, and shooting mechanics, and the eventual playable mockup, ALL new backers will receive immediate rewards.

New backers will receive (at the close of this campaign), the PDF design vision book (with 20 pages of lore, game design and illustrations), as well as the downloadable first build of the game: the THMPR Art Demo made with Unreal Engine 4.

The unreal test dummy is temporary. The THMPR and landscape are original. As a eligible backer, you will be emailed a download link to this current exe art demo as soon as the campaign ends.

This 20 page, full-color, illustrated PDF describes the main vision of the game: it's lore, crafting systems, invasions and base building, and much more. It will be emailed to eligible backers as soon as the campaign ends.

 

World Class Experienced Team

If you are new to Em-8ER, welcome! My name is Mark Kern, and I create worlds with my fantastic teams. I lead the creation of World of Warcraft at Blizzard (team lead on vanilla) and also helped lead the petition with Nostalrius to bring back legacy servers on WoW. Em-8ER is the game I've always wanted to make: an online game where hundreds of players wage a persistent war in an openworld shooter against a ruthless enemy AI!

Lead by Mark Kern, Team Lead, original Vanilla WoW.

We are currently a team of 6-7 working part-time on Em-8ER's playable mockup in preparation for launching a full-time game company. We have years of experience making massive worlds and intense shooters. Some of the games we have worked on include:

Working Pilots, Geesuits in MEKs!

At the successful completion of this milestone, you will be able to climb into your omniframe MEK with your choice of male or female pilot in their sleek geesuits (pilot suits). Glide, skim and jet over 1/2 sq kilometers of terrain. Then deploy your omniframe's weapon systems. and start shooting! We'll provide plenty of static targets for you to practice on while we wait on the Tsi-Hu shape-shifting enemy milestone!

The male and female zBrush sculpts are complete, but we need to finish their textures, low-poly LODs and get them into the game with finely rendered hair. Backing the milestone will help go towards compensating the artist for what they have already done and finish the last steps.

The medium omniframe in development. Pilots sit exposed under shields. Player can equip a "hard driver" mode to place a hard shell to completely encase the pilot if desired.

Guns!

This milestone we are creating the art pipeline for our modular gun system. Everything is crafted in Em-8ER and you can choose what weapons you want to equip as loadouts on your omniframe. The milestone will feature at least one gun and basic shooting mechanics at static targets. But the art pipeline should allow a small team like our to create the looks we need to support a variety of crafting weapons.


 

The KAIJU SLAYER perk allow you to pick components from our art library to build your own custom gun, then art direct us on color and look as we create a custom skin for your unique combination.

This is the "geesuit" a survival suit worn by Gatestrider players. It allows them to withstand harsh gravity and temperatures. The FOUNDERS version will allow the founder to set the stripes to GLOW and CONTROL THE COLOR of the emissive glow and CHANGE it at any time or set it to cycle CHROMA style in fading cycling colors.

What we already have, or are about to have working:

  • 1/2 square kilometers of icy terrain
  • Spawning, patrolling, drilling and emoting THMPR mining MEK/A
  • Omniframe exosuit/MEK armor (in progress)
  • Walking, running, gliding, jetting omniframes (in progress)

What we are creating this milestone:

  • Male and Female pilot bodies, faces and hair
  • Geesuit concept art and modeling
  • Animations for player characters, run/walk, board and exit omniframe
  • Omniframe opening/closing animations for pilots
  • Concept & design modular gun system (for art pipeline)
  • Model enough parts for at least one gun
  • Animate shooting, gun FX, and sound fx
  • Provide static targets for shooting at and destroying

 

Milestones? What are those?

Em-8ER takes a unique approach to crowd-funding and building a community around the game. We recognize there is a lot of skepticism and worry about funding games on sites like IndieGoGo. We wanted to build trust, momentum and community to address that. Instead of asking for hundreds of thousands up front and never delivering until alpha or beta, we create smaller milestones instead:

Milestones are short, achievable steps and goals for the game. The community can inspect each milestone and determine if they want to see it continue by funding, or encouraging their friends to fund the next. This grows the audience and community for the game as we build trust and deliver results. So far we have successfully funded and delivered 2 milestones for Em-8ER at 460-600% of our original goals and grown to nearly 10,000 community members. It appears to be working!

This has benefits for us, the developers, too. First, we don't end up building a game where there is not enough demand or community. Second, we also avoid wandering off course or into feature creep as we have to keep very focused on these smaller goals. Finally, we get to grow an enthusiastic, excited community over time, not based on hype, but based on what they've actually played.

The ultimate goal is to have a couple of milestones to build our first playable mockup of the game. This is what devs call a "vertical slice," which is taking the core elements of gameplay and fully rendering them to see how it looks/feels. This is used to ultimately approve full development of the project. Only, in this case, it is the community instead of a publisher who will be approving our playable mockup. We will hold a large fundraiser when we complete the mockup in order to start everyone on a full-time production schedule.

Becoming a backer gives you access to this milestone, its exclusive rewards, as well as the final playable mockup. We will be focusing on the frenetic combat feel of Em-8ER. The THMPR will drop down and start mining for resources while being attacked by waves of shape-shifting Tsi-Hu. Players must defend the THMPR to extract as many resources as possible while trading fire, using abilities, and jetting and gliding around the combat area.

 

The Perks:

 

  • All backers receive the last THMPR art build (in Unreal Engine) and PDF book

  • Deepscanner and above will receive this goals build as well as the FINAL game and playable prototype (if all milestones fully funded).

  • Deepscanner and above will receive the Character Omniframe/Shooting build as well as the upcoming Omniframe art build.

  • 3D printer files let you use a 3D printer to print parts for a bust of the THMPR mining MEK/A. Assembly required, but parts can be outsourced to places like shapeways.com

  • Founder Omniframe skin is skin exclusive to this milestone. It will not be available any other milestone and will ship with the final game. This will be for each of the three frame sizes (light/med/heavy).

  • Founder THMPR emote pack will give your THMPR three extra emotes exclusive to this milestone and not found in others: /rude, /victory, and /conga. To be delivered in final game. /rude is just like the one removed from WoW and will never be removed from Em-8ER. /conga will chain THMPRs together in a conga line.

  • Name reservation and guild name reservation are new for this milestone. They will apply to final game ship.

  • Founder geesuits is also exclusive to this milestone and not available in any other milestone. Male and female variants included. Show off the fact that you were first to land on Em-8ER!

  • Deepstrike THMPR - This special skin is black with red accents and has a unique feature. Instead of dropping in by dropship, it teleports in with a unique effect. This is purely cosmetic and has no gameplay changes. It is also exclusive to this milestone and won't be offered again.

  • Custom Base Banners - These are black and white symbols that you get to design within our guidelines. They are displayed on large banners on the sides of the nexus buildings of bases you contribute to. The top 10 contributors of resources to a base have their banners displayed like a leaderboard on the sides of the nexus.

  • Gold skins - Gold skins use our PBR advanced shaders in Unreal 4 to provide a real polished look.

  • Playable Mockup and Final Game multiples - At higher tiers, these will let you provide additional copies of either the playable mockup or final game to your friends. Contingent on all milestone funding. They are not cumulative perk to perk (important!)

  • Custom Gun Skin - Our highest perk. This allows you to design a gun from the library of parts we use to assemble them, and then design a custom skin to go over the parts. You may claim this reward later, as you play the game and determine which weapon type is your favorite.

  • Any entry marked as (final game) or including a prior perk with (final game) means this is only shipped if game is fully funded and completed and is not guaranteed.

  • Final Playable mockup is also contingent on all milestone goals being funded. We anticipate another 2-3 after this current one.

 

A Special Offer for Firefall Veterans

If you played the beta or early versions of Firefall, you might be familiar with some of the invasion, resource gathering, and crafting aspects that will be featured in Em-8ER.  Since Em-8ER is, in some ways, a spiritual successor to Firefall, we are extending a future virtual store credit towards Em-8ER for eligible Firefall veterans. Find out more on our Firefall Credit Program website.

 

Why $20,000?

The money raised for this milestone will be used towards the creation of a LOT of assets and functionality this milestone:

  • Male & Female playable characters
  • Characters functioning inside and piloting Omniframes
  • Gee-suits, clothing for the characters (concept & modeling)
  • Animation of the characters
  • Weapon system concept and design. Modeling 1st gun
  • Basic Shooting mechanics (temporary targets)
  • Scripting & Coding
  • Sound and visual effects

We're raising more this round because of this, and because of features and speed. We want to be able to devote more hours and more team members to build a faster momentum behind game builds and deliverables. We also want to properly budget for animation, which we missed last milestone.

Finally, $20,000 is a good litmus test for us. Making an indie game of this scope, and targeting near AAA production values needs good funding. It's better that we ask now and see if there is a market for our idea. Using milestone based funding means we ensure there is enough demand before we go to bigger, riskier steps of development. We prefer this to asking for a lump-sum of hundreds of thousands up-front and then realizing too late that there is not enough demand later on to justify development. So far, our method has been popular and demand is 5x-10x what it was from our last milestone. So things look very promising.

Fixed Funding, All or Nothing

Since we are asking for more, we've moved to a fixed funding mode for this milestone. Either we raise our goal of $20,000, or we find out there is not enough demand and stop here having delivered successfully on our last two milestones. No backers will be changed for this milestone if it does not fund. Since we raised $23,000 on our last milestone, and our community is 5-10x the size we feel confident this is a realistic goal.

Risks & Challenges

Over our past 2 successful fundraisers, we've grown more confident about addressing the challenges we identified in the past:

  • Market Interest: There may not be enough interest to complete all the funding steps necessary for the playable mockup. However, we've had 2 successfully delivered fundraisers that reached 469-600% of our goals and have also grown the community to over 10,000 people. We feel there is good interest here.
  • Technology:  There is a risk that the game engine cannot reach the goals we are striving for. Since then we have made our first prototype in Unreal Engine 4, and also made a internal prototype server with the help of one of Nostalrius' (legacy wow server) server programmers help. We feel more certain about accomplishing our multiplayer goals and our terraforming terrain goals in a large open world.
  • Unforeseen Risks. The path to making a game is always fraught with risk. We've mitigated this by breaking the project down into separate fundraisers on a milestone basis. You can see where the project is going step by step. This new approach to fundraising helps mitigate risk and build confidence. So far, it's working!

There is so much more written about Em-8ER! We have tons of design vision and more in PDF book that backers will receive. In the  meantime, browse our extensive FAQ on our forums!

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute today, you can always join us at a future milestone. Another way that anyone can help is by joining our community and helping to spread the word of our new game:

  • Forums - Join our active forums to talk about the game.
  • Discord - Join our popular and very active Discord chat server.
  • Signup - Visit our website and sign up to our mailing list.

And please be sure to share this link on your social media accounts, forums, and other places you visit online. Help us make Em-8ER an even bigger success!

Model the Tsi-Hu  in Beast Form, without animations and import it into Unreal. Reward: All backers get two decals to place on their Omniframe (at final game launch): Pin-Up "nose art" decal and "Tiki God Mask" decal.
UNLOCKED! 300 Backers - CHROMA Jets
Help spread the word and get this backed. Post screenshots, art, and videos of Em-8ER and link to our fundraiser. Reward: All backers get CHROMA jetpack jets. Control the color and other options of your Omniframe's jumpjets (final game launch). 
UNLOCKED! $30,000 - ANIMATE & FIGHT THE BEAST. UNLOCKED!
Full animation and scripting of the Tsi-Hu Beast to attack in Melee mode and fight the player characters in their MEKs. Reward:  PETS! All backers get the mini-Tshi-Hu beast pet (at game launch). 
UNLOCKED! 500 Backers - THMPR CHROMA skin
All backers will receive the THMPR Chroma skin. This unique skin features glow stripes on the THMPR whose color, intensity and cycling can be controlled by the backer (final game).
UNLOCKED! $35,000 - NPCS & Base Concepts
We purchase a motion capture system to be able to make more animations for things like NPCs at bases and emotes for players. We also create the first base concept art for player built bases in the game. Reward: All backers will receive Founder Emote base set for their characters and Omniframes. TBD with community input. 6 (3 human, 3 omniframe) different animations unique and exclusive to backers.
UNLOCKED! 750 Backers - Omniframe Unique AI Voicepack 
Spread the word and post our art and videos and demo screenshots everywhere to get us to 750 Backers! Reward: All backers will receive a custom VOICE PACK for their Omniframe Pilot Assistant Intelligence or OP-AI. We will do our best to book Laura Post, the voice of Aero in Firefall for this pack if she is available, or another equally unique voice just for backers.
UNLOCKED! $40,000 - Model the Tsi-Hu and Fight Them
We model the humanoid Tsi-Hu and use our motion capture system to save time animating them and go straight to fighting them in-game. We will also concept and model their gun so they can pew-pew at players. Rewards:  All backers will receive the CHROMA Omniframe skin. This unique, exclusive skin has glow stripes where the players can control the intensity, color and cycling. For light/med/heavy frames.
UNLOCKED! 1000 Backers - Deepstrike Omniframe Skin 
All backers will receive the Deepstrike Omniframe skin (black with red accents), which allows you to visually (cosmetic only) "teleport in" with your frame instead of having it dropped by drop-ship. (light/med/heavy frames included).
UNLOCKED! $45,000 - Model a Giant Kaiju!
Kaiju is a major theme of the game. We will concept and model a non-animated Kaiju intended to go head to head with the THMPR and similar in size. Reward: 3D files of the Kaiju so you can print and assemble one yourself for your desk!
UNLOCKED!!! 1250 Backers - Founder Flags 
All backers will receive a "founder flag" that signifies you are one of the very first to back Em-8ER. These flags are attached and worn on the back of your Omniframe like a warbanner.
UNLOCKED! $50,000 - Animate & Fight a Giant Kaiju!
We take the Kaiju from the last stretch goal, animate it and script it to the fight the THMPR and players in the playable mockup!. Reward: Mini Kaiju pet in final game! 
UNLOCKED!!! 1500 Backers OR $75,000 - Thunder Bumping Bikes
If you get us to 1500 backers, we will provide all backers with a unique sci-fi motorcycle for player characters (not your Omniframe) at (final game) launch. Note that this is mainly cosmetic. Most players will travel using skim mode on their Omniframe. Using a bike you will still have to incur the wait-time of calling down your MEK once you reach your destination.
UNLOCKED!!!! $60,000 - Full Playable Mockup
This is it, we fund fully and don't have to do any more milestones. We create the playable mockup THMPR encounter. Call down a THMPR mining mech and defend it from waves of attacking Tsi-Hu shapeshifting between humanoid and beast modes. Fight a giant Kaiju as it grapples with your THMPR and defeat it as the climax of the encounter. This will be our demo for our future "fund the full-time game team" fundraiser to make the final game. Reward: The goal is the reward. Play it and enjoy.
NEW - $85,000 STRETCH GOAL - COMBAT MUSIC
We will include combat music in the game AND the PLAYABLE MOCKUP composed and performed by Michael Bross, Firefall's Audio Director and Composer.
 
Here it is, our 3rd successful milestone goal on Indiegogo!
Em-8ER is a game with a fanbase!

Games take a lot of funding to create. Instead of one large goal, we divided ours into cheaper, smaller steps and deliver the latest version of our game to you along the way. Each smaller funding step entitles you to new collectable skins and perks and lets you build confidence in the progress of our unique massive planetary wargame!
Your incredible support has driven our last 2  successfully delivered IndieGoGo campaigns to well over 469-600% of our goals. We're confident you can make this one a huge success too! With our community at over 10,000 fans, we're bigger than ever and growing! 8300 on our mailing list, 4900 on our forums, 2300 in our discord chat server, and another 4700 on our change.org petition. You fans have been amazing in your support!
Don't forget to visit our website for much more detail about the game and progress so far!
Mine with MEK/A not pickaxes! Mine resources with your calldown pet mech and craft everything in the world from weapons to abilities to bases to help fight the massive war against Kaiju invaders. Mining is combat oriented, fight against waves of enemies. The longer you last, the more precious the ore!
Em-8ER - A Massive Battle Fought Online

Em-8ER is played online, in a persistent open world where players must conquer and terraform new territory and wage a huge war against an aggressive shape-shifting group of aliens and monstrous creatures. While there is nothing quite like Em-8ER, we've been influenced by games/films/anime such as:


Planetside 2 - Massive open world wars, but ours are PvE.

Firefall - Jetpacks, gliding and thumping. Fast movement.

Starcraft - RTS base building (We worked on this game too)

Pacific Rim - Kaiju! Giant monster battles!

Attack on Titan - Fast, agile humans with vertical combat vs giants.

Xenoblade Chronicles - Mecha! But ours are smaller, more like exosuits.

Em-8ER offers a a blend taken from a little bit of each of these inspirations, and more. Our experience with delivering large scale worlds like World of Warcraft and Firefall mean we are in a unique position to deliver on this vision.
Furious Mech vs Monster Combat

Pilot MEK suits called "omniframes" in fast paced gunplay and brutal melee combat. Grapple with the Tsi-Hu in their dangerous, bladed beast forms and use finisher moves to eliminate your enemies. Craft and collect multiple omniframes, load them out with your own weapons and abilities, and make your combat style truly unique. Jet up, skim the terrain, and glide over landscapes in nimble combat maneuvers.
Craft Everything, Build Bases

Mine precious resources with giant autonomous drill-mechs known as MEK/A. Use those resources to craft everything in the game from weapons and abilities, to establishing and upgrading huge military bases. Research tech trees to unlock higher tiers of crafting and join with other players to pool resources to build bigger and better fortifications and upgrades for bases
Terraform the World

Conquer new zones and terraform them by establishing bases and deploying giant atmospheric machines that churn the atmosphere and gradually alter the landscape into lush biomes. The more you terraform the world, the more unique resources and crafting tiers are unlocked. Players must all work together in a huge group effort to advance the state of the world and defend it from destructive invasion by the Tsi-Hu and their giant monsters.
Giant Kaiju Monster Battles

The Tsi-Hu enslave and use giant, tech-augmented monsters called kaiju as their siege weapons. The Tsi-Hu have blended their technology with the beasts, augmenting them to control them and equip them with advanced weapons and shield generators. These giant beasts rip through bases and can lay waste to entire zones. Players must band together to bring them down.
Immediate Rewards for New Backers!
In addition to this fundraiser's new goals of characters, weapons, and shooting mechanics, and the eventual playable mockup, ALL new backers will receive immediate rewards.
New backers will receive (at the close of this campaign), the PDF design vision book (with 20 pages of lore, game design and illustrations), as well as the downloadable first build of the game: the THMPR Art Demo made with Unreal Engine 4.

The unreal test dummy is temporary. The THMPR and landscape are original. As a eligible backer, you will be emailed a download link to this current exe art demo as soon as the campaign ends.

This 20 page, full-color, illustrated PDF describes the main vision of the game: it's lore, crafting systems, invasions and base building, and much more. It will be emailed to eligible backers as soon as the campaign ends.
 
World Class Experienced Team
If you are new to Em-8ER, welcome! My name is Mark Kern, and I create worlds with my fantastic teams. I lead the creation of World of Warcraft at Blizzard (team lead on vanilla) and also helped lead the petition with Nostalrius to bring back legacy servers on WoW. Em-8ER is the game I've always wanted to make: an online game where hundreds of players wage a persistent war in an openworld shooter against a ruthless enemy AI!

Lead by Mark Kern, Team Lead, original Vanilla WoW.
We are currently a team of 6-7 working part-time on Em-8ER's playable mockup in preparation for launching a full-time game company. We have years of experience making massive worlds and intense shooters. Some of the games we have worked on include:


Working Pilots, Geesuits in MEKs!
At the successful completion of this milestone, you will be able to climb into your omniframe MEK with your choice of male or female pilot in their sleek geesuits (pilot suits). Glide, skim and jet over 1/2 sq kilometers of terrain. Then deploy your omniframe's weapon systems. and start shooting! We'll provide plenty of static targets for you to practice on while we wait on the Tsi-Hu shape-shifting enemy milestone!


The male and female zBrush sculpts are complete, but we need to finish their textures, low-poly LODs and get them into the game with finely rendered hair. Backing the milestone will help go towards compensating the artist for what they have already done and finish the last steps.

The medium omniframe in development. Pilots sit exposed under shields. Player can equip a "hard driver" mode to place a hard shell to completely encase the pilot if desired.
Guns!
This milestone we are creating the art pipeline for our modular gun system. Everything is crafted in Em-8ER and you can choose what weapons you want to equip as loadouts on your omniframe. The milestone will feature at least one gun and basic shooting mechanics at static targets. But the art pipeline should allow a small team like our to create the looks we need to support a variety of crafting weapons.
 

The KAIJU SLAYER perk allow you to pick components from our art library to build your own custom gun, then art direct us on color and look as we create a custom skin for your unique combination.

This is the "geesuit" a survival suit worn by Gatestrider players. It allows them to withstand harsh gravity and temperatures. The FOUNDERS version will allow the founder to set the stripes to GLOW and CONTROL THE COLOR of the emissive glow and CHANGE it at any time or set it to cycle CHROMA style in fading cycling colors.
What we already have, or are about to have working:

1/2 square kilometers of icy terrain
Spawning, patrolling, drilling and emoting THMPR mining MEK/A
Omniframe exosuit/MEK armor (in progress)
Walking, running, gliding, jetting omniframes (in progress)

What we are creating this milestone:

Male and Female pilot bodies, faces and hair
Geesuit concept art and modeling
Animations for player characters, run/walk, board and exit omniframe
Omniframe opening/closing animations for pilots
Concept & design modular gun system (for art pipeline)
Model enough parts for at least one gun
Animate shooting, gun FX, and sound fx
Provide static targets for shooting at and destroying

 
Milestones? What are those?
Em-8ER takes a unique approach to crowd-funding and building a community around the game. We recognize there is a lot of skepticism and worry about funding games on sites like IndieGoGo. We wanted to build trust, momentum and community to address that. Instead of asking for hundreds of thousands up front and never delivering until alpha or beta, we create smaller milestones instead:

Milestones are short, achievable steps and goals for the game. The community can inspect each milestone and determine if they want to see it continue by funding, or encouraging their friends to fund the next. This grows the audience and community for the game as we build trust and deliver results. So far we have successfully funded and delivered 2 milestones for Em-8ER at 460-600% of our original goals and grown to nearly 10,000 community members. It appears to be working!
This has benefits for us, the developers, too. First, we don't end up building a game where there is not enough demand or community. Second, we also avoid wandering off course or into feature creep as we have to keep very focused on these smaller goals. Finally, we get to grow an enthusiastic, excited community over time, not based on hype, but based on what they've actually played.
The ultimate goal is to have a couple of milestones to build our first playable mockup of the game. This is what devs call a "vertical slice," which is taking the core elements of gameplay and fully rendering them to see how it looks/feels. This is used to ultimately approve full development of the project. Only, in this case, it is the community instead of a publisher who will be approving our playable mockup. We will hold a large fundraiser when we complete the mockup in order to start everyone on a full-time production schedule.
Becoming a backer gives you access to this milestone, its exclusive rewards, as well as the final playable mockup. We will be focusing on the frenetic combat feel of Em-8ER. The THMPR will drop down and start mining for resources while being attacked by waves of shape-shifting Tsi-Hu. Players must defend the THMPR to extract as many resources as possible while trading fire, using abilities, and jetting and gliding around the combat area.
 
The Perks:


 

All backers receive the last THMPR art build (in Unreal Engine) and PDF book
Deepscanner and above will receive this goals build as well as the FINAL game and playable prototype (if all milestones fully funded).
Deepscanner and above will receive the Character Omniframe/Shooting build as well as the upcoming Omniframe art build.
3D printer files let you use a 3D printer to print parts for a bust of the THMPR mining MEK/A. Assembly required, but parts can be outsourced to places like shapeways.com
Founder Omniframe skin is skin exclusive to this milestone. It will not be available any other milestone and will ship with the final game. This will be for each of the three frame sizes (light/med/heavy).
Founder THMPR emote pack will give your THMPR three extra emotes exclusive to this milestone and not found in others: /rude, /victory, and /conga. To be delivered in final game. /rude is just like the one removed from WoW and will never be removed from Em-8ER. /conga will chain THMPRs together in a conga line.
Name reservation and guild name reservation are new for this milestone. They will apply to final game ship.
Founder geesuits is also exclusive to this milestone and not available in any other milestone. Male and female variants included. Show off the fact that you were first to land on Em-8ER!
Deepstrike THMPR - This special skin is black with red accents and has a unique feature. Instead of dropping in by dropship, it teleports in with a unique effect. This is purely cosmetic and has no gameplay changes. It is also exclusive to this milestone and won't be offered again.
Custom Base Banners - These are black and white symbols that you get to design within our guidelines. They are displayed on large banners on the sides of the nexus buildings of bases you contribute to. The top 10 contributors of resources to a base have their banners displayed like a leaderboard on the sides of the nexus.
Gold skins - Gold skins use our PBR advanced shaders in Unreal 4 to provide a real polished look.
Playable Mockup and Final Game multiples - At higher tiers, these will let you provide additional copies of either the playable mockup or final game to your friends. Contingent on all milestone funding. They are not cumulative perk to perk (important!)
Custom Gun Skin - Our highest perk. This allows you to design a gun from the library of parts we use to assemble them, and then design a custom skin to go over the parts. You may claim this reward later, as you play the game and determine which weapon type is your favorite.
Any entry marked as (final game) or including a prior perk with (final game) means this is only shipped if game is fully funded and completed and is not guaranteed.
Final Playable mockup is also contingent on all milestone goals being funded. We anticipate another 2-3 after this current one.

 
A Special Offer for Firefall Veterans
If you played the beta or early versions of Firefall, you might be familiar with some of the invasion, resource gathering, and crafting aspects that will be featured in Em-8ER.  Since Em-8ER is, in some ways, a spiritual successor to Firefall, we are extending a future virtual store credit towards Em-8ER for eligible Firefall veterans. Find out more on our Firefall Credit Program website. Why $20,000?
The money raised for this milestone will be used towards the creation of a LOT of assets and functionality this milestone:

Male & Female playable characters
Characters functioning inside and piloting Omniframes
Gee-suits, clothing for the characters (concept & modeling)
Animation of the characters
Weapon system concept and design. Modeling 1st gun
Basic Shooting mechanics (temporary targets)
Scripting & Coding
Sound and visual effects

We're raising more this round because of this, and because of features and speed. We want to be able to devote more hours and more team members to build a faster momentum behind game builds and deliverables. We also want to properly budget for animation, which we missed last milestone.
Finally, $20,000 is a good litmus test for us. Making an indie game of this scope, and targeting near AAA production values needs good funding. It's better that we ask now and see if there is a market for our idea. Using milestone based funding means we ensure there is enough demand before we go to bigger, riskier steps of development. We prefer this to asking for a lump-sum of hundreds of thousands up-front and then realizing too late that there is not enough demand later on to justify development. So far, our method has been popular and demand is 5x-10x what it was from our last milestone. So things look very promising.
Fixed Funding, All or Nothing
Since we are asking for more, we've moved to a fixed funding mode for this milestone. Either we raise our goal of $20,000, or we find out there is not enough demand and stop here having delivered successfully on our last two milestones. No backers will be changed for this milestone if it does not fund. Since we raised $23,000 on our last milestone, and our community is 5-10x the size we feel confident this is a realistic goal.

Risks & Challenges
Over our past 2 successful fundraisers, we've grown more confident about addressing the challenges we identified in the past:


Market Interest: There may not be enough interest to complete all the funding steps necessary for the playable mockup. However, we've had 2 successfully delivered fundraisers that reached 469-600% of our goals and have also grown the community to over 10,000 people. We feel there is good interest here.

Technology:  There is a risk that the game engine cannot reach the goals we are striving for. Since then we have made our first prototype in Unreal Engine 4, and also made a internal prototype server with the help of one of Nostalrius' (legacy wow server) server programmers help. We feel more certain about accomplishing our multiplayer goals and our terraforming terrain goals in a large open world.

Unforeseen Risks. The path to making a game is always fraught with risk. We've mitigated this by breaking the project down into separate fundraisers on a milestone basis. You can see where the project is going step by step. This new approach to fundraising helps mitigate risk and build confidence. So far, it's working!


There is so much more written about Em-8ER! We have tons of design vision and more in PDF book that backers will receive. In the  meantime, browse our extensive FAQ on our forums!

Other Ways You Can Help
Even if you can't contribute today, you can always join us at a future milestone. Another way that anyone can help is by joining our community and helping to spread the word of our new game:


Forums - Join our active forums to talk about the game.

Discord - Join our popular and very active Discord chat server.


Signup - Visit our website and sign up to our mailing list.

And please be sure to share this link on your social media accounts, forums, and other places you visit online. Help us make Em-8ER an even bigger success!

story:
The Firestorm

As a result of an ambitious mage's experiment - who wanted to be a god - a firestorm scorched the world. Only few survivors reached the peninsula, that was  untouched by the apocalypse. You are one of these survivors, and are about to start to exploring the remains of your world.

The Firestorm is a game, that runs on most android devices. The world is an explorable area, full of monsters (with craftable parts), adventures (with dungeons) and with other characters (adventurers, masters, villains). Game languages are english and magyar (hungarian).

The game's developer isn't the Beholder kft, this game is an independent startup. Licensing of Beholder's "Tulelok Foldje" is in progress.

We are looking for supporters who are interested in playing a brand new style of role-playing, or love survivor games, and every fantasy fan.

Join our facebook community for updates: https://www.facebook.com/The.Firestorm.Survivors.Land/


Packages:

FREE - join our facebook page. Every like and invite helps. -> https://www.facebook.com/The.Firestorm.Survivors.Land/

$1 - Support: Looks interesting, I support your game.

$5 - Survivor: I wanna play with your game, and i want a starter pack

$5 - Patron: I'm one of the patron the game. My name listing in credits (alphabetically).

$10 - Explorer: Love your idea, i want a starter pack, and a digital wallpaper pack

$10 - Secret Map - The map for the first quests.

$15 - Legendary Adventurer: I want name an (non-player) adventurer character in the game. Players can trade (and other) with andventurers.

$20 - Legendary Villain: I want name a (non-player) villain character in the game. Players can fight (and other) with villains.

$25 - Legendary Master: I want name a (non-player) master character in the game. Masters give quest to adventurers.

$30 - Legendary Place: I want name an place/building in the game. Players can enter to buildings or interact with places.

$40 - Epic character: I want my digital copy in the game, with my face.

$1000 - God: I want to be one of a fallen/ancient god/deity in the game. Appearing on statues, walls.


Sample artwork from the game

Milestones

$100+: 25+ monsters, with unique monster parts + ANIMATED BACKGROUND

$150+: 25+ craftable weapons and items

$200+: 50+ monsters + INTRO VIDEO

$250+: 50+ craftable weapons and items

$300+: 100+ monsters

$350+: 100+ craftable weapons and items

$400+: 200+ monsters

$450+: 200+ craftable weapons and items

$500: wizardry + spellcasting

$600: deities and religions with divine spells

$700: more bigger world to explore

Follow us on facebook! https://www.facebook.com/The.Firestorm.Survivors.Land/
