story:
Have you ever wanted to be a Pro Gamer?  Our goal is to provide you the opportunity! We are creating the worlds first FPS that will allow you to play for real money! Imagine running around a map with your friends, fighting in a free -for- all style of gameplay.  Every time you kill an opponent,  you can pick up their gear and weapons, then take them back to our microtransaction store and sell them for actual cash! 

Rising Games is a brand new start up game development company looking to make our first big impact on the gaming world. Up to this point, we have been focusing on mobile game development with great success.  We now want to take our knowledge and experience in game development to the next level!  To do this, we need to expand  our staff and their capabilities to bring our absolute best to the table from the beginning. 

The Game

The game we are looking to put together will be a first person shooter (FPS).  It will consist of around Three, 12 v 12 maps.
When you log on to the game,  you will have the option of going to our armoury (the store) and selecting the following:   packs of weapons, grenades, combat knives, and an assortment of upgrades for your weapons.
We want to cover every single category of weapons that players would expect, with at least ten unique guns per category as well as  custom skins for your weapons and characters.
First, the  player will purchase a number of loadout packs.  The player will  then move back to the main menu, then select multiplayers.   At this point, the player will move to a pre-game screen showing your map and other important information. After spawning on the map,  the player will then kill absolutely every other player on the map in a free- for- all style of gameplay.
 When the player  kills another player,  he will drop one of the loadout packs that he purchased from the store.  The loadout pack then moves to the player backpack. You will only be able to carry ten loadouts in your backpack at a time.  After the backpack is full, the player then  leaves the game to return to the store.  The player is then able to sell the loadout packs back to us for their real world value.  The player has the capability to go again and again, as there will be no limit to the amount of money you can earn.  The challenge is, is the player good enough to Scavenge it?

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking to raise $400,000.00 to expand our premises, hire more developers and work on marketing our game. We also are looking to contract out the musical score as well as some other features of the game.  As of now, we do not have a full staff to meet our goal.    
The above included youtube video is just a example of the quality of work that we can do with a bare minimum team.   Imagine what we can do with a staff three times as large!
Everyone always wants to get the best bang for their buck when contributing to these types of campaigns.  That said, we have put together a  great series of perks as added encouragement to help us get our game off the ground! 
The perks start with something as simple as being able to reserve your username and going all the way to never having to pay a subscription fee for the life of your account.   Imagine logging on and being paid to play a game with almost no cost to yourself except a moderate investment in a Indiegogo campaign!


The Impact

This will be the worlds first game of this type! No plot, no story, just a fast paced FPS where the only reason you're playing is to earn as much money as possible, as fast as you can. All contributions to this campaign will go to developing this game to the high quality of standards that modern gamers have come to expect.

Our goal is the game will function with graphics comparable to Planetside 2. Producing a game of quality takes time and effort.  Rising Games goal is to  launch our game a full year after funding goals are achieved, In the interim,  we will not leave our valued contributors in the dark. We will launch a website with a full game development blog with weekly updates to keep you informed of our progress and build a following for the game before it launches.

Risks & Challenges

There is always the possibility that we will not reach our funding goals.  Our commitment to you, the contributor, is our pledge to continue to develop our game regardless. If funding goals cannot be achieved,  every contributor will still receive the perks promised, The time table of our game will just be moved out to a later date as needed.
We will also be launching additional  crowdfunding campaigns periodically.  Our team is dedicated and determined.  We want every opportunity to increase the possibility that we will receive the necessary funding to bring our dream to life.  If you have ever wanted to be a Pro Gamer, our product will meet your highest expectations and continue to challenge you.  

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to help fund our game at this time that is OK! We would love to have your support on Facebook and Twitter. Share the word about our company and help us build a following!   With your support,  we can still achieve our dreams of bringing the best game possible to the table for gamers of all types to play.  The more support we can generate the better chance that our game will be produced. Rising Games will join the long list of industry giants who love doing nothing more than playing games with friends and giving the world a great gaming experience!
story_txt:
Have you ever wanted to be a Pro Gamer?  Our goal is to provide you the opportunity! We are creating the worlds first FPS that will allow you to play for real money! Imagine running around a map with your friends, fighting in a free -for- all style of gameplay.  Every time you kill an opponent,  you can pick up their gear and weapons, then take them back to our microtransaction store and sell them for actual cash! 

Rising Games is a brand new start up game development company looking to make our first big impact on the gaming world. Up to this point, we have been focusing on mobile game development with great success.  We now want to take our knowledge and experience in game development to the next level!  To do this, we need to expand  our staff and their capabilities to bring our absolute best to the table from the beginning. 

The Game
The game we are looking to put together will be a first person shooter (FPS).  It will consist of around Three, 12 v 12 maps.
When you log on to the game,  you will have the option of going to our armoury (the store) and selecting the following:   packs of weapons, grenades, combat knives, and an assortment of upgrades for your weapons.
We want to cover every single category of weapons that players would expect, with at least ten unique guns per category as well as  custom skins for your weapons and characters.
First, the  player will purchase a number of loadout packs.  The player will  then move back to the main menu, then select multiplayers.   At this point, the player will move to a pre-game screen showing your map and other important information. After spawning on the map,  the player will then kill absolutely every other player on the map in a free- for- all style of gameplay.
 When the player  kills another player,  he will drop one of the loadout packs that he purchased from the store.  The loadout pack then moves to the player backpack. You will only be able to carry ten loadouts in your backpack at a time.  After the backpack is full, the player then  leaves the game to return to the store.  The player is then able to sell the loadout packs back to us for their real world value.  The player has the capability to go again and again, as there will be no limit to the amount of money you can earn.  The challenge is, is the player good enough to Scavenge it?
   What We Need & What You Get

We are looking to raise $400,000.00 to expand our premises, hire more developers and work on marketing our game. We also are looking to contract out the musical score as well as some other features of the game.  As of now, we do not have a full staff to meet our goal.    The above included youtube video is just a example of the quality of work that we can do with a bare minimum team.   Imagine what we can do with a staff three times as large!  Everyone always wants to get the best bang for their buck when contributing to these types of campaigns.  That said, we have put together a  great series of perks as added encouragement to help us get our game off the ground! The perks start with something as simple as being able to reserve your username and going all the way to never having to pay a subscription fee for the life of your account.   Imagine logging on and being paid to play a game with almost no cost to yourself except a moderate investment in a Indiegogo campaign!  The Impact This will be the worlds first game of this type! No plot, no story, just a fast paced FPS where the only reason you're playing is to earn as much money as possible, as fast as you can. All contributions to this campaign will go to developing this game to the high quality of standards that modern gamers have come to expect.
  Our goal is the game will function with graphics comparable to Planetside 2. Producing a game of quality takes time and effort.  Rising Games goal is to  launch our game a full year after funding goals are achieved, In the interim,  we will not leave our valued contributors in the dark. We will launch a website with a full game development blog with weekly updates to keep you informed of our progress and build a following for the game before it launches.  Risks & ChallengesThere is always the possibility that we will not reach our funding goals.  Our commitment to you, the contributor, is our pledge to continue to develop our game regardless. If funding goals cannot be achieved,  every contributor will still receive the perks promised, The time table of our game will just be moved out to a later date as needed.  We will also be launching additional  crowdfunding campaigns periodically.  Our team is dedicated and determined.  We want every opportunity to increase the possibility that we will receive the necessary funding to bring our dream to life.  If you have ever wanted to be a Pro Gamer, our product will meet your highest expectations and continue to challenge you.    Other Ways You Can Help If you are not able to help fund our game at this time that is OK! We would love to have your support on Facebook and Twitter. Share the word about our company and help us build a following!   With your support,  we can still achieve our dreams of bringing the best game possible to the table for gamers of all types to play.  The more support we can generate the better chance that our game will be produced. Rising Games will join the long list of industry giants who love doing nothing more than playing games with friends and giving the world a great gaming experience!

story:
Evolution of Maximum Fantasy Sports ("MFS")

My name is Bill Parsons and I have been playing fantasy sports since I was a kid using baseball cards, dice and See-Action Football projection slides. After leaving my parent’s house and beginning my adulthood, that youthful exuberance for fantasy sports followed me and I began running my own fantasy leagues on notepads. The birth of the internet made this much easier, but the companies operating the fantasy sites did not offer the vast features that I incorporated into my fantasy leagues. Instead of dumbing my games down, I joined forces with friends and built Maximum Fantasy Sports (“MFS”). We built the site for the devout fantasy football players with features that no other site offered. The majors, Yahoo, ESPN and CBS, have since incorporated a few of our unique features, but we still have many more that they are not willing to attempt to incorporate into their offerings.

No other site offers the full suite of fantasy fantasy football leagues and pools that MFS does. The hottest games in the fantasy universe right now are the Daily and Weekly fantasy football contests, hosted by such companies as FanDuel and DraftKings, but they do not offer pools or any full-season fantasy leagues. The other majors mentioned previously do not offer Daily and Weekly contests. We are the only site that offers all products that a fantasy player would want. Our problem is that we do not have the budget that the other companies have and have earmarked the majority of our budget each year to development and testing. 


How To Put MFS On The Map

We are happy with the products that we offer and need to spread the word about who we are and what we offer. The majority of fantasy football players do not just play one game. Many of them with have a full-season fantasy league and augment their experience with football pools and now many are turning to the short-term contests as well. If we can position MFS in front of them, they will see that they can get all of their needs in one location. There is no longer a reason to have leagues spread across two or three websites. We are out of budget and need your help to spread the word about MFS!

Unfortunately, “Field Of Dreams” is just a movie. We built it, but they won’t come unless they know about it! We need the means and assistance to spread the word. We plan on quick advertising hits for the remainder of this season such as Google Adwords and banner advertising across various NFL sports forums and NFL-related sports sites. This is the quickest way to get the word out that we are familiar with. We would like to build immediate interest to help fuel the current fire and bring in additional revenue to help with wider advertising approaches to really get us into the public's eye for 2015.

Investors will receive free leagues, free entries in Daily and/or Weekly contests, some MFS swag and, for investors looking to advertise, we can add your advertising to various pages on the website and/or incorporated into the various email communication that we send out throughout the week. MFS is a live site with hundreds of active leagues and about 15,000 active users participating in these leagues.

The Industry

An estimated 41 million people will play some sort of fantasy sports in the U.S. and Canada this year, up from 32 million in 2012, according to the FSTA (Fantasy Sports Trade Association}, with nearly 37 million people playing fantasy football this year.

Participation in all fantasy sports has grown by more than 60 percent the last four years with 19 percent of all males in the U.S. playing fantasy sports. According to the FSTA, around $1.6 billion is spent across all fantasy sports on items like apps and access to pro sports packages for fantasy player tracking. Another $1.7 billion is spent on entry fees to fantasy leagues at an average of $70 to $100 per person. 

Daily/Weekly Fantasy Football is the largest growth segment in the industry. In terms of the market size, D/W is still a relatively small industry. However, the growth trajectory has been astounding and estimates suggest player spending (i.e. total entry fees) on D/W sites will likely exceed the total amount wagered annually on sports in Las Vegas by CY15 and all of Nevada by CY16. 


Differentiating Attributes

For fantasy football leagues, a few of the configuration options that set us apart are listed below. You can see the full set on our Features page. Additionally, we have developed a social network that is geared to a sports-centric infrastructure, but that is for a different focus.

· In-game player changes. No other company offers the option of swapping players in and out of starting roster positions at the end of quarters or halves. With an increasing number of customers connected to the internet on a constant basis, this feature needs to be advertised to the fantasy football community. It is a major selling point to fantasy football aficionados.

· Bye Week Rollover. No other company offers the option of being able to elect to roll over a player’s performance for the week prior to his Bye Week. This feature needs to be advertised to the fantasy football community. It is a major selling point to fantasy football aficionados.

· League Average. MFS allows configuration of a common opponent for all teams called the League Average. This opponent has no team but receives a score for the week which is the average of all league teams’ score. So, a team will play two games per week; one against a head-to-head opponent and one against the League Average opponent. This feature is very rare and not offered by any of the majors.


Take A Test Drive

Head over to maximumfantasysports.com and click on Demo Leagues or log in with the following information to see a few in-season and completed leagues.

Member ID: DemoUser
Password:    password  (all lowercase)


Other Ways You Can Help

Cash is a key component to helping us spread the word of MFS, but there are other ways to contribute without providing funds. We gladly accept any pointers from those with experience in online advertising, especially when it comes to stretching a limited budget.

You can also help by getting the word out about our campaign to your friends, colleagues and interested parties via the various social media platforms. If everyone is able to share this campaign using the connection tools at the top of the page, the extra exposure with benefit us in many ways.

story:
“Who honestly likes the current recruitment process?" Let’s tackle current job application problems together by bringing about a revolutionary change - by playing a Video Game!

Problem: 

These are the first thoughts that come to people's minds after leaving the job application process. 

Do tests like this really engage you as a candidate...?

                              

 

We are Owiwi, and we have a solution. We want to shape the future of recruitment,

So it looks a bit more like this...

                    


What is Owiwi?

The Company: Owiwi is an HR serious gaming development company shaping the future of talent recruitment with video games.

The Game: A technologically advanced game that can showcase your personality, traits and soft skills to your future employers. We want to sell our software to large MNCs, SMEs, Universities and Startups in order to improve their recruitment processes (which will help you get the role that you’ve wanted for so long).

Why we do it: Like you, we have been left frustrated or disappointed when applying for jobs. Like you, we have been discarded by companies before they’ve even had the chance to get to know us properly.

We want to find out who you really are.


How does it work?

Once the game begins, users are tasked with creating an avatar and embarking on a fictional journey. In the game, you will make a number of decisions to progress through the story with your avatar. 

                            

Each decision changes the very plot of the game for a truly personalised and immersive assessment experience. 

We have teamed up with psychologists to create an algorithm that can track these decisions and measure your soft skills (leadership, teamwork etc.). This gives you the ability to show who you really are in a stress free, fun and fair environment.


What are the benefits to you?

We are giving you the opportunity to prove to companies that you are the right person for that job position.


How can you help?

We need 2,000 GBP to finish the development of our demo for a single soft skill (Teamwork) within the game and we ultimately aim to develop more than 10 assessment tools covering a range of soft skills. These skills will include, but not be limited to:


The more you donate, the more soft skill demos we can develop. This gives us the opportunity to represent you more effectively.

These demos will be presented to our potential clients for future adoption. Our demo for TEAM PLAYING skills will be launched in March/April with a view to launching more demos as soon as possible.

Our intent is that we can approach investors with our demo and secure long term funding to take our assessment tools to the next level, adding even more functionality and strengthening your representation to employers.


Why should you donate?

The job market is hard enough already. We don’t need out-dated recruitment processes holding us back as well.

We strongly believe that we can revolutionise the job application process and we hope that you do too.


Why will companies use it?

They get to see the real you to ensure that they are getting the best fitting candidate for their job position. Currently, companies are limited in their ability to accurately measure the soft skills of candidates; especially now that more and more companies emphasise soft skills over hard skills (i.e. technical skills)

Companies across industries such as Financial Services, Professional Services and Engineering have already displayed interest and are just waiting for us to come up with our Team Playing demo.

This software is the first tool to assess candidates through serious gaming. It generates information about intentions, motivations and behaviours, and reduces the risk of a ‘bad hire’. Now all we need is to develop demos for a variety of soft skills and let clients test them out for themselves.

story:
Fields of War is a massive multiplayer third-person-shooter focused on large scale battles, territory control, skill and most importantly team play.

 

Main Features:

• Massive battles of up to 200 players.
• Large persistent maps hosted on our dedicated servers.
• Full dynamic Day-Night cycle.
• Five mech classes focused on different play styles.
• Heavy skill-based combat.
• Unique node-based territory control mechanic, with special nodes giving extra abilities to the controlling team.
• Buy to play. No micro-transactions. No subscriptions.

 

Where we are now:

We are currently in alpha stages of development with beta planned for January 2013.

We have work left on: Server infrastructure, SoundFX/Music and GUI/HUD.

 

Why crowdfund?

We can finish our game with our current budget but we don't have enough money to launch it properly.

Also, we need beta testers... lots of them.

 

Last words:

We appreciate your support and Feedback, and will be glad if you join our SteamGroup community. You can also find us on the group chat, we're online most of the day GMT time.


Thank you for taking interest in our game, and we hope to see you all!

story:
-- The Pitch Media --

It is highly recommended that you turn on Youtube's annotations while watching the pitch video. You may want to pause the video to read the annotations at some time.

The graphics shown in the video are not final, they are taken from royalty-free sources. Custom assets will be created, as well as game audio.

The video shows a low framerate due to the limitations of the free video recording software, the game actually runs at a constant 100 fps.

 

Take My Souls

Take My Souls is a multiplayer online video game, which tests the player on his luck and skills.

Based on the Warcraft III mod, "Castle Fight", players summon souls in their base, and watch them spawn bodies to fight the opposition!

- Card Game Mechanism

Take My Souls integrates the idea of a card game mechanism, with its deck being called the Vault, which stores a total of 40 souls. There may be duplicate souls in each player's vault, and may different souls can be bought in a virtual shop.

In the game, players will have a hand of 7 souls, and souls are drawn from the Vault whenever he plays a soul, or reshuffles the soul for an Energy cost.

- Souls

Souls are like the cards in the game, and players summon them using some Energy. There will be many souls in the game when its released (at least 50!!). They have their own evolution chain, such as a Peasant soul being able to evolve into a Knight soul, or Archer soul, and so on.

- Bodies

Each soul when placed in the game, will periodically spawn a body. Bodies are the fighters in the game, they are exact replicas of the soul, but they can move and attack the enemies! An Archer soul will spawn an Archer body, and the Archer body will move forward and attack the enemies. Each kind of body will have its own skills, such as Power Shot for Archer, and Ally Heal for Priest.

- Energy

Summoning and evolving souls cost Energy, so players must strategically counter the opposition. When the team's bodies kill the enemy team's bodies, Energy is earned. There is also income system which periodically gives Energy based on the number of Souls placed.

If a player's hand has only evolution souls, he may have to reshuffle them into the Vault and draw new Souls, and this costs energy.

- Matchmaking

Games will be split into matches, where players or parties put themselves into a matchmaking system, and they will enter a 3v3 battle. To win, the team must summon souls and bodies to destroy the enemies' castle.

- Platforms

This game will first be released on the PC, and be ported over to mobile platforms (iOS, Android, Windows Phone).

- Development Progress

Take My Souls is currently in very early stages of development, and is estimated to be ready by late 2012, as a free-to-play game with microtransactions.

The game servers and master server is being developed concurrently too, and players may host their own game rooms for a pre-made 3v3 match.

Once released, developments will be ongoing and updates will be added for free.

 

About Me

I'm a game programmer, age 19, from Singapore. I am trying my best to make my dream a reality, which is to create and publish a game of my own.

I studied games and programming, and I am able to do C++, C#, Java, ActionScript, objective-C.

 

Why fund me?

You would be thinking, why would I need fundings?

As seen in the video of Take My Souls, the graphical assets are actually royalty-free images, and there are no sounds too. I hope that you will be able to contribute to my humble goal of $500.

The funds will be spent wisely to:

  • Hire a game designer
  • Hire an artist
  • Hire an audio professional
  • Hosting servers (Web Server + Game Master Server)

(For the terrain and ALL souls in the game)

Depending on how much funds I receive, more variety of souls and their evolutions will be created, and have the artist draw them well.

Although there is still quite some time before the game would be released, the design, concept art and graphical assets have to be available early for a great game! 

 

Finally

To conclude these, I sincerely hope that I will receive support to make this a well-designed and polished game, which everyone will recognize and love!
 
If you like this game too, please help to spread the word around, providing positive anticipation and motivation for me! :)
 
Thanks for taking your time to read my pitch too!!

If a player's hand has only evolution souls, he may have to reshuffle them into the Vault and draw new Souls, and this costs energy.
- Matchmaking
Games will be split into matches, where players or parties put themselves into a matchmaking system, and they will enter a 3v3 battle. To win, the team must summon souls and bodies to destroy the enemies' castle.
- Platforms
This game will first be released on the PC, and be ported over to mobile platforms (iOS, Android, Windows Phone).
- Development Progress
Take My Souls is currently in very early stages of development, and is estimated to be ready by late 2012, as a free-to-play game with microtransactions.
The game servers and master server is being developed concurrently too, and players may host their own game rooms for a pre-made 3v3 match.
Once released, developments will be ongoing and updates will be added for free.
 
About Me
I'm a game programmer, age 19, from Singapore. I am trying my best to make my dream a reality, which is to create and publish a game of my own.
I studied games and programming, and I am able to do C++, C#, Java, ActionScript, objective-C.


 
Why fund me?
You would be thinking, why would I need fundings?
As seen in the video of Take My Souls, the graphical assets are actually royalty-free images, and there are no sounds too. I hope that you will be able to contribute to my humble goal of $500.
The funds will be spent wisely to:

Hire a game designer
Hire an artist
Hire an audio professional
Hosting servers (Web Server + Game Master Server)

(For the terrain and ALL souls in the game)
Depending on how much funds I receive, more variety of souls and their evolutions will be created, and have the artist draw them well.
Although there is still quite some time before the game would be released, the design, concept art and graphical assets have to be available early for a great game! 
 
Finally

To conclude these, I sincerely hope that I will receive support to make this a well-designed and polished game, which everyone will recognize and love!
 
If you like this game too, please help to spread the word around, providing positive anticipation and motivation for me! :)
 
Thanks for taking your time to read my pitch too!!

story:
THE DEVELOPERS

Dungeon Legend was birthed in the heart of professional 3D/Game artist, and owner of 3D Attack, Thomas Pasieka in 2009. His love for games like Dungeons & Dragons, Baldur's Gate and Diablo were the inspiration behind his desire to take on a project as sensational as Dungeon Legend. Knowing he would need a programmer he contacted Jon Tiller of Spark GFX.  Jon has been developing professionally for web, multimedia and games since 1995. A composer/sound effects artist, character/creature artist, concept artist and animation/rigging artist were soon added to the team.


Thomas Pasieka - Project Lead/Art Director - http://www.3dattack.us
Jon Tiller - Project Lead/Programmer http://www.sparkgfx.com/
Erez Yohanan - Music/Sound Effects - http://www.musicbyerez.com/
Glen Southern - Characters/Creatures Artist - http://www.southerngfx.co.uk/
Andreas Knauf - Rigging/Animation Artist -
Bjorn Hurri - Concept Art / Lead Artist at Opus Artz - http://opusartz.com/


DUNGEON LEGEND

Dungeon Legend is a "Dungeon Crawler" of a "different" kind using a  tactical turn based combat system in a single player setting. Atmosphere and storytelling are a big part of Dungeon Legend. You will explore dark dungeons in a fantasy world inhabited by demons and monsters.

New quests and equipment will be added on a monthly basis once the game is released (weapons, armor, monsters and new dungeons/quests). Dungeon Legend is a ever evolving Role Playing Game (RPG) game, meaning we have lots of plans for the future.


Dungeon Legend has been warmly received by Touch Arcade and was featured on their front page http://toucharcade.com/2010/07/19/dungeon-legen...


Dungeon Legend will first be compiled for Apple's iPad.  It is then our goal to prepare releases for iPhone, iPod Touch, and later PC and Mac. HELP US GET THERE!



WHY WE ARE ASKING FOR YOUR HELP


It's our goal to release Dungeon Legend for iPad by March 2011.  To accomplish this we will need to focus solely on finishing up the development and production phases.  Therefore, all monies will go directly to development and production. 


WHEN YOU GIVE YOU GET


We would never ask you to contribute without giving you something in return. Upon release of the game you will receive one or more perks. Our PERKS include:

  • $5 gift card to the iTunes App store towards the purchase of Dungeon Legend for iPad.
  • Your name in the game credits.
  • One 5x7 print of original game art.
  • One 8x10 print of original game art.
  • Official Dungeon Legend Dice Bag
  • Dice (including dice designed by Thomas Pasieka)
  • Download of the Dungeon Legend Soundtrack (15 tracks)
  • Dungeon Legend T-Shirt
  • You get to name a Dungeon Legend Monster
  • Dungeon Legend iPad skin


MAKE SOME NOISE

We need your help in getting the word out about our campaign.  MAKE SOME NOISE!!!! We would more than appreciate your help in getting others involved.  Please, please, please e-mail your friends and family, send out a Tweet, drop a link on facebook and/or MySpace.  Help us get the word out about the Dungeon Legend Project!!!!





3D ATTACK

Dungeon Legend is being developed under the Umbrella of 3D Attack.

In the past...

3D Attack was founded in 2004 by professional 3D Graphic Artist Thomas Pasieka and his wife Tavy.  Together, Thomas and Tavy successfully published 3D Attack - The CINEMA 4D Magazine and hosted a popular internet based forum for nearly six years. Their digital magazine provided training material to the CINEMA 4D, 3D, 2D and CG artist in the traditional written word format.  

Today...

3D ATTACK serves the “Game Developer”. In particular those artists and programmers who use the “Unity Game Engine” to create games and applications. Their new magazine “Unity Creative” features articles, tutorials and much more to educate and entertain the “Unity” community.

http://3dattack.us

story:
EXPO FIGHTER is a free to play web browser fighting game pitting video game industry inspired characters against one another. The creation of the game will be live streamed throughout the entire development. EXPO FIGHTER is planned for release by June 1st 2013.

I am asking for your help to raise $18000 to fund the development of this game project.

UPDATE MAY 17 2 Weeks Left! --------------------------------

2 Weeks left to make this game a reality!

We have 2 weeks left on indiegogo and still a long way to go. Looking at it realistically I dont think the $18,000 goal is going to be hit but that doesn't mean things are over. If we can raise enough funds I can still put together something that is fun and fit as many features in as I can.

If you know ANYONE who would be interested in putting even $10 towards this game idea now is the time to reach out to them. If you have a favorite game site or forum please post some info about the game. Below is a breakdown I've put together of smaller goal tiers to shoot for:

Goal Tiers
------------


- $1500(current rank) - Unity Pro - The currently raised money is going to one purchase, the Unity Pro license. This will allow for some upgrades in lighting and other back end processes.

- $4000 - Online Ranking System - If we can raise $4000 I can spend a couple months to develop a robust online ranking system. This will include individual win ranking, rankings for the best players of each character, AND a faction based ranking allowing players to fight for their favorite company in the console wars!

- $6000 - Graphic Additions - At $6000 I can spend some time upgrading the graphics to include full normal mapping for the characters, upgraded shaders, and more work on the visual effects.

- $8000 - Single Player Content - At $8000 I can spend about 5 months on the game full time. This will allow me to add in some robust single player features such as a fully featured training mode including dummy recording and link timing indicators. Also a full mission mode which will include a dummy to beat on inspired by Kudo Tsunoda!

- $10000 - Complete Package - If we can raise $10000 I can complete this game nearly to the level initially planned. I will have to slum it a little more than I had hoped but I can do it. This will also mean no contract work for the audio and animation so those will be lower quality overall.

- $14000 - Contract Audio + Animation - At $14000 I can finish the game on time as planned with some kick ass Audio and Animation to boot. I have the contractors super excited to work (all have worked in the game industry) I just need to line up the pay.

- $18000 - Rollback Netcode (GGPO style) - One of the major reasons I am spending the time I am on this game is to get the netcode right. A fighting game requires a precision and plays at a speed that standard interpolation netcode isn't sufficient for. The plan is to implement a GGPO style rollback netcode into the game. Of course that will take time which in turn costs money. 

Thank you guys for all the help and support you've given me so far. I just need a little more of a push for this last 2 weeks to make it come together. If you have any ideas or questions please post them.

UPDATE MAY 9 Hype Trailer! ----------------------------------

 

The first promo trailer is live on youtube. A huge thank you to everyone involved. This will be going out to major gaming site to generate buzz for the project.

Some bad news, I found out the hard way that Twitch.tv doesnt archive your old streams unless you specifiy it so many of the previous streams have been deleted :(. At least most of the work was focused on the trailer and not the game proper so it wasnt too important. Good to know from now on though.

UPDATE APR 27 Character 2 model nearly complete -----------

working hard on the model for the second character Donny Matchstick. He should be done by May 1.

I am going to be shooting a live action portion of the teaser trailer next Friday. If you are going to be in Vancouver on May 4th come down to the VFS game design campus at 4:00pm to join in and get hype!

 

UPDATE APR 19  Reggie is ready ------------------------------

The model of our first character, Regicide, is complete and in engine. He seems pretty happy about it. I hit my target time estimates pretty well; he took about 24 hours to get to this state. 

Next up is animation...

 

UPDATE APR 17  Answering some questions -------------------

I want to answer some questions that have come up a lot lately. If you have a question please ask me at miggsthejust@gmail.com

F.A.Q.

Who are you and why would I give you money?

I am a game designer who has been working in the industry for 7 years now. During that time I have been a developer on 3 indie projects in varying roles:

Once Upon a Time - Role: Combat designer/Level designer

Super RPG Boss Battle Master (coming soon) - Role: Scripter/Game designer

DrumSkulls (unreleased) - Role: Level designer/Game designer

In addition to working on game projects I have been an instructor of game design at Vancouver Film School game design program. There I taught classes in game mechanics (awarded best course by students) and level design as well as mentored over 50 student final projects (basically 3 month game projects). 

I have a strong background in fighting games, playing for many years and running many tournaments and ranbats in the vancouver area. 

This project is a labor of love for me. I have been working towards this for many years and I am at a point in my career where I have the understanding to create a strong game design and implement it effectively.

If you have reservations about contributing based on my experience or understanding I urge you to watch the live stream at twitch.tv/miggsthejust to see how I work and even ask me any questions you might have.

Why are you creating this by yourself?

This isnt entirely true, I am the project lead and will be handling a majority of the work, but I will be contracting several key pieces of the project. I will be contracting the design of the interface and menus out to another designer as well as the music of the game. These contracts are factored into the contribution goal.

What I dont want is to talk people into working on this game for free. I've worked on many projects where this was the case and not only is it a disservice to the talent these guys have, it also puts a lot of pressure on the project to generate a lot of money just to cover backpay. I'd rather not end up in that situation again.

I feel I've been able to scope this project so that it is manageable with my personal skillset, and I will be able to deliver an engaging, well built game on time based on the project budget. That being said, if we are able to raise beyond the project goal, I will be seriously considering bringing more talent on board to make the final game even more polished.

$18000 seems a little odd, where does the money go?

$18000 is the number I determined would be a realistic project budget for the timeline and quality I am looking to achieve. Let me break it down a bit:

Indiegogo 4% cut - $720 (if I raise the full amount, if not $1620)

Contributor Perk costs - $1500 

Monthly Development costs for 8 month dev cycle - $1400 ($11200 total)

Pay for Contract work - $5000

These are rounded numbers and dont necessarily take into account the odds and ends fees that tend to come up. I feel it is a reasonable budget for a project of this size. Please email me if you have any further questions about the budget, I'm completely open to answering them.

What happens if we dont reach the project goal?

The Indiegogo flexible funding system works a little different than Kickstarter in that if the project goal isnt reached by the deadline the project will still receive the money raised.

That being said, if we dont raise the full $18000 amount I Promise to contact each contributor directly and ask them if they want the money sent back. It is fully up to you. I will still be giving out all the perks that have been promised and I will still use all of the money raised to finance the game project. I will still be developing the game, but it will either be scoped down or will be delayed until I can raise money from other sources or finish the game as a part time project.

What happens if we pass the project goal?

If the campaign is able to raise above the $18000 goal, I will move the project forward into some of the stretch goals planned for the game. Integrating GGPO netcode into the online play is a major one. Hiring on more developers in order to increase the character count to 6 is another.

What is Unique about EXPO Fighter

Expo Fighter is a traditional 2D fighter and in that vein I didn't want to reinvent the wheel when it came to the general game system. That being said, the ability to chain EX attacks together to allow for custom supers and the meter costing parry system are both improvements that I believe will give the gameplay a fresh feel, and will engage fighting game fans.

But Remember this is a game where you play as the President of Nintendo piledriving the President of Sony into the pavement! The game is full of E3 inspired insanity and that alone will make it a hilarious experience.

I don't like your perks, can I have something else?

In short, Yes! I want to create perks that will get people excited about helping out. If there's something you want to see, let me know and I'll do my best to make it happen.

------------------------------------------------------

ROUND 1: FIGHT!

Hello Internets, my name is Justin Meagher and I have been designing and instructing the design of video games for seven years here in Vancouver,BC. Recently I was laid off from one of the big companies in town and I decided this would be a chance for me to fulfill a game design dream I have had for a while now; create a fighting game. 

I have been playing fighters since I was nine years old playing at the corner hockey card shop and fighting games have been a major influence on the way I approach designing games. For a while now I have been refining a design for a fighter, developing an interesting theme, and researching the tech involved. Now seems like the perfect time to move forward.

The problem of course comes down to money as always, and that's where YOU can have a huge influence. My goal is to raise 18000$ dollars over the coming few months to finance the development of a small web browser based fighting game. The majority of this amount is to cover development expenses while working full time on the project. If I am not able to reach this goal I will probably have to put a halt on the work until I can generate the funding which will probably mean the game will not be released on time. I need your help on this one.

ROUND 2: EXPO FIGHTER

I am looking to create a web browser based fighting game to be released by June 1st 2013. The game is tentatively titled EXPO Fighter and it parodies the silliness surrounding the large video game expo's and announcements by pitting major game company exec inspired characters against one another. 

The game features 2D gameplay with 3D graphics similar to Street Fighter 4 or Mortal Kombat 9, and will be released with 3 fully playable characters to start. The game will support local multiplayer and will have fully featured online play. I plan to have an individual online ranking system in place along with a faction based ranking system so that players can battle it out to see who wins the console wars once and for all.

There are some interesting gameplay systems planned and over the course of the month I am going to be talking in depth about them. If you wish you will also be able to see and take part in the development process itself.

ROUND 3: THE LIVE STREAM

This is somewhat of an iron man challenge for me; designing, coding, and creating the art for a fighting game in 1 year! So I thought this would be an interesting way to open up the game creation process and let you see how I go about this project. 

Starting April 1st I am going to begin live streaming my work on this game in its entirety. Each night I will alternate working on the design, the scripting, or the art of the game and live stream it for anyone to watch. If you want to learn about the process, if you are interested in fighting games, or if you just want to come make fun of me you can check out the insanity at twitch.tv/miggsthejust!

YOU WIN! PERFECT!

Thank you so much for taking the time to read over this pitch, I really appreciate it. I am very excited to attempt this project and you can make it all possible with your support. Feel free to email me at miggsthejust@gmail.com if you have any questions about the project. 

There are going to be a lot of updates over the coming month, follow me on twitter @expofighter to keep up with the development.

--------------------------------------------------------------

NOTE: Expo Fighter is still very early in development, but let's go over some of the currently planned mechanics.

BASICS

Much of Expo Fighters gameplay follows the standard format of traditional 2D fighters: players choose one of a selection of characters and attempt to knockout the opposing players character by reducing their health gauge to zero. By default a player needs to do this 2 out of three times to win the game.

Expo Fighter uses a set of directional buttons/keys and a four button/key attack layout.

Throws are executed with the two light attacks.

Each character has a set of unique standard attacks and special attacks.

GENERAL FEEL

I'm attempting to create a fighter that I don't feel exists in the current market, a game with strongly defined character match-ups but gives the player the freedom to freestyle within those defined boundaries.

Movement speeds will be fast overall and hit stun will be high in general to allow for players to create a strong offense. At the same time smart defense and good reads will have strong rewards.

I like the purity of a meterless fighter such as SF2 Hyper Fighting but I also think there is a lot of strategic possibilities in meter management. I'm attempting to create a nice middle ground allowing for a flexible meter management game without it overwhelming the fundamental game.

HYPE GAUGE

Players generate hype by connecting attacks and successfully blocking attacks. Hype charges the hype gauge up to four levels. These levels can then be spent offensively or defensively to gain a stronger advantage. Unused hype stays stored in between game rounds.

HYPE ATTACKS

Players can spend a hype gauge level to turn a special attack into a hype attack. Hype gives an attack new properties such as increased hit stun, overhead properties, or invincibility frames.

One unique aspect of Hype attacks is that many of them can be chained together into a combo if the player wishes to spend the hype gauge. This allows players flexible options to increase damage or create pressure.

DENIALS

Players can choose to spend a hype gauge level to parry an incoming attack. The player simply taps forward for high attacks or down for low attacks at the point of contact to resist the damage and leave yourself at an advantage.

Once an attack is successfully denied the player may continue to parry attacks at no hype cost until a specific frame window has passed. This allows parrying to have a cost associated while still allowing a skilled player to benefit from making a good read.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

This is an early proof of concept I created about a year ago and have been tinkering with to try out ideas. I wanted to make it available even in it's rough state just to prove the technical feasibility and give you a taste of what will be possible.

That being said, if we dont raise the full $18000 amount I Promise to contact each contributor directly and ask them if they want the money sent back. It is fully up to you. I will still be giving out all the perks that have been promised and I will still use all of the money raised to finance the game project. I will still be developing the game, but it will either be scoped down or will be delayed until I can raise money from other sources or finish the game as a part time project.
What happens if we pass the project goal?
If the campaign is able to raise above the $18000 goal, I will move the project forward into some of the stretch goals planned for the game. Integrating GGPO netcode into the online play is a major one. Hiring on more developers in order to increase the character count to 6 is another.
What is Unique about EXPO Fighter
Expo Fighter is a traditional 2D fighter and in that vein I didn't want to reinvent the wheel when it came to the general game system. That being said, the ability to chain EX attacks together to allow for custom supers and the meter costing parry system are both improvements that I believe will give the gameplay a fresh feel, and will engage fighting game fans.
But Remember this is a game where you play as the President of Nintendo piledriving the President of Sony into the pavement! The game is full of E3 inspired insanity and that alone will make it a hilarious experience.
I don't like your perks, can I have something else?
In short, Yes! I want to create perks that will get people excited about helping out. If there's something you want to see, let me know and I'll do my best to make it happen.
------------------------------------------------------

ROUND 1: FIGHT!
Hello Internets, my name is Justin Meagher and I have been designing and instructing the design of video games for seven years here in Vancouver,BC. Recently I was laid off from one of the big companies in town and I decided this would be a chance for me to fulfill a game design dream I have had for a while now; create a fighting game. 
I have been playing fighters since I was nine years old playing at the corner hockey card shop and fighting games have been a major influence on the way I approach designing games. For a while now I have been refining a design for a fighter, developing an interesting theme, and researching the tech involved. Now seems like the perfect time to move forward.
The problem of course comes down to money as always, and that's where YOU can have a huge influence. My goal is to raise 18000$ dollars over the coming few months to finance the development of a small web browser based fighting game. The majority of this amount is to cover development expenses while working full time on the project. If I am not able to reach this goal I will probably have to put a halt on the work until I can generate the funding which will probably mean the game will not be released on time. I need your help on this one.
ROUND 2: EXPO FIGHTER
I am looking to create a web browser based fighting game to be released by June 1st 2013. The game is tentatively titled EXPO Fighter and it parodies the silliness surrounding the large video game expo's and announcements by pitting major game company exec inspired characters against one another. 
The game features 2D gameplay with 3D graphics similar to Street Fighter 4 or Mortal Kombat 9, and will be released with 3 fully playable characters to start. The game will support local multiplayer and will have fully featured online play. I plan to have an individual online ranking system in place along with a faction based ranking system so that players can battle it out to see who wins the console wars once and for all.
There are some interesting gameplay systems planned and over the course of the month I am going to be talking in depth about them. If you wish you will also be able to see and take part in the development process itself.
ROUND 3: THE LIVE STREAM
This is somewhat of an iron man challenge for me; designing, coding, and creating the art for a fighting game in 1 year! So I thought this would be an interesting way to open up the game creation process and let you see how I go about this project. 
Starting April 1st I am going to begin live streaming my work on this game in its entirety. Each night I will alternate working on the design, the scripting, or the art of the game and live stream it for anyone to watch. If you want to learn about the process, if you are interested in fighting games, or if you just want to come make fun of me you can check out the insanity at twitch.tv/miggsthejust!
YOU WIN! PERFECT!
Thank you so much for taking the time to read over this pitch, I really appreciate it. I am very excited to attempt this project and you can make it all possible with your support. Feel free to email me at miggsthejust@gmail.com if you have any questions about the project. 
There are going to be a lot of updates over the coming month, follow me on twitter @expofighter to keep up with the development.
--------------------------------------------------------------

NOTE: Expo Fighter is still very early in development, but let's go over some of the currently planned mechanics.
BASICS
Much of Expo Fighters gameplay follows the standard format of traditional 2D fighters: players choose one of a selection of characters and attempt to knockout the opposing players character by reducing their health gauge to zero. By default a player needs to do this 2 out of three times to win the game.
Expo Fighter uses a set of directional buttons/keys and a four button/key attack layout.

Throws are executed with the two light attacks.
Each character has a set of unique standard attacks and special attacks.
GENERAL FEEL
I'm attempting to create a fighter that I don't feel exists in the current market, a game with strongly defined character match-ups but gives the player the freedom to freestyle within those defined boundaries.
Movement speeds will be fast overall and hit stun will be high in general to allow for players to create a strong offense. At the same time smart defense and good reads will have strong rewards.
I like the purity of a meterless fighter such as SF2 Hyper Fighting but I also think there is a lot of strategic possibilities in meter management. I'm attempting to create a nice middle ground allowing for a flexible meter management game without it overwhelming the fundamental game.
HYPE GAUGE
Players generate hype by connecting attacks and successfully blocking attacks. Hype charges the hype gauge up to four levels. These levels can then be spent offensively or defensively to gain a stronger advantage. Unused hype stays stored in between game rounds.
HYPE ATTACKS
Players can spend a hype gauge level to turn a special attack into a hype attack. Hype gives an attack new properties such as increased hit stun, overhead properties, or invincibility frames.
One unique aspect of Hype attacks is that many of them can be chained together into a combo if the player wishes to spend the hype gauge. This allows players flexible options to increase damage or create pressure.
DENIALS
Players can choose to spend a hype gauge level to parry an incoming attack. The player simply taps forward for high attacks or down for low attacks at the point of contact to resist the damage and leave yourself at an advantage.
Once an attack is successfully denied the player may continue to parry attacks at no hype cost until a specific frame window has passed. This allows parrying to have a cost associated while still allowing a skilled player to benefit from making a good read.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

This is an early proof of concept I created about a year ago and have been tinkering with to try out ideas. I wanted to make it available even in it's rough state just to prove the technical feasibility and give you a taste of what will be possible.

story:
What is DNA Tinker Studio?

Harness the tools and techniques of Rapid DNA Prototyping to build your own sophisticated genetic circuits. This powerful set of modular parts enables you to determine your own complex projects. The power of synthetic biology has never been so accessible!

DNA Tinker Studio explodes at SXSW 2015 in Austin! Panel with Synbiota CEO Connor Dickie, Director of the MIT Media Lab Joi Ito, Inventor of "Moore's Law for Biotech" Rob Carlson, and UPenn School of Fine Art Professor Orkan Telhan.

Use DNA Tinker Studio to design, build and grow microbes that fluoresce!


Use DNA Tinker Studio to design, build and grow microbes that turns simple sugar into medically important compounds like Violacein!


Even use DNA Tinker Studio to design, build and grow a living thermometer that senses the temperature and lets you know how hot it is by smell. And that's just the beginning!

With many incredible possibilities for what you can create, this kit is not only the most accessible Life Science learning tool available, it’s a powerful collection of parts ready to be used immediately in your research lab.


DNA Tinker Studio is a collection of 59 Rapid DNA Prototyping (RDP) Standardized parts which allow you to quickly and reliably build a great deal of biotechnology projects. 


DNA Tinker Studio includes all the parts from our prior kits (Rainbow Factory, Violacein Factory, & Hello World) ​— p​lus a handful of new parts that allow advanced users incredible flexibility.

With this collection you have the freedom to build sophisticated genetic circuits that can sense and react according to your choosing.

Design a genetic circuit that includes a wide array of regulators, including fixed or tunable promoters, operators with activators or repressors, and plasmid backbones with different copy numbers.

Use different producers and product modifiers, including the components of the Violacein and Lux operons, chromophores, scents, cleavable and non-­cleavable protein linkers

— a​nd more!

With Synbiota, virtual and physical are harmonized as genetic designs translate seamlessly from the computer to the petri dish

Synbiota's integrated suite of software and wetware solutions empowers you to create your own genetic constructs with unparalleled speed and reliability.

"An exciting hands-on tool to introduce artists and designers to the world of synthetic biology. Elements of the kit are well designed and simple to use. A great example of allowing people to think about biological components as potential media for visual and design processes. Well done!"

- Raphael Kim, Royal College of Art, London, UK.

"It’s a great way to introduce people with no science background to the principles of synthetic biology. At Genspace we use it for outreach events such as science and technology fairs, and also for teaching classes to the general public."

- Ellen Jorgensen, Genspace NYC http://genspace.org/ 

"One word: awesome! At MadLab, we've used Synbiota in a workshop context – that you can take a roomful of amateur biologists, with little or no laboratory experience, and have them building custom genetic constructs within a matter of hours is incredible; inconceivable only a few years ago and a testimony to the achievements of the Synbiota team."

- Asa Calow, Manchester Digital Labratory http://madlab.org.uk/

"The whole bead concept is quite brilliant and presents countless potential opportunities to customize the genetic engineering lab for different students/groups and allow them to develop and test their own hypotheses in experiments of their design. The method is easy for students to follow, and they found it very stimulating."

- Tim Gannon, AP Biology Teacher, Tempo School http://temposchool.org/

"Disruptively simple, robust and effective"

- FBI Biological Countermeasures Unit

"Thank you so much for your dedication and guidance, and - most importantly - thank you for inspiring a new way of thinking about making that will enter our every project from now on. We very much look forward to growing more and to more to grow with your incredible team at Synbiota”
- Neri Oxman, Professor Media Arts, & Presidential Fellow @ MIT Media Lab

protective gloves
microcentrifuge tubes (1.5 mL)
6 cm petris dishes
pipet tips (for 5, 20, 50, and 250 μL volumes)
plastic spreader for plating bacteria
ice
bleach (for disposal and inactivation)
rubbing alcohol (optional for sterilization)
Equipment
pipets
ice bucket
discard containers
sharpies
microwave/autoclave
37 °C incubator
42 °C waterbath (with thermometer)
scale (for measuring LB agar powder)
UV illuminator to view fluorescent bacteria (optional)
Autoclave for disposal (optional)

Synbiota Inc., creator of the DNA Tinker Factory, and the RDP Standard is an integrated software and wetware platform that enables you to explore the full potential of synthetic biology.

We're taking biotech beyond the walls of institutions, universities, and large corporations and into the public realm. Like an Arduino for living things, the growing collection of modular RDP Standardized DNA parts can be rapidly assembled into complex genetic circuits in hours instead of weeks or months.

As an end-­to­-end platform, our standardized DNA parts are complemented with web-­based DNA design software that helps you conceptualize your genetic circuits before you assemble them. Our electronic lab book is host to protocols and allows you to log your results as you design, assemble, test, and iterate.

Our vision is to create a safe, open, and thriving ecosystem where synbio knowledge and innovations are created and exchanged.

Risks & Challenges

While we have been delivering DNA products based on the RDP standard for over 2 years, DNA Tinker Studio is our most ambitious product yet. With this comes some level of risk for backers, but we have been working to reduce this risk as much as possible so that backers get a quality product that works every time.

The science is done, so we're good to go. This is not vaporware that is shipping (or not shipping ) years from now. The biggest risk that we have identified for this campaign is one of quality control during manufacturing. We’re making custom DNA parts that fit together easily like LEGO® - but we’re working on the molecular scale. Far smaller than the eye, or even an optical microscope can see. Sometimes things can go wrong.

Professor Mike Ellison, Inventor of the RDP standard, and Chief Science Officer at Synbiota has devised an ingenious manufacturing process that allows us to detect flaws in the early stages of product creation. This allows us to either fix or replace flawed parts with ones that meet our high quality standards. In fact, this Quality Control mechanism has been in use for the creation of both Violacein Factory and Rainbow Factory kits that we have already been selling, both of which had zero reports of any flaws from the hundreds of customers that have bought our kits.

story:
IMPORTANT:

All contributors of $5 and above will get a free copy of the game in addition to the perks listed on the right!


Background

Littlecosm is a browser-based online game powered by your emotions.  It plugs into twitter and creates a world (with 8-bit style graphics!) based on your current sentiment - good or bad.  "Good" people in your twitter stream appear as good characters in the game.  And vice versa. 


http://littlecosm.com


Below: Daytime in Littlecosm (view full size image)




Below: Sunset in Littlecosm (the game is played in real-time)




Below: the Map screen and crashed ship



A ship carrying a great treasure has crashed on a planet far away. 

The treasure: every object, thought and memory that mankind ever created during its short history. 

The little inhabitants of the planet curiously collect things from the crashed ship and try to learn as much as they can about this place called "earth" and what has happened to it.


Littlecosm is a game about collecting memories.


Funds raised will go towards content creation in this final stretch of development - giving more depth to the writing, artwork for game items and licensing of music.  All of this will help to create a much more memorable game for you to play.


Join me for a nostalgic journey in January 2011.


Please help to spread the word about Littlecosm and my little fundraiser.  I'd love it if you linked people to this page or blogged about the game (or both!), and I'll see you all in the game when it launches in January :)


p.s. if you need more, there's a slightly longer explanation of Littlecosm over at my blog:


http://yongfook.com/all-about-littlecosm


To all contributors: many, many thanks! Sit tight - I will send you a mail when the fundraising closes (Dec. 31st) to gather the necessary info.

story:
Sleepless Game Studios is a small indie game studio comprised of a group of talented students in the Vancouver area. Our previous project was titled Catacomb , which was nominated for best indie game by the CVGAs (Canadian Video Game Awards) . We’re now beginning our next development titled Oswald , a side scrolling, 2D, swinging game requiring players to solve puzzles and use physics to swing to locations and avoid various enemies. It will be a cross platform release with a full PC version, and 2 mini games on iOS/Andriod which will unlock content on the full version. Our prototype and mechanic are finished, and we are moving into final development phase using Unity Pro. The development cycle is expected to be 3-4 months, with a release hopefully in late summer/fall 2012.

As up and coming developers, our goal is to create a fully polished product ready for release which will generate revenue, create a portfolio piece, and most importantly, gain us notoriety. Contributes will have a more then significant impact on this project. Without them, we still create a fully polished game, but with, we have the ability to pay for licences to have full release on various platforms.

Sleepless Game Studios has set (what we feel is) a realistic goal of $6000. We plan on using this funding, whether we reach our goal, don’t reach our goal, or go over our goal, on a dedicated server, Unity Pro licences (including iOS and Andriod), a Apple developers licence, and advertising.

We highly encourage people to visit the SleeplessGameStudios website to check out videos, download builds and view art for our previous project Catacomb. For those who can’t contribute funding but still wish to help, feel free to send us an email at sleeplessgamestudios@gmail.com to be part of upcoming beta testing, or for any information you might want to know. Please feel free to spread the word about Oswald using Indiegogo share tools.

story:
What is Game Of Engines?

Game of Engines is a small application that allows everyone to create their very own game. This application includes a level editor, asset manager and game engine so all you need to do is add some graphics and functionality to create the game you have always wanted.

Who is Game Of Engines For?

Game of Engines is for everyone. It is simple enough that a child could use it but powerful enough for a developer to. Our unique level editor is perfectly suited to your game's needs - It has everything you need to make ANY kind of game: Platformer, RPG, Side-Scroller, Arcade... The list goes on.

Who's Behind Game Of Engines?

That would be me. My name is Matt and I am a software programmer from England. I started work on Game Of Engines around 2 years ago when I realised that Game Maker and RPG Maker didn't have the functionality I needed to create my dream game. With this in mind, I set off on a 2 year quest to create a fantastic Game Engine that would run MY game - This engine is called Light Engine.

What Is Light Engine?

I don't want to get too complex here but Light Engine is a powerful 2D engine I created to run games created in GoE. Light Engine is powered by YOUR lua scripts and contains some of the following features:

  • Fast Launch Time -  Game Of Engines loads your game in real time so you don't have to sit through annoying load screens.
  • Amazing Collision Detection - Our engine can detect even the slightest of collisions (even a feather lightly floating by a leaf)
  • Brilliant Physics - Our Lua-Physics add on allows you to create game's with amazing physics potential - Now you can finally add that scene where your main character runs up walls and jumps from bridges.
  • Smooth Graphics - We use our own png resource loader and drawing systems so that your games look and render smoothly.
  • Great Cross-Platform Action - Game Of Engines runs on Windows, Mac, Linux, PSVita, DS and the Sega Dreamcast so you can play your game anywhere. We are also working on a iPhone and Android version.
  • No Strict Rules - Game Of Engines will never tell you what to do, you can make anything and everything from scratch or templates.
  • No Programming - Despite what our hastily made Intro Video shows, you don't even need a keyboard to create a game. Our objects come with Components so you can just add the functionality you need without scripting.
  • No Third Party Software - 99% of our Toolkit is homebrewed so you only need to use 3rd Party Applications if YOU want to. If not then feel free to use our custom File Editor, Asset Manager and Action Panels.

 

What We Need And What You Get

Game Of Engines is still in early alpha and despite all the features listed above are ALREADY implemented, we still need to enhance the Toolkit further and get it fully working. I have never done this for the money but I have now reached a point in which I need some to progress with this work. This project needs money for all kinds of development (and distribution) licenses for Qt, Apple, PlayStation Mobile and loads of other software. In addition, we also need money for help with marketing and design so that we can continue to bring you great features.

Our fund goal is 4,000 - This will be enough for a number of licenses and some research development. I would NEVER EVER ask for money to fund this project but Kickstarter allows me to give you something in return - A complete Game Development Toolkit with everything you need to create a killer game.

Community

There are other ways you can help this project progress. Our biggest source of info right now is our Twitter page: http://www.twitter.com/evilwatersuk and by following us, you can have the chance to win FREE ALPHA ACCESS in our giveaways every month.

You can also help us by simply telling other people about this project. If you have a friend/Uncle/Nephew/Son/Daughter who would be interested in making their own game then please send them this way.

News And Info

If you would like more information or news on the Game Of Engines project then we very strongly recommend checking out our indiedb page (http://www.indiedb.com/engines/game-of-engines). This page is essentially a journal that we have been updating for the past 2 years on information from the Toolkit. In Addition, this page also houses loads of brilliant screenshots of GoE.

What's Next

With the money raised here, I hope to buy all the licenses we need and implement loads of cool new features to GoE such as:

  • The Marketplace - A store where you can publish and even sell games you have created using the engine. This is something we have been planning for a while but as of yet do not have the funding.
  • Art Assets - I would like to hire somebody to draw up some simple art assets that we can use in examples for launch.
  • A Rest - If we by some chance exceed our funding goal then I would love to either hire some help with programming or call in a few friends to help out.

On a final note, I would like to say thank you all for taking the time to view this project and if by chance we manage to exceed our funding goal then for every £100 we exceed, I will knock £10 from the Market Price for everyone.

 

Thanks For Reading,
Matt
