What is Game Of Engines?
Game of Engines is a small application that allows everyone to create their very own game. This application includes a level editor, asset manager and game engine so all you need to do is add some graphics and functionality to create the game you have always wanted.
Who is Game Of Engines For?
Game of Engines is for everyone. It is simple enough that a child could use it but powerful enough for a developer to. Our unique level editor is perfectly suited to your game's needs - It has everything you need to make ANY kind of game: Platformer, RPG, Side-Scroller, Arcade... The list goes on.

Who's Behind Game Of Engines?
That would be me. My name is Matt and I am a software programmer from England. I started work on Game Of Engines around 2 years ago when I realised that Game Maker and RPG Maker didn't have the functionality I needed to create my dream game. With this in mind, I set off on a 2 year quest to create a fantastic Game Engine that would run MY game - This engine is called Light Engine.
What Is Light Engine?
I don't want to get too complex here but Light Engine is a powerful 2D engine I created to run games created in GoE. Light Engine is powered by YOUR lua scripts and contains some of the following features:

Fast Launch Time -  Game Of Engines loads your game in real time so you don't have to sit through annoying load screens.
Amazing Collision Detection - Our engine can detect even the slightest of collisions (even a feather lightly floating by a leaf)
Brilliant Physics - Our Lua-Physics add on allows you to create game's with amazing physics potential - Now you can finally add that scene where your main character runs up walls and jumps from bridges.
Smooth Graphics - We use our own png resource loader and drawing systems so that your games look and render smoothly.
Great Cross-Platform Action - Game Of Engines runs on Windows, Mac, Linux, PSVita, DS and the Sega Dreamcast so you can play your game anywhere. We are also working on a iPhone and Android version.
No Strict Rules - Game Of Engines will never tell you what to do, you can make anything and everything from scratch or templates.
No Programming - Despite what our hastily made Intro Video shows, you don't even need a keyboard to create a game. Our objects come with Components so you can just add the functionality you need without scripting.
No Third Party Software - 99% of our Toolkit is homebrewed so you only need to use 3rd Party Applications if YOU want to. If not then feel free to use our custom File Editor, Asset Manager and Action Panels.
 
What We Need And What You Get
Game Of Engines is still in early alpha and despite all the features listed above are ALREADY implemented, we still need to enhance the Toolkit further and get it fully working. I have never done this for the money but I have now reached a point in which I need some to progress with this work. This project needs money for all kinds of development (and distribution) licenses for Qt, Apple, PlayStation Mobile and loads of other software. In addition, we also need money for help with marketing and design so that we can continue to bring you great features.
Our fund goal is 4,000 - This will be enough for a number of licenses and some research development. I would NEVER EVER ask for money to fund this project but Kickstarter allows me to give you something in return - A complete Game Development Toolkit with everything you need to create a killer game.
Community
There are other ways you can help this project progress. Our biggest source of info right now is our Twitter page: http://www.twitter.com/evilwatersuk and by following us, you can have the chance to win FREE ALPHA ACCESS in our giveaways every month.
You can also help us by simply telling other people about this project. If you have a friend/Uncle/Nephew/Son/Daughter who would be interested in making their own game then please send them this way.

News And Info
If you would like more information or news on the Game Of Engines project then we very strongly recommend checking out our indiedb page (http://www.indiedb.com/engines/game-of-engines). This page is essentially a journal that we have been updating for the past 2 years on information from the Toolkit. In Addition, this page also houses loads of brilliant screenshots of GoE.
What's Next
With the money raised here, I hope to buy all the licenses we need and implement loads of cool new features to GoE such as:

The Marketplace - A store where you can publish and even sell games you have created using the engine. This is something we have been planning for a while but as of yet do not have the funding.
Art Assets - I would like to hire somebody to draw up some simple art assets that we can use in examples for launch.
A Rest - If we by some chance exceed our funding goal then I would love to either hire some help with programming or call in a few friends to help out.
On a final note, I would like to say thank you all for taking the time to view this project and if by chance we manage to exceed our funding goal then for every £100 we exceed, I will knock £10 from the Market Price for everyone.
 
Thanks For Reading, Matt

story:
Why a Trike?


I have a beautiful bicycle, a Cannondale to be precise, that
I stare at lovingly everyday when I walk through my garage. That Bike and I
have many great memories, and I smile when I think of it.  Since my spinal cord injury, I found out the hard way that I cannot ride it anymore; so I share it with my partner or friends and live vicariously through their experience on it.  What to do? I knew my quadriplegic status made it very hard to operate a hand cycle- and what about that huge hill to get out of my neighborhood? I know how vital it is for me to work to keep muscle on this body.  A friend recommended a wonderful organization called Adaptive Adventures.  They come out to Washington Park here in Denver every Saturday to bring different kinds of adaptive bikes for people with disabilities to try. But my work schedule kept me from getting there to meet them.  So I started my journey through tons of research- and it came to me. Terra Trike.

The height of the seat is perfectly placed for ease of mount and dismount without help. This is a VERY important detail. And the design makes it easy to turn on a dime without fear of tipping over. Rocky Mountain Recumbents www.rockymountainrecumbents.com owned by Steve Shoemaker in Fort Collins, CO had one in their showroom that they took out and let me test drive. I suddenly felt freedom like I had not felt in forever. They rarely receive used Terra Trikes, but I lucked out with this one. It is a Rambler Sturmey Archer 8 Speed Trike, barely used with plenty of upgrades. Susan, Steve’s mother (who works there as a volunteer) worked to do something they’ve never done.  She held the trike in a “lay-away” fashion, allowing me to raise money for its purchase without fear of it selling to someone else.  They both treated me like family, and want to help me achieve this goal. As Steve said “Are you happy with the trike? That’s all that matters- that you’re happy.” Yes Steve, I already am. And this will just enhance that feeling. 

The amount I need to raise is $1295.55 (plus 9% in fees) for the bike.  But any money I raise above that amount I would like to donate to Adaptive Adventures, so they can continue to show all kinds of people with disabilities that they CAN.  You can check out all their wonderful programs at www.adaptiveadventures.org. 

Thank You, all, for your support on this.
Let’s get this ROLLING!

 

What I Need & What You Get

  • The money I am asking you to contribute, will go directly toward paying for a Terra Trike, to be purchased from local business, Rocky Mountain Recumbents.
  • Any Money raised beyond the $1295 (plus fees) will be donated to Adaptive Adventures to help them continue to be an amazing resource for people with disabilities.
  • My team and I are offering to give each individual contributor a big lovin' shout out on Facebook and Twitter!
  • If we don't reach our goal, the money we do raise will help pay for a Terra Trike.

The Impact

  • It's difficult for me to walk for any distance and my muscles are deteriorating without a means to keep them strong.  This Trike will make ALL the difference!
  • This Terra Trike will allow me to participate in Adaptive Sports and help others excel in the face of adversity.
  • Having a Terra Trike helps me accomplish a freedom that I have not experienced since my neck injury.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • By sharing my story with this web page with all your Facebook and Twitter friends, plus personal networks, we can help many with disabilities. I hope to inspire and give hope to those who struggle on any level. 

Thanks so much for your support!

story:
About Me ...

I'm a young French developer who loves creating small iOS games/apps, but I don't have enough money to finished all my projects. 

This project is my favourite and I will be very disappointed if I can't finished it .. 

The goal of this campaign is to make my dream reality, publish my first real iOS game on the AppStore.

Your help is very important to me and I can't thank you enough for helping me.

What I Need ... 

To continue the development of my game, I have to raise funds for : 

  • Platform and additional licensing costs
  • Testing devices (iPads, iPhones and other devices) to insure the game performs on every mobile devices.
  • A music/sound and graphics budget
  • A marketing budget

I'm currently funding for the iOS system, but if we reach our goal I will be putting in place the necessary to have this game available for the Android market.

For the Android market further development will be needed additional funds that will be used for :

  • Engine, platform and additional licensing costs
  • Android testing devices to insure the game performs on every mobile devices.
  • A marketing budget 

    Risks & Challenges ...

    It's hard to start creating a game, it's full of challenges and it's quite difficult. 

    The progress of my project is already in a well on the way but your help is very important to make this project a reality.

    Thank you so much for taking a bit of your time to consult this page.

    Other Ways You Can Help Me ...

    If you can't donate it's doesn't matter, you can help me in other ways like :

    • Talk to your friends or your family about this project,
    • Share this campaign on socials networks,
    • Maybe you can help me to developing my game.

    One More thing ... 

    5% of the profits will be donated to Amnesty International.(http://www.amnesty.org/en)

    Thank You ... 

    Again thank you for taking a bit of your time for reading this !

story:
Update:

In our previous campaign efforts we have raised over $3,600.00 so far! Thanks to all the new contributors! Our design forums on the Thrones of Valor site are starting to buzz. Already our supporters have come up with great ideas that are now part of the game description below! Please jump in and support this game so we can keep on it full time, and so you can get involved with the player and developer community right away!

The Game

Can you imagine what it would be like to be part of a massive fantasy metaverse, where there were no NPCs, no quests, and no AI, but where all of the day in and day out tasks and socializing and battling were planned and carried out by groups of real people? This is the essence of Thrones of Valor™

Will you choose to be a King or a Queen? A Knight of Valor? A Lord of the Realm? A Steward of the Village? An Innkeeper? A Landowner? Or A Peasant? The choice is yours.

Will you spend your time planning and carrying out fierce battles for realm territory? Or will you help your fellow citizens plan and improve realm life? Will you spend time thrown in the dungeon for treason? Or will you peddle merchandise or ale and be a friend to all? It's up to you.

The game of Thrones of Valor is about realm versus realm battling. It's about winning or losing territory. It's about forming guilds and raid parties and having sophisticated ways of holding secret meetings to plan strategy. It's about trading goods, abilities, equipment, and gold. And it's about socializing, forming relationships with your fellow citizens, realm diplomacy, and even collecting intelligence on the enemy.

The thread running through all of this is our philosophy of offering the community brilliant graphics, immersive music and sound effects, powerful communication tools such as video, audio and text chat, flexible systems for trading, and ways to constantly improve your characters, while leaving the "HOW", to you. You have the world and the tools, yet you will have to decide along with your fellow citizens of the realm, how you will conduct yourselves and play the game.

"How is Thrones of Valor Special?"

It's All Real People

Let's think of how this is special. The game is Realm vs. Realm battle for territory. It's also day in and day out living in a fantasy metaverse. The Realm is run by a King or Queen (see the perks!) The Realm has a palace, and a number of Knights of Valor. In the Realm are a number of villages. Each village is run by a Lord. The Lord has a Steward who aids in running the village. There are Innkeepers, Merchants and Villagers who may or may not own Dwellings of their own.

Your Realm Monarch will want to gain territory, or protect what is the Realm's. He or she will hold LIVE VIDEO MEETINGS with his Knights of Valor. Strategies will be planned. Then communiques will be sent to all the Lords of the Realm, who then will hold LIVE VIDEO MEETINGS with villagers. Village raid or protection strategies will be planned and employed.

From this one scenario, you can see how different and special this MMORTS is. It's people, working and planning with people. It's powerful communication tools used to form and execute plans. It's NOT the normal MMORTS where you play as the god of your nation moving around groups of little AI armies, going head to head with other players' nations. Instead it's you working with other citizens, all making plans and working together to get the job done for your Realm. In other words it's much more like REAL LIFE. Real nations. You are building a nation with other real people. How well your realm, your government functions is up to all people involved.

It's a Unique Style of Gameplay

Thrones of Valor employs rich, isometric 3D graphics, music, and sound effects to provide an immersive experience in an enjoyable fantasy world. Isometric 3D is formed from pre-rendered 2D graphics, so any video card will work brilliantly.

When you go on planned raids to conquer neighboring villages, it won't be the normal hack and slash. You will find enemies and challenge them to a battle. However the battle will take the form of your character versus their character using a hybrid d20/TCG-style RPG rules. You'll have stats, and a TCG-style deck of cards you can use to draw from and activate certain equipment, weapons, abilities and stat buffs the way you see fit. Then you'll take turns rolling to hit, rolling damage, and choosing actions, just like you would in any d20 game. When the battle is finished, one person will emerge victorious. No hard feelings, just great d20 battle fun.

So while the game has the feel of a normal MMO video game, you battle and decide actions in a paper/pen RPG form. Our fans say they can't wait to try this new play style. Neither can we!

You Choose How You Spend Your Time

Even though the main combat goal of the game is to protect your territory and possibly expand it, we want our citizens to feel that they can spend their time playing any way they like.

If you like battling realm vs. realm and spending time working out raid strategy, then by all means do that! However if you want to focus on forming relationships in the realm community, roleplaying to your heart's desire, planning to make village life better for other citizens, then feel free! With trading systems, video and voice chat for avatars, the ability to own and decorate your own cottage, manor or castle, and then meet groups of people there by invitation only, you have a powerful means to live a social life in Thrones of Valor.

And of course you can mix it up, and spend time in all the different ways you can think of. It's your world, your life, you lead it!

There are new Technology Features Uncommon to the MMORTS

  • Avatar-Proximity Video & Voice Chat. If a group of you approach each other, you'll be connected by text, voice, or even video! Of course you have option settings to control how this works for you.
     
  • Setting dwelling interior security allows you to hold live-video meetings with players inside your dwelling, from guild members, to friends, and on to individual players by invitation only. You'll use this feature both for pure fun, and for holding secret meetings to plan strategy.
     
  • Enhanced email and text notifications for raids, meetings and get-togethers. Imagine receiving an email or text reminding you of a pending raid you've planned to attend. Or notifying you that your village or a neighboring village is being attacked so you can jump online and help defend her with all your might. Because of the "All Real People" nature of the game, our communication and notification systems have to be best-of-class.
     
  • A macro scripting language you can use to control what your character is doing while you're away from the game! Our players have asked for this feature so that they can still be productive while away from the game (for example when real life intervenes.) Set your character to patrol the walls and attack raiders. Or set your character to mine for precious metals or other resources. The options will be many.

How is Gamesabi Special?

The designers and developers at Gamesabi have a track record of successfully building and boot-strapping large, unique, commercially available game software.

As a part of Universal Online Magic, LLC, we have built iTabletop: a powerful online virtual tabletop that focuses on using rich media, maps, tokens, and live video and voice chat to reproduce the feel of your group of friends being around the game table, even though you're playing online remotely.

iTabletop was the first "VTT" to be group webcam-centered, and have a style of using rich media to do immersive storytelling for the RPG.

iTabletop was also crowdfunded and built from the ground up, and in fact, Thrones of Valor represents a major feature addition to iTabletop, using the same Silverlight-based game platform code base reloaded to handle an MMO and RTS environment. As a result of Thrones of Valor, iTabletop is now receiving an isometric 3D face lift by Gamesabi, so iTabletop customers can build their games to look like off-the-shelf 3D video games, while retaining all the flexibility that iTabletop is known for.

All this to make the point that Gamesabi has a history of being able to build large projects like Thrones of Valor, and additionally that Thrones of Valor has a huge jump start since it is being built on top of the iTabletop code base. For more information please read the Deep Dive: The Technology section at the bottom of this page!

The Pay Model

Thrones of Valor is free to play. Gamesabi will make money selling in-game digital content such as character and costume upgrades, in-game real estate, buff-packs, etc., none of which are necessary to play and have fun. This is a popular trend used by many MMOs such as LOTRO, D&D Online, and others. Players have the ability to jump in and play as much and as often as they like, and only purchase those things that they decide will significantly impact their own style of play.

Our Game-Design Philosophy

  • We at Gamesabi feel passionately about building a large online community that has powerful tools to play, and yet has the choice to play the way they desire to play.
     
  • We believe in games that foster the maximum in emergent behavior, so that you, the players, end up coming up with ways to play that we never imagined.
     
  • It's a powerful thing to create a new community of people having fun and being challenged and creating social connections, and we take this commitment and responsibility seriously. We desire to make this game a reality, just as we made iTabletop a reality and continue to expand and improve it on a regular basis.

"How Will My Money Be Used?"

The money you provide will go toward:

  • Expanding and improving the iTabletop game platform to build out Thrones of Valor functionality.
     
  • Detailing and refining the Thrones of Valor game design with your help, so we end up with a game that is thrilling and unique to play.
     
  • Purchasing 3D modeling and rendering assets, in-game music and sound effects licensing, and all the other assets that make up a graphical video game.
     
  • Composing and rendering isometric 3D exterior village maps, dwelling and dungeon interior maps, and animated character avatars with a wide variety of body and clothing styles.
     
  • Covering the monthly costs of the game development. We work to keep this low by working virtually from our home offices and not having to pay for an office lease, but we do pay for our server infrastructure through Amazon.com, our business-level Internet connections, and other development necessities.
     
  • Lean spending on marketing. We strive to keep this low as well, first by opting to use this crowdfunding system at IndieGoGo where we can simultaneously raise funding while at the same time build up our initial player base through the perks we offer. We also work to keep marketing funding needs low by building the game to be more viral, whereby it becomes more fun to play when your friends play, so you naturally tell friends about the game and invite them to play for free.

"What Perks Will I Get?"

  • A fun and valuable perk that gives you something you can do Right Now, in the form of comparably-priced iTabletop Lifetime Accounts for use in RPG gaming, as well as in creating unique worlds to use for video chat and hanging out with friends and family.
     
  • You also get valuable perks that you will put to use as soon as Thrones of Valor is complete. These perks give you ownership of medieval dwellings, special titles and status in the game, special abilities and duties, and one-of-a-kind upgrades that will never be available to people who did not support development of the game. Some Perks you'll see can even give you the ability to name your village or name your realm!
     
  • Additionally all contributors get the ability to immediately join the Thrones of Valor player and developer community! You can jump in right now and get to know players and developers, by forum, text, voice, or video chat built right into the iTabletop software. Help shape the game starting right now.
     
  • Guaranteed inclusion in the Thrones of Valor closed and open betas. Be among the first to play this game.
     
  • Check the perks listed to the right for all the details!

"What if you have already raised your entire goal amount?"

If you find that we've already met our original goal, we ask that you still contribute funds to the effort, and join in and become part of this new kind of emerging MMO. Rising above our goal means we can purchase even more 3D content, music, and sound effects, and afford more labor to build the game, building more features into the game and significantly improving the experience for everyone involved.

As another caveat, additional funding will help us achieve our dream of releasing actual foil-wrapped TCG card packs in retail hobby and game stores! You've seen the TCGs that include serial numbers to unlock the cards online. Well that is a goal we can't wait to see a reality. Please help us blow away our goal amount so we can move forward with our entire vision.

Other Ways You Can Help

Of course spread the word to your friends! Like us on Facebook. Follow us on Twitter. Email this campaign link to your friends! Help us find contributors! Make sure that when you play Thrones of Valor, your friends are also there playing. As an encouragement to seek out your friends for contributing to this campaign, at this early stage we can and will accommodate when you request a group of you to be in the same realm and village. Later when released, to keep the game balanced, these kinds of requests will be more difficult or even possibly unavailable. But again, please help spread the word and seek out contributors with whom you want to play the game!

Thank you so much for your time and for your considering contributing to this unique and fun game. Please be sure to check the Thrones of Valor website for more information on the game, and the iTabletop website for more information on the technology and community we have built there.

 

Sincerely,

 

KnightErrant (James Auld)

Ranger (Ed Blumberg)

Acknowledgments

Thrones of Valor™ trademark Gamesabi, LLC. Thrones of Valor game design copyright (c) 2012 Gamesabi, LLC. iTabletop™ trademark Universal Online Magic LLC

Deep Dive: The Technology

Click here for a deeper dive into the technology.

From this one scenario, you can see how different and special this MMORTS is. It's people, working and planning with people. It's powerful communication tools used to form and execute plans. It's NOT the normal MMORTS where you play as the god of your nation moving around groups of little AI armies, going head to head with other players' nations. Instead it's you working with other citizens, all making plans and working together to get the job done for your Realm. In other words it's much more like REAL LIFE. Real nations. You are building a nation with other real people. How well your realm, your government functions is up to all people involved.
It's a Unique Style of Gameplay
Thrones of Valor employs rich, isometric 3D graphics, music, and sound effects to provide an immersive experience in an enjoyable fantasy world. Isometric 3D is formed from pre-rendered 2D graphics, so any video card will work brilliantly.
 When you go on planned raids to conquer neighboring villages, it won't be the normal hack and slash. You will find enemies and challenge them to a battle. However the battle will take the form of your character versus their character using a hybrid d20/TCG-style RPG rules. You'll have stats, and a TCG-style deck of cards you can use to draw from and activate certain equipment, weapons, abilities and stat buffs the way you see fit. Then you'll take turns rolling to hit, rolling damage, and choosing actions, just like you would in any d20 game. When the battle is finished, one person will emerge victorious. No hard feelings, just great d20 battle fun.
So while the game has the feel of a normal MMO video game, you battle and decide actions in a paper/pen RPG form. Our fans say they can't wait to try this new play style. Neither can we!
You Choose How You Spend Your Time
Even though the main combat goal of the game is to protect your territory and possibly expand it, we want our citizens to feel that they can spend their time playing any way they like.
 If you like battling realm vs. realm and spending time working out raid strategy, then by all means do that! However if you want to focus on forming relationships in the realm community, roleplaying to your heart's desire, planning to make village life better for other citizens, then feel free! With trading systems, video and voice chat for avatars, the ability to own and decorate your own cottage, manor or castle, and then meet groups of people there by invitation only, you have a powerful means to live a social life in Thrones of Valor.
And of course you can mix it up, and spend time in all the different ways you can think of. It's your world, your life, you lead it!
There are new Technology Features Uncommon to the MMORTS

Avatar-Proximity Video & Voice Chat. If a group of you approach each other, you'll be connected by text, voice, or even video! Of course you have option settings to control how this works for you.   

 Setting dwelling interior security allows you to hold live-video meetings with players inside your dwelling, from guild members, to friends, and on to individual players by invitation only. You'll use this feature both for pure fun, and for holding secret meetings to plan strategy.  
Enhanced email and text notifications for raids, meetings and get-togethers. Imagine receiving an email or text reminding you of a pending raid you've planned to attend. Or notifying you that your village or a neighboring village is being attacked so you can jump online and help defend her with all your might. Because of the "All Real People" nature of the game, our communication and notification systems have to be best-of-class.  
A macro scripting language you can use to control what your character is doing while you're away from the game! Our players have asked for this feature so that they can still be productive while away from the game (for example when real life intervenes.) Set your character to patrol the walls and attack raiders. Or set your character to mine for precious metals or other resources. The options will be many.





How is Gamesabi Special?
The designers and developers at Gamesabi have a track record of successfully building and boot-strapping large, unique, commercially available game software.
As a part of Universal Online Magic, LLC, we have built iTabletop: a powerful online virtual tabletop that focuses on using rich media, maps, tokens, and live video and voice chat to reproduce the feel of your group of friends being around the game table, even though you're playing online remotely.
iTabletop was the first "VTT" to be group webcam-centered, and have a style of using rich media to do immersive storytelling for the RPG.
iTabletop was also crowdfunded and built from the ground up, and in fact, Thrones of Valor represents a major feature addition to iTabletop, using the same Silverlight-based game platform code base reloaded to handle an MMO and RTS environment. As a result of Thrones of Valor, iTabletop is now receiving an isometric 3D face lift by Gamesabi, so iTabletop customers can build their games to look like off-the-shelf 3D video games, while retaining all the flexibility that iTabletop is known for.
All this to make the point that Gamesabi has a history of being able to build large projects like Thrones of Valor, and additionally that Thrones of Valor has a huge jump start since it is being built on top of the iTabletop code base. For more information please read the Deep Dive: The Technology section at the bottom of this page!




The Pay Model
Thrones of Valor is free to play. Gamesabi will make money selling in-game digital content such as character and costume upgrades, in-game real estate, buff-packs, etc., none of which are necessary to play and have fun. This is a popular trend used by many MMOs such as LOTRO, D&D Online, and others. Players have the ability to jump in and play as much and as often as they like, and only purchase those things that they decide will significantly impact their own style of play.




Our Game-Design Philosophy

We at Gamesabi feel passionately about building a large online community that has powerful tools to play, and yet has the choice to play the way they desire to play.   
We believe in games that foster the maximum in emergent behavior, so that you, the players, end up coming up with ways to play that we never imagined.  
It's a powerful thing to create a new community of people having fun and being challenged and creating social connections, and we take this commitment and responsibility seriously. We desire to make this game a reality, just as we made iTabletop a reality and continue to expand and improve it on a regular basis.





"How Will My Money Be Used?"
The money you provide will go toward:

Expanding and improving the iTabletop game platform to build out Thrones of Valor functionality.  
Detailing and refining the Thrones of Valor game design with your help, so we end up with a game that is thrilling and unique to play.  
Purchasing 3D modeling and rendering assets, in-game music and sound effects licensing, and all the other assets that make up a graphical video game.  
Composing and rendering isometric 3D exterior village maps, dwelling and dungeon interior maps, and animated character avatars with a wide variety of body and clothing styles.  
Covering the monthly costs of the game development. We work to keep this low by working virtually from our home offices and not having to pay for an office lease, but we do pay for our server infrastructure through Amazon.com, our business-level Internet connections, and other development necessities.  
Lean spending on marketing. We strive to keep this low as well, first by opting to use this crowdfunding system at IndieGoGo where we can simultaneously raise funding while at the same time build up our initial player base through the perks we offer. We also work to keep marketing funding needs low by building the game to be more viral, whereby it becomes more fun to play when your friends play, so you naturally tell friends about the game and invite them to play for free.

"What Perks Will I Get?"

A fun and valuable perk that gives you something you can do Right Now, in the form of comparably-priced iTabletop Lifetime Accounts for use in RPG gaming, as well as in creating unique worlds to use for video chat and hanging out with friends and family.  
You also get valuable perks that you will put to use as soon as Thrones of Valor is complete. These perks give you ownership of medieval dwellings, special titles and status in the game, special abilities and duties, and one-of-a-kind upgrades that will never be available to people who did not support development of the game. Some Perks you'll see can even give you the ability to name your village or name your realm!  
Additionally all contributors get the ability to immediately join the Thrones of Valor player and developer community! You can jump in right now and get to know players and developers, by forum, text, voice, or video chat built right into the iTabletop software. Help shape the game starting right now.  
Guaranteed inclusion in the Thrones of Valor closed and open betas. Be among the first to play this game.  
Check the perks listed to the right for all the details!





"What if you have already raised your entire goal amount?"
If you find that we've already met our original goal, we ask that you still contribute funds to the effort, and join in and become part of this new kind of emerging MMO. Rising above our goal means we can purchase even more 3D content, music, and sound effects, and afford more labor to build the game, building more features into the game and significantly improving the experience for everyone involved.
As another caveat, additional funding will help us achieve our dream of releasing actual foil-wrapped TCG card packs in retail hobby and game stores! You've seen the TCGs that include serial numbers to unlock the cards online. Well that is a goal we can't wait to see a reality. Please help us blow away our goal amount so we can move forward with our entire vision.




Other Ways You Can Help
Of course spread the word to your friends! Like us on Facebook. Follow us on Twitter. Email this campaign link to your friends! Help us find contributors! Make sure that when you play Thrones of Valor, your friends are also there playing. As an encouragement to seek out your friends for contributing to this campaign, at this early stage we can and will accommodate when you request a group of you to be in the same realm and village. Later when released, to keep the game balanced, these kinds of requests will be more difficult or even possibly unavailable. But again, please help spread the word and seek out contributors with whom you want to play the game!




Thank you so much for your time and for your considering contributing to this unique and fun game. Please be sure to check the Thrones of Valor website for more information on the game, and the iTabletop website for more information on the technology and community we have built there.
 
Sincerely,
 
KnightErrant (James Auld)
Ranger (Ed Blumberg)




Acknowledgments
Thrones of Valor™ trademark Gamesabi, LLC. Thrones of Valor game design copyright (c) 2012 Gamesabi, LLC. iTabletop™ trademark Universal Online Magic LLC




Deep Dive: The Technology
Click here for a deeper dive into the technology.

story:
What is The ManaPot Network?

We're a company dedicated to providing video game streamers with awesome tools and features for their Twitch.tv channel. We believe that viewer interaction is very important when doing live content, and we aim to help make that happen.

The network has two main features, currency and ManaBot.

Stream Currency

Get something out of your viewing experience! Viewers can collect currency on their favorite streams that can then be used for in-game and out-of-game rewards or services. The way the system is setup is to reward those who are loyal and give new viewers something to "work" towards.

Always wanted to play a game of LoL with your favorite streamer, but you never get picked to go? Save up your currency and spend it on a viewer run with them!

Anybody can earn currency just from watching the stream, given out every 15 minutes. You can also obtain currency by making a donation to the stream (as little as $2 USD); allowing you to quickly that viewer run, in-game item, song request, etc.

ManaBot

All members on the network have access to our exclusive chat-bot, ManaBot. If you've ever watched a stream on Twitch, you probably know of NightBot and MooBot. ManaBot is basically the same thing, but has built-in features for network members. Viewers can look-up their currency, bid currency, enter raffles, gamble and more.

ManaBot also has custom command support  allowing streamers to automatically display certain text phrases when specified. Anti-link features are also in place for those who don't want links being posted in their chat.

One of the coolest features that ManaBot has is the gambling feature. Viewers can risk their currency against others in a couple of different ways. This allows for an addictive mini-game that can be played right in your chat, and also serves as a "sink" (pulling currency out of the economy). We've had lots of success and praise about this feature!

The Website

We offer many great features on the ManaPot website such as the ability to create and host raffles. Streamers can setup raffles (Daily, Weekly, Monthly, Yearly) in which viewers can purchase entries to. This means that the more you watch a stream, the better your odds of winning are.

Premium Membership is another feature that we offer. This option is for viewers who want to show their dedication to a stream, earning them a special flair next to their name (when displayed on the website), extra currency every 15 minutes and free raffle entries each week.

We're adding lots of new features to the website and overall system on a weekly basis.

What are funds being used for?

I'm mainly looking for funds so I can hire some additional programmers to help out. I have created and ran this project 100% by myself and it is getting to big for me to handle alone. Funds will also be used to pay for hosting services and other expenses occurred with running everything.

Athene is down, are you?

One of the main network members we have is someone you have all probably heard of, Athene. He contacted me a few weeks ago with interest for joining the program, and after a few Skype calls, is very eager to join. As he put it, this is "a million dollar idea and one of the best ideas to ever come to Twitch". You can see a short clip from one of his videos talking about the point / currency system by clicking here.

How long has the network been active?

I started working on The ManaPot Network around the end of March, so it's been up and running publicly for about one month now. I used the system for about four months myself before deciding to re-code everything from scratch to support multiple users.

In the one month that we've been live, we have generated nearly $3,000 in donations. A lot of streamers were barely bringing in any donations and have seen a huge increase ever since joining the network.

Money isn't everything though! Overall, viewers are pleased with the system and have been giving us lots of positive feedback about everything we have in place and features they would like to see. We believe that making the viewers happy is the most important aspect of the whole system and we're always striving to make that happen.

Backer Rewards

Unfortunately, we don't have a lot to offer those who back our project. You will notice that you get Premium Membership packages with each donation though (on the official ManaPot stream). I have even added a special membership package for backers who support this project a lot (Titanium), something that isn't obtainable any other way.

I hope this doesn't affect the support of this project too much, as it is a really great system. We want to help out the gaming community and make these services and features available to everybody interested, so please help us make that happen!

story:
What Gamerception Is

Gamerception was an idea that was thought up by myself and a good friend of mine. We're both teens with big ideas and both of us have some experience developing simple websites but the complexity of this site and the amount of labor that will be needed to create it will require much larger funds.

Have you ever had a really great idea for a PC game? Maybe you've already made a PC game but don't know how or where to sell it. Or maybe you just want to find a good website to buy PC games from. With Gamerception you will be able to upload anything from a simple flash game to an advanced First Person Shooter game. And here's the best part: uploading a game will be absolutely FREE and you will get to keep 60 to 70% of your profits depending on how many sales you make.

Funds Needed

We think that we will be able to complete our website in three phases: In Phase 1 we will need to raise at least $30,000 to get the website creation started. This should cover the initial price of the web designers and developers. In Phase 2 we will try and raise $30,000 more to cover the price the designers and developers charge. In Phase 3 we will have to raise between 30,000 and $40,000 to launch and maintain the website.

How Your Contribution Helps

Your contribution can help in many ways! Even if you donate a small amount of money it still adds up in the long run and we will be very grateful.

My friend and I have some great connections when it comes to making websites and we'll find the right people to get the job done. Every cent of your contribution will be put to use in making Gamerception a reality.

Anyone Can Help

Sam and I are aware that you may not be able to contribute, even if you would like to. But we want you to know that even if you cannot donate money you can still help us by getting the word out about Gamerception. You can help by "liking" our Facebook page or following us on Twitter. You can also help just by telling people you know about our project.

Thank you for your contribution!

Sincerely,

Jordan Cox and Sam Barber

story:
WELCOME

We are making a PSA to help continue the dialogue about gun violence prevention in our society. This movement has gained legs in recent months, and we want to continue to push the issues forward to help make a positive difference. As both parents and filmmakers; our committment is to actively work towards improving the safety of our communities through the power of the visual medium.

We're not new to the production of a PSA. We’re excited to announce that our recent work, a PSA for raising awareness about domestic violence, was recently launched by the National Domestic Violence Hotline and continues to gain media exposure through press and awards recognition at the Addys. Here’s a link if you would like to read more: http://bit.ly/TLtgqW

 

WHY WE ARE FUNDRAISING:

In order to ensure a PSA is taken seriously and seen by as many people as possible; we have to produce it with quality production values that will enable it to serve its function. Attaining that comes with a real price tag that is beyond our personal means. However, thankfully in the era of digital production, that price tag is now eminently more feasible.

We’ve established a base budget to achieve the necessary quality for this production. Unfortunately, after factoring in the supportive in-kind donations we’ve already had pledged from industry sponsors, we’re still faced with some hard costs we cannot avoid. But, with your help, they are not insurmountable. Any level of support is deeply appreciated and valuable to the making of this production.

 

ABOUT THE PSA:

In an issue that is so complex, we aim to cut to the heart of the matter and focus on the real victims of gun violence – kids. They are our future, and by ignoring this issue and threatening their safety, we endanger the well-being of our entire society.

In our PSA, we focus on a child’s discovery of a gun. How does that child come to understand what a gun is for; its purpose for destruction, and what we as a community think of bringing that into their lives? The PSA's purpose is not to take sides or give answers; but to stimulate an open discourse with the sincere hope of finding solutions.

 

HOW INDIEGOGO WORKS:

By making a pledge, you bring us closer to attaining our goal. If we make the goal within the time limit set, we get the funding. If we don't make the goal in the time limit, we get charged a bigger fee to release the funds; which leaves us with even less money to make the PSA. If you join us in this cause, we will be one step closer to having our voices heard.

 

THANK YOU

If you like the idea of our PSA, we would be grateful for your support, and we'll make it count. If you can't pledge, please share the page with anyone you can. 

Thank you for reading and I hope you will join the effort.

story:
Nov 8th - Campaign complete: EPIC Quest is funded!

Thanks to everyone for their support of the EPIC Quest!! We have already started work and are eager to get all 5 chapters of clues ready to go. Stay tuned in the coming weeks for updates on when the EPIC Quest will launch!

Nov 4th - 100% funded!!!

We are officially over 100% funded! A EPIC-sized 'thank-you' to all the contributors that helped bring us to this point. Keep sharing the good word in the homestretch as there are still prizes and contests going on!

Oct 17th - EPIC Referral Contest:

Win a $200 puzzle prize pack by sharing the campaign link with your network! See more details on the Updates tab. 

Oct 3rd - Contributor Map for NEW UrbanQuest: 

All contributors will get added to this map. At the end of the campaign, we’ll travel to whichever city has the most contributors and create a new UrbanQuest as a sign of our appreciation. Even $1 counts, so make sure to get your city on the map!

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


The EPIC Quest is a huge, online, interactive puzzle. Five chapters, five weeks, $5,000 in cash prizes. The premise: clues and riddles will be hidden in every corner of the internet (think hidden pixels on websites or embedded clues in a cat video). To win and be crowned the EPIC Champion, you just need to solve all five chapters the fastest. You can request an EPIC pre-invite right now and check out a SAMPLE CLUE below: 


We’ve made it our full time job to create great puzzles, so we’re excited to present this one-of-a-kind challenge. We will begin production on EPIC as soon as the campaign wraps up. 


We love the community we live and work in, so it's important to us that we spread the love around. Over the past three years, we've been involved with producing the annual fundraising events for two national charities here in Ottawa, Canada. We're keeping the giving streak alive by letting winners choose a charity to also "win" through EPIC. Each winners' charity will receive a donation equal to the prize money that was won. So if you win $1,000, we'll also donate $1,000 to your charity. That's why we've called it "Win a Little, Give a Little!" 


We grew up on movies like Indiana Jones and have dreamed of becoming real life, mystery-solving heroes. We made a product that gives people a taste of that rush. Our real world UrbanQuest product gets people off the couch and solving clues in their own city. For the EPIC Quest, we wanted to build an online puzzle that everyone could take a crack at. We also got inspiration for the EPIC Quest from books like Ready Player One by Ernest Cline (we highly recommend it to all gamers and ‘80s kids!). 

A few months ago, we brought EPIC to life through a beta test with select users. The reception was very positive and we received great feedback that allowed us to work out the bugs. So, now we’re eager to bring the EPIC Quest to everyone!


As a contributor, you get our endless appreciation, gratitude ... and the following perks!


In order to make the EPIC Quest truly, well, epic, we need to design and build the required areas of the website.  We want it to look great and also have powerful back end technology for a smooth experience. Take a look below to see a breakdown of where the money is going. It mostly consists of awesome stuff like designing a live leaderboard but we’ll admit there is some boring stuff too, like lawyer fees (apparently, we need one).

 


If we raise more than $20,000!

We hope you will be interested in getting behind the biggest puzzle in Internet history.  We appreciate all of your support. Even if the event isn’t for you, we hope you’ll help spread the word about our campaign.  Please use the sharing tools to post about, tweet, and like EPIC! 


There is a team of dedicated puzzle sensei behind EPIC. At the helm are two guys that simply love gaming and a good adventure.  Anthony cut his teeth in San Francisco with the successful start-up Ingenio.com/Keen.com.  He has been involved with three start-ups and has a strong track record of building successful businesses. He considers himself the brains of the operation. Wes is the design guru. He brings to the table seven years of graphic and user design expertise. Wes thinks of himself as the good looks of the company. Both are proud nerds.  


UrbanQuest is where we make cool puzzles all day, when we’re not working on new ideas like EPIC. Our first product is a real world scavenger hunt that feels like the Amazing Race. Groups solve a series of clues that lead them from site to site in a city. It’s fun, you get to see interesting things, and you’ll even learn a thing or two along the way. Click here for a video demo.

Have a question? 

Email us anytime at epic@urbanquest.com!
story_txt:
Nov 8th - Campaign complete: EPIC Quest is funded!
Thanks to everyone for their support of the EPIC Quest!! We have already started work and are eager to get all 5 chapters of clues ready to go. Stay tuned in the coming weeks for updates on when the EPIC Quest will launch!Nov 4th - 100% funded!!!
We are officially over 100% funded! A EPIC-sized 'thank-you' to all the contributors that helped bring us to this point. Keep sharing the good word in the homestretch as there are still prizes and contests going on!
Oct 17th - EPIC Referral Contest:
Win a $200 puzzle prize pack by sharing the campaign link with your network! See more details on the Updates tab. 
Oct 3rd - Contributor Map for NEW UrbanQuest: 
All contributors will get added to this map. At the end of the campaign, we’ll travel to whichever city has the most contributors and create a new UrbanQuest as a sign of our appreciation. Even $1 counts, so make sure to get your city on the map!
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------





The EPIC Quest is a huge, online, interactive puzzle. Five chapters, five weeks, $5,000 in cash prizes. The premise: clues and riddles will be hidden in every corner of the internet (think hidden pixels on websites or embedded clues in a cat video). To win and be crowned the EPIC Champion, you just need to solve all five chapters the fastest. You can request an EPIC pre-invite right now and check out a SAMPLE CLUE below: 









We’ve made it our full time job to create great puzzles, so we’re excited to present this one-of-a-kind challenge. We will begin production on EPIC as soon as the campaign wraps up. 




We love the community we live and work in, so it's important to us that we spread the love around. Over the past three years, we've been involved with producing the annual fundraising events for two national charities here in Ottawa, Canada. We're keeping the giving streak alive by letting winners choose a charity to also "win" through EPIC. Each winners' charity will receive a donation equal to the prize money that was won. So if you win $1,000, we'll also donate $1,000 to your charity. That's why we've called it "Win a Little, Give a Little!" 



We grew up on movies like Indiana Jones and have dreamed of becoming real life, mystery-solving heroes. We made a product that gives people a taste of that rush. Our real world UrbanQuest product gets people off the couch and solving clues in their own city. For the EPIC Quest, we wanted to build an online puzzle that everyone could take a crack at. We also got inspiration for the EPIC Quest from books like Ready Player One by Ernest Cline (we highly recommend it to all gamers and ‘80s kids!). 
A few months ago, we brought EPIC to life through a beta test with select users. The reception was very positive and we received great feedback that allowed us to work out the bugs. So, now we’re eager to bring the EPIC Quest to everyone!




As a contributor, you get our endless appreciation, gratitude ... and the following perks!














In order to make the EPIC Quest truly, well, epic, we need to design and build the required areas of the website.  We want it to look great and also have powerful back end technology for a smooth experience. Take a look below to see a breakdown of where the money is going. It mostly consists of awesome stuff like designing a live leaderboard but we’ll admit there is some boring stuff too, like lawyer fees (apparently, we need one).
 




If we raise more than $20,000!



We hope you will be interested in getting behind the biggest puzzle in Internet history.  We appreciate all of your support. Even if the event isn’t for you, we hope you’ll help spread the word about our campaign.  Please use the sharing tools to post about, tweet, and like EPIC! 





There is a team of dedicated puzzle sensei behind EPIC. At the helm are two guys that simply love gaming and a good adventure.  Anthony cut his teeth in San Francisco with the successful start-up Ingenio.com/Keen.com.  He has been involved with three start-ups and has a strong track record of building successful businesses. Click here for a video demo.
Have a question? 
Email us anytime at epic@urbanquest.com!

story:
Grassroots Gaming Expo

October 18-19 2013

About Us

                                                                    

     Hello, my name is Elizabeth Bolinger and I'm the co-founder of Grassroots Gaming Expo.  I've been a gamer my entire life, either watching my parents play video games or playing them myself.  Video games have always been a big part of my life. 

In 2010, I started setting world records, and now have over 100 verified records, as well as being featured in the Guinness Book Of World Records: Gamer's Edition 2012 for "The Most Prolific Dancing Game High Scorer."  Over the last three years, I've also dedicated a lot of time volunteering for various charities, such as Child's Play, Able Gamers, The International Video Game Hall Of Fame and the American Cancer Society.  I try to combine gaming with charity work.
 
 

     My husband and I conceived of the idea of Grassroots Gaming Expo after a local event by the International Video Game Hall Of Fame fizzled out only two months prior to the event date in 2011.  We wanted to give the people that were already planning on coming to Ottumwa an event to go to, so with only two months to pull it off, we managed to gather enough local support to make it happen.

     This year, we want to not only continue to do the event, but we want to make it better.  We want to make our event the most interactive and enjoyable gaming event possible.

This year, we will be holding GGE on Friday and Saturday, October 18th and 19th at the Advanced Technology Center (ATC) at Indian Hills Community College.

 

What We Need And What You Get

     All money raised will go to fund the infrastructure of the event.  The venue rental fees, needed equipment and staffing/lodging expenses.  The amount we set our goal at is less than the actual operating costs of the event, but that is the bare minimum of what we need.  Anything raised in excess of our goal will go towards event costs.  Anything in excess of the operating costs will go towards next years event.  If we do not reach our goal, the event will still go on, and all available funds will still be applied to operating costs.  We are confident that we will meet our goal.

 

 
This years event will take place at the Advanced Technology Center at IHCC.
 
     We think that the perks we are offering are pretty enticing.  From simply being named as a sponsor, to exclusive merchandise, all the way up to special VIP treatment at the event, there is a little something for everyone.

$5 Donor Button
 
     Your contributions will have a great impact on our event by not only helping to make it possible, but to help pave the way for more events to be held in the Midwest.  There is a great deal of interest in gaming outside of the east and west coasts, but not a lot of events happening.  We believe that every event benefits all events, and your support can help that idea grow.
 

How you can help

 
     Aside from donating money, there are plenty of ways you can help.  The easiest is to help spread the word through friends and social media. IndieGoGo has some great sharing tools available.
 
     We will gladly accept donations of gaming and networking equipment.  We are not a non-profit, so your donation would not be tax deductible, but it would still be greatly appreciated.
 
     If you are in the area, you can also volunteer your time to help at the event. 
 
     You can get in contact with us via e-mail at: grassrootsgamingexpo@gmail.com
 
 

Thank you!

 

Elizabeth Bolinger

Grassroots Gaming Expo

story:
As the global demand for fossil fuels increases countries begin invading one another and stealing the resources. This causes worldwide conflicts such as in the middle east where the land is fought over. During this time, Britain is able to grow its army and economy, it also uses the opportunity of desperation to grow its empire as it conquers Iceland and The Republic of Ireland. There is little retaliation as most of Europe is crippled. As Britain becomes more and more powerful, the Prime Minister Victor Natas is becoming more erratic as he believes that he will be invaded by other countries in need. The USA has now annexed Venezuela as to have better access to their oil supplies. In the English Channel, a massive oil reserve is discovered, the UK Government attempts to cover this up, however America finds out. Assuming their alliance is still intact, America deploys troops to the UK in order to annex the UK and retrieve oil. The UK Government finds out about this and believes that the UK is being invaded by the USA, acting under pressure, Natas launches multiple inter-continental nuclear ballistic missiles which strike major Northern-American cities and wipe out a signifigant proportion of the population. The American troops in the UK are wiped out by the British Army and the UK officially declares war on the US. 

Exnite is multiplayer only with servers of up to eighteen players with nine versus nine teams. Exnite strives to create realism through it's horror art style of graphics. 

System Requirements: 
MINIMUM: 
OS: Windows XP/7 (32-bit) 
Processor: Intel Pentium 4 @ 3.2 Ghz / AMD 3200+ XP 
Memory: 2 GB RAM 
Graphics: DirectX 9.0c capable graphics chip with at least 256MBs of VRAM 
Hard Drive: 3 GB available space 

RECOMMENDED: 
OS: Windows 10 (64-bit) 
Processor: Intel Core 2 Duo E8400 @ 3.0 GHz / AMD Phenom X4 9600B @ 2.3 GHz 
Memory: 4 GB RAM 
Graphics: nVidia GeForce GTX 650 / AMD Radeon HD 7750 
DirectX: Version 11 
Hard Drive: 3 GB available space

story:
Bit Evil S.A.- we grew up, just like all people do, we got steady and respectable jobs at big firms and unexpectedly it turned out that we didn't like our average 9 to 5 office jobs. But lets skip the boring story of our everyday struggles in lives we didn't want to lead and go straight to happy ending.

After a few talks we decided life is to short to spend it being bored and unhappy. We got together and created Bit Evil S.A. which is everything that we have dreamt of. Now we can put our hearts, minds and efforts behind projects we believe in and are passionate about. It’s our a “little bit evil” way to deliver games, comics, clothing and a lot of cool stuff for everyone to enjoy. We created a few games for Android, which you can check out on Google Play right now! Whatever you do, whoever and wherever you are, we want to bring joy and excitement to your life with our games.

We are the new kid on the block of games industry, we have heads full of ideas, but we lack funds. Sadly, in this world you can't pay in huggs and rainbows, you need real money. And that is why we are here, to share with you our passion project game Space Pogo and ask for your help to make it happen!

Our Team:

★ Andrzej – Commander in chief of Space Pogo world. Has the vision of everything that Space Pogo can become.

★ Anna – First mate keeping everyone and everything in cheeck with a smile on her face. Definitely a Space Pogo believer.

★ Piotr – First, Second & Third Engineer of our Spaceship or as some might simply call him Graphic designer extraordinaire.

★ Katarzyna - Communications, Data Collection & Management Technician,  embarking on a first space adventure with the team of Space Pogo





Long, long ago in a distant galaxy...sounds familiar? We know! Just see for yourself what it feels like! It's a speace shooter with unique graphics design. Are you ready for Space Pogo?

Have you ever wanted to become a captain of your own spaceship? Space Pogo is here to give you that chance! It doesn't matter if you're big or small, girl or a guy, young or old. Space Pogo is great fun for everyone.

So how does the story goes?

Imagine you live your happy life in peace and one day an unexpected threat appears out of nowhere. Hostile race of aliens is gunning for your home planet. What do you do? What can you do? Well it's Space Pogo time! You get a ship and go out there to fight the enemy! Space is a frighteningly huge and dangerous place, but you're not afraid are you? In the world of Space Pogo you are the only thing that stands between total annihilation of your planet and those wicked aliens.


The rules of Space Pogo are quite simple!

  1. You have to be quick and precise to control your space ship and avoid the deadly asteroids coming at you!

  2. Remember those ugly, mean aliens we talked about? You have to shoot em up before they'll shoot you up! Also don't let them get to close, or you' ll lose!

  3. Earn your points! Unlock achievements and new weapons that will help you fight the good fight! There is no room for mercy for the enemy in Space Pogos world!

Remember if you play your cards right at Space Pogo, you can Pogo yourself out of this space mess and end up on top!


How did Space Pogo came about?

So what is Space Pogo all about? Do you remember those old school shooter games? You know those of likes of Galaxian and Space Invaders – they were pure joy and entertainment! We do remember and love them. And idea for Space Pogo was born out of our love for this type of games and nostalgia for the simple pleasure playing them brought us.

As everything we create Space Pogo was born and gained it first shape in our idea incubator. The Ahoy (The Ahoy) our unique platform for artists was the source of graphics for Space Pogo. 

We are extremely grateful to Adrianna Glowacka who designed Space Pogo graphics for us. She is an amazing young polish concept artist and illustrator with specialization in character design. Adrianna prides herself in working mainly for games industries as this is where her true love lays. 

Check out Adriannas work at

http://adriannaglowacka.com/

Music in our game is the result of long search for simple yet unique sound. Gameplay and rules we used in Space Pogo are a compromise between desire to create the most difficult game in the world and developing the arcade game you can play with one hand.

We created Space Pogo combining the simpicity of storys from those oldschool games, graeat graphics, sound and our unique ideas.

We love Space Pogo and we want you to love it to! That is why we want to make it better every day.


Space Pogo for Android!


As for now in Space Pogo you can choose one of two availbal space ships and start your space quest. Travel through space moving right and left avoiding asteroids and your enemies attacs. Shoot your enemies before they shoot you! You'll be batteling four different alien creatures which might be challenging in the begining, but don't get discouraged and figt to save your planet! Shoot aliens, gain points and unlock achievements&guns. Gaining access to guns will make your fight so much easier and more entertaining!



1. Naughty Peacemaker



2. Little Rascal 




1. The Terrible Vaspler – always giving you the intergalactic stink eye, charging with sharp fangs



2. Flash The Snailer – beware of those hypnotizing big eyes and sharp teeth, he shoots to kill



3. Almighty Callamarie – knows no mercy for enemies, so get rid of him before he gets rid of you



4. Four eyed Crusher - beware of the innocent looking ones, they usually turns out to be the most dangerous ones




1. Blaster   2. Multi Gun   3. Double Gun   4. Machine Gun   5. Shotgun   


The best way to find out how Space Pogo looks now is to download free demo version of the game from Googel Play. 



We have big plans for Space Pogo, but remember it will only happen if you guys believe in us and grace us with your support. We created Space Pogo for Android, but we want as many pople as possible to enjoy our game and with additional funding we are hoping to bring Space Pogo to iOS and later also to other platforms.

For now the story of Space Pogo is pretty straight forward – you choose a spaceship and fight aliens to live another day.

We want to make the game more enjoyable and diverse so we plan on getting everything bigger&better. Creating new levels, spaceships&enemies, guns&achievements, more undiscovered corners of galaxy for you to explore! Every level will have its own BOSS – big, nasty and dangerous super alien making you life harder and playing more revarding.

As spirit of competition is important we want to introduce daily challenges that will keep you engaged playing everyday!

We also want to build a Space Pogo community and enable you to use multiplayer mode! That way you can join forces with other space captains! Fighting hand in hand or more likley spaceship in spaceship for the sake of your planet. Meet other warriors like you and Pogo in space!

Piotr and his vivid imagination are always working to bring the new big bad enemies to the world of Space Pogo.

Here is the first look at our soon to be first Boss!

Tremble before Spiker The Conqueror!



With the generous support and help from our contributors we will be abel to complete Space Pogo and keep it running in the future!



You're not only helping us to create great&entertaining game you will most definitely enjoy playing. By donating to Space Pogo project you can get some nice perks!

You have plenty goodies to chose from:



Space Gratitude

★ Gratitude from space! PDF Thank you note! 


Space Gratitude Delux

★Gratitude from space! PDF Thank you note!

★Space Pogo wallpaper!


Digital Space Goodies Basic

★ Gratitude from space! PDF Thank you note! 

★ Space Pogo wallpaper! 

★ digital Space Pogo cut-out


Digital Space Goodies Basic

★ Gratitude from space! PDF Thank you note! 

★ Space Pogo wallpaper x3! 

★ digital Space Pogo cut-out 

★ your space ship in our cut-out 

★ social media shout out 


Digital Space Goodies Deluxe

★ Gratitude from space! PDF Thank you note! 

★ Space Pogo wallpaper x3! 

★ digital Space Pogo cut-out 

★ your space ship in our cut-out 

★ social media shout out 

★ all weapons unlocked 



Cosmic Well-Wisher

★ Gratitude from space! PDF Thank you note! 

★ Space Pogo wallpaper x3! 

★ digital Space Pogo cut-out 

★ your space ship in our cut-out 

★ social media shout out 

★ all weapons unlocked 

★ your name engraved on one of the Space Pogo asteroids 



Cosmic Supporter

★ Gratitude from space! PDF Thank you note! 

★ Space Pogo wallpaper x3! 

★ digital Space Pogo cut-out 

★ your space ship in our cut-out 

★ social media shout out 

★ all weapons unlocked 

★ your name engraved on one of the Space Pogo asteroids 

★ Space Pogo T shirt (6 patterns) 



Cosmic Booster

★ Gratitude from space! PDF Thank you note! 

★ Space Pogo wallpaper x3! 

★ digital Space Pogo cut-out 

★ your space ship in our cut-out 

★ social media shout out 

★ all weapons unlocked 

★ your name engraved on one of the Space Pogo asteroids 

★ Space Pogo sweatshirt (2 patterns) 



Cosmic Benefactor

★ Gratitude from space! PDF Thank you note! 

★ Space Pogo wallpaper x3! 

★ digital Space Pogo cut-out 

★ your space ship in our cut-out 

★ social media shout out 

★ all weapons unlocked 

★ your name engraved on one of the Space Pogo asteroids 

★ Space Pogo sweatshirt (2 patterns) 

★ Set of stickers: Space Pogo Golden Thoughts for rainy days 



Cosmic Patron

★ Gratitude from space! PDF Thank you note! 

★ Space Pogo wallpaper x3! 

★ digital Space Pogo cut-out 

★ your space ship in our cut-out 

★ social media shout out 

★ all weapons unlocked 

★ your name engraved on one of the Space Pogo asteroids 

★ Set of stickers: Space Pogo Golden Thoughts for rainy days 

★ Space Pogo 3D figure (2 patterns) 



We decided to use crowdfunding as we are a small indie game developer and this was only way we could obtain funds necessary for further development of Space Pogo. We did everything we could with little money we had, pouring our hearts, souls, time and efforts into Space Pogo.

After surfing endless number of crowdfunding sites from all over the world we set our hearts on Indiegogo as it seem to be the best fit for us. Great community of like minded people sharing passion and believe that dreams do come true. We believe that Indiegogo community will see Space Pogos potential, fall in love with it and help us shape it into the best version of itself it could possibly be.

We are here with everything we've got, counting on your support to make Space Pogo a great and fun game for everyone!



As we mentioned before we are a small studio just begining our journey with games industries. We have limited resources and for now we are only armed in our talent, ideas and concentrated power of will. Nothing would make us happier than further developing Space Pogo, making it better and more fun to play for all of you out there. We come from different backgrounds but we share passion for Space Pogo, and we want to deliver the best version of this game that we can create.

Every dollar and cent you donate will go to the games development, and you, our backers will have a part in making Space Pogo happen.


Thank you for all your support! We would love for everyone to be able to donate but we understand sometimes it's just not possible. However there are different ways you can help! Please help us spread the word about Space Pogo campaign to your friends. Sharing our social media and Space Pogo Indiegogo campaign is making it more likely for this game to become what we know it can be - dangerously engaging and highly addictive fun for everyone! We would also love your feed back. Download and play Space Pogo and then let us know what you liked and what do you think we should change!

Let's make it happen together 'coz Space Pogo won't happen without you!

So what is Space Pogo all about? Do you remember those
old school shooter games? You know those of likes of Galaxian and
Space Invaders – they were pure joy and entertainment! We do
remember and love them. And idea for Space Pogo was born out of our
love for this type of games and nostalgia for the simple pleasure
playing them brought us.
As
everything we create Space Pogo was born and gained it first shape in
our idea incubator. The Ahoy (The Ahoy) our unique platform
for artists was the source of graphics for Space Pogo. 
We are extremely grateful to Adrianna Glowacka who designed Space Pogo graphics for us. She is an amazing young polish concept artist and illustrator with specialization in character design. Adrianna prides herself in working mainly for games industries as this is where her true love lays. 
Check out Adriannas work at
http://adriannaglowacka.com/
Music in our
game is the result of long search for simple yet unique sound. 
Gameplay and rules we used in Space Pogo are a compromise between
desire to create the most difficult game in the world and developing
the arcade game you can play with one hand.

We created Space Pogo combining the simpicity of storys
from those oldschool games, graeat graphics, sound and our unique
ideas.

We love Space Pogo and we want you to love it to! That
is why we want to make it better every day.


Space Pogo for Android!

As for now in
Space Pogo you can choose one of two availbal space ships and start
your space quest. Travel through space moving right and left avoiding
asteroids and your enemies attacs. Shoot your enemies before they
shoot you! You'll be batteling four different alien creatures which
might be challenging in the begining, but don't get discouraged and
figt to save your planet! Shoot aliens, gain points and unlock
achievements&guns. Gaining access to guns will make your fight so
much easier and more entertaining!




1. Naughty
Peacemaker



2. Little
Rascal 







1. The
Terrible Vaspler – always giving you the intergalactic stink eye,
charging with sharp fangs



2. Flash The
Snailer – beware of those hypnotizing big eyes and sharp teeth, he
shoots to kill



3. Almighty
Callamarie – knows no mercy for enemies, so get rid of him before
he gets rid of you



4. Four eyed
Crusher - beware of the innocent looking ones, they usually turns out
to be the most dangerous ones









1. Blaster   2.
Multi Gun   3. Double Gun   4. Machine Gun   5. Shotgun    


The best
way to find out how Space Pogo looks now is to download free demo version of the game from Googel Play. 



We
have big plans for Space Pogo, but remember it will only happen if
you guys believe in us and grace us with your support. We created
Space Pogo for Android, but we want as many pople as possible to
enjoy our game and with additional funding we are hoping to bring
Space Pogo to iOS and later also to other platforms.
For
now the story of Space Pogo is pretty straight forward – you choose
a spaceship and fight aliens to live another day.
We
want to make the game more enjoyable and diverse so we plan on
getting everything bigger&better. Creating new
levels, spaceships&enemies, guns&achievements,
more undiscovered corners of galaxy for you to explore! Every level
will have its own BOSS
– big, nasty and dangerous super alien
making you life harder and playing more revarding.
As
spirit of competition is important we want to introduce daily
challenges that
will keep you engaged playing everyday!
We
also want to build a Space Pogo community and enable you to use
multiplayer mode!
That way you can join forces with other space captains! Fighting hand
in hand or more likley spaceship in spaceship for the sake of your
planet. Meet other warriors like you and
Pogo in space!
Piotr and his vivid imagination are always working to bring the new big bad enemies to the world of Space Pogo.Here is the first look at our soon to be first Boss! Tremble before Spiker The Conqueror!


With
the generous support and help from our contributors we will be abel
to complete Space Pogo and keep it running in the future!




You're not
only helping us to create great&entertaining game you will most
definitely enjoy playing. By donating to Space Pogo project you can
get some nice perks!
You have plenty goodies to chose from:




Space Gratitude
★ Gratitude from
space! PDF Thank you note! 



Space Gratitude Delux

from space! PDF Thank you note!

Pogo wallpaper!

from space! PDF Thank you note!

Pogo wallpaper!

Space Pogo cut-out

from space! PDF Thank you note!

Pogo wallpaper x3!

Space Pogo cut-out

ship in our cut-out

media shout out

unlocked
