We decided to
use crowdfunding as we are a small indie game developer and this was
only way we could obtain funds necessary for further development of
Space Pogo. We did everything we could with little money we had,
pouring our hearts, souls, time and efforts into Space Pogo.
After surfing
endless number of crowdfunding sites from all over the world we set
our hearts on Indiegogo as it seem to be the best fit for us. Great 
community of like minded people sharing passion and believe that
dreams do come true. We believe that Indiegogo community  will see
Space Pogos potential, fall in love with it and help us shape it into
the best version of itself it could possibly be.
We are here
with everything we've got, counting on your support to make Space
Pogo a great and fun game for everyone!



As
we mentioned before we are a small studio just begining our journey
with games industries. We have limited resources and for now we are
only armed in our talent, ideas and concentrated power of will.
Nothing would make us happier than further developing Space Pogo,
making it better and more fun to play for all of you out there. We
come from different backgrounds but we share passion for Space Pogo,
and we want to deliver the best version of this game that we can
create.
Every
dollar and cent you donate will go to the games development, and you,
our backers will have a part in making Space Pogo happen.





Thank
you for all your support! We would love for everyone to be able to
donate but we understand sometimes it's just not possible. However
there are different ways you can help! Please help us spread the word
about Space Pogo campaign to your friends. Sharing our social media
and Space Pogo Indiegogo campaign is making it more likely for this
game to become what we know it can be - dangerously engaging and
highly addictive fun for everyone! We would also love your feed back.
Download and play Space Pogo and then let us know what you liked and
what do you think we should change!
Let's
make it happen together 'coz Space Pogo won't happen without you!

story:
We Need Your Help!

We're currently in the prototyping phase. We have a working program set up for the controller and are ready to source all the necessary hardware to build some prototypes for testing. Our plan is to build 3-5 prototypes utilizing different housings to see which will provide the best user-friendly experience.

Our plan is to build 3-5 prototypes utilizing different housings to see which will provide the best user-friendly experience.

story:
Story of E-Path, The game

Half a year ago, we came up with an idea for a logic game. As a player you have to activate all the tiles of the floor. The challenge? There will be broken tiles and other obstacles - like teleports, fire and ice - that will make it harder to you. Also, you never have the chance to go back. “E-path” will make you think.

But this is just the beginning! After six months of hard work with no other resources than our best hopes, we have finally finished “e-path.” You can download it here:

https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=markit.game

We want you all to play “e-path” for free, because we think that you all should have the chance to try it.

The aim of our company is to create a new set of challenging and entertaining games. Our first big try is “e-path” and we hope that as many people as possible will like it.

The future of E-Path

First of all, we invite everyone to play it and contribute giving us feedback. After that, we would love to improve it, adding a new version with Online Challenges (where you will be able to send the maps to your friends), Cooperative Online Mode, “e-path” available for other platforms and so on.

We do believe in this game. We wanted to play this kind of game while we where waiting for the bus and we have programmed it. We wanted challenges for our minds and also an enthralling game. Would you like to be part of our project?

What is the help for & What you will get

In order to complete all next stages of the development of the game, we need our own servers and more fellow programmers that would want to help us in this adventure.

All the money will be invested in the servers for the game and the development team in order to add the following features:

  • Sharing the maps you generate with other friends.
  • Compare your scores with other people all around the world.
  • Create your own maps, not only done randomly, but by choosing each tile type and position.
  • Create new kinds of tiles, to make it even more interesting.
  • Have an Ad-free version.
  • Create tournaments, as if it is the new kind of "chess" sport.
  • Direct online playing in cooperative mode.

If more income than expected is achieved, also an iOS, Windows Phone 8, and browser version will be developed.

If the goal is not reached, the features will also be planned, but not all of them will be available or released (due to server costs / people work).

The Impact

The world of smartphones and tablets has already arived. A good maze game, with online features should be created. Social networks + thinking games is the best for everyone.

Help us to create the most challenging and interesting maze game ever seen. We believe in e-path, and also hope you do as well.

Other Ways You Can Help

Although the money is useful for upgrading the game, a social game like this one won’t get far if you do not share it with your friends. Help us giving feedback, ideas and sharing it with your friends and family. Lets change the world!

story:
Bonjour à tous,

Je m'appelle Alain Truffier (Alias Angelstar) et je suis le créateur de plusieurs jeux en ligne dont 650km.com et Druidik.com.

J'ai fondé mon entreprise "Les mots dits Français" pour permettre aux milliers de joueurs en ligne de profiter de nouveaux concepts, add-on et animations au sein de mes jeux.


Ce projet de financement INDIEGOGO permet de remplacer l'ancienne boutique en ligne de 650km.com.

 

Il vous permet de faire vos achats en toute sécurité et de recevoir vos KM-POINTS sous 24 heures après le crédit des achats sur le compte de 650KM

(dans le projet j'ai mis une date de livraison au 1 septembre parcequ'il faut mettre une date...

Je vous invite à mettre à jour vos informations personnelles dans 650km.Com afin que je puisse faire la liaison entre le contributeur INDIEGOGO et le joueur de 650km!

Grâce à ces fonds il me sera possible de maintenir le jeu en état et également de pouvoir créer de nouveaux scénarios et objets pour les prochaines ruines.

 

Il est donc désormais possible d'utiliser vos cartes de crédits ainsi que vos comptes Paypal pour obtenir des KM-POINTS!

 

Comme ce projet et vos paiements sont liés à mon activités dans le jeu j'ai décidé de présenter une échelle de travaux qui sera fait en fonction de vos contributions totales :

  

PALIER DE CONTRIBUTION

TRAVAUX QUI SERONT EFFECTUES

100 $

 Mise en ligne de nouveaux objets en boutique (pack armure de nowel, épée magnétique)

500 $

Créations d'une nouvelle salle des ruines + 1 nouvel objet surprise collector!

800 $

Mise en ligne de nouveaux objets en boutique (Pack appât, Pack armure d'ours)

1000 $

Création d'une nouvelle salle des ruines de niveau intermédiaire.

1500 $

Mise en ligne de nouveaux objets en boutique (Pack anciens)

2000 $

Création d'une nouvelle salle des ruines + 1 nouvel objet surprise collector!

4000 $

Nouvelle quête in-game dans la lignée de Rakham pour les connaisseurs :)

 

Merci à vous et n'hésitez pas à soutenir l'autre projet que j'ai lancé pour vous faire partir en vacance!

 

 

Alain Truffier / Angelstar

story:
Thanks for visiting this page. We are a small group of young non-profit professionals wishing to start our own initiative to work with underprivileged and street children. KHEL is a Hindi work meaning 'play' (verb) or 'game'(noun). As an acronym for Kids Holistic Education and Life-skills, KHEL is a novel program which uses sports and games to achieve developmental outcomes. Working with underprivileged and street children both in and out of school using games as a platform, we hope to bring about positive change in their lives. We recognise children’s ‘right to play’ and believe that sports, in itself, builds character and teaches important life-lessons. Using sports and games as a platform we will work with children towards various goals - be it getting drop-outs back to school, keeping street children away from substance abuse or deviant behaviour, improving important life-skills,imparting key health messages or linking them with further education/ vocational training opportunities.

At KHEL, we do not profess to know exactly what is needed and we believe there is no ‘one size fits all’ solution to each child’s needs. Our aim is to first have fun, something sorely lacking in many a child’s dictionary, and then to work towards a better future for each individual, while still having fun!

We have put in our own money to begin operations in the first week of July and we will soon have our website up where you can follow progress. However, the money won't last long and as a start-up non-profit it is almost impossible to raise money from anyone other than well-wishers. We hope to raise enough money to be able to start our program which will, hopefully, allow us to write grant applications in a year or two. we dont have much to offer by way of perks but gratitude. Major contributors can, if they wish, visit us any time in India, get free acocomodation at our project site (Lucknow) and volunteer with the children playing cricket, soccer or other games.

Please share this among your networks as well. If you have a bank account in India and would like to support us, you can donate directly instead of through this site by getting in touch with one of the team members.

story:
The Gun Channels Project

Members have grown Gun Channels into a large and feature packed community. 

It is time to expand our features to include mobile applications

What We Need 

We need to hire developers and cover fees for the new Gun Channels Mobile App

What You Get

To help fund this effort we have teamed up with Etched Ordnance (Tulsa, OK) to laser engrave our own copper Gun Channels Challenge Coins 

  • Limited Edition 2016 coin design


The Coin

This is our first Gun Channels Coin:

  • Unique 2016 Design (not dated)
  • 0.999% Copper
  • 100% Made in the U.S.A.
Heads:
  • Our Gun Channels G logo, with raised edge
Tails:
  • Second Amendment written out around border
  • Assortment of guns represents the firearms community 

Risks & Challenges

We will make these as they are ordered, so no risk of not receiving the coins.

Other Ways You Can Help

Dont want a coin?

  • Contribute a few bucks to the Mobile App campaign
  • Join Gun Channels (it's FREE) 
  • Contribute to Gun Channels.com & get a patch
  • Spread the word about Gun Channels and the Mobile App / Challenge Coin campaign

Thank You

story:
Imagine you’re playing in your fantasy football league championship. It’s the 4th quarter of the Monday night game. You’re up by a point, but you don’t have any active players left. Your opponent still has their RB1 left to play.

You’re pretty well screwed.

So what do you do?

Well, up until now, you couldn’t actually do anything. Fantasy football means drafting, scouring the waiver wire, picking a lineup…then waiting and watching – powerless.

That ends right here.

Dragons & Gridirons is a new, interactive version of fantasy football, where you get the power to impact the outcome as your matchup unfolds. You'll customize your team with over 100 spell cards that do everything from boost your players’ yardage to banish opponent players to the X-Zone.

Dragons & Gridirons is based on traditional, season-long fantasy football. You form a league of 11 or so friends, draft your teams from the current pool of NFL players, and then face off in head-to-head battles  ("matchups" in FF speak) each week of the real world football season.

The outcome of each battle is the result of both traditional fantasy scoring (i.e., you earn fantasy points when players on your team earn stats in their real life NFL games), and the impact of your/your opponent’s use of spell cards.

Let's say you have a running back who got you 10 fantasy points one week, from 40 rushing yards (4 points) plus a touchdown (6 points).

If you had the foresight to play your the Double TD Points spell card on him before he found the end zone, you'd end up with 16 points from that player. (4 + 6x2).

Some spells, like Snow Day, will impact your entire league! Even the more basic cards can be directly applied to any valid player in your league*. Feel like meddling in a battle that you're not  a part of, to try to tilt the standings in your favor? You can do that! Just don't blame us if your league gangs up on you next week..

(*This ability can be toggled on/off when setting up your league, so if this is too cutthroat for your group, just turn it off before drafting.)

It’s up to you to decide whether you use multiple small spell effects or go for broke with one powerful spell that could turn the tide of the game.

Spell cards go into effect in real time. Do you play your hand early to capture the full benefit? Or do you wait and see how things are playing out, at the risk of failing to get a boost on some big plays?

Each team begins the season with the same set of basic spell cards, and then you get to choose three new spell cards to add to your deck each week that advance you up various skill trees. This occurs as a basic and automatic game mechanic - there are no micro-transactions in Dragons & Gridirons. Each team will have the exact same access to spell cards as any other team - no money or "currency" required.

We've included more details in our FAQ (at the very bottom) for any rule lawyers out there. Start plotting your loopholes to exploit now!

For those unfamiliar with Indiegogo: funding can work on a flexible basis, or an all-or-nothing basis. To underscore our ironclad commitment to seeing Dragons & Gridirons all the way through, we've chosen flexible funding.  That means we'll receive whatever funds are pledged, regardless of whether our goal is met, and we're going to move forward with the project, even if the funding falls shorts.

If you think our goal seems like less than what's needed for a project of this scale, you'd be right. Our goal amount reflects only what's left after our considerable investment (both years and money) into the project. Our inner circle also came up big in our previous crowdfunding effort.

We have some great Perks in store for those who back our project! Tiers ranges from $3 to $5000, so hopefully everyone can find a level that works for them and delivers them something valuable in return for their generous support of Dragons & Gridirons.

If you're not in a position to pledge a financial contribution, we would also be very, very grateful for your support in spreading the word to friends! Use the buttons below to automatically share a link to our campaign. You never know who else might want to contribute.

Up until just a few years ago, neither one of use was what you would call a die-hard football fan. Though we both followed our home team (who dey!), we didn’t know a tight end from an end run.

That was until we were introduced to fantasy football.

As life-long fans of role-playing games, it took only a few weeks of fantasy football for the similarities between the two to become obvious. You assemble a team of different classes, carefully manage who’s in your party, and then get into random encounters where the outcome of the battle is all about stats vs stats. Interest became obsession within weeks. We found ourselves tuning in to games just to watch a kicker on a team we never even cared about before.

We were hooked.

And as we discussed our new appreciation for football – both real and fantasy – we both realized how much fun it would it be if fantasy football could be expanded into something more interactive and off the wall. Something that felt a bit more like a game, and a bit less like dueling box scores. A game where your stats could grow over time, based on your personal choices and customization preferences, to make your team even more your own.

And thus, Dragons & Gridirons was born. Two years later, we’re ready to unleash our creation on the world. But we need your help to get this thing going!

The core of the D&G team is Fantasy Realm Sports, LLC; Co-Founders: Edward and Jay. Recognizing the scope of the project and our own skills and not-skills, we've tapped friends and professionals alike to help with the project. Development is being handled by a highly skilled studio that specializes in fantasy sports applications.

Edward C. Wright, Ph.D., is a writer, entrepreneur, and board certified clinical psychologist. He grew up in Cincinnati and went to Miami University before receiving his M.A. and Ph.D. in Clinical Psychology from George Mason University. He now lives in Boston with his girlfriend and two cats. He finds inspiration in video games, anime, graphic novels, sci-fi movies, and Armin van Buurin’s A State of Trance radio show.  He is the author of upcoming post-apocalyptic martial arts novel, The Teleknight, and a bunch of psychology stuff that you've never heard of.

Jay Wilson is a designer, developer, and production facilitator of advanced weapons and accessories. A Cincinnati native, Jay has a bachelors degree from The College of Design, Architecture, Art, and Planning at the University of Cincinnati, and has worked with specifiers, suppliers, and OEM sellers of both private and government ordnance systems. Jay is an enthusiastic eater and chef, an avid hiker and cyclist, and a lover of adventure and hijinks. He resides in a cyberpunk dystopian urban core with his wife and a miniature black panther that is most assuredly not a common house cat.

As you can plainly see from the football below, we've been making steady progress, and things have really taken off since establishing our development team. We've left ourselves plenty of time to deliver an amazing experience with the 2018 season.

Thank you for your support of Dragons & Gridirons! This geeky fever dream is only possible through your kindness and generosity!

Risks and challenges

The key challenge will be the web development work of implementing the unique features of Dragons and Gridirons in a web application. We’ve contracted with a development team that’s highly specialized and experienced in fantasy sports, and we’ve already completed the site designs. Based on their proven track record in this area, we’re very confident that they can get the job done.

Cost overruns are a natural concern when it comes to web development. We will do whatever it takes to complete this project once it is funded, even if our expenses turn out to be greater than anticipated. We take our commitment to our backers extremely seriously.

We’ve made it a point to set this process in motion well in advance of the 2018 season, and so we don’t anticipate our timeline to be a risk. Our developers have provided an estimate of 19 weeks to complete the rest of the development. That gives us a projected completion date around the end of this year’s football season, with 5-6 months to do additional testing and preparation.

Finally, game balance will be important to making DnG as entertaining as it can be. We’ll be using archival fantasy data to look at the average impact of each card, to refine what week they unlock, how many magic points they use up, and whether they have a cooldown cost. Of course, every week is different, so there will never be a no-brainer “best” set of cards to use. And that’s part of the fun! Some cards will turn out to be a better value than others. Figuring out which will be a part of gaining an edge over the rest of your league…

FAQ

So is this some kind of video game?

Dragons & Gridirons is a web application (software you access through a web site) for hosting fantasy football leagues. It's not a game that you download, just a web site that you go to where you can play in one of our unique fantasy football leagues.

How do I get spell cards?

Teams begin the season with the same set of basic spell cards. You get 3 new spell cards each week. You simply choose which 3 you want to add to your deck from the spell card library. There is no real-life money involved in this process - selecting these new spell cards is a normal game mechanic.

How much do spell cards cost?

They're FREE. There are no micro-transactions in Dragons & Gridirons. You get to choose 3 new spell cards each week (through week 10) as a game mechanic.

Ah, so I buy "gold pieces" with real world money, and use those to trade in f-

NO

Why even have 100+ spell cards when I'll just pick the most powerful ones and spam them week after week to destroy my friends? FOOLS!

Not so fast. There are two rules guiding your choice of spell cards:

1) Each spell card fits within a tier of similarly powerful spells, and higher up tiers remain locked (unavailable for anyone to select) until later weeks in the fantasy season. A new tier of spell cards unlocks each week up until week 10, at which point all spell cards are unlocked.

2) Each spell card also fits within a certain skill tree. In order to add a spell card to your deck with one of your 3 selections for the week, you must have all the previous cards within that same skill tree. For example, if you want the spell card that gives a target player triple TD points, you need to have chosen the double TD spell card already.

How many spells can I cast each week?

There's no limit on the number of spells per se. Activating a spell card before/during your matchup uses up a certain amount of magic points (MP), which varies from spell to spell. Teams all receive the same weekly MP allowance. The MP allowance increases from weeks 1 through 10, allowing you to activate increasingly powerful spells, or apply numerous basic spells.

How many times can spell cards be used?

Each spell card can be used a maximum of once per week. They are not consumed upon use - they remain in your deck for next week. Some of the most powerful cards, however, do have a cooldown period - a waiting period before you can use them again. Cooldown periods are typically 1-2 weeks.

Hm, so I guess I'll save all my best spells for the championship, right?

Not necessary. All spell cards in a cooldown state are refreshed at the start of the playoffs, and again at each week of the playoffs. So there's no need to horde your best spells for your championship - every playoff game will let you pit your best against your opponent's best.

How are the effects of spell cards scored?

The scoring of each spell effect is a direct function of the base score it's being applied to, and each spell effect is handled separately (i.e., additively). So if you use both a Double TD spell and a Triple TD spell on the same player, each 6-point TD he scores will get you an extra 18 points, not 54. Because that'd just be ridiculous.

How do boosts and nerfs interact when applied to the same player?

As with boosts, nerf cards typically don't impact how many bonus points you get from boosting the same base score. A doubled TD gives you +6 bonus points, even if a separate card is cutting the TD value in half (that would count separately as -3 bonus points). The only exception comes up with cards that "eliminate points" - those actual change the base score to 0. Otherwise, the base score stays the same and the effect of each spell just creates bonus points.

tl,dr: Just think of a boosts and nerfs as adding completely new values rather than modifying the base score, unless the base score is "eliminated" first.

But the season is already underway!

We're launching in 2018. Plenty of time before then, right?

You're a shrink and a gun maker? How can I trust you to code a web application?

You can't. Fortunately, we're working with developers who specialize in fantasy sports applications, and they're doing the coding. We're handling all the other other stuff, like coming up with fun spell ideas and game rules, based on our 50+ years of combined experience playing RPG's and collectible card games. Marketing involves a lot of psychology and writing, so Edward's got that down. Creating an application this extensive involves a lot of project management, so Jay's got that down. And we're fortunate to have some friends to help when they can put their skills to use.

This sounds awesome, I want to help! What can I do?

The number one way people can help is just by spreading the word, or even enlisting other friends to spread the word. Tell your leaguemates, use the share buttons above to post on social media, write a blog post, start a thread on your favorite message board.

If you're serious about wanting to do more, email dragon@dragonsandgridirons.com and let us know what sort of time and skills you want to put to use. I'm sure we can find something for you!
story_txt: Imagine you’re playing in your fantasy football league championship. It’s the 4th quarter of the Monday night game. You’re up by a point, but you don’t have any active players left. Your opponent still has their RB1 left to play.You’re pretty well screwed.So what do you do?Well, up until now, you couldn’t actually do anything. Fantasy football means drafting, scouring the waiver wire, picking a lineup…then waiting and watching – powerless.That ends right here.Dragons & Gridirons is a new, interactive version of fantasy football, where you get the power to impact the outcome as your matchup unfolds. You'll customize your team with over 100 spell cards that do everything from boost your players’ yardage to banish opponent players to the X-Zone.Dragons & Gridirons is based on traditional, season-long fantasy football. You form a league of 11 or so friends, draft your teams from the current pool of NFL players, and then face off in head-to-head battles  ("matchups" in FF speak) each week of the real world football season.The outcome of each battle is the result of both traditional fantasy scoring (i.e., you earn fantasy points when players on your team earn stats in their real life NFL games), and the impact of your/your opponent’s use of spell cards.Let's say you have a running back who got you 10 fantasy points one week, from 40 rushing yards (4 points) plus a touchdown (6 points).If you had the foresight to play your the Double TD Points spell card on him before he found the end zone, you'd end up with 16 points from that player. (4 + 6x2).Some spells, like Snow Day, will impact your entire league! Even the more basic cards can be directly applied to any valid player in your league*. Feel like meddling in a battle that you're not  a part of, to try to tilt the standings in your favor? You can do that! Just don't blame us if your league gangs up on you next week..(*This ability can be toggled on/off when setting up your league, so if this is too cutthroat for your group, just turn it off before drafting.)It’s up to you to decide whether you use multiple small spell effects or go for broke with one powerful spell that could turn the tide of the game.Spell cards go into effect in real time. Do you play your hand early to capture the full benefit? Or do you wait and see how things are playing out, at the risk of failing to get a boost on some big plays?Each team begins the season with the same set of basic spell cards, and then you get to choose three new spell cards to add to your deck each week that advance you up various skill trees. This occurs as a basic and automatic game mechanic - there are no micro-transactions in Dragons & Gridirons. Each team will have the exact same access to spell cards as any other team - no money or "currency" required.We've included more details in our FAQ (at the very bottom) for any rule lawyers out there. Start plotting your loopholes to exploit now!For those unfamiliar with Indiegogo: funding can work on a flexible basis, or an all-or-nothing basis. To underscore our ironclad commitment to seeing Dragons & Gridirons all the way through, we've chosen flexible funding.  That means we'll receive whatever funds are pledged, regardless of whether our goal is met, and we're going to move forward with the project, even if the funding falls shorts.If you think our goal seems like less than what's needed for a project of this scale, you'd be right. Our goal amount reflects only what's left after our considerable investment (both years and money) into the project. Our inner circle also came up big in our previous crowdfunding effort.We have some great Perks in store for those who back our project! Tiers ranges from $3 to $5000, so hopefully everyone can find a level that works for them and delivers them something valuable in return for their generous support of Dragons & Gridirons.If you're not in a position to pledge a financial contribution, we would also be very, very grateful for your support in spreading the word to friends! Use the buttons below to automatically share a link to our campaign. story:
Hi Everyone!

Delta's Angels is a junior roller derby team based in Memphis.  We are raising funds to get to our first real game!  The girls have been training hard for nearly two years and looking forward to playing in Gray, Tennessee - about a seven hour drive from Memphis.  We will be leaving on Friday afternoon and returning on Sunday.  We have girls from the Nashvillans, from Nashville's junior leauge, and the Killer Kittens from Jackson's Magnolia Roller Vixens joining us!  Together we make a great team!

http://magnoliarollervixens.org/portfolio

http://www.nashvillejrd.com/

  • The Delta's Angels are group of hard working girls ages 8-17.
  • Junior derby is new there are not many leagues close-by, scrimmaging and playing against other teams will give the girls experience, and strengthen team morale.
  • Any contribution is welcome!

What We Need & What You Get

Contributions of $50.00 or $100.00 are considered sponsorship level and your business logo will remain on website and social media for all of 2014.

We are trying to raise $1500.00 by March 22 for the following:

  • Van Rental = $265
  • Gas = $300 - We have about 21 riders and (5 adults and 16 players)
  • Extra Mileage Charge = $150.00
  • Hotel (4 rooms for 2 nights) = $480.00

Each contrbution receives a perk!  Please check out the perks :).

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute, please share our campaign with your friends and family :).

story:
Im terrible at formatting this part. Please forgive my computer illiteracy.

Alot of you may have noticed the video quality of streams/ videos has fallen recently (streams never above 720p/30fps, and constant stuttering occurs, and my ingame graphics settings are set to their lowest possible amount). This is because when I built this computer originally, I didnt think I was gonna be streaming/ recording stuff on it (I wasnt doing youtube/twitch at that point). 
Now that the computer is getting older, the cracks are showing, and its almost impossible for me to stream at this stage, with constant frame stuttering occuring, its bad for you, its bad for me. 
So whats this crap then!
I set this page up so that I could try and raise some money to upgrade my computer, and get back to making awesome (lets be honest its actually shit) content to entertain and engage with everyone! That said, I dont like the idea of people just giving me money for nothing when I havnt done anything to deserve it, so I setup this thing so that we could TRADE and BARTER and engage in other frivolous activities. 
Signoff baby
So if you feel like helping to save my destitute computer then awesome! Just checkout the sidebar for some of the awesome rewards that could be yours!

story:
Short Summary

In more detail, "Lucou" is an adventure game where the main character, Aime, is sent into the wilds of the mountains to be killed because she is thought to be a reincarnation of a powerful demon. So she has to fight her way home to prove that she is not a demon.

What We Need & What You Get

  • This game needs $6000+, which will be going towards:
    +Software
    +Developer fees (for Steam and such)
    +Hiring programmers, voice actors, environment artists, level designers and composers
    +Rewards being sent through my Redbubble shop
  • The rewards vary, with some of them being downloads and stream invites and others being goods. I don't have much to offer, so it's understandable if you go with one of the lower perks because you don't feel the higher ones are worth it.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you want to help but don't have any money, here's what you can do:

    • SPREAD THE WORD
    • Seriously, spread the word about this game. Raise interest. Talk about it on social networks. Post links to here on said social networks. I would like to get many people interested in this project.

story:
Short Summary

     Hello,

I am a little friendly astronaut ... (you can suggest the name of the hero)


I wander through worlds and dimensions in search of something which would allow me to find peace and happiness....


Rushing through the skies, suddenly something strange shook the spaceship ....

It did not look too good ....



not without problems ... I barely ... barely  .. landed.

I need your help to pick up the equipment to repair the spaceship ...

    So I ask you for help to return home ...

I present to you a 2D skill game on mobile platform iOS / Windows Phone / Android. You control the astronaut that, wandering through farthest corners of the world, was forced to emergency landing losing at the same time load / luggage / equipment in the unknown world. Ultimately, we want to create 3 worlds with 30 levels, in which our hero has to collect the lost equipment needed to repair the rocket and go home.

Our previous game Crazy Labyrinth 3D was our small success. However, it does not generate enough income to enable us to finance a more ambitious project, namely Axy Galaxy 'the legend'.

This time, with Axy Galaxy 'the legend', we want to jump to the next level and develop the game to the full extent of our possibilities. To achieve it, we need your help. The money we gather will allow us for a longer production cycle and thus refining and expanding the project. We considered getting funding from the publisher, but this is difficult to achieve and may prove to be restrictive on the creative side.

That is why IdieGoGo seems to be an ideal solution for us. This will allow us to fully implement our vision.

The web site will allow us to get feedback from people who support us, as well.


We start from this ...

Ouer Hero  .... and world   



We have a prototape of  ouer other world and levels ....




Risks & Challenges

We are experienced in the area of games design and have carefully identified, reviewed and addressed the different possible risks. With all the core elements of the gameplay and working prototype already in place, we are now working on solid ground, and we believe we’re well past the unknowns and potential difficulties inherent to early development stages.

The money will allow us to work in the best possible and complete the game development .




Other Ways You Can Help


You can help us so much by tweeting, sharing and talking about Axy Galaxy 'the legend' !

Please, visit our website and join the fan base on Facebook

You can join IllegalRollercoaster discussions, get involved, talk to the production team,  by following us on Twiter.

Thank you so much for getting involved!
story_txt:
Short Summary
     Hello,


I
am a little friendly astronaut ... (you can suggest the name of the hero)




I
wander through worlds and dimensions in search of something which would allow
me to find peace and happiness.... 




Rushing
through the skies, suddenly something strange shook the spaceship ....




It
did not look too good ....





not
without problems ... I barely ... barely 
.. landed.

I
need your help to pick up the equipment to repair the spaceship ... 
 
So
I ask you for help to return home ...




I
present to you a 2D skill game on mobile platform iOS / Windows Phone /
Android. You control the astronaut that, wandering through farthest corners of
the world, was forced to emergency landing losing at the same time load /
luggage / equipment in the unknown world. Ultimately, we want to create 3 worlds
with 30 levels, in which our hero has to collect the lost equipment needed to
repair the rocket and go home.Our
previous game Crazy Labyrinth 3D was our small success. However, it does not generate
enough income to enable us to finance a more ambitious project, namely Axy Galaxy 'the legend'.



This
time, with Axy Galaxy 'the legend', we want to jump to the next level and develop the
game to the full extent of our possibilities. To achieve it, we need your help.
The money we gather will allow us for a longer production cycle and thus
refining and expanding the project. We considered getting funding from the
publisher, but this is difficult to achieve and may prove to be restrictive on
the creative side.
That
is why IdieGoGo seems to be an ideal solution for us. This will allow us to
fully implement our vision.
The
web site will allow us to get feedback from people who support us, as well.
We start from this ...
 Ouer Hero  .... and world    

 

We have a prototape of  ouer other world and levels ....

Risks & Challenges
We are experienced in the area of games design and have 
carefully identified, reviewed and addressed the different possible 
risks. With all the core elements of the gameplay and working prototype 
already in place, we are now working on solid ground, and we believe 
we’re well past the unknowns and potential difficulties inherent to 
early development stages.
The money will allow us to work in the best possible and complete the game development . 




 Other Ways You Can Help 
You can help us so much by tweeting, sharing
and talking about Axy Galaxy 'the legend' !

Please, visit our website and join the fan base on Facebook 
You can join IllegalRollercoaster discussions, get
involved, talk to the production team,  by following us on Twiter. 
Thank you so much for getting involved!

story:
MAGE, or Mobile Application Generation Environment, is an easy-to-use product that allows anyone to create a mobile application without any programming simply by loading MAGE in their browser. MAGE is perfect for experienced application creators and beginners alike. Load the creation panel; select a template or work from scratch; add content; select features and build.

Featured On:

MAGE allows anyone to create gorgeous mobile applications without sacrificing functionality.


Stretch Goal!

Our new stretch goal is $2,000. If we hit this goal we will add 20 new templates including business templates, a wedding template, and many others!

The mobile creation environment allows anyone to quickly and easily create a gorgeous mobile application with superior functionality. MAGE allows a user to add content and images as well as incorporate lists, tables, and menus. MAGE also allows an application creator to integrate dynamic content, analytics, and push notifications into their applications by using an online control panel for each created application.

Create Unlimited Apps

There is no limit to the number of apps that you can create using MAGE.

 The Goal

The end goal of MAGE is to create an environment that brings all mobile application creation options and outside features under one roof. There are many amazing extra features to complement mobile applications that developers do not add because of the time it takes to add them. MAGE makes this extremely simple, but don’t forget that MAGE’s primary goal is to enable mobile application creation to the highest extent.

The funds provided by you, our backers, will be used to develop a new social media template. This template will allow for the quick and easy creation of social media applications. 

How It Works

If you have a website, not a problem if you don't, the first option will be to enter in your address. MAGE can then pull content (such as images and text) from your website and generate a starter application for you to modify. The application creation panel then allows an application creator numerous options to add text, images, buttons, menus, dynamic content modules, and dozens of other features. Choose from our pre-designed templates to build off of or build an application from scratch. The choice is yours.

Creating Games with MAGE

A lot of feedback we have gotten is for the ability to create games with MAGE. We are happy to respond to these requests with a very positive YES! You will be able to create games with MAGE. Using our games pack and provided templates you will be able to create games. These games will be limited to the templates we provide, but our goal is to continually be providing new templates for our users as MAGE continues to develop and evolve.

Templates

MAGE users will have the option of choosing from a set of templates to help them get started creating their mobile application. These templates will be for businesses and individuals alike.

Mobile Control Panel

Each application built using MAGE also gets a mobile control panel that is generated by MAGE. Application creators can access the control panel and use it to change content on the application, push out updates, send push notifications, and monitor analytics.

Dynamic Content

Our dynamic content option allows for an application creator to set a specific area on an application for dynamic content and then set this content through the mobile control panel. This content can be changed at any time from the control panel, and it is instantly reflected across all installed applications.

Analytics

MAGE has two levels of analytics: basic and advanced. Basic analytics keep track of page views and installs of your applications. Advanced analytics break this data down into much more detailed information, such as time period of views, location of installs, and other useful information.

Push Notifications

MAGE offers push notifications for all applications. The mobile control panel has a scheduling and grouping plug-in built in that allows administrators to schedule when notifications are to be sent as well as whom to send notifications to.

Publishing Your App

Many app creators don't realize the extra work and effort required to submit their app to their chosen platform's app store. MAGE takes care of this as well for application creators. We will build your application binary, certify it, and submit it for review. The Google Play Store publishes application within several hours, Apple's App Store usually takes some time due to their extensive review process.


MAGE in Action

Below are images of the application creation panel and the mobile control panel.

Our Story

The Demski Group is a company focused on innovation and helping to improve businesses and individuals. MAGE was conceived out of the idea of an easier way to create mobile applications without having to pay high prices or sacrificing functionality. Among us, we have a rather extensive background in designing, building, and publishing mobile applications, and it has brought us joy to see our users discover what we have built and use it. We wish to bring that same joy in creating to everyone.

The idea for MAGE originally stemmed from the questions of how to get more individuals and businesses exciting about mobile applications and how they can use them to address their needs. Our first thought was to go to more events and trade shows and directly interact with potential customers there; however we didn't think that a few phones and slides would be all that interesting. Our next idea was to allow individuals to create a mobile application right there on the spot using a laptop or tablet. From this idea, MAGE was born.

The Team

Andrew - CEO and Chief Developer. With over 10 years of experience in the industry Andrew has worked on hundreds of groundbreaking projects.

Aaron - Social Media, Marketing, and Design. Aaron has a knack for recognizing trends and capitalizing on them. He helped create the original design for MAGE.

Mike - Developer. Creating applications and seeing them in use has always been a joy for Mike, and MAGE is a project he is very passionate about.

Taylor - Designer. With an amazing ability to bring to life the designs people only imagine, Taylor is one of the primary designers for MAGE and his designs will facilitate an easy-to-use user interface.

Seth - Creative. Seth is the ideas guy. When we get stuck on a problem he has no problem pushing the limits and finding a solution.

Kody - Designer. A designer specializing in UI design. Kody has created designs in the past for mobile applications and understands what needs to be done to create conducive user interfaces.

Development Timeline

The original parts of MAGE have been completed and have been released to our previous backers. Now we are looking to add the ability to create social media apps for our users and that's what the funds provided by this campaign will be used for.

Risks and challenges

The risks and challenges faced by the team are minimal. We have already built, tested, and developed the fundamental back-end of MAGE that allows the platform to add in features such as dynamic content, analytics, and push notifications. However, the front-end and synchronized building on multiple platforms still needs to be developed. This could prove to be more challenging and time-consuming than originally anticipated. Our team is experienced with encountering and defeating obstacles and we take each challenge on with vigor.

Fulfillment: As each platform capability is completed and added to MAGE we will send out notifications to each backer so that they can logon and start building their application.

Thank you again, to our wonderful Indiegogo supporters!

story:
Hello Indiegogo'ers
My name is Jeff and i want to fund making our card shop into a place that everyone can go and have fun.  Games aren't just for kids anymore and that's the message we want to give our local community here in Island.  Without really anywhere to go and have fun the kids in our town are eagerly awaiting our grand opening, but whether we can give them everything we want to offer is really up to you all at indiegogo.

What will we do with the funding?

At present we mainly deal in magic the gathering cards, but we want to have so much more.  With the funding we get from indiegogo we will

  • Furnish our game hall with quality chairs for our gamers
  • Branch out into tabletop rpgs and having Rpg night weekly
  • Be featuring games of the week and/or month for free play
  • Have a game for everyone no matter what age

What about perks?

We will be offering 4 perks to our funders,$2 gets you a random rare from magic the gathering, $5 awards you a pack of mtg cards out of standard. $50 and up you will receive a dice bag with all the dice you need to play most D20 system rpgs.  Anyone who funds us $100 or more will receive the dice bag and a random board game that has been featured on tabletop.  We do have to limit the perks to 10 for $50 and up category so it will be first come first serve on the funding perks.

    What difference will we see in the card shop?

    The difference will be very great, with the funding from this campaign our shop will open with an rpg night in place and ready to start organizing tournaments for the various games that we will be catering too.

    Those that find buying the books for an rpg a barrier to playing it can come to our hosted rpg nights and play with everything they need provided to play, no investment in a library needed.

    Ever go to the Friday Night Magic  game and have to sit in the infamous "broken chair" of the shop?  With this funding we won't have one of those and all our chairs will be of good quality.

    Setbacks and Delays

    We have experienced delays in our renovation and hope to be opening very soon, these delays haven't been too detrimental to our card shop but they have taken their toll. Either way we will achieve our goals of having a great place for people to hangout and play. We are determined in our goal and all of us here at Southern Cards share the same dream, our dream is...

    • to have a place someone can go and instantly relate to a game they see
    • for people to ask about a game and play it moments after their query
    • to have a place kids can go and have fun, and stay out of trouble

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Even if someone cannot contribute monetarily, they can still do a world of good by simply telling friends about us.  Just passing along our website to a friend you know wants a good deal on a magic the gathering card they had their eye on will be plenty of help. www.southerncards.com

story:
- 12th of April 2013 - We did it! The second stretchgoal has been reached!


Thank you so much everybody! The fullscreen planetary exploration just became a reality. We have the last day of this campaign and we can't express enough how happy you made us. Thank you! 

 

- 8th of April 2013 -  Please don't forget to join us for our "thank you" live-streamed concert!

 

- 4th of April 2013 -  We've released yet another comparison shot so you can understand why you want Fullscreen planetary exploration! We are extremely proud that we can offer you this level of visual experience!

 

- 28th of March 2013 -  We've reached our first stretch goal! This means that you're going to get longer story and Rachel's log to keep track of her adventure! Thank you! You're so amazing!!!

We are also presenting a new music clip and displaying technology which was meant for the ultimate, currently unannounced, stretch goal:

Ultimate exploration OST

 

- 22nd of March 2013 - We are presenting you with a few music videos which could make you decide, if you want to have our soundtrack - pledges up from $25. We will be uploading 3 more tracks to show you how diverse the music in J.U.L.I.A. is. Enjoy!

(due to IGG limitation you have to click on the youtube links)

Jungle OST

Biomechanical world OST

Endless Ocean OST

 - 19th of March 2013 - We would like to show you a visual difference between story expansion stretch goal and full screen planetary exploration. Your support will decide! Thank you!

- 8th of March 2013 - We did it! We've got funded thanks to your awesome support. We've added stretch goals with an explanatory video as an update no. 6. For visual and textual description please scroll down below.

Important information

If you want to upgrade your pledge, see FAQ at the very bottom of this campaign. Unlike with KickStarter, your pledges here are summed. So if you want to upgrade $7 to $25, your second pledge should be only $18. I hope this clears up all the confusion with a different pledging system.

Help us create an enhanced version of our point'n'click science fiction PC game J.U.L.I.A.

Please check our commented gameplay video of the original J.U.L.I.A. in the gallery section.

Dear backers,

My name is Jan Kavan and I am musician, writer and game developer. With my small independent studio we've already created 4 video games - Ghost in the Sheet, J.U.L.I.A., J.U.L.I.A. Untold and Vampires! Personally I did contribute to many other games including Tale of a Hero (Peregrius / Future Games), Carol Reed series (MDNA games), Dark Fall 2 or Barrow Hill.

I strongly believe in innovation and for that reason we always try to bring fresh air into our games. This comes for a price though - not always we get everything right the first time around.

J.U.L.I.A. is an innovative, narrative driven PC game. The story centers on Rachel Manners, a 35 year old astrobiologist. She is a member of an elite group of scientists, chosen to embark on one of the most critical missions ever conceived on Earth. Now Rachel is alone, orbiting an unknown planet. Her only companions are J.U.L.I.A., the space probe’s artificial intelligence and Mobot, a huge reconnaissance robot. Together, this unlikely trio will explore the mysteries of the solar system of Salia. But are they prepared for what they will find?

Find out more about the story at our official page:

When we've released J.U.L.I.A. back in 2012, the response especially from the adventure gaming community was amazing. While we've approached our players with a certain degree of concern, knowing that this is a new video game format, we've been well accepted and especially the story, music and game flow was generally praised.

Also the game was just recently nominated for the best gameplay and the best character (Mobot) by adventure gamers - the largest international website specialized on adventure games!

This came to us as a big surprise because we've been working on the game for more than 3 years in only two persons. The fact that we've invested only our time and my personal budget however negatively influenced some of the game aspects.

The ultimate problem appeared when the only income we've been able to get from our three years of hard work covered merely the legal expenses to reclaim back J.U.L.I.A. rights.

So now we stand here, asking you to help us iron the edges. We ask only for a bare minimum to help us survive and polish the generally disliked stuff.

The basic goal consisted of the following items:

  • Create backers' only event of recreating Rachel Manners from scratch, making the used model much more human.
  • Redesigning some of the game interface and getting backers' feedback for the new looks.
  • Making certain parts of the game optional (like harvesting minigame for example).
  • Introducing easy mode for problematic puzzles.
  • Rewriting some of the puzzles which helps better reflecting on what to do.
  • Extending some of the music tracks which repeat too much.
  • Polishing some of the puzzles to be more reactive to players.
  • Refine a few parts of the script when it gets ridiculous / over the top. One needs a bit of a distance to do that and I am fairly positive that I can do this now. 

However! Thanks to your amazing support we're able to introduce you with the stretch goals for enhancing J.U.L.I.A. even more.

 

$7.500 - Story Expansion

- We will seriously enhance the exploration part of the story. The exploration areas will become larger with more choices and we will also introduce some of the crew members who were left out from the original game.

$12.500 - Fullscreen Exploration

- We will change the exploration to a hybrid between J.U.L.I.A. exploration mode and fullscreen point’n’click adventure game. We will create fullscreen visuals for each of the exploration views and the actions will be issued through contextual menu interface. This way the spirit of J.U.L.I.A will remain but both visually and gameplay-wise the enhanced edition is going to become more engaging. 

This will require us to create a brand new visuals for many new scenes. Our next update will show you a comparison how this expansion would look like.

$25.000 - PC, MAC and LINUX Unity 3D port

- Many people asked us to do Mac or Linux port or to allow for resolutions larger than 1024x768. If we port the whole game to Unity 3D, it will open a whole incredible window of possibilities and then we can promise native Mac and Linux build as well. While this means basically recreating the game assets and code from scratch, it’s still easier than doing another game. 

 

For this all to work we need at least $5000. There are many other things we could do with J.U.L.I.A., but we're being modest with our goal and if you decide to trust us and help us fund the project beyond the original target, we have many ways how to appreciate it starting from multiple localizations, including J.U.L.I.A. Untold (prequel to J.U.L.I.A.) as a part of the game, creating a basic lipsync, extending the gameplay etc. We're not there yet and for that reason we'll leave this for an eventual update.

Why do we need $5000?

In case we will get exactly $5000:

  • $350 will be given to IndieGoGo team
  • Roughly $1000 is estimated to fulfill our promised physical perks and shipments
  • We will of course have to pay taxes from the income and it also seems that we will have to pay taxes from shipping out the physical rewards thanks to a tax gray zone.
  • With this basic funding we will need 3 months of two people to deliver the Enhanced Edition

When we sum this up, it leaves us with just enough money to create the promised enhanced edition of J.U.L.I.A. 

Adventure Gamers 4/5 stars (Katie Hazen)

“Plenty of varied puzzles will appeal to players looking for a challenge, and the story of humanity’s dealings with others and itself will draw you into its sci-fi mystery, while the decisions you’re forced to make will resonate long after you’ve left the game behind. There are really no games out there quite like J.U.L.I.A., and anyone interested in something a little different will be rewarded with a fun experience that’s well worth the time and effort.”

Just Adventure B (Ray Ivey)

“You can feel the love the designers of this game have for the adventure genre. It oozes out of every pore of the game. It makes you want to call them up and sit around and have a conversation about everyone’s favorite old adventure games.”

GameBoomers B++ (Flotsam)

“…J.U.L.I.A. provides eight or so hours of thoughtful, enjoyable, story driven science fiction, a good number of well crafted and varied puzzles, and some excellent looking cutscenes. J.U.L.I.A. is a game I would happily recommend as being well worth the price of admission.”

Gamercast.net 4/5 (Charlotte Woolley)

“…J.U.L.I.A is an all-round fantastic adventure game, with an intriguing story and a very satisfying ending. It supplies fresh and challenging puzzles and includes one of the most endearing robots since Dog. If you are looking for an engaging and enjoyable adventure game and don’t judge a book by its cover, look no further than J.U.L.I.A”

Adrenaline Vault 4/5 (Michael Smith)

“J.U.L.I.A. is obviously a labor of love, and it’s hard to be critical of a labor of love. But a few more hands on deck would’ve helped turn a good-looking, sometimes frustrating puzzle fest into an outstanding adventure game. The future appears bright for CBE; I look forward to their next project.”

No problem! We have a playable demo readily available so you can see if this game would be your cup of tea.

 

If you look to the right side of this campaign, you can see a description of all the beautiful rewards we offer for your generous help. However to get a visual idea what are you going to get for your kind contribution, we've created a visual overview for each individual pledge. Please refer to the pledge level description for details. Also, please note, that shipping is a part of the pledge. No need to add any extra money on top.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

First of all, please do support us at Steam Greenlight by tossing a free upvote. Not only it will help us, but also it allows us to give you a Steam game key. 

 

There are other ways how to help us. Please spread the word among your friends, classmates, families etc. 

Below this campaign you can quickly approach our Facebook and Twitter pages, so please do like us there and feel free to follow us. We're not paranoid... yet.

Q: When will be the advanced edition ready?

A: Basic idea is to finish in 3 months from being succesfuly funded. However if our gently backers allow us to do more with the Enhanced Edition, we'll make sure to be very transparent with longer development cycle.

Q: How will I vote for Rachel / Interface looks?

A: We will set up a private backers forum. Here all polls and discussions will take place. We will inform you continuously about our ongoing progress and share some imagery, concepts etc. as well.

Q: Why IndieGoGo?

A: We are Czech-based company and Kickstarter is not available for us. While KS is perceived to be more influential for video games, we still strongly hope that we can achieve our modest goal through IndieGoGo as well.

Q: Should I include shipping and handling for physical shipments?

A: Not at all. We've calculated those in the pledge level. I believe it's better this way. Since we're Czech based, I bet that 99% of all the shipments will go abroad anyway.

Q: I want to upgrade my pledge. How should I do it?

A: Simply add another pledge to the level you want to reach and the only rule is to use the same email address which you’ve used for your original pledge. When we end this campaign, I will sum pledges by email and run this result through you so you can check that we got your pledges right.
story_txt:
- 12th of April 2013 - We did it! The second stretchgoal has been reached!
Thank you so much everybody! The fullscreen planetary exploration just became a reality. We have the last day of this campaign and we can't express enough how happy you made us. Thank you! 


 
- 8th of April 2013 -  Please don't forget to join us for our "thank you" live-streamed concert!
 

- 4th of April 2013 -  We've released yet another comparison shot so you can understand why you want Fullscreen planetary exploration! We are extremely proud that we can offer you this level of visual experience!
 

- 28th of March 2013 -  We've reached our first stretch goal! This means that you're going to get longer story and Rachel's log to keep track of her adventure! Thank you! You're so amazing!!!
We are also presenting a new music clip and displaying technology which was meant for the ultimate, currently unannounced, stretch goal:
Ultimate exploration OST
 
- 22nd of March 2013 - We are presenting you with a few music videos which could make you decide, if you want to have our soundtrack - pledges up from $25. We will be uploading 3 more tracks to show you how diverse the music in J.U.L.I.A. is. Enjoy! 
(due to IGG limitation you have to click on the youtube links)
Jungle OST
Biomechanical world OST
Endless Ocean OST
 - 19th of March 2013 - We would like to show you a visual difference between story expansion stretch goal and full screen planetary exploration. Your support will decide! Thank you!

- 8th of March 2013 - We did it! We've got funded thanks to your awesome support. We've added stretch goals with an explanatory video as an update no. 6. For visual and textual description please scroll down below.
Important information
If you want to upgrade your pledge, see FAQ at the very bottom of this campaign. Unlike with KickStarter, your pledges here are summed. So if you want to upgrade $7 to $25, your second pledge should be only $18. I hope this clears up all the confusion with a different pledging system.
Help us create an enhanced version of our point'n'click science fiction PC game J.U.L.I.A.
Please check our commented gameplay video of the original J.U.L.I.A. in the gallery section.

Dear backers,
My name is Jan Kavan and I am musician, writer and game developer. With my small independent studio we've already created 4 video games - Ghost in the Sheet, J.U.L.I.A., J.U.L.I.A. Untold and Vampires! Personally I did contribute to many other games including Tale of a Hero (Peregrius / Future Games), Carol Reed series (MDNA games), Dark Fall 2 or Barrow Hill.
I strongly believe in innovation and for that reason we always try to bring fresh air into our games. This comes for a price though - not always we get everything right the first time around.

J.U.L.I.A. is an innovative, narrative driven PC game. The story centers on Rachel Manners, a 35 year old astrobiologist. She is a member of an elite group of scientists, chosen to embark on one of the most critical missions ever conceived on Earth. Now Rachel is alone, orbiting an unknown planet. Her only companions are J.U.L.I.A., the space probe’s artificial intelligence and Mobot, a huge reconnaissance robot. Together, this unlikely trio will explore the mysteries of the solar system of Salia. But are they prepared for what they will find?
Find out more about the story at our official page:


When we've released J.U.L.I.A. back in 2012, the response especially from the adventure gaming community was amazing. While we've approached our players with a certain degree of concern, knowing that this is a new video game format, we've been well accepted and especially the story, music and game flow was generally praised.
Also the game was just recently nominated for the best gameplay and the best character (Mobot) by adventure gamers - the largest international website specialized on adventure games!
This came to us as a big surprise because we've been working on the game for more than 3 years in only two persons. The fact that we've invested only our time and my personal budget however negatively influenced some of the game aspects.
The ultimate problem appeared when the only income we've been able to get from our three years of hard work covered merely the legal expenses to reclaim back J.U.L.I.A. rights.
So now we stand here, asking you to help us iron the edges. We ask only for a bare minimum to help us survive and polish the generally disliked stuff.

The basic goal consisted of the following items:

Create backers' only event of recreating Rachel Manners from scratch, making the used model much more human.
Redesigning some of the game interface and getting backers' feedback for the new looks.
Making certain parts of the game optional (like harvesting minigame for example).
Introducing easy mode for problematic puzzles.
Rewriting some of the puzzles which helps better reflecting on what to do.
Extending some of the music tracks which repeat too much.
Polishing some of the puzzles to be more reactive to players.
Refine a few parts of the script when it gets ridiculous / over the top. One needs a bit of a distance to do that and I am fairly positive that I can do this now. 
However! Thanks to your amazing support we're able to introduce you with the stretch goals for enhancing J.U.L.I.A. even more.

 
$7.500 - Story Expansion
- We will seriously enhance the exploration part of the story. The exploration areas will become larger with more choices and we will also introduce some of the crew members who were left out from the original game.
$12.500 - Fullscreen Exploration
- We will change the exploration to a hybrid between J.U.L.I.A. exploration mode and fullscreen point’n’click adventure game. We will create fullscreen visuals for each of the exploration views and the actions will be issued through contextual menu interface. This way the spirit of J.U.L.I.A will remain but both visually and gameplay-wise the enhanced edition is going to become more engaging. 
This will require us to create a brand new visuals for many new scenes. Our next update will show you a comparison how this expansion would look like.
$25.000 - PC, MAC and LINUX Unity 3D port
- Many people asked us to do Mac or Linux port or to allow for resolutions larger than 1024x768. If we port the whole game to Unity 3D, it will open a whole incredible window of possibilities and then we can promise native Mac and Linux build as well. While this means basically recreating the game assets and code from scratch, it’s still easier than doing another game. 
 

For this all to work we need at least $5000. There are many other things we could do with J.U.L.I.A., but we're being modest with our goal and if you decide to trust us and help us fund the project beyond the original target, we have many ways how to appreciate it starting from multiple localizations, including J.U.L.I.A. Untold (prequel to J.U.L.I.A.) as a part of the game, creating a basic lipsync, extending the gameplay etc. We're not there yet and for that reason we'll leave this for an eventual update.
Why do we need $5000?
In case we will get exactly $5000:

$350 will be given to IndieGoGo team
Roughly $1000 is estimated to fulfill our promised physical perks and shipments
We will of course have to pay taxes from the income and it also seems that we will have to pay taxes from shipping out the physical rewards thanks to a tax gray zone.
With this basic funding we will need 3 months of two people to deliver the Enhanced Edition
When we sum this up, it leaves us with just enough money to create the promised enhanced edition of J.U.L.I.A. 

Adventure Gamers 4/5 stars (Katie Hazen)
“Plenty of varied puzzles will appeal to players looking for a challenge, and the story of humanity’s dealings with others and itself will draw you into its sci-fi mystery, while the decisions you’re forced to make will resonate long after you’ve left the game behind. There are really no games out there quite like J.U.L.I.A., and anyone interested in something a little different will be rewarded with a fun experience that’s well worth the time and effort.”
Just Adventure B (Ray Ivey)
“You can feel the love the designers of this game have for the adventure genre. It oozes out of every pore of the game. It makes you want to call them up and sit around and have a conversation about everyone’s favorite old adventure games.”
GameBoomers B++ (Flotsam)
“…J.U.L.I.A. provides eight or so hours of thoughtful, enjoyable, story driven science fiction, a good number of well crafted and varied puzzles, and some excellent looking cutscenes. J.U.L.I.A. is a game I would happily recommend as being well worth the price of admission.”
Gamercast.net 4/5 (Charlotte Woolley)
“…J.U.L.I.A is an all-round fantastic adventure game, with an intriguing story and a very satisfying ending. It supplies fresh and challenging puzzles and includes one of the most endearing robots since Dog. If you are looking for an engaging and enjoyable adventure game and don’t judge a book by its cover, look no further than J.U.L.I.A”
Adrenaline Vault 4/5 (Michael Smith)
“J.U.L.I.A. is obviously a labor of love, and it’s hard to be critical of a labor of love. But a few more hands on deck would’ve helped turn a good-looking, sometimes frustrating puzzle fest into an outstanding adventure game. The future appears bright for CBE; I look forward to their next project.”

No problem! We have a playable demo readily available so you can see if this game would be your cup of tea.
 

If you look to the right side of this campaign, you can see a description of all the beautiful rewards we offer for your generous help. However to get a visual idea what are you going to get for your kind contribution, we've created a visual overview for each individual pledge. Please refer to the pledge level description for details. Also, please note, that shipping is a part of the pledge. No need to add any extra money on top.

 
 

 
 

 
 

 
 

 
 

 
 

 
 

 
 

 
 

 
 

 
 
 
 
 

First of all, please do support us at Steam Greenlight by tossing a free upvote. Not only it will help us, but also it allows us to give you a Steam game key. 

 
There are other ways how to help us. Please spread the word among your friends, classmates, families etc. 
Below this campaign you can quickly approach our Facebook and Twitter pages, so please do like us there and feel free to follow us. We're not paranoid... yet.

Q: When will be the advanced edition ready?
A: Basic idea is to finish in 3 months from being succesfuly funded. However if our gently backers allow us to do more with the Enhanced Edition, we'll make sure to be very transparent with longer development cycle.
Q: How will I vote for Rachel / Interface looks?
A: We will set up a private backers forum. Here all polls and discussions will take place. We will inform you continuously about our ongoing progress and share some imagery, concepts etc. as well.
Q: Why IndieGoGo?
A: We are Czech-based company and Kickstarter is not available for us. While KS is perceived to be more influential for video games, we still strongly hope that we can achieve our modest goal through IndieGoGo as well.
Q: Should I include shipping and handling for physical shipments?
A: Not at all. We've calculated those in the pledge level. I believe it's better this way. Since we're Czech based, I bet that 99% of all the shipments will go abroad anyway.
Q: I want to upgrade my pledge. How should I do it?
A: Simply add another pledge to the level you want to reach and the only rule is to use the same email address which you’ve used for your original pledge. When we end this campaign, I will sum pledges by email and run this result through you so you can check that we got your pledges right.

story:
Edit: Thank You for your support, you find the program on http://www.epicgenerator.net

 

This program will be an excellent tool for fantasy roleplayers, who can't draw, but would like to illustrate their player or non-player characters.
There are similar programs on the market but with much less content and in a very different style. My approach is to make a realistic character illustration application, which can be a great aid for the fans of classic role playing games.

The high resolution images are an excellent way to make the otherwise text and conversation based games visible and more realistic. If you are a writer, you can use them as illustrations for your work, or if you make games, you can make character portraits, even complete gamescenes out of it, just to mention a couple of good examples how this tool can really be used.

You don't need any artistic skills, all you need to do is simply click with your mouse, and you can make quality characters in no time, like this:

 

 

I've started working on this program in February, and I've already finished the human race. Currently I'm working on the dwarf characters. Since it's more than 200 images per character per gender, it takes a lot of time.

I mix paint and 3D. I'm really in love with this project, and I would like to make as much content as I can, so I need your help to make it as good as I've imagined it on the first place.

The program is planned to be released in June, and with your help, it will be the ultimate role playing tool for all the gamers out there!

 

The program will be avaible on PC, Android, and iOS devices.  It has a very early dummy version, which I use for testing the images.

Here are some of the generated characters: :

 Or even token:

- If you are an artist, i would gladly share the base characters, and implement your artwork in the program.

- Sharing is always nice and highly appreciated.

- Give feedback! What could you use, what would you like to see, what do you need!?

story:
What is CodeLump?

Lumps of code are scattered around the internet! The web is not as it appears: it is an ever-expanding battlefield full of mines and resource crates. Posts guide the way to safe ground, but may also lead to traps, so beware! CodeLump is the invisible layer of the web, the layer that contains this world of chaos. Among the chaos are players like you and me. Players explore the web using Google's Chrome browser and the CodeLump extension, which allows them to interact with the CodeLump universe. CodeLump consists of three basic entities: mines, crates, and posts. The concept is simple:

  • Mines take away points
  • Crates give points
  • Posts suggest places to go on the internet

These entities are placed automatically by AIs that underly the CodeLump universe, as well as by players. Players can purchase crates if they're feeling generous, and stash them around the internet for other players to find, or mines if they want to wreak a little havok. A player may lead others to treasures or a trap using a post. This game is revolutionary, spanning the entire web! All of this is accessed via a simple Chrome extension. The user installs our extension, and automatically gets a toolbar added to the top of every page allowing them to view their inventory; place mines, crates, or posts; and more!

What We Need & What You'll Get

Here's the basic break down:

We need a couple thousand dollars to ensure that server costs are covered, the downfall of our predecessor, The Nethernet. The money will also be put into finding and hiring great artists to make the game look just as fun as it feels to play. Finally, the money will be put into miscellaneous tasks such as hiring an attorney to review our terms of service, etc, and other tasks required to launch a good product.

Of course, if I were in your shoes I'd be wondering why I'd throw my hard earned money into such an ambitious project. This is why we're offering incentives for different levels of contribution. Almost everyone who donates (all donations greater than or equal to $5) will get access to our closed beta, and have the privillege of playing the game before it's released to the general public. For higher-level contributions, we might even give you some impact in the development of CodeLump!  If we can make it happen, it's as good as done! If you want to have your contribution guaranteed to be acknowledged, we need at least $75. Then, if we like your idea and think it will work, we'll add it in the game. If we don't add it, you'll still get a super awesome CodeLump t-shirt! If you go super crazy supportive of this project and donate over $200, we'll send you two shirts: one for you and one for a friend, in addition to listening to your game contribution idea and kissing up to you as long as our game exists. You'll be granted a large sum of premium credits when and if the premium system is released, and you'll be entered on a wall of fame on our website (if you wish).

Join the revolution

We want to make this game the next big thing, so, when you recieve beta access, you're allowed to distribute the extension to as many people as you want! The way the game is designed, there is a direct correlation between the number of players and the awesomeness of the game.

If you can't contribute money, per se, don't be deterred! Try to tell as many people about us as you can!
