story:
VIDEO COMING SOON

 

Jake's Field Vision

Jake is passionate about football.  He plays it in the pool, on the trampoline, on the grass, on the wii and even in real pads on his Pop Warner team - go Falcons!  On an especially long trip at the age of 7, he and I decided to come up with a simple game to play with a regular deck of playing cards.  I gave him the general concepts of how to make it fun and realistic and he ran with it.  We have refined it a few times over the last year, but it turned out amazing. He and I can literally play it for hours together or alone.

It is so much fun that I sometimes need to convince him to go outside and play.  A few weeks ago I said to him "some kids are stuck in hospital rooms and can only dream of running outside to play football."

In a moment of insight that only an 8 year old can have, Jake told me "I bet if they were having fun playing this (our football card game) they wouldn't."  

After explaining that he had missed my point - we both agreed that it would be nice to share our "fun" game with sick kids at the Children's Hospital.  Jake added that to make sure they realized how cool football was - we'd give them packs of football cards also.  

Everyone Wins

The children at the hospital will win and you will also win.  For as little as $7 you will get a game that will bring you a lifetime of fun.  I'm not just saying this - you will really enjoy playing the game with your family or even alone.  When your iphone batteries are dying - you'll pick up a deck of cards and just start playing.  The rules are complex enough that you are simulating a realistic football game, but simple enough that anyone can play and quickly memorize the basics. If you like football, sports in general or just playing card games - you will truly enjoy playing this game.

Pick the level of giving that is right for you, but please realize that you will be getting a great game and helping put a smile on many children's faces.

 

How the money will be spent

Jake wants to be able to bring games for any children who want to play.  We can print the rules on our home printer, but they will require a regular deck of playing cards and so we need to be able to buy those.  He loves collecting football cards and reading the stats - so he thinks it is an important gift also.  Everyone likes football cards.  The other kids can be inspired to invent their own games and use the cards to represent the players when playing Jake's card game. We will spend the money we get on a few things

  • Decks of playing cards
  • Packs of football cards
  • some 'other' toys/gifts for the children who don't like football 
  • Delivery of the games to the most generous supporters

Please trust us that every penny you contribute will go to the cause.  If there are only $300 of contributions we will buy just enough and choose carefully.  If we raise Jake's goal of $100,000 we will make sure sick kids all around the country get something.

 

Please help spread the word

I hope that this campaign can be successful to inspire Jake to do more in the future.  We teach him that every one can make a difference and a successful campaign will help him to truly understand.  

My network of friends is a respectable size, but I know that if a few of you can post a link on your networks - we can reach thousands of people.  Whatever you can do to spread the word would be awesome.  Thanks.

story:
Just named one of Forbes' 5 Startups To Watch in 2014

THE FACTS

Really, that’s all it takes.  No joke!  Learn 2,000 of the most commonly used words and verbs and you’ll know 60% of a language.  You'll be able to say nearly anything you need to and understand the gist of what someone else is saying to you. 

THE PROBLEM

Our co-founder, Kevin, traveled to Costa Rica and found himself in a common traveller predicament. He took years of high school Spanish, but he was completely tongue-tied when locals tried to speak to him. Uttering the occasional "hola" or "por favor" wasn't exactly enough to meaningfully interact. After all, one of the best parts about travel is meeting the locals. After spending a long trip relegated to the ex-pat community, he was inspired to figure out a flexible, affordable solution to language study. 

When he learned that it only takes 2,000 words to hold a conversation, we went on the hunt for a platform that quickly built on our existing language skills from high school and college. 

The more we searched for this option, the more we realized one didn’t exist.  We found ourselves in a “Goldie Locks and the Three Bears” predicament. Learning systems that are on the market today are either too big and require us to start from scratch and spend a lot of money, or are too small and rely solely on personal discipline.  There’s no middle ground, one that’s just right, that supplements existing knowledge. 

So, using the latest web technology, we’ve taken the addictive nature of gaming and combined it with memory improvement techniques to fast-track the language learning process. Oh yeah, and the price is just right!  It’s free to learn the first 2,000 words and after that, it’s only $5 per month! 

THE SOLUTION

At SixtyVocab, digital flashcards meet addictive gaming to get your vocab off the paper and into your conversation.  

  1. We start you off by learning the most commonly used words and verbs in conversation first. 
  2. Then we track your retention of those words.  The words that you don’t know appear first and more frequently in your lessons and games until you master them. 
  3. Finally, we help you recall words at conversational speed. (That's 7 seconds, in case you are wondering.) 


WE'RE LIVE!  CHECK US OUT!

SixtyVocab.com is up and running -- we even have our first wave of users! Jump on your computer or tablet to start learning Spanish, French, German, Portuguese, or English.

WHAT WE ARE HERE FOR....

With all the positive feedback we received, there was just one recurring theme: the need for a mobile app.  Since Sixty Vocab’s games are built on time-based learning principles, putting Sixty Vocab in your hands on-the-go makes learning a new language even easier.

For 20 minutes a day, you can turn your downtime into game time.  When you have an extra 5 minutes while riding the bus, getting a cup of coffee, waiting at the bar, or even sitting in front of the TV, you can learn all the vocab you need to be conversationally fluent within 3 months.

So we turn to you, IndieGoGo, to help us fund the next evolution of Sixty Vocab:  our mobile app.  We’ve already designed it and we just need your help to build it.  

WHO LOVES US


THE ASK

Please support the SixtyVocab IndieGoGo campaign today and help us #GoMobile! 

Join SixtyVocab today and get 2,000 words for free! 


¡Muchas Gracias!

Obrigado!

Merci!

Danke!

Thank you very much!
story_txt:
Just named one of Forbes' 5 Startups To Watch in 2014THE FACTSReally, that’s all it takes.  No joke!  Learn 2,000 of the most commonly used words and verbs and you’ll know 60% of a language.  You'll be able to say nearly anything you need to and understand the gist of what someone else is saying to you. THE PROBLEMOur co-founder, Kevin, traveled to Costa Rica and found himself in a common traveller predicament. He took years of high school Spanish, but he was completely tongue-tied when locals tried to speak to him. Uttering the occasional "hola" or "por favor" wasn't exactly enough to meaningfully interact. After all, one of the best parts about travel is meeting the locals. After spending a long trip relegated to the ex-pat community, he was inspired to figure out a flexible, affordable solution to language study. When he learned that it only takes 2,000 words to hold a conversation, we went on the hunt for a platform that quickly built on our existing language skills from high school and college. The more we searched for this option, the more we realized one didn’t exist.  We found ourselves in a “Goldie Locks and the Three Bears” predicament. Learning systems that are on the market today are either too big and require us to start from scratch and spend a lot of money, or are too small and rely solely on personal discipline.  There’s no middle ground, one that’s just right, that supplements existing knowledge. So, using the latest web technology, we’ve taken the addictive nature of gaming and combined it with memory improvement techniques to fast-track the language learning process. Oh yeah, and the price is just right!  It’s free to learn the first 2,000 words and after that, it’s only $5 per month! THE SOLUTIONAt SixtyVocab, digital flashcards meet addictive gaming to get your vocab off the paper and into your conversation.  

We start you off by learning the most commonly used words and verbs in conversation first. 


Then we track your retention of those words.  The words that you don’t know appear first and more frequently in your lessons and games until you master them. 


Finally, we help you recall words at conversational speed. (That's 7 seconds, in case you are wondering.) 

WE'RE LIVE!  CHECK US OUT!SixtyVocab.com is up and running -- we even have our first wave of users! Jump on your computer or tablet to start learning Spanish, French, German, Portuguese, or English.WHAT WE ARE HERE FOR....With all the positive feedback we received, there was just one recurring theme: the need for a mobile app.  Since Sixty Vocab’s games are built on time-based learning principles, putting Sixty Vocab in your hands on-the-go makes learning a new language even easier.For 20 minutes a day, you can turn your downtime into game time.  When you have an extra 5 minutes while riding the bus, getting a cup of coffee, waiting at the bar, or even sitting in front of the TV, you can learn all the vocab you need to be conversationally fluent within 3 months.So we turn to you, IndieGoGo, to help us fund the next evolution of Sixty Vocab:  our mobile app.  We’ve already designed it and we just need your help to build it.  WHO LOVES US












THE ASK

Please support the SixtyVocab IndieGoGo campaign today and help us #GoMobile! 
Join SixtyVocab today and get 2,000 words for free! 




¡Muchas Gracias!
Obrigado!
Merci!
Danke!
Thank you very much!

story:
Note: Project started 30 days ago, but it really started at 26.08.13, so we have only 15 days to make it happen. Please share it.

About myself, who am I and why do I need the money
note:gameplay shown in this video is old, you can see current progress in upper video


Welcome to my campaign for 3D MMORPG Parkour game.

I’m Temo Kokiashvili an indie game developer, working in unity game engine almost 5 years.

I have worked as a freelancer on some game projects, have done several starter kits and I'm lead programmer of "Spate" the game which was winner of IGN show "The Next Game Boss". Now I want to create my dream game.

With your support we can create amazing game together.  

The game will free to play, MMORPG style with realistic environment, where you’ll be able to create your own characters, make them tall or small, athletic or fat, dress them as you wish with different style of shirts, trousers, shoes and accessories.

Interact with other players and challenge them in side by side running from point A to B.

Each player will have their level and it will increase when player wins the challenge, gets new clothes or tricks. Special clothes, accessories and tricks will be able to buy with coins which you exchange in real money or win in challenge. Each cloth will increase some type of abilities. Player will have speed, flexibility, stamina and strength values. High level players will have access to higher level clothes, accessories and tricks.

The winner of challenge will be determined by points. Player will be given different points for different tricks, harder ones will give more points. But main goal will be finishing first, it'll give much more points then any other tricks. The winner will be awarded with coins and his/her level will increase. If player crashes, of course he/she will loose.

Here are basic features which will be implemented definitely, more features will come along, for example you'll be able to exchange coins in training to increase any  ability (speed, flexibility, stamina, strength ), team challenge, social network integration etc.

Basic Features:

  • Generate your character with different body parts
  • Manipulate face and body shape
  • Change skin and cloth colors
  • Dress up character with different style of clothes and accessories
  • Buy special clothes, accessories, tricks
  • Interact with other players 
  • Challenge in side by side running
  • Crashing system

The game would be done in unity game engine which gives power to make more realistic and believable animations with it’s new animation system called “Mecanim”.

The game will be targeted to all 3 main platforms: Windows, Mac, Linux and it'll be completed around quarter 4, 2014.

 

So long I’m working alone, doing everything started from parkour to music, 3d modeling, texturing, programming. For this time I have only little test scenes, with my character doing some tricks and flips and interacting with environment. It’s a very basic movement system for now, but all these takes much time for one person. And the amount which I'm asking is a minimal to buy motion capture (mocap) system and hire few people to create high quality game and deliver it to you as quick as possible.


update 26.08.13

Now the environment got some realistic look and character system has improved too, but it is still very early stage and your help is really needed to make this happen.


 

You’ll get cool perks:

 

Note:

10 000 coins will be equal to 10 dollar and with it you'll be able to buy: shoes, trousers, t-shirt and 2 accessories in game

 

$5 Perk:

Thank you & Wallpaper

 

$10 Perk:

Soundtrack, Thank you & Wallpaper

 

$15 Perk:

Get 10 000 coins in game + Soundtrack, Thank you & Wallpaper

 

$20 Perk:

Get 30 000 coins in game + Soundtrack, Thank you & Wallpaper

 

$25 Perk:

Get 50 000 coins in game + Soundtrack, Thank you & Wallpaper

 

$30 Perk:

Exclusive mini version for android + 10 000 coins, Soundtrack, Thank you & Wallpaper

 

$35 Perk:

Exclusive mini version for PC / Mac / Linux with ability to construct your own levels + 10 000 coins, Soundtrack, Thank you & Wallpaper

 

$40 Perk:

Beta access + 10 000 coins, Soundtrack, Thank you & Wallpaper

 

$40 Perk:

Unlock unlimited t-shirt pack in game + Soundtrack, Thank you & Wallpaper

 

$40 Perk:

Unlock unlimited trousers pack in game + Soundtrack, Thank you & Wallpaper

 

$40 Perk:

Unlock unlimited accessories pack in game + Soundtrack, Thank you & Wallpaper

 

$50 Perk:

Unlock unlimited tricks pack in game + Soundtrack, Thank you & Wallpaper

 

$72 (-10%) Perk:

Unlock t-shirt & trousers pack in game + Beta access, Soundtrack, Thank you & Wallpaper

 

$102 (-15%) Perk:

Unlock t-shirt , trousers & accessories pack + beta access, Soundtrack, Thank you & Wallpaper

 

$136 (-20%) Perk:

Unlock all 4 (clothes and tricks) pack + Beta access, Soundtrack, Thank you & Wallpaper

 

$250 Perk:

Feedback webpage access, your ideas will be considered + unlock all 4 (clothes and tricks) pack, Beta access, Soundtrack, Thank you & Wallpaper

 

$500 Perk:

Your name will be written in game credits + $250 perk

 

$750

Your clothes style in game (1 pair of shoes, trouser, shirt, accessory)  + $500 perk which also contains $250 perk

 

$1000 Perk:

Your own graffiti style drawing on the wall in game +  $500 perk which also contains $250 perk

Thanks for reading….. and don’t forget you can be part of this game development and get cool perks. Please fund the project, tell your friends and families,

Let's make it happen together!

story:
Who Are We, and What is Fishy Warfare?

Our team here at Elemental Zeal Game Studios consists of one lead artist, Amanda Reuillon, and one lead programmer, Zack Licastro. We have been working as hobby game designers for a few years now. As we are currently enrolled in University, and being eaten by our part time jobs, we often can’t put as much time or money into our game design as we’d like.

We are asking for your help so that we can ease the burden of bringing our newest game, Fishy Warfare, to both Windows PCs and Xbox Live Indie Games. 

In Fishy Warfare, you play as a toy submarine, battling other toy submarines, all inside an everyday aquarium. As you play, you’ll unlock new submarines, and be able to purchase various different components to upgrade your submarine in combat.

 

Fishy Warfare emerged into this world as our entry to the 2012 Indie Speed Run game development competition. Although it didn’t win a prize, it did end up with 4 ½ stars out of 5. You can try the version that we created in 48 hours for that over at http://www.escapistmagazine.com/content/indie-speed-run/?game=150 and watch our development vlog at http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VfRyG1vpAS8.

We want to have a lot more content in the full release than we had for the competition, including new submarines, weapons, bosses, and even new aquariums to battle in.

 

Sample soundtrack of three songs from the game: http://elementalzeal.com/media.php

 

What We’re Asking For...

We are only asking for $750 dollars, as we don’t expect the entire process of game design to be paid for by others and are willing to sacrifice our own time and money to get the job done.

 We decided on flexible funding as we are going to finish the game no matter what, the extra funding just allows the release date to be brought forward in time, and allows us to put the amount of content and time into the game that it deserves.

Any extra funding that we can’t squeeze into the game will go directly into allowing the company to stay affordable while we continue to develop our skills and grow.

What Else Have You Done?

Although we are still a very new company, we have already entered a bunch of game development competitions. This includes three different Ludum Dare Game Jams, and now, the 2012 Indie Speed Run competition. We have even taken two older projects to market on Windows PC and Xbox Live Indie Games. This means we have a bit of experience with releasing projects, and we will certainly use what we have learned when we release this one.

You can see some examples of some prototypes we have programmed, along with some of the previous competition games we mentioned, in our 2012 demo reel here: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7_rS6zdoAqo

Or check out our last game No Air Out Here’s full trailer here: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zPyDY16Xwws

We want the opportunity to continue learning and improving our skills, and there is no better way than to continue making projects we love.

What’s Left To Do?

Although we have most of the important work done, we still have lots of little things left to do to complete Fishy Warfare.

This includes:

-        A few bug fixes/menu changes

-        About half the game content art  - Finished!

-        More components for your submarines  - Finished!

-        Rebalancing all the new components

-        Special behaviours for the remaining bosses and special submarines  - Finished!

-        Creating more audio tracks for the games bosses

-        Rewriting the sound engine - Finished!

-        Porting to the Xbox and making the trial version

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you like what we are doing, but are unable to contribute, you can still help by telling people about our campaign, or just show your support by following us on twitter, and keeping an eye on our website elementalzeal.com for news on releases and future projects.

 

 

Update #1

Just a small update for today: Fishy Warfare’s sound engine has been rewritten, and is working a lot better.

Our music before (as seen in the Indie Speed Run competition version) would only allow for changing of songs once a currently playing song was finished. This resulted in you being half way through a boss level before the boss music start to play. The music would have to finish it’s current loop before muting would have an affect on it.

Now the music fades in much more nicely when it’s expected and sounds stop immediately when muting occurs. :)

We also wanted to mention that we’ve already had some good suggestions from people viewing our campaign. One suggested feature was nicer “death” animations when a fight is over (getting to watch your submarine sink a little in defeat). This will now be added to the game.

We are always open to more suggestions, so feel free to leave any thoughts in the comments of our campaign, at our twitter page (https://twitter.com/ElementalZealGS), or through our website’s contact page (http://elementalzeal.com/contactUs.php).
